Chapter 1 ABIES CANADENSIS

INTRODUCTION

It is one of the remarkbale remedies in the treatment of chronic gastric affections and uterine disorders.

CLINICAL

Indigestion. Liver disorder. Uterine disorder.
SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS
It acts on stomach and uterus, heart, lungs. It produces catarrhal condition of stomach.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Great debility with strong desire to lie down and rest most of the time.
2) Gnawing, hungry, faint feeling at the epigastrium.
3) Great appetite, even tendency to eat far beyond the capacity for digestion.
4) Craving for meat, pickles, radishes, turnips, coarse food etc. is peculiar.
5) Chilliness is very characteristic especially when associated with peculiar cravings and prostration.
6) A remedy for uterine displacement with sore feeling at fundus of uterus relieved by pressure.

PARTICULARS
Stomach
Gastric symptoms are the most prominent Symptoms to guide us in our selection of Abies Can.
There is canine hunger which gnaws in the stomach causing, a sort of fainting feeling at the epigastrium.
The patient does not know how much he eats and very often there is excessive loading of the stomach which causes distention of stomach & abdomen with severe palpitation of heart.

Female genital Organs
Uterine prolapsus with sore feeling at fundus of uterus, relieved by pressure. Prostration; wants to lie down all the time. She thinks womb is soft & feeble.


Chapter: 2 ABIES NIGRA

INTRODUCTION
A powerful and long acting remedy, in various kinds of diseases, whenever the characteristic stomach symptoms are present.

CLINICAL
Constipation. Dyspepsia.
SPHERES OF ACTION
The most specific action of this remedy is on stomach and also on heart and lungs.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1) Sensation as if a hard-boiled egg had lodged in the cardiac end of stomach.
2) Pain in stomach always comes after eating.
3) Wakeful and restless at night, with hunger.
4) Dyspeptic troubles of the aged after abuse of tea or tobacco.

PARTICULARS

Gastrointestinal Symptoms:
It is a grand remedy in dyspepsia especially of the aged, habituated to excess of tea and tobacco.
They are generally low spirited and dull and have wakeful nights. The most characteristic symptom of
Abies N. is the sensation as if a hard boiled egg had lodged in the cardiac end of stomach.
The patient may describe this as a feeling as though he had swallowed some indigestible substance which had stuck in his stomach. Severe pain in stomach is felt after eating. Total loss of appetite in morning, but great craving for food at noon & night. Dyspepsia with functional heart symptoms.

Chest:
There is painful sensation, as if something were lodged in the chest and had to be coughed up. Chest cannot be fully expanded, Sharp, cutting pain in heart ; heart’s action heavy & slow, tachycardia.
Dyspnoea worse lying down. Water brash succeeds cough, worse coughing.

Relation : Compare, China, Bryo, Puls, in Lump in Stomach; also Thuja, Sabina, Nux Vom, Kali Carb



Chapter :3 ABROTANUM

INTRODUCTION

Abrotanum is a very useful medicine derived from the vegetable kingdom. The mother tincture is prepared from fresh leaves of the plant, which 
abundantly grows in Southern Europe. This is a remedy often required in cases of Marasmus in children and for Rheumatism caused by checked 
diarrhoea or other secretions. Abrotanum is one of the drugs having prominent alternating actions.

CLINICAL

Chilblains, Gout, Haemorrhoids, Hectic Fever, Hydrocele, Indigestion, Lientery, Marasmus, Pleurisy, Rheumatism, Umbilicus, Oozing from, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

The chief centres of action of Abrotanum are gastro-intestinal tract, nerves, mind, fibrous tissue and serous membrane.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on gastro-intestinal system causes disturbed digestion, defective assimilation, impaired nutrition, lientery distension of abdomen resulting in progressive emaciation and marasmus. While its action on fibrous tissue produces rheumatic and gouty manifestation, its affection on serous membrane sets in pleurisy, hydrocele etc.

CONSTITUTION

Make up of the body : The patients, usualy a child, is emaciated especially more marked in Lower Extremities old looking face; face pale and wrinkled; the skin is
flabby and hangs loose in folds; head is weak and the child cannot hold it up.

Temperature : Cruel and inhuman temperament.

Relation with heat and cold : Chilly patients.

Miasm : Psora is in the background of all the troubles.

Diathesis : Tubercular diathesis,

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Great progressive wasting, specially more in the Lower Extremities.
2. Ravenous appetite; eats well, loses flesh while living well (lod; Nat.mur; Sanic;Tub).
3. Lientery, ie. stool contains undigested food particles; alternate diarrhoea and constipation (Ant.c; Nux v; Sulph; Verat.alb; Ant. t; Podo;       Chelid).
4. Rheumatic conditions with heart irritation, epistaxis, bloody urine, anxiety and trembling. Rheumatism without swelling, but Gout with       swelling and inflammation,
   Rheumatism alternates with haemorrhoids and dysentery (Kali bich).
5. Hydrocele in children; oozing of blood and moisture from navel of new born (Cale. phos.), (of urine Hyos).
6. Angioma of the face.
7. Mind : The patient is very cruel; always wants to do something cruel; irritable and ill natured, violent and inhuman, cross and despondent;       with incapacity to think.
8. Aliments from : Suddenly checked diarrhoea or other secretions, malnutrition, defective digestion and absorption.

PARTICULARS

Marasmus :
Causation: Impaired nutrition, defective digestion and imperfect assimilation and absorption.

Character: Progressive marasmus of children, with marked emaciation of Lower Extremities.
Ascending type of emaciation. The child is very weak and is unable to hold up head; great weakness and disturbed digestion.

Concomitants : There is ravenous appetite; the child eats well, still progressive emaciation is well marked and continues to lose flesh. Along with this, there is great weakness and prostration and a kind of hectic fever.
Such children usually pass lienteric stool; suffer from alternate obstinate constipation and diarrhoea. The baby is chilly, mentally irritable and ill-natured.

In marasmus :

Abrotanum can be compared with Aethusa-eyn, lodum Natrum mur, Silicea, Calcarea phos, Tuberculinum and Sulphur which are as follows :

1.  Aethusa cyn : It is generally indicated in acute attacks of the baby caused by heat of summer, during dentition and due to intolerance of milk, The baby cannot bear   milk in any form; it is vomited out in large curds as soon as taken, Indigestion of teething children; diarrhoea and vomiting especially in hot summer weather;             followed by great weakness, prostration and sleepiness complete absence of thirst: child is unable to hold up head; incapacity to think with well marked linea-nasalis.

2.  Iodum : Iodum is the hottest baby. Baby has scrofulous and tubercular diathesis, cachectic condition, profound debility and emaciaiton of the whole body, but with hypertropy and induration of all the glands. The baby has great, Ravenous hunger, eats freely and well, yet loses flesh all the time. The baby has distended abdomen  full of gas; suffers from constipation which is relieved by drinking cold milk. Baby has croupy attack with sneezing and swaing respiration. The child grasps the larynx while coughing with fact pale and cold.

3. Natrum mur : The baby is anaemic and cachetic with great emaciation. Here too, loses flesh while living well. Emaciation is well-marked in neck and throat. The baby  craves for salt but has aversion to bread, and suffers from bad effects of salt. The baby also has great liability to take cold; is irritable and cross; weeping mood  and consolation aggravates.
4. Silicea is a chilly baby suffers from deficient and impaired nutrition, imperfect assimillation; scrofulous and rachitic child with large head, open fontanelles and  sutures; much offensive sweating about the head; always covered; distended abdomen and weak ankles; late learning to walk; late dentition; suffers from bad effects of      vaccination, especially confulsion and skin affections. Lack of vital heat. The childs obstinate, headstrong and cries when kindly spoken to. Suffers from very difficult constipation; stool partly expelled and then recedes again (Thuja). Child desires to be magnetised (Calc. carb; Phos).

5. In calcarea phos. too, the child is anaemic and emaciated, ahving scrofulous diathesis. Emaciation of the whole body. The child is unable to stand; slow in learning to     walk, with flabby but sunken abdomen; cranial bones are thin and brittle; frontanelles and sutures remain open too long or close and reopen delayed or complicated       teething; bony deformities, spine weak, disposed to curvature, unable to support body; neck is weak and therefore, unable to hold up the head.

6. Tuberculinum baby as the very name indicates, has tubercular diathesis; is physically very weak. There is emaciation of the whole body. Emaciation is very rapid and        highly pronounced; losing flesh while living well. The baby catches cold very easily without knowing how and from where. The baby usually has family history of            tubercular affection. It suits when the best selected remedies fail to relieve or permanently improve.

7. Sulphur baby is hot and psoric, having scrofulous diathesis; is emaciated and pot bellied. The baby has dirty and filthy look, weak, tall and stoop shouldered; with all    the orifices of the body red. The baby does not like to be washed or bathed. Cannot bear to stand. These type of babies may suffer from morning diarrhoea which is painless and involunary and acrid, causing redness of the anal orifice. The baby may have skin affections with itch, soreness and boils which come in crops or a single boil is succeeded by another one as soon as the first one is healed. The baby is also prone to have worm manifestations with intense craving for sweet.

Rheumatism and Gout :

Causation : Rheumatic affections are caused by suddenly checked diarrhoea or other secretions.

Character of pain :; In rheumatic affections, there is excessive pain, but there is no swelling; whereas in gout, the joints are inflammed, swollen, stiff and very painful with pricking sensation; especially ankle joints and wrists are very much inflamed and highly painful; very lame and sore all over.

Modalities :

Aggravation : At night and from cold.

Amelioration : By motion.

Concomitants : There is painful contraction of limbs from cramps or after colic. Metastatis or theumatism to heart is a frequent phenomenon. 
There is high fever during rheumatic attack Rheumatism may also alternate with heart irritation, epistaxis, bloody urine, anxiety and trembling. 
Suppressed rheumatism of any joint followed by violent cardiac symptoms call for Abrotanum.

Abrotanum can also be thought of in itching chilblains. It may also be of immense assistance in pjeurisy after. Aconite and Bryonia when a 
pressing sensation remains in affected side impeding respiration with other symptoms of pleurisy, such as evening rise of temperature, nocturnal 
sweating, great susceptibility to catch cold, etc.

General Modality :

Aggravation : At night and from cold.

Amelioration : By motion.

Relations :

Compared with Nux vomica and Agaricus in Chilblains. Bryonia and Baryta carb, follow Abrotanum well. In pleurisy, after Aconite and Bryonia, Abrotanum follows well. 



Chapter 4 ACALYPHA INDICA

INTRODUCTION

There is controversy about the first prover of this medicine. Dr. N.M. Chowdhury says that, “This remedy was first proved by Dr. P.C. Mazumder of 
Calcutta” where as Dr. S.C. Ghosh in his “Drugs of Hindoosthan” says that “Dr. C.F. Tonnere, a french homoeopath made a proving of Acalypha 
Indica and called attention to this plant as a valuable remedy”. Dr. Mahendra Lai Sirkar has also conducted the proving of this medicine through 
his disciple Babu Joy Kissen :

Ghoshal. Acalypha Indica is an infallible remedy agree for haemorrhages especially haemoptysis in our Materia Medica.

CLINICAL

Bronchiectasis. Cough. Diarrhoea. Flatulence. Haemoptysis. Incipient phthisis.

PARTICULARS

Respiratory symptoms : Acalypha Indica is employed in the beginning of phthisis associated with hard, dry and severe cough followed by bloody expectoration. Expectoration of pure bright red blood comes on in morning and dark clotted blood in the evening. Cough most violent at night. There is dullness of chest on percussion and severe pain in chest with progressive emaciation, night sweat & evening rise of temperature. It is indicated in incipient phthisis with hard, racking cough, bloody expectoration, arterial haemorrhage but no febrile disturbance.

Gastrointestinal symptoms : This medicine also has marked action on the alimentary canal characterised by burning in intestines, sensation of weight in stomach, flatulence and spluttering diarrhoea with forcible expulsion of noisy flatus. (Calc. Phos.) Rectal haemorrhage worse in the morning.
N.B. Author has releived hundreds of cases of haemoptysis when there is active, bright red bleeding from the respiratory passages (From bladder ; Erigeron, haemorrhage from piles-Mill.

Chapter 5 ACETIC ACID

INTRODUCTION

Although debility and prostration run through all the acids, these are more marked in Acetic Acid, Mur. Ac., Phos Ac. and Sulph. Ac. For cachectic condition or
anaemia or pallor or excessive wasting and dropsical condition, Acetic Acid leads the other acids of our Materia Medica. Guernsey says, “Vinegar must be
remembered as an antidote to all anaesthetic vapors— chloroform, ether etc. as well as fumes of charcoal.

CLINICAL

Anaemia. Croup. Diabetes. Diarrhoea. Dropsy. Fevers. Phthisis. Haemorrhage. Vomiting. Stomach-Cancer of. Marasmus. Corns. Warts.

SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS

It produces a sort of anaemia with debility, loss of flesh, cough, dropsical swelling & haemorrhage.


CONSTITUTIOIN

Physical Make up : Adopted to pale, lean persons with lax, flabby muscles. Face is pale & waxy.

Heat cold relation : Sensitive to cold (Kent)

Temperament : Irritable, borrows trouble.

Diathesis :Haemorrhagic. 

Miasm :All three miasms.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Great burning thirst, insatiable even for large quantities but no thirst in fever.

2) Great prostration—after injuries, anaesthetics and surgical shock and with other complaints.

3) Haemorrhage from every mucous outlet : nose, throat, lungs, stomach, bowels and uterus.

4) Profound anaemia with waxy pallor of the face.

5) Great emaciation especially of the face, hands, & thighs (Nash)

6) Copious pale urine is characteristic particularly if accompanied by intense thirst & dry hot skin.

7) Sour belching and vomiting of pregnancy, burning water-brash and profuse salivation, day & night (Lac.Ac.-Saliva-tion agg. at night Merc.S.)

8) Cannot sleep lying on the back, sensation of sinking in abdomen causing dysponoea, rests better lying on belly (Amm.C.)

9) Hectic fever, skin dry and hot; red spot on left cheek and drenching night sweats.

10) Diarrhoea : Copious, exhausting with great thirst, in dropsy, typhus, phthisis, with night sweat.

11) Sweat : profuse, colliquative
.
12) Mind : The patient is irritable, borrows trouble, worried about business affairs. Grieves about his sickness and his children.

13) Ailments from : Bad effects of anaesthetic vapors, fumes of charcoal and gas. Bad effect of stings & bites. Injury, surgical shock, sausage poisoning.

PARTICULARS

Gastrointestinal Symptoms :

Acetic Acid is indicated in various kinds of gastrointestinal diseases; it covers even advanced stage of peptic ulcer, malignancy of stomach, intestinal tuberculosis etc. The symptoms are : sour belching an vomiting after every kind of food, burning waterbrash and profuse salivation with fermentation in stomach. There is violent burning pain in stomach and chest followed by coldness of skin and cold sweat on forehead. Cold drinks disagree but patient has intense burning thirst.

Diarrhoea:

Chronic diarrhoea of emaciated children. Diarrhoea in dropsy, typhus, phthisis, exhausting, copious, frequent watery stools worse in the morning. Diarrhoea with great thirst & night sweats.

Urinary Symptoms :

Copious pale urine is the characteristic of Acetic acid in Diabetes Mellitus if associated with intense burning thirst and dry hot skin and debility.

Dropsy : It is one of the prominent medicines for dropsy associated with diabetes and gastrointestinal diseases. With dropsical condition, there is profound anaemia with waxy pallor of the face. Dropsy with great thirst and debility, emaciation, sour belching, waterbrash and diarrhoea. Patient cannot sleep lying on back but rests better lying on belly.

Fever : Especially indicated in hectic fever with drenching night sweat. & prosiration. Skin dry and hot. There is red spot on left cheek. No thirst in fever is characteristic. There may be profuse salivation and stomach disorder with fever, Patient feels better by lying on belly.

Relations : It antidotes anaesthetic vapors. (Amyl.); fumes of charcoal and gas; Opium and Stramonium.

Cider Vinegar antidotes Carbolic acid.

Follows well : after cinchona, in haemorrhage; after Digitalis, in dropsy.

Chapter 6 ACONITUM NAPELLUS

INTRODUCTION
There are several remedies derived, proved and established from Aconite family, the most important of which is Aconitum Napellus. Aconite is one of the deadliest and most rapidly acting poison; yet, through Hahnemann’s discoveries, it has been transformed into one of the best of the nurseries. It is one of Clarke’s A, B, C, Nurseries, others being Belladonna and Chamomilla. Aconite causes Turmoil in circulation, belladonna causes Turmoil in brain and Chamomilla causes Turmoil in temperament.
Had it not been for the wonderful curative power which Master Hahnemann found and developed from this wild poisonous plant, we would have been lagging behind and missed lot in the effective treatment of many acute diseases in their initial stage. Aconite is a short and’quick acting superficial remedy for acute and most distressing conditions. Aconite is like a great storm; it comes Suddenly and violently, sweeps over and passes away in the same manner. With the action of the remedy, the storm is over. And in this powerful drug, we find a ready solution to many of our staring problems encountered when dealing with many diseases, provided they are in the initial stage and the symptoms corroborate.

CLINICAL

In the initial stage of any acute diseases such as Apoplexy, Asthma, Chest affection, Chicken-pox, Cholera, Convulsion, Epilepsy, Croup., Cough, Diarrhoea, Dropsy,
Dysentery, Amenorrhoea, Dysmenorrhoea, Bad effects of fear & fright, Fever, Headache, Heart affections, Inflammation, Menses, Pneumonia, Suppression of urine, Vertigo,etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Perhaps there may not be any organ, tissue or system in the body which is not susceptible to the action of this remedy. Still it predominently acts on cerebro-spinal
nervous system, brain, serous and mucous membrane, blood, cardio-vascular system, etc.

PATHOGENESIS

Aconite causes “Turmoil in circulation.” It is capable of irritating brain and cerbro-spinal nervous system producing exalted activity on the circulation, paralysing the capillaries, resulting in tension and congestion with tendency towards inflammation. The genius of this highly useful remedy is through mental sphere and it is always important to consider the mental symptoms. Its action on heart retards the intensity of its function.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up : Since Aconite is purely an acute drug, consideration of constitution is not of much importance. However, it is indicated in acute cases occurring in plethoric sanguine persons with rigid fibres, dark hair and eyes, full of plethoric habits who lead a sedentary life and who are most in need of Aconite are strong, robust people. Aconite is the remedy of the rosy, chubby and plethoric babies.

Temperament : Sanguine temperament.

Relation with heat arid cold : No definite stamping can be made in this respect. Still Aconite seems to be a ‘warm blooded’ patient.
Miasm : Psora is the miasm in the back-ground.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. “Tension” is the key-note of Aconite (Key-note of Belladonna is congestion). Due to irritation of the mind and affection of circulation, tension always prevails Aconite      patients

2  .Aconite is indicated in the first stage of any acute case which starts suddenly and violently like a storm.

3. It is one of the Trios of restlessness (others being Arsenic and Rhus tox.). The patient is very much restless. Cannot remain in one place. He is full of energy, vigor     and strength; as such, moves frequently from place to place. (Aconite patient moves quite frequently because physically he is very strong and he can move about, but in     Arsenic the patient is too weak to move although he wants.)

4. There is great fear and anxiety of mind : intense nervousness. The very face of Aconite expresses FEAR and this remedy is curative of ailments from fright, mental or       physical. The patient tosses about in agony; life is rendered miserable by fear.

5. Fear and fright are the most characteristic manifestations of Aconite—fear of death even predicts the time of death. (In Arsenic patients too, there is fear of death.      He feels that the disease is fatal and he is surely going to die. But the difference is that Arsenic patient does not predict the time of death and he feels that the.      disease in incurable and fatal. Therefore, there is no use of taking any medicine; hence no doctor is to be called. The Aconite patient thinks that unless proper  is       taken, he is going to die and, therefore, wants the doctor to be called immediately.)

6. Dry and hot skin with rare sweat (Nash). (Where there is sweat it is only on the parts rested upon—Boericke).

7. According to Nash, Aconite is one of the greatest pain remedies. His Trios of pain remedies are Aconite, Chamomilla and Coffea. Aconite screams with pain, pains are.       intolerable, they drive him crazy; he becomes very restless at night. The pain is often associated with numbness (Platina, Chamomilla).

8. Excessive sensitiveness to the least touch.

9. Unquenchable thirst for large quantity of cold water. There is active haemorrhage from any part of the body, both internal and external, uterus or other places in stout plethoric patients. The character of the blood is pure, and bright red accompanied by fear of death and nervous excitability. The face of Aconite patient is red or red and pale alternately. Anxious and frightened pxpression. Sensation of face growing or swelling. On rising, the red face becomes deathly pale and he feels dizzy.

Aggravation : In the evening and especially at night.

Amelioration : By uncovering and in the OPEN AIR.

Aconite is the drug for the congestive stage of inflammation before localisation takes place. Paralysis from exposure to dry cold wind (Caust).

Mind : Aconite patients have peculiar mental’symptoms which are as follows :

There is great fear and anxiety of mind, with great nervous , excitability, which run through the whole drug. The very face of Aconite patient expresses the fear.

The Aconite patient has fear of death, in any acute disease; fear of darkness, fear of bed, fear of ghost, fear of going out. Fear to go into a crowd where there is any excitement or many people. Fear to cross street, fear to cross a bridge, fear of death in pregnancy. There are numerous remedies having fear of death, but the peculiarity of Aconite is clairvoyance i.e. the patient predicts the date and even the hour of death. If a clock is in the patient’s room, he will say that when the hands reach a particular point, he will be nothing but a corpse. This symptom is very striking and peculiar to Aconite only. It is the Aconite patient who calls his friends around him and takes leave of them. Such a mental state occurring in the course of any illness calls for Aconite only.


The patient seems to have been threatened with sudden, violent death but recovery is also very quick like a great storm, only to be quiet very soon.
The patient is very much restless and he does everything in great haste; must change position quite often; everything startles him. The Aconite patient tosses about in agony and his life is rendered. miserable.



Music is unbearable for Aconite patient; it makes her sad (Sabina; Thuja, Graphites, Natrum sulph., Natrum carb.).
This mental anxiety, worry and fear accompany most of the trivial ailments. Almost certainly this remedy should never be given in case where the sickness is borne
with patience and calmness. Mental calmness contra-indicates Aconite. If Aconite is to be thought of, there must be mental uneasiness, worry, anxiety and fear  accompanying the most trifling ailments. Intense and uncontrollable anguish, anxiety and great fear are characteristic symptoms.
Hahnemann says. “Whenever Aconite is chosen homoeopathically, you must, above all, observe the moral symptoms and be careful that it closely resembles them, the anguish of mind and body; the restlessness; the disquiet not to be allayed.”

16. Ailments from. Exposure to dry cold air, dry North or West wind, or exposure draught of cold air, while in perspiration; bad effects of checked perspiration, fear, fright, shock, heat of sun, excitement, injury, surgical operation, etc.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation : Exposure to dry cold air, exposure to draught of cold air, while in perspiration, bad effects of checked perspiration, fear, fright, shock, heat of sun, excitement, etc.
Location : Intense pain is felt in the frontal region or semi-laterally.
Sensation : Headache as if nailed up; drives him crazy; fullness and heaviness in forehead, as if the skull would be forced out through the forehead. Burning headache as if the brain were agitated by boiling water. Sensation of fulness and throbbing in the head.

Modalities :
Aggravation: Towards the evening and at night, when going to bed. Pains are worse in a warm room and when lying on affected side,

Ameliorafion : In the open air.
Concomitants: Fear of death, anxiety, worry, mental uneasiness and restlessness.

Cough :
Causation : Cough may be caused due to exposure to dry cold air, dry North or West wind, or exposure to draught of cold air; checked perspiration, etc. The cough may.come along with fever or cough itself may start violently.

Character of cough : It is sudden and violent. It may be croupy in nature. Cough is dry, hoarse, suffocating, loud, rough, croaking, hard, ringing and whistling.

Modalities :
Aggravation : On expiration, towards evening and at night.
Amelioration: In the open air.
Dysentery :
Causation: Fear, fright, shock, heat of sun, or® excitement.
Mode of onset : Sudden and violent.
Character of stool : There is sudden agonising pain in the abdomen. Severe tenesmus and
gripping colicky pain. Frequent stool, stool contains undigested food particles, mucus and bright red
blood; frequent desire to defaecate.

Modalities : Attack severe and more towards evening and at night.
Concomitants : There is. intense nervous restless.ness, fear, anxiety and anguish. The patient tosses
about in agony. He thinks the attack is fatal and he is going to die.

Collapse :
Causation ; Just as in dysentery, cholera may also set in due to fear, fright, shock, heat of sun, or any excitement.
Mode of onset : The onset is sudden and violent. 
Character : There is severe vomiting and purging of profuse quantity. Gripping and cutting pain in abdomen. Frequent desire for stool and vomiting.

Modalities :
Aggravation : Towards evening and at night.
Amelioration : In open air.

Concomitants : There is severe Precordial pain, intense nervous restlessness, fear, anxiety and anguish. The patient tosses about in agony. He thinks the attack is fatal and he is going to die soon.

Convulsion : Generally teething children may get the attack of convulsion which will be relieved by Aconite Character of convulsion: There is jerking and twitching of single muscle (Agaricus, Zincum met.). The child gnaws its fist, bites, frets and screams. The skin may be very hot and’dry, with high fever and
dilated pupils.

Menses :
There may be amenorrhoea or suppression of menses in young plethoric girls usually after fright. fear or exposure to cold, etc.

Fever:
Aconite is a great fever remedy. Causation : Exposure to dry cold air, dry North or West wind or exposure to draught of cold air,
while in perspiration, bad effects of checked perspiration, fear, fright, shock, heat of sun and excitement.
Mode of onset : Starts very suddenly and violently.

Symptoms of fever : There is sudden and violent attack of fever with high rise of temperature. Severe chill in the beginning, violent and more chill in the evening and at night. Very chilly if uncovered, but with internal heat. The acute fever is generally of short and sharp attack.

There is no periodicity whatsoever. The most violent attack of fever, requiring Aconite will subside in a night, no other drug is needed. Aconite should never be given simply to control the fever, never be alternated with other drug for that purpose.
Face during fever : Face is red or pale and red alternately. Anxious and frightened expression. Sensation of face growing or swelling, On rising the red face becomes deathly pale and he feels dizzy.

Skin during fever : Skin is dry and hot with burning sensation. Skin is red, shining, not with violent pain.
Sweat in fever : There is drenching sweat, especially on parts laid on, which relieves (Boericke) (Natrum mur., Psorinum).
Thirst during fever : Especially during the heat state, the patient is very much thirsty. There is burning thirst for large quantity of cold water.
Mental symptoms during fever : The patient is very much anxious.. There is intense nervousness and restlessness. He tosses about in agony. The face is expressive of fear, fear of death and even predicts the time of death.

Becomes intolerable towards the evening and on going to bed. The patient thinks that he will definitely die soon and the fever is so severe that it will be fatal to him unless treated immediately.

Modalities:
Aggravation : Towards the evening and at night and in a warm room.
Amelioration : In open air and by prespiration.

General Modalities :
Aggravation : Evening and at night, pains are unsuportable; in a warm room; when rising from bed; lying on painful or affected side.
Amelioration: In open air.

Relations :
Aconite is complementary to Coffea in fever, sleeplessness and intolerance of pain; to Amica in traumatism; to Sulphur in all cases, Rarely indicated in fevers which bring out eruptions.
Aconite is the acute of Sulphur and both precede and follow in acute inflammatory conditions. In Aphonia, when Acon., Phos., Spongia fail, Cina should be thought of.
Antidotes : Bell., Cham., Coffea, Nux v., Sepia, Spongia, Sulph.
Antidoted by: Acet. acid., Alcohol.

Chapter 7 ACTAEA RACEMOSA (CIMICIFUGA)

INTRODUCTION

Some confusions may arise in the minds of the students due to different names applied to this remedy and, therefore, appearing in different parts of Materia Medica. It was Hughes who preferred it to be called by its Linnaean-name Actaea. Others who supported him rank from Hering, Clarke, Allen, Genius Kent and Guernsey, whereas it was Nash, Boericke, Roger and Stanels, in opposition who named it as Cimicifuga. Hughe’s Pharmacodynamic reveals its nick-name. “The Homoeopathic milk for the Allopathic Babes” for his Object was, evidently to reconcile Homoeopathy or at least.make it acceptable to the members of the orthodox school of medicine.

CLINICAL
Abortion tendency to, Breast affections, Chest affections, Disorders of Pregnancy, Puerperal mania, Headache, Heart affection, Labour, Menstrual disorders, Rheumatism, Vomiting of pregnancy, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Acts especially upon the entire nervous system and female generative organs. As far as the nervous system is concerned, it acts especially on the cerebro-spinal nerves and
especially on the motor nerves as well as upon the uterus, ovaries and joints.


PATHOGENESIS
It disturbs the nerve centres and produces irritation. It also increases arterial tension,

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: There is no particular look of the patient. 

Temperament: Hysterical temperament. 

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient. Miasm; Psora is in the background. 

Diathesis: Rheumatic and gouty diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. All the symptoms are WORSE DURING MENSES: more profuse the flow, greater the sufferings.

2. Chilly Patients, easily affected by cold, sensitive to cold and relieved by warmth.

3. Muscular soreness, a bruised feeling all over the body.

4. Pain is like electric shock here and there, sharp, lancinating, in various parts; chest and uterine region, shoots from side to side.

5. Mind. This remedy is full of mental symptoms. Fear, anguish and restlessness are well marked.There is fear of death with great suspicion.
The Actaea racemosa patient has got mania which occurs in nervous hysterical women; puerperal mania; thinks she is going to be crazy; tries to injure herself. Sensation as of a heavy, black cloud had settled all over her and enveloped her head so that everything is in darkness and confusion; as if some weight is laid upon the head. There is illusion of a mouse running under her chair She is sad, melanholic, gloomy and low spirited. She is bowed dawn with sorrow and sits and mops in great sadness. Hysterical girls in a state, of sadness and she will sit and say nothing. When questioned, she will break into tears or express in various ways the overwhelming sadness, with chorea and epileptic fit as a reflex symptom from uterine diseases. There is also changeable mood; physical and mental symptoms are all the time changing. The mental state following disappearance of rheumatism i is a strong feature. The Theumatism get gets better, but the mental state becomes worse. All the mental ‘symptoms change proportionately, worse during menstruation and compared to the amount of menstrual flow; more profuse the flow, greater the mental distress. 

6. Ailments from : Anxiety, fright, disappointed love, business failure, over-exertion, child bearing, etc.

PARTICULARS
Headache :
Causation: From cold, damp wet weather. The headache is also of rheumatic origin.

Sensation: Sore, bruised feeling all over the head; bruised sensation in the occiput; sore, bruised feeling on the top of head, as if top of the head would fly off.

Character; Shooting and throbbing pains in the head from reflex symptoms of uterus. Brain feels too large with waving sensation or opening and shutting sensation in the head. Pains as if pressing outward. Pressing type of headache with soreness in the back of neck.With headache, the eye balls are very sore; feels pain if he turns head to any direction with ciliary neuralgia, aching or sharp, darting, shooting pain in the globes extending” to the temples, vertex and occiput.

Modalities:
Aggravation: From going upstairs; during menses; weather changes; cold damp weather.

Amelioration: By lying down.

Menses :

Delayed menses by mental emotion, from cold.
Time: Irregular and delayed.

Quantity: Profuse, scanty or suppressed.

Character of blood: coagulated, and very much offensive.

Modality:

Aggravation of pain during the flow; more the flow, greater the pain.

Concomitants: There is severe pain all through the period of flow; pain in ovarian region, across pelvis, from hip to hip with great sensitiveness. With menses, there may also be chorea, hysteria or mania with more rheumatic pains and palpitation of heart.

Pregnancy :
During pregnancy, there is nausea all the time with sleeplessness and sharp pain across the abdomen from hip to hip; abortion, especially at the third month. When given during later months of pregnancy, it shortens labour if symptoms correspond. In ladies who. have previously borne only dead children, from no discoverable cause. Actaea should be given in daily dose of potency for 2 months before term.

Labour :
False labour like pain, which is sharp and lancinating, electric like pains in various parts from uterine irritation, in uterine region from side to side. Shivering in the first stage of labour-irregular type of pain during labour with rigid os. No dilatation. Pain severe, spasmodic, difficult. Aggravation from least noise.

Prolapse :
Severe pain in the uterine region, darting from side to side, sharp, lancinating, electric like pain. Bearing down sensation with relaxation of the parts. Bearing down sensation is accompanied with other general symptoms.

Heart :

Irregular action of the heart with fluttering and quick pulse. Sensation as if heart is enlarged with sore feeling in the region of heart. Heart’s action ceases suddenly with impending suffocation and palpitation.

Modality:
Aggravation: From least motion and during menses.

Concomitant: Heart troubles are from reflex symptoms of uterus and ovaries.

Rheumatism: Being one of the good remedies for muscular rheumatism, it especially affects the bellies of muscles of neck and back. The joints commonly affected are those of lumbo-sacral region and big joints.

Sensation: Excessive muscular soreness is felt. There is uneasiness, restlessness, aching in the limbs with pain in lumbar and sacral region down thigh. There is stiffness, lameness, contracted feeling with stitching and cramping pain.

Modality:

Aggravation: From using arms in sewing, type writing, piano-playing, from cold, damp weather and during menses.

Concomitant; Rheumatism alternates with mental symptoms.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: From, cold, during menses. More severe the flow, greater the suffering 

Amelioration: From warmth.

Relations :
Similar to Caulophyllum and Pulsatilla in uterine affections.

Chapter 10 AESCULUS HIPPOCASTANUM

INTRODUCTION

Hale writes of Aesculus, “A veritable polychrest having a wide range of action, but like some other polychrests it has a central point of action from which radiates a series of reflex symptoms. This central point of action is the liver and portal system and nine out of every ten of its symptoms are due to this action.” It is one of our great haemorhoidal remedies.

CLINICAL :

Backache. Constipation. Coryza. Haemorrhoids. Liver-affection of Uterine—affection of.
SPHERES OF ACTION :
It appears to have a marked influence on the venous especially portal system, liver and lumbo-sacral articulation.
Mucous membranes of mouth, throat, rectum also come under the domain of this remedy.

Pathogenesis : It produces many symptoms of disordered liver resulting engorged hemorrhoidal veins. Due to congestion of veins sense of fullness, dryness, heat & pain are produced.

Constitution : It is suitable to persons having haemorrhoidal tendencies and who suffer with gastric, bilioiis or catarrhal troubles. It is an antipsoric medicine.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :

1) Severe dull backache in lumbo-sacral articulation; more or less constant, affecting sacrum & hips is the greatest concomitant symptom.
2) Sensation of fullness in various parts such as heart, lungs, stomach, anus, brain, pelvis ete.
3) Piles-purple, painful, burning, blind, rarely bleeding.
4) Stool followed by fullness of rectum and intense pain in anus for hours 
5) Frequent inclination to swallow, with burning, pricking stinging and dry constricted faces 
6) Thin, watery burning coryza with characteristic rawness & sensitiveness to cold air. 
7) Back “gives out” during pregnancy, prolapsus and leucorrhoea.
8) Mind : Aesculus hip. patients are, as a rule despondent gloomy and irritable. They lose temper easily and gain control slowly and are also miserably cross.

PARTICULARS

Nose:

Mucous membrance is dry, swollen. Inspired air feels cold & nasal passages are sensitive to cold air. Sneezing, followed by severe coryza with thin watery burning discharge and sensation of rawness.
Modality : Aggravation : Cold air, after washing.
Throat:

A medicine for follicular pharyngitis where dry-ness, roughness, rawness & sensitiveness to inspired air are characteristic symptoms. There is also violent burning like fire on swallowing. Frequent inclination to swallow, with burning, pricking, stinging and dry constricted fauces. Patient hawks ropy mucus of sweetish taste.

Backache :
Location-Aesculus Hip. has special affinity for lumbo-sacral articulation. Severe dull backache in lumbosacral articulation which is more or less constant. There is sensation of heaviness and lameness in back.

Modality: | Aggravation—Motion, walking, stooping Concomitant :Backache associated with constipation, piles, prolapsus uteri, leucorrhoea.

Rectal Symptoms :

Constipation :

Stool is large dry, hard & difficult to pass. Stool followed by fullness of rectum and intense pain in anus for hours. There is dryness and heat of rectum. Constipation with severe lumbosacral backache.
Haemorrhoids :
Haemorrhoids blind, painful burning & purplish, rarely bleeding. Rectum sore with fulness, burning and itching. Dryness & heat of rectum, with sensation as if rectum is full of small sticks. Knife- like pains shoot up the rectum,

Relations :
Similar: To Aloe., Coll., Ign., Mur.ac., Nux., Sulph,, in haemorrhoids. After collinsonia has improved piles, Aesc. often cures.

Useful after Nux and Sulph. have improved, but failed to cure piles.


Chapter 11 AETHUSA CYNAPIUM

INTRODUCTION

AEthusa Cynapium is one of the best remedies for the vomiting in children especially during dentition and in hot summer weather due to intolerance of milk. It is a thirst remedy and is most important for Cholera infantum and also for Epilepsy in babies.

CLINICAL
Brain fag, Cholera infantum, Convulsion, Cough, Delirium, Dyspepsia, Epilepsy, Headache, Hiccough, Idiocy, Infantile paralysis, Intolerance of milk, Disorders of
stomach, Vomiting, etc.
SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on nervous system, glandular system, mucous membrane and skin. PATHOGENESIS It is a frightful poison having narcotic properties as well as paralysing effects. The principal use we make of the drug arises from its action on the stomach.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: Features expressive of pain and anxiety. Herpetic eruption on end of the nose. Sunkenness in the face with marked linea nasalis. Physically the child is so weak that he is unable to stand or hold up the head.

Temperament: Mentally the patient is idiotic, confused and unable ito think. Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient.
Miasm: It touches all the 3 miasms in acute state. 

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
The characteristic, uncommon and peculiar symptoms by which one can make selection of this remedy homoeopathically by individualising a patient are:

1. Intolerance of milk in any form-e.g. mother’s milk, cow’s milk, bottled and tinned milk. It is vomited in large curds and after vomiting weakness causes drowsiness.

2. Indigestion of teething children. Vomiting is violent, sudden, of frothy milk-white substance or yellow fluid followed by CURDLED MILK AND CHEESY MATTER.

3. Regurgitation of food an hour or so after eating. Greenish copious vomiting followed by weakness and prostration with sleepiness.

4, Complete absence of thirst is very striking in Aethusa.

5. Physically great weakness; the child can neither stand nor hold up the head. Prostration with sleepiness is well marked.
6. An expression of great anxiety and pain; sunkenness in the face with well marked LINEA NASALIS. This well marked linea nasalis symptom is more characteristic of AEthusa    than of any other remedy.

7. Mentally the patient is idiotic ; incapacious to think and is very much confused.

8. Epileptic spasms with clenched thumbs, red face, fixed and dilated pupils, mouth filled with foam; locked jaws with small, hard and quick pulse. And most    peculiar symptom is, EYES ARE TURNED DOWNWARDS instead of upwards or sidewise.

9. Herpetic eruptions on the end of the nose.

10. Mind : Patient imagines that he sees rat or mouse running across the room. Idiocy with incapacity of thinking anything and confused. The features expressive of             much pain and anxiety, are found on face with a drawn condition and well marked linea nasalis. AEthusa is a wonderful medicine for ‘EXAMINATION FUNK (Arg. nit., Gels).

11. Aliments from : During period of dentition, hot summer weather, milk or milk in any form, errors of diet and bad hygienic surroundings.

PARTICULARS

AEthusa Baby :

One can take the help of AEthusa cynapium as one of the best remedies for vomiting in babies, cholera infantum and epilepsy of children. The troubles occur normally during dentition in hot summer weather, in children who CANNOT TOLERATE MILK IN ANY FORM. The baby is very weak, cannot stand up or hold the head up; weakness and prostration with sleepiness persist throughout. The child is confused, idiotic, and has incapacity to think. The features are expressive of much pain and anxiety, with a drawn condition and well marked linea nasalis and herpetic eruption on the end of the nose.

Vomiting :
Causation: Period of dentition, hot summer weather, milk or milk in any form. Baby CANNOT TOLERATE MILK OR MILK IN ANY FORM. It is vomited out in large quantities like very sour curd in one great effort as soon as it is swallowed, after which the baby becomes greatly relaxed and drowsy. During dentition, in hot summer weather and due to indigestion, the baby vomits violently and suddenly of a frothy milky white substance or yellow fluid followed by curdled milk and cheesy matter.

Calcarea os :
Also has got the symptom of sour vomiting of large curds but the symptoms differentiating it from AEthusa are:
(1) Leucophlegmatic temperament of Calcarea.
(2) Sour stool, sour vomiting and sour sweat.
(3) Sweaty head with open fontanelles.
Regurgitation of food an hour or so after eating is also a recorded symptom of AEthusa. Vomiting is copious and greenish.
After vomiting, weakness and prostration with sleepiness is found in AEthusa.
Mentally the baby is idiotic and physically so weak as to unable to stand and hold up head.
Features expressive of pain and anxiety are present on face. Prostration with sleepiness is well-marked in AEthusa compared to Calcarea os. or carb.

Cholera Infantum : (Summer diarrhoea or Infantile Cholera).

If the milk drunk by the baby stays in the stomach for a long time, it is vomited out finally as very sour curds, so large in quantity that it would seem almost impossible that the baby could have ejected them. This condition of stomach when worse, turns into Cholera infantum. This is due to acute catarrhal inflammation of the stomach and intestine with irritation of sympathetic ganglia.

Causation: High temperature of summer, errors of diet, dentition and bad hygienic surroundings.

Character: The onset is sudden and the child lies stretched out in an unconscious condition, with fixed and dilated pupils and eyes turned downwards. Sunken face and well marked linea nasalis. Great INTOLERANCE OF MILK. It is vomited out in large sour curds. After vomiting, the baby falls down completely prostrated and exhausted. Violent.sudden vomiting of frothy white substance resembling milk. Vomiting is green and copious. The child can retain nothing in its stomach. At every commencement of an attack, there is great exhaustion and rapid wasting of the tissues.

Stool: Greenish, liquid, slimy and undigested, profuse with green mucus.
During and before stool, there is colic and convulsion. After stool, weakness and prostration with sleepiness are well-marked.
In the last stage symptoms of collapse supervene.
Modality: Worse in the morning.
For cure of Cholera infantum, sometimes AEthusa should be followed by an anti-psoric remedy like Psorinum or Sulphur. The attack may last from a few hours to severalweeks.

Convulsion or Epilepsy :
AEthusa has got peculiar symptoms of epileptic convulsion. EYES ARE TURNED DOWNWARDS instead of upwards or side wise. If the condition is worse, there is sunkenness on the face with well
marked linea nasalis. This symptom leads to AEthusa more than to any other remedy. Spasm with clenched thumbs red face, fixed and dilated pupils, locked jaws and foam in the mouth are among the very marked symptoms of AEthusa. Pulse is small, quick and hard. After spasm, weakness and
Prostration with sleepiness occur.
General Modalities :
Aggravation : All complaints are worse after eating or drinking, hot summer weather, milk or milk in any form, after vorniting, after stool, after spasm during the period of dentition, 3 a.m. to 4 a.m. and in the evening.
Amelioration : All complaints are better by covering, open fresh air, seashore, rest, company and tight bandage on head.
Relations :
Similar to: Antim. crud., Arsenic., Calcarea carb.
Complementary to: Calcarea carb.
Antidoted by: Vegetable acids.
It antidotes: Opium, Aconite in inflammatory conditions.

Chapter 12 AGARICUS MUSCARIUS

INTRODUCTION
Agaricus muscarius is a gift of vegetable kingdom. It is very much suited to nervous affections of old people, drunkards who often become delirious and get epileptiform fit. Agaricus finds a respectable place in the Materia Medica as an excellent remedy for neruous affections.

CLINICAL
Bad effects of alcohol Chilblains, Chorea, Delirium, Debauch, Epilepsy, Enteric Fever, Gangrene, Headache, Itching, Lumbago, Prolapse, Rheumatism, Skin affections, Sexual excess, Suppressed eruption, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It energetically acts upon nerves, mind, brain, circulation, skin and mucous membrane.

PATHOGENESIS
It irritates nerves and brain producing various delirious conditions, epileptiform fit and exaggeration of nervous functions other reflex symptoms.

Constitution :
It is best adapted to old people with weak indolent circulation, light hair, lax skin and muscles.
Temperament: Nervous temperament.
Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.
Miasm: Psora and Syphilis are in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Delirium with constant raving.
2. Involuntary movements while awake; spasmodic motion and chorea.
3. Uncertainty in walking; stumbles over everything on the way.
4. Twitching and trembling run through the whole remedy,
5. Great sensitiveness of the entire body.
6. Chilblains and frostbite, with itching and redness and burning intolerably.
7. Complaints appear diagonally: Upper left arm and lower right leg (Anac., Arn,, Kalic., Led., R.tox., Thuja). Upper right arm and lower left leg (Ambra, Caust,, Lyco.,     Medo., Phos., Sulp.ac.).
8. Pain as if ice touched or pierced by needles of ice, is very characteristic.
9. Violent bearing down pain in females.
10. Ailments from : Indolent circulation, bad effects of alcohol, debauch, sexual excess,
suppressed eruption.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: Headache may be caused by defective circulation, alcohol or sexual excess.

Character of headache: Headache of those readily become delirious in fever or with pain; of persons subject to chorea; twitching or grimaces; from spinal affection.
Modality: Aggravation from exposure to cold air, before a thunderstorm, after coition or alcoholism.
Concomitants: Delirium; twitching and jerking; especially while awake.

Convulsion and delirium :

Causation: Of drunkards, bad effects of sexual excess, debauch or suppressed eruption.

Character of delirium: With constant raving. The patient tries to. get out of bed and escape, generally in typhoid. Twitching and trembling and jerking of the whole body with chorea. Involuntary movements while awake, ceases during sleep; chorea of single muscle to the dancing of the whole body. There may be spinal irritation due to sexual excess. Nervous prostration after sexual debauch. Every motion and turn of the body causes pain in the spine. There is uncertainty in, walking; stumbles over everything on the way. Feels pains as if beaten. A peculiarity of the delirium is tendency to make verses and prophecy and incoherent talks; it gives the nearest approach to paralysis; exalted notions of grandeur and power, followed by depression, confusion and imbecility.


Concomitants: There may be headache along with or consequent upon this attack. The whole body is very painful and sensitive to touch. Extreme sensitiveness to cold air.
Skin :

Causation: Exposure to cold; snow-bite
.
Sensarion: Chilblains with itching, redness and burning. Frostbite and all cosequences thereof.

Sensation as if ice touched or ice cold needles were piercing the skin or as from hot needles.

Burning, itching and redness of various parts; ears, nose, face, hands and feet. The affected parts are red, hot and swollen.

Feels pain all over the body. Spine is very sensitive to touch. Pain is sore, aching, especially in lumbar and sacral region, during exertion, in daytime and while sitting. Single vertebra is very sensitive to touch. Extremely sensitive to cold air.

Modality: Aggravation when standing and in cold air.

Prolapse : Especially in post-climacteric period, there is bearing down sensation, with severe intolerable pain.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: After eating, after coitus, cold air, mental application, before thunderstorm.

Amelioration: In open air and warm application.

Relations :
Similar to Calcarea, Cantharides, Hyos.; Lachesis, Nux vomica and Stramonium, in delirium of alcoholism arid to Zincum in chorea.

Antidoted by : Charcoal; Coffea, Camphor.

Follows well : Bell., Caic., Merc., Op., Puls., Rhust., Sil.

Followed well by: Tarent.


Chapter 13 AGNUS CASTUS

INTRODUCTION
Agnus Castus was used in early days by both men & women to suppress the sexual desire and hence homoeopathically it becomes a medicine for sexual weakness with no desire & power. It belongs to the same category as Selenium, Staphysagria and Acid Phos, although properly speaking it typifies a condition more desperate than that presented by any one of those remedies.

CLINICAL :

Agalactia, Impotency. Leucorrhoea. Sterility. Gonorrhoea—secondary. Sprains.
Spheres of Action & Pathogenesis : Agnus produces its chief effect on sexual organs of both the sexes. It lowers sexual vitality, with corresponding mental depression and loss of nervous energy.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS : 
1) Prematurely old age-from abuse of the sexual powers.

2) Complete impotence with relaxation, flaccidity, coldness of genitalia. No sexual power or desire.

3) Impotency after repeated attacks of gonorrhoea.

4) Deficient secretion or suppression of milk in nursing women 

5) Leucorrhoea transparent but Draining linen yellow; passes imperceptibly from the Very relaxed parts.

6) Mind : Absent minded. Unable to recollect things. He has to read a sentence twice before he can comprehend. He becomes melancholic apathetic, distracted from
abuse of sexual powers. Illusions of smells, herrings, musk. There is great sadness with a fixed idea of approaching death. This fear is not of immediate death as with
Aconite, but the patient thinks it is sure to come after a while, and there is no use in doing anything, Nervous debility in unmarried persons. Tachycardia caused by
tobacco in neurotic young men, 

7) Ailments from—Sexual excesses. Repeated attacks of gonorrhoea or gleet. Sprains or Overlifting.
PARTICULARS

Male sexual Organs :

It has more marked action on male sexual organs than female sexual organs. Agnus should be thought of when the sexual life is entirely annihilated due to abuses & excesses of former years and due to repeated attacks of gonorrhoea in the past. The patient becomes a complete impotent with relaxation, coldness, flaccidity of the genitalia. There is no sexual power and desire, even voluptuous fancies excite no erection. It is also medicine for secondary gonorrhoea. Gleety discharge with absence of sexual desire & erections. Testes cold, swollen, hard & painful.

Female sexual Organs :

Breast symptoms : Agalactia—There is deficient secretion or suppression of milk in nursing women (Asaf., Lac. Can., Lac. Defl.} This condition is often associated with great sadness & an idea of approaching death.

Leucorrhoea : There is transparent, imperceptible discharge from the very relaxed parts which stains the linen yellow.

Sterility : This remedy is very good for sterility if a woman had indulged extensively in secrete vice. She has no sexual desire, aversion to coition, sexual thrill is absent with suppression of menses.

In sterility Agnus Castus can be compared with Borax, Lycopodium, Nat. Carb, Platina and Sepia.

Borax : In Borax hot, acrid leucorrhoea causes death of sperms thereby preventing pregnancy
.
Lycopodium :Coition is prevented by dryness of vagina (Nat Mur., Lyssin).

Nat Carb :There is discharge of mucus from vagina after an embrace causing sterility.

Platina : Here coition is prevented by extreme sensitiveness of the vagina (Thuja).

Sepia :In Sepia also, there is aversion to opposite sex, to coition, even young newly married Sepia lady has no desire for intercourse. Vagina painful especially on coition


Chapter 14 ALLIUM CEPA . 

INTRODUCTION

The mother tincture of Allium cepa is prepared from the fresh red bulbs which abundantly grow in India. Ordinarily it has no therapeutic value, but when it is potentised, it serves as an excellent remedy for any catarrhal inflammation. It is more or less an acute drug.

CLINICAL

Catarrah, Cold, Coryza, Cough, Diarrhoea, Influenza, Injury, Laryngitis, Nasal polypus, Throat affections, Whooping cough etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Its main seats of action are conjunctiva, mucous membrane of nose, respiratory tract, intestine, nerves and veins.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes irritation of conjunctiva and mucous membrane of nose, respiratory and gastro-intestinal tracts, producing acute catarrhal inflammation and profuse discharge.
It also causes neuralgia and inflammation of veins.

CONSTITUTION

Since it is mainly an acute drug, consideration: .of . constitution is not important. The patient is, however, very hot with psoric miasm in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Allium cepa is a left sided medicine. Symptoms go from left to-right.

2. In common cold or cough or headache, which is aggravated in a warm room, better in open air and worse again on-returning to a warm room, Allium cepa must be thought of.
3. Profuse watery and acrid nasal discharge with profuse bland lachrymation (rev. of Euphrasia where nasal discharge is bland and lachrymation is acrid).
4. Desire for raw onion is an indication for the remedy (Cub.).
5. Aggravation in warm room and in the evening; relieved in cold room and open air.
6. Violent laryngitis, cough seems to TEAR AND SPLIT THE LARYNX.
7. Neuralgic pain like a long thread following amputation or nerve injuries is relieved by this remedy.
8. Thread like pain, in various parts, is characteristic of Allium cepa. 
9. Ailments from : Exposure to damp north-western cold wind, bad effects from getting wet, salad, cucumber.

PARTICULARS

Headache :
There is catarrhal dull headache with coryza, which aggravates in warm room, better in open air and worse again on returning to a warm room.
Eyes :
The eyes are burning, biting, smarting as from smoke, must rub them for relief, watery and suffused; capillaries are injected, congested and EXCESSIVE LACHRYMATION WHICH IS PROFUSE-BUT
BLAND.
Nose :
The discharge from nose is also profuse and watery but ACRID. Excoriates the part touched by the nasal discharge. The nasal discharge drops from tip of the nose.
There may also be nasal polypus found in the patient (Sanguinaria, Psorinum, Mar.v., Sang. Nit.).
Coryza :
There is spring coryza after exposure to damp northwestern wind; discharges burn and corrode the nose and upper lip. catarrhal laryngitis, with severe cough which compels the patient to grasp the larynx: seems as if the cough would fear the larynx.

Modalities: The above symptoms of headache, eyes, nose and coryza are aggravated in the evening, in a warm room and are relieved in the open air and in a cold room.

Colic :
Allium cepa patient may also suffer from colic usually caused from cold; by getting feet wet; from overeating; cucumbers; salads; haemorrhoidal; of children; is aggravated by sitting and relieved by moving about.

Injury :
If in neuralgia the pain is like a long thread on face, hand, neck or chest or if there is traumatic chronic neuritis of neuralgia after amputation with burning and stinging pain Allium cepa is the remedy.
Phlebitis :
Furthermore, if phlebitis, puerperal or after forceps delivery, develops or panaritia with red streaks up the arm with pain driving the patient to despair, in child-bed Allium cepa is to be thought of as an effective remedy.

For the sore and raw spots on feet especially heel, ‘from friction particularly when the feet are rubbed sore” Allium cepa is very much efficacious.
General Modalities : 
Aggravation: Predominantly in the evening and in warm room (puls—in open air, Euphrasia).
Amelioration: In cold room and open air (puls).

Relations :
Complementary to Phosphorus, Puls., Thuja. Compatible before Calcarea and Silicea in polypus, Similar to Euphrasia, but coryza and lachrymation are opposite.Bad effects from getting wet (Rhus tox.).Antidoted by: Am., Cham., Nx v., Thuja.


Chapter 15 ALOE SOCOTRINA

INTRODUCTION
Aloe socotrina is an excellent remedy like Nux vomica in re-establishing physiological equilibrium after much drugging where disease and drug symptoms are mixed to form a common pool. For this wonderful medicine, Dr. N.M. Choudhury has masterly remarked that “To write a Materia Medica without Aloe is to write a novel without a hero.” Its importance and usefulness become evident as soon as we launch in our business of curing the sick.

CLINICAL
Abdominal disorders, Anal affection, Colic, Constipation, cough, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Haemorrhoids, Skin affections, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts especially upon the nervous system, portal system, blood and skin. It has got special action upon the liver and intestine.

PATHOGENESIS
When acting on mucous membrane of gastrointestinal tract, it produces diarrhoea, dysentery and haemorrhage from the haemorrhoidal vessels. It affects the intestine
especially rectum producing loss of control of sphincter ani. It also causes congestion of various parts, especially abdomen, pelvic organs and head.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: Especially suited to old people, women of relaxed, phlegmatic habit. Indolent weary persons leading sedentary life, averse to either physical and
mental labour.
Temperament: Bilious temperament,
Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient.
Miasm: Psora is in the background,

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :
1. Profuse jelly like of mucus from all mucous membranes, especially of intestine a throat (Kali bi., Podo., Helleborus).
2. Insecurity of rectum with want of confidence and power in sphincter ani.
3. Hot patient, aggravation from warm and amelioration from cold water, cold weather.
4. Itch appears each year as winter approaches.
5. Dissatisfied and angry about himself or his complaints, especially when constipated.
6. Haemorrhoid like a bunch of grapes, blue, which bleeds and is sore, tender and hot with itching relieved by cold application.
7. Diarrhoea followed by obstinate constipation.
8. Solid stool passes out involuntarily.

PARTICULARS
Headache :

Causation: Due to insufficient stool and from sedentary life.

Location: Headache across the forehead.

Character: Congestive type of headache, sensation of heat on the surface with feeling of congestion and fulness, aching pain above the forehead, with heaviness in the eyes, must close them.

Modalities: Aggravation from every foot-step, from heat and amelioration from cold application.

Concomitants: Headache alternates with lumbago.

Gastro-intestinal symptoms :

Diarrhoea :

Causation: after eating and drinking.

Time: Early in the morning. The patient has to hurry to the closet, driving out of bed. early in the morning (Psor., Rumex, Sulphur) Or immediately after eating and drinking WITH WANT OF CONFIDENCE IN SPHINCTER ANI.
Quantity : Scanty stool.
Character: WATERY, yellowish, jelly-like mucus in the stool, pajnful.
Before stool : The abdomen is distended with gas, causing a feeling of fulness and tightness with rumbling and gurgling sound in the abdpmen, with sudden urging and heaviness in the rectum.

During stool: Cutting, griping pain in right lower portion of abdomen, excruciating type of pain with much flatus, When passing flatus, sensation as if stool would also pass with it. The flatus is very offensive, burning and copious. Much flatus with small quantity of stool, Earning in anus after passage of flatus, Also during stool, there is gushing of thin, yellowigh, watery, offensive and excoriating faeces which burns like fire making the anus sore. Hungry during stool


After stool: All pains cease after stool, LEAVING PROFUSE SWEATING AND PROFOUND WEAKNESS. Aggravation after eating and drinking. Concomitants: Diarrhoea alternates with Headache. 

Dysentery :
There is inflammatory condition of lower portion of colon and rectum.

Character of stool: Bloody discharge with much jelly-like mucus and less blood. Sometimes the patient passes nothing but large quantity of jelly-like mucus only.

Before stool: Rumbling sound in the abdomen which is full of gas.
During stool: Cutting, griping pain in the lower portion of abdomen.
After stool: Profound weakness and prostration.
Modalities: Aggravation after eating and drinking.
Constipation :
Causation: Sedentary life.
Character of stool: Hard lump without any urging to stool. Solid stool and masses of mucus pass involuntarily. There is entire loss of sensation in anus, no feeling during passage of stool.

Piles :
Causation: Sedentary life and portal congestion.
Character: Bleeding piles.
Appearance: Like a bunch of grapes; bluish in colour.

Character of pain: Constant bearing down pain in the recturny iwith intense itching and burning in anus, preventing sleep. Very much tender, hot and sore with loose stool.

Modalities :
Aggravation: From heat.
Amelioration: By cold application.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: Early in the morning, sedentary life, hot dry weather, after eating and drinking, standing or walking.
Amelioration: Cold water, cold weather, discharge of flatus and stool. 
Relations :

Complementary to Sulphur. It is antidoted by Sulphur, but it resembles Sulphur in many syrnptoms and is of equal importance with Sulphur in chronic diseases with abdominal plethora.


Chapter 16 ALUMINA

Aluminium Hydrate HAHNEMANN Al(OH)

INTRODUCTION

As a result of a fast civilization, people are much habituated to using metals and their compounds for various purposes. One of them is the use of metals in cooking utensils Aluminium being the major component. Prolonged use of these utensils brings a state of chronic aluminium poisoning. This state is now-a-days often met with for which potentised Aluminium is the remedy. Hering has remarked “apparently as usual, crude poison is antidoted by its potencies—200, etc.”

CLINICAL 

Anus affection, Constipation of infants, Cough, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Eczema, Headache, Leucorrhoea, Locomotor Ataxia, Menstrual disorders, Nervous affection, Skin affection etc. 

SPHERES OF ACTION 

Alumina directly affects the motor nervous system; most specific action is on mucous membrane, specially of intestine and vagina. Skin remains the main seat of action.

PATHOGENESIS

When acting on the motor nervous system, it produces a state of paralysis—paralytic condition. By its action on mucous membrane, like Bryonia, it produces a condition of extreme dryness, lack of secretion, with more or less irritation. Skin under the action of
this drug also becomes dry. 

CONSTITUTION

Physical makeup: Alumina patient is spare, dry, thin, having dark complexion, persons of sedentary habits who suffer from chronic ailments; to constitutions which suffer from diminished animal heat.

Temperament: Hypochondriac.
Relation with heat and cold: Very chilly patient.
Miasm: Psora is in the background.
Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis. 
Alumina
GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1.Very chilly patient, deficient in animal heat and relieved by warmth in general,except skin eruptions.

2. Dryness of all the mucous membranes of the body; also there is dry skin.

3. There is extreme inactivity of the rectum; even soft stool requires great straining. There is no desire for stool for days together.

4. Obstinate constipation due to paretic condition of the intestine and rectum and dryness of mucous membrane. Requires great straining even   to void soft stool which  adheres to the rectum like clay (Platina).

5. There is diarrhoea when the patient urinates (Mur.ac).

6. Leucorrhoea is profuse, transparent and acrid, running down to heels; more during day and better by cold bathing. There is intense craving for    undigestible things, such    as starch, chalk, charcoal,cloves, coffee, teagrounds, etc. Aversion to meat and potato which disagree.
  
7. Inability to walk except with eyes open and in the daytime (Arg-nit., Gels.).

8. Trembling of the whole body with desire to lie down which, however, aggravates the fatigue.

9. All irritating things—salt, wine, vinegar, pepper, et¢., immediately produce cough.

10. Aggravation at new and full moon, in cold air, from eating potatoes. Amelioration in summer weather, from warmth and while eating.

11. Mind : The patient is very hasty and hurried. Timepasses too slowly; an hour seems half a day (Arg.nit., Cannabis indica, Medorrhinum— rev. of Cocculus). Great mental confusion persists; confusion of mind and ideas. Confused as to his personal identity itself. The consciousness of his existence is forgotten. He is not exactly who he is, it seems as though he were not himself. The patient makes mistakes in writing and speaking, uses wrong words. He is very sad and has variable mood. Yet there is another-state of mind too, where the patient is very much impulsive; when he sees sharp instruments or blood,impulses rise up so as to kill himself. Most of the mental symptoms come on in the morning or on walking in the morning.

PARTICULARS

Gastrointestinal symptoms :

Stomach : Abnormal craving for starch, charcoal, cloves, coffee or tea-grounds, acid and undigestible things. (Calc. carb., Nitric acid, Cicuta, Cina, Psorinum). There is no desire to eat; potatoes disagree, aversion to meat. Chronic eructation for years, up and down, worse in the evening.

Diarrhoea : Inactivity of the rectum and paralytic condition of the intestine is well-marked.Consequently, there is great straining. Even soft stool requires great straining (Anac., Platina, Nit. acid.). There is diarrhoea when the patient urinates. The patient has to strain at stool in order to urinate. Diarrhoea after eating potatoes.

Constipation :
Causation: Due to dryness of mucous membrane and paretic condition of the intestine, there is inactivity of the rectum.
During stool: There is great straining; patient has to strain a lot to pass stool, even soft stoo| requires great straining. There is no desire to pass stool unless there  is large accumulation. Patient must grasp the seat of closet tightly.
Character of stool: Stool is dry, hard, knotty, covered with mucus. Soft stool adheres to the parts (Platina).After stool: Rectum feels sore, inflamed and bleeding.
Concomitants: The patient has to strain at stool in order to urinte. There is also constipation of nursing children from artificial food, bottle-fed babies Podo.

Menses :
Time: Too early.
Quantity: Scanty.
Character of blood: Pale.
During menses: The sufferings are terrible and the patient is miserable at the menstrual period,although the flow is scanty it is prostrating.
After menses: The patient is exhausted mentally and physically, scarcely able to speak.It makes the woman nearly tired and takes until next period tecget straightened.
Leucorrhoea :
Time: During the day (rev. Syphilinum).
Quantity: Profuse and copious; running down to heels. :
Character: Acrid, yellow, and excoriating. The discharge of leucorrhoea is thick, yellowish, but it may be albuminous and stringy, looking like white of an egg. Leucorrhoea is corroding, profuse and running down to the -heels; more noticeable in daytime because these complaints are generally worse» when walking or standing.

Modalities: Worse during daytime and better by cold bathing.

Nervous symptoms :
Alumina causes paretic condition of muscles. Paralysis of one side of the body or paralysis of the muscles of ithe lower extremities. The paralytic state begins as semi-paralysis; for a long time merely jus!as inactivity, which grows at length into a complete paralytic condition.The paralytic state runs through the remedy and is observed in various parts in many ways.Pains in the sole of foot on stepping; numbness of the heels when walking. Feeble circulation, feeble conductivity and feeble nerve action; everything is slowed down.One sided paralysis, especially of extensors; pain in arms and fingers, arms.feel paralysed. Trembling here and there in the body; slow, tottering gait, staggers on walking.There is inability to walk except with eyes open and in the daytime; tottering and falling when eye are closed (Arg. nitricum, Gels.).


Alumina 
Skin :
Dry type of skin eruptions. The,skin withers, becomes dry and is subject to eruption, thickening, ulceration and bleeding. Tettery type of, skin eruption. The skin is damaged and fissured from its dryness.
Dryness and burning of the skin run through the remedy.

Time: Aggavated in winter.
Character: The skin itches even when there is no eruption; more itching from warmth of bed. The patient scratches until the skin bleeds, then becomes painful. The eruptions are worse in the warmth of bed. The striking feature of this remedy is chronic dryness of the skin.Sweat is rare and if occurs, it is scanty. Alumina is not suited to those with copious exhaustive sweat. It is thus the very opposite of Calcarea carb. which sweats profusely; but Alumina is no doubt, very much exhaustive due to spinal and-paralytic affection, but does not sweat.

Modality: All skin symptoms are WORSE IN WINTER.
General Modalities :
Aggravation: In cold air, during winter, from eating potatoes, in the morning on waking, full and new moon.
Amelioration: In summer weather, from warm drink.

Relations :

Complementary to Bryonia.
Alumina is the chronic of Bryonia.
Alumina is one of the chief antidotes for lead poisoning, painter’s colic (Plumbum). The action of Alumina is slow in developing and the remedy must not be changed quickly.

The following medicines have relation to the moon’s phases :-

Aggravation: At New Moon; Alumina, Ammon. carb., Calcarea carb., Causticum, Cuprum met,Sepia, Silicea.

Aggravation: At full Moon; Alumina, Cal. carb., Graphites, Nat. carb., Nat.mur. Sepia, Silicea, Sulphur.

Aggravation during increasing Moon: Arnica.

Aggravation during waning Moon: Dulc., Thuja.
  
chapter 17 AMBRA GRISEA
    
Ambergris A. Nosode

INTRODUCTION 

 About its origin Dr. H.C.Allen says. “Of doubtful origin, for years on the border land as to its true classification, but probably a nosode or morbid product found in the belly of the spermwhale. It has many characteristics of intestinal or biliary concretions and has been
considered to be of hepatic origin, probably a fatty excretion from its gall bladder” Dr. N.M.Chowdhury says, “Ambergris is a fatlike substance found in the intestines and among the excreta of the spermwhale.” The Oil of Amber i.e. Oleum Succium should not be confounded with
Ambergris.

CLINICAL

Constipation. Convulsions. Cough. Dyspepsia. Hysteria. Menstrual disorder.Leucorrhoea. Neuroses. Nymphomania. Ranula.

SPHERES OF ACTION 

It affects predominantly nervous system especially pneumogastric, spinal nerves and solar plexus. It also acts on gastrointestinal and respiratory tracts and female genital organs. 

PATHOGENESIS 

Acting on nervous system it produces faintness, jerking, twitching and other nervous hysterical manifestations. It affects female genital organs manifesting as leucor-rhoea.,menstrual disorder and pruritus valvae etc. |

CONSTITUTION 

Physical make up : It is suited to old people and children especially young girls whol are excitable, nervous and weak. Lean, thin emaciated nervous persons and thin scrawny women (Sec. Cor.)

Temperament—Nervous bilious temperament.

Heat cold relation—Patients are aggravated from warm and better from cold i general. Miasm—Psora and syphilis are in the background.

Ambra Grista

GUIDING SYMPTOMS 

1) Great bashfulness is very characteristic of Ambra Grisea.
2) The presence of others is unbearable during stool, when urinating even can’t do any thing in pressence of others.
3) After business embarrassments, unable to sleep, must get up (Act., Sep.)
4) Sensation of coldness in abdomen (Cal.)
5) Discharge of blood between periods, at every little accident—a long walk, after every hard stool etc.
6) Leucorrhoea : Thick, bluish-white mucus especially or only at night (Caust, Merc., Nit Ac.)
7) Cough in spasmodic paroxysms, with eructation and hoarseness. Ranula with foetid breath.
8) One sided complaints.
9) Mind : The red strand of this remedy is found in its bash fulness, embarassment and nervousness. The patient is excitable, nervous and hysterical. He is intensely shy blushes easily. He can’t do any thing in presence of others. The presence of others even the nurse, is unbearable during stool, when urinating. There is great sadness, patient sits for days weeping. Music is intolerable, causes weeping. Dread of people and desires to be alone. Restless, excited, despair and very loquacious. Time passes too slowly. Fears of becoming insane. The presence of other people and music aggravate the symptoms. Ambra is a good remedy for sleeplessness due to nervousness and business embarrassment.

PARTICULARS

Gastrointestinal Symptoms :

Stomach : Eructations with violent convulsive cough. Distension of stomach after midnight. Heart burn from drinking milk, Thirstlessness.
Abdomen : Flatulence, distended abdomen after midnight. Sensation of coldness in abdomen.

Constipation : There is frequent ineffectual desire for stool which makes the patient anxious. The presence of others even the nurse is unbearable during stool, Inveterate constipation in old people.

Modality: Aggravation—After eating, warm drink especially warm milk after midnight, in the morning.

Respiratory Symptoms :

Cough : Violent nervous cough in spasmodic paroxsysms with eructations and hoarseness.Hollow, spasmodic barking cough coming from deep in chest. Whooping cough without .crowing inspiration, morning with, evening without expectoration.

Modality : Agg.—Talking, reading aloud, in presence of people, Music.

Asthma : It is very good medicine for asthma of old people and children. Whistling in chest duringbreathing. Asthma comes on while he is attempting coition.

Female Sexual Organs :
It has marked action on female genital organs. Menses—Too early and too profuse. There is discharge of blood between periods at every little accident such as a long walk and after every hard stool.

Leucorrhoea—Discharge of profuse, thick bluish white mucus especially or only at night, Often associated with nymphomania. Pruritus Vulvae—Itching of pudendum with soreness and swelling. During urination, itching, titillation, burning of valva and urethra. There is also burning of sexual parts.

General Modalities :

Aggravation—Warm drinks, warm room, music, lying down, reading or talking aloud, the presence of many people, after waking.
Amelioration—After eating, cold air, cold food and drinks, rising from bed.
