Chapter:20 AMYLENUM NITROSUM 


Nitrite of Amyle TF ALLEN 

INTRODUCTION

The Nitrite of Amyle was introduced into medicine by the oldschool as a remedy for Angina pectoris, and was supposed to act bylessening arterial tension.

CLINICAL:

Angina pectoris, Blushing. Convulsions. Epilepsy.Climacteric-ailments of. Flushings. Headache.Heart-affection of. Sea-sickness. Sunstroke.

SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS :

Tt affects the vaso-motor. nerves causing dilatation of allarterioles and capillaries” thereby flushing of face, heat and throbbing in the head are produced.

CONSTITUTION :

Make up—It is suited to patients subject to flushings and blushings, nervous, sensitive, plethoric women during and after menopause.
Temperament—Nervous, anxious patient.Relation with heat & cold—Hot patientMiasm—Psoric.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :

1) Flushings : Start from face, stomach, various parts of the body followed by often profuse hot sweatings and prostration.
2) Intense surging of blood to face and head (Bell., Glon.) I 
3) Face flushes at the slightest emotion (Coca., Per.)
4) Craves fresh air, patient opens clothing, removes bed covering and opens windows in the coldest weather (Arg Nit., Lach., Sulph.)
5) Constant stretching for hours, impossible to satisfy the desire and call for help tostretch.
6) Profound and repeated yawning (Kali C.)
7) Collar seems too tight, must loosen it (Lach,, Sepia)
8) Hemicrania, especially when affected side is pallid,
9) Puerperal convulsions immediately after delivery.

Amy Nitrite is one of the grand remedies for Angina pectoris in our Materia Medica. Relations :

Crude drug chiefly palliative ; must be repeated as patient becomes accustomed to it ; is curative in the stronger higher potencies. chapter: 22 ANTHRACINUM

A nosode (A product of Anthrax poison)

INTRODUCTION

Anthracinum was introduced into Homoeopathicpractice by “Lux” long before the experiment of“Pasteur”. Though it is not a polychrest medicinehaving limited sphere of action still it has got very important and respected place in Homoeopathy because it has got power to make surgeon’s knife useless and relieves the most serious cases of Carbuncle, Gangrene, Felons, Blood boils etc.

CLINICAL:

Acne. Boil. Carbuncle. Insect stings. Gangrene.

Malignant pustules. Felons. Septic fever. Splenic fever. Dissecting wounds. Anthrax poisoning by foul breath, Foul gas etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION :

Anthracinum has its centre of action over the connective tissues. It covers all theinflammatory conditions of connective tissue in which there exists some purulent focus.Tt also acts on skin.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :

1) Atrocious burning pains as if hot coals were applied to parts. (Ars.)

2) Discharges are ichorus, putrid and offensive from mouth, nose, throat, nostrils, vagina, rectum, ulcer, carbuncle etc. Horribly offensive (Ars., Pyr.).
3) Haemorrhages are black, thick, tar like, rapidly decomposing, from any orifice.

4) Tendency towards malignancy and rapid formation of gangrenous condition.

5) Fever, rapid loss of strength, great prostration, sinking pulse, delirium and fainting.

6) Affected parts turn black and blue.

7) Red lines from the area of infection marking the course of lymphatics.

8) Rapid spread of infiltration and oedema of cellular tissue. Excessive thirst with inability to swallow. We may compare Anthracinum with    Arsenic Album, Tarentula Cubensis & Secale Cornutum in relation with the above mentioned complaints,


Arsenic Alb. : In Arsenic Alb. we get the same atrocious burning pain ichorous and offensivedischarge, marked prostration and ailments from dissecting wounds and anthrax,—like Anthracinum. But unlike it Arsenic pains are relieved by Hot application, associated with great restlessness, midday,midnight aggravation and thirst for little quantity of water at short intervals.

Tarentula Cubensis : Tarentula Cub. is also useful in felons, carbuncles, boils, abscesses, malignantulcers, gangrene and anthrax.
Tarentula has also got atrocious burning pain, bluish discolouration of affected part; but pain associated with hyperaesthesia is its peculiarity.

There is pain of death; it soothes the last struggles. There may be aggravation by contact or touch , Of affected parts but relieved by rubbing affected parts.

Secale Cor : It is also a medicine for gangrene, ulcers, boils etc. Secale has also got burning as of sparks of fire. Haemorthages are offensive, putrid, watery, thin and black. Its Characteristic is relief of burning pain by cold application (rev. of Ars.)


Relation:
When Arsenic or best selected remedy fails to relieve the burning pains of Carbuncle or malignant ulceration, then think of Anthracinum. When Arsenic, Anthracinum fail to relieve terrible pains of cancer,carbuncle or erysipelas then think of Euphorbinum.

chapter: 25 ANTIMONIUM TARTARICUM

Tartar Emetic STAFF 

INTRODUCTION

It is due to the emetic influence of the tartarised antimony that this medicine got its name “Tartar Emetic.” Emetic is a substance which when taken can make a person vomit. Vomiting is under the control of nerve centre present at the base of the brain in Medulla Oblongata. This medicine acts not only on those nerve centres, but also on the pneumogastric nerve to produce pneumonia and bronchitis.

CLINICAL

Alcoholism, Aphthae, Asphyxia neonatorum,Asthma, Bronchitis, Catarrh, Chicken-pox,Cholera, Cough, Fever, Impetigo, Lung affection,Pneumonia, Rheumatism, Tongue coated,Vomiting, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Antim. tart, acts on respiratory organs, salivary glands, mucous membranes, brain,nerve and skin.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on the pneumogastric nerve causes depression of respiration and circulation and other symptoms, resembling pneumonia, bronchitis, asthma, etc. Nausea and vomiting are the manifestations of its influence on the Medulla Oblongata. While on the mucous membrane, it establishes catarrhal inflammation and increased secretion; on the skin it causes pustular eruption, resembling smallpox. The drug also promotes rapid waste of tissues.

CONSTITUTION
Antim. tart. has got hydrogenoid constitution of Grauvogl, torpid, phlegmatic persons. Child at birth is pale.
Diasm : Psora and Sycosis are in the background.
Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Usually suited (or diseases originating from exposure to damp basements or cellars, and after vaccination.
2. There is great accumulation of mucus in air passage which cannot be coughed out, but gives a rattling sound, popularly known as “Death Rattle”.
3. Face becomes pale, cyanosed and flushed due to circulation of unoxydised blood, face covered with cold sweat.
4, Nausea,vomiting, coldness and prostration run through the whole of this remedy.
5. All complaints are attended with IRRESISTIBLE DESIRE TO SLEEP.(Nux. mos., AEthusa, Gels).
6. There is excessive craving for apples and acids (Aloe). Desire for acids, acid fruits and apples; cold water; strong liquors. Aversion to milk and tobacco.
7, Vomiting in any position except when lying on right side. Vomits until he faints, followed by drowsiness, prostration and sleepiness.
8. Pneumonia with jaundice (Chel.)
9. Bad effects of vaccination, when Thuja fails and Silicea is not indicated; usually it produces asthma.
10. Pustular eruptions like small-pox is a great symptom of Ant.tart.

Mind : Confusion of head with a feeling as if he must sleep. Child will not allow itself to be touched. Bad humour during bronchial catarrh. Apprehension and restlessness during evening. Dread of being left alone. Mental excitement and
nervousness. The patient is frightened at night. Vertigo on closing the eyes, when walking and flickering before the eyes, when lifting the head. So she-must lie down.

Ailments from : Anger, vexation, smallpox, after eating, vaccination, damp, debility, debauchery.

PARTICULARS
Gastro-intestinal symptoms :
Overeating, yawning and drowsiness. Vomiting in any position except when lying on right side. Thevomitus is green, watery and frothy, Due to violent straining, there is tendency to vomit.

Tongue :
Tongue is covered with thick, white pasty coat; red streaks; very red, dry in the middle. On thetongue there are small pustules which are very painful. In most complaints this remedy is; thirstless. There is perspiration on forehead; with coldness of surface, usually the hands and feet are as cold asice; thirstless or may drink little often.

Asiatic cholera :
There is incessant diarrhoea and vomiting until the patient faints. The patient has inordinate craving for apple (Aloe). Very much sleepy after vomiting. Nausea Is better and relieved after vomiting. Vomiting in any position except when lying on right side.Diarrhoea and constipation alternate.

Respiratory System :

Antim. tart, is a wonderful medicine for many diseases of respiratory tract, whether it is pneumonia, bronchitis, asthma, etc., it matters little, if the following symptoms are present.

Causation: Exposure to damp basement and cellars. Bad effects of vaccination.

Character of troubles: Difficult suffocation in the evening and at am .compelling the patient to sit up due to aggravation of cough with less or no expectoration of mucus. LOUD RATTLING DUE TO LARGE ACCUMULATION OF MUCUS IN BRONCHI which can be heard across the entire room. In the last stage of pneumonia when the resolution takes place much more rapidly than absorption and expectoration, so that lungs are fitted with mucus and pus, this remedy will relieve. There will be marked dyspnoea and the patient gets anguished with the cough.

Cardio-vascular system :

Incontinence of urine with great irritation of the parts. Frequent, painful; canscarcely retain the urinefor a moment.
Urine is scanty, coming only in drops; bloody, foetid, albuminous with casts. May be very dark and frothy. .
Before urination: As soon as a few drops collect in the bladder, the urge comes; constant and inffectual urge. Much straining before the urine starts coming.
During urination: Scalds severely, stinging pain, strangury, Last drop burns and smarts.

Chest :
Hoarseness, dyspnoea, breathing hurried and difficult. OEdema of larynx, feels as if he could notdraw another breath; suffocation and short cough.

Female genital organs :
OEdema of labia; relieved by cold water. Oophoritis with burning stinging pain; worse in right ovary Ovarian tumour. Great tenderness over abdomen and uterine region.

Menses:
Suppressed with cerebral and head symptoms, espcially in young girls. Metrorrhagia profuse, with heavy abdomen, faintness and stinging pain. Sense of tightness. Bearing down sensation as if menses
were to appear. For dysmenorrhoea with severe ovarian pain, Apis is a good medicine.

Skin :
Skin is waxy, pale and oedematous. Very sensitive to touch. Erysipelas with stinging, burning pain.OEdematous condition of face, especially lower eyelids, extends from right to left. (Left to right, Rhustox.).

Urticaria: Like bee stings or stings from other poisonous insects. Body covered with large, elevated white wheals, stinging, buming, pricking and smarting or itching of the skin.
Modalities:
° Aggravation: At night, by covering, application of heat or in a warm room.
© Amelioration: From cold and open air.
Boils and carbuncles: Rosy hue; oedematous condition sensitive to touch. Aggravation from heat,
covering and amelioration from cold application.
cancer: The affected part has great buring and stinging pain with extreme sensitiveness to touch and general soreness. Metastasis of cancerous affection takes place in the cellular tissue with effusion.
Modalities:
¢ Aggravation: By warmth and hot application In: general and by covering.
¢ Amelioration: By cold application.

Fever :
Apis is an excellent drug for both remittent and intermittent fever.
Intermittent fever: Chill begins at 3 p.m. with thirst (Ign). Pulse is full and rapid, small and tremblingintermittently. Chilliness from least motion, Swelling and burning of lips during entire paroxysm. After fever paroxysms there is deep sleep. After perspiration, there may be nettle-rash, also with shuddering. No thirst in sweat stage. Worse from warm and heated room and external heat.

Remittent fever: Apis is an infallible remedy for remittent fever especially when the fever assumes a typhoid form or meningitis, cerebral fever, etc, The patient is generally thirstless except during chill. Chill running over the back. Fever is continuous and low type. The patient does not like to cover up or to be touched for the body is very sensitive, Always wants open air, uncovering and cold drinks.

General Modalities :
Aggravation : Alter sleep (Lach.), closed, warm and heated room, from getting wet (Rhus tox.),touch, pressure, late in afternoon, 3p.m., right side.
Amelioration: In open air, uncovering, cold bathing, pains by coughing, walking or changing position, when sitting erect.

Relations :
Complementary to Natrum mur. Inimical to Rhus tox., in eruptive diseases.
Follows well: Arsenic and Pulsatilla.
Antidote: Cantharides, China, lodum, Digitalis.
Apis has low action and must not be changed too soon. Increased flow of urine shows that it is producing a favourable effect.

 chapter:27 APOCYNUM CANNABINUM
Indian Hemp FREITAG Apocynaceae

INTRODUCTION
Apocynum is reputed to be a very good remedy for dropsy, hydrocephalus and ascites and as such it occupies a place as important as that of Apis.

CLINICAL:
Ascites. Amenorrhoea. Cough. Dropsies. Heart affection. Hydrocephalous. Metrorrhagia. Urinary affection. Vomiting.

SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS :
It acts on urinary organs digestive tract and uterus. Acting on urinary organs, induces diuresis and removes the dropsical effusions It depresses the heart, kidneys and intestines relaxing sphincters. It also produces intense gastric disturbance.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :
. Excretions diminished, especially urine and sweat.
.Dropsy with thirst (Ace. Acid, without thirst, Apis Mel) but water disagrees, causing pain or is vomited ; when associated with heart, liver & kidney diseases.
. Hydrocephalas with open sutures ; stupor, sight of one eye lost, constant and involuntary motion of one arm and one leg ; forehead projected. (Helleborus—leftarm & leg,—Bryonia)
. Amenorrhoea in young girls with bloating or dropsical extension of abdomen and extremities.
.Metrorrhagia with continued or paroxysmal flow and fluid or clotted blood, nausea, vomiting, palpitation, pulse quick, feeble when moved ; vital depression, fainting when rising from pillow.
.Cough, short & dry or deep and loose during pregnancy (Con.)

Ailments from : Dropsy after typhus, typhoid, scarlatina, cirrhosis, after abuse ofquinine, alcohol.It can be compared with Acetic acid, Apis mel. and Ars, Alb. in dropsy.
Acetic Acid : It is one of the prominent medicines for dropsy associated with diabetes and gastrointestinal diseases. With dropsical condition, there is profound

Apocynum Cannabinum 73

anaemia with waxy pallor of the face. Dropsy with great thirst and debility, emaciation,sour belching, waterbrash & diarrhoea. Patient cannot sleep lying on back but restsbetter lying on belly.

Apis Mel : Oedema of the hands & feet, anasarca, ascites. Dropsy without thirst.Bag like puffy swelling under the eyes is characteristic dropsy after suppressederuptions. Urine frequent, painful, scanty.

Ars. Alb. : Anasarca with skin pale, waxy, earth colored. Dropsy with burning thirst without special desire to drink. Stomach does not seem to tolerate because it cannot assimi-late, cold water. Great thirst for cold water, drinks often, but little at a time.
Patient sleeps better on back.


 chapter: 28 ARGENTUM METALLICUM
Pure Silver HAHNEMANN The Metal

INTRODUCTION
Argentum metallicum is prepared from the precipitated Silver. It is mainly a left- sided remedy. Almost all the heavy metals have been proved to be excellent remedies after the process of potentisation and so does the Silver too. Hahnemann.was shrewd enough to understand the curative value of this metal and enunciated the process for the benefit of all generations of mankind.

CLINICAL

Brain-fag, Diabetes, Exosfosis, Heart affections, Laryngitis, Loss of voice, Male genital organs, Prolapse of uterus, Rheumatism, Throat affections, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

The main centres of action of this remedy are mucous membrane of throat and respiratory tract; affects all cartilages, and hence all joints and bones; cartilages of ear,nose, euslachian tube, male and female genital organs, etc.

PATHOGENESIS
It causes irritation of mucous membrane of throat and respiratory tract, producinghoarseness and loss of voice and cough; it also produces sexual weakness in male andprolapse with pain and haemorrhge in female. As it affects the cartilages, bones andjoints it produces bruised pain, tenderness and weakness.

CONSTITUTION
Make-up of the body: Usually the patient is tall and thin, with constitutional effectsof onanism and abuse of mercury.

Temperament: Irritable temperament.
Miasm: Syphilis is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

. Hoarseness of professional singers and public speakers with total loss of voice.
. Laughing excites cough (Drosera, Phosphorus, Stannum), and produces profuse mucus in larynx.
. Great weakness of the chest (Stannum).
, Raw spot over the bifurcation of trachea.
. Exhausting fluent coryza with sneezing.
. Sexual weakness with crushed pain in testicles.
. Prolapse of uterus with pain and haemorrhage.
. Bad effects of abuse of mercury, syphilis, sexual excess, and onanism, such as impotency, atrophy of penis, bruised pain in resticle, etc.
. Articular rheumatism without swelling (so called hysterical rheumatism).

PARTICULARS

Throat and respiratory tract :
There is exhausting and fluent coryza with sneezing. Hoarseness of professional singers and public speakers with total loss of voice.
Throat and larynx feel sore or raw on swallowing or on coughing. Laughing causes cough (Drosera, Phosphorus, Stannum) and produces profuse mucus in larynx, cough with easy expectoration of gelatinous viscid mucus, looking like boiled starch.
While reading the patient has to hem and.hawk to clear the throat and expectorate the mucus. Great weakness in the chest (Stannum); worse when lying on left side. Raw spot over the bifurcation of trachea; worse when using voice, talking or singing.

Modalities:
 Aggravation: When riding in a carriage; when touching or pressing upon, when talking, singing or reading aloud.

Male Genital Organs :

Causation: Due to sexual excess, onanism and abuse of mercury.
Character: There is seminal emission after onanism, almost every night, without erection. The penis is atrophied.
There is crushed pain in the testicles.
Female Genital Organs :
Prolapse : There is prolapse of uterus with pain in the left ovary and back. The pain extends forwards and downwards.
During climacteric age; along with prolapse, there will also be haemorrhage.
Unine : The colour of urine is like whey in diabetes mellitus.
General Modalities :
Aggravation: Riding in a carriage (Cocculus), when touched or pressed upon; talking, singing, treading aloud.

Relations :
Follows well after Alumina.
Similar to: Stannum in cough excited by laughing.
Antidoted by: Puls and Mercurius.


chapter: 29 ARGENTUM NITRICUM
Silver Nitrate J.O. MUELLER 

INTRODUCTION
Argentum nitricum is one of the “Monumental treasures”, and in its PATHOGENESISis, we find a wonderful remedy having tremendous influence over the human economy, particularly in the affections of the brain, nerves and_ gastro-intestinal tract, producing multiple physiological and pathological changes. This great anti-sycotic remedy is mainly indicated in those persons in whom intellectualfeatures predominate.
It has been extensively used by the Allopaths for the cauterisation of ulcers which do not yield to medicinal treatment.

CLINICAL
Acidity, Addison’s disease, Anaemia, Dyspepsia, Diarrhoea, Emaciation, Eructation, Eye affections, Flatulence, Gastric, ulcer, Gonorrhoea, Headache, Heart-burn, Locomotor ataxia, Neuralgia, Ophthalmia neonatorum, Paraplegia, Paralysis, Ricket, Spinal irritation, Throat affection. Ulcerated tongue, Warts, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts on brain, spinal cord, nerves, blood, mucous membranes such as of eyes, throat, stomach, urethra, etc. periosteum, bones, kidney, liver, gastrointestinal tract alsoare susceptible to the action of this great remedy.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces hyperaesthetic and anaesthetic condition of the nerves, i.e. neuro-sycosis.Kidney liver and other glands show degeneration. It also causes disturbed digestion,diarrhoea, etc. The blood becomes fluid and darker. Haemoglobin is diminshed, setting in defective oxidation and anaemia. Mucous membranes are inflamed.

CONSTITUTION
Adapted to hysterical nervous person with vivid imagination, having carbo-nitrogenoid or hydrogenoid constitution.

Physical make-up: Cachectic, scrawny, withered, dried up, old looking young persons,having history of unusual or long continued mental exertion.

Temperament: Bilious temperament, Very irritable and becomes angry easily.

Argentum Nitricum 77

Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient. Wants everything cold, which gives relief, excepting the gastric symptoms which aggravate.

Miasm: Argentum nitricum covers all the three miasms. It is, however, mainly sycotic and syphilitic with Psora in the background.

Diathesis: Neuro-sycotic.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. Emaciation progressing every year which is most marked in the lower extremities.
. Defective co-ordination of muscles (Gels.) with trembling in the affected parts.
. Great apprehension, especially when getting ready for church, opera, examination, public meeting or any other, engagement and at that time   DIARRHOEA SETS IN (GELS.). It is a good remedy for examination funk.
. Sensation of a splinter in throat, uterus and other parts of the body (Hepar sulph.,Nitric acid).
. Chilly when uncovered, yet feels smothered if warapped up, craves fresh air (Puls.).
. Desire for sugar, sweets (Lyco., Cina, Sulpur), for salt (Carbo veg., Nat. mur.,Phos.).
. Great longing for fresh air.
. Belching accompanies most gastric ailments.
. Urine passes unconsiously day and night (Causticum).
. Impotence, erection fails when action is attempted.
. Chronic laryngitis of singers. The high notes cause cough.
. Great weakness of lower extremities with trembling. Cannot walk with eyes closed(Alumina).
. Coition is painful in both sexes, followed by bleeding from vagina (Nitric acid).

. Acute or chronic diseases from unusual or long continued mental exertion.

 Mind : There is GREAT APPREHENSION when getting ready to go to church or opera, examination or any other important engagement and at that time diarrhoea sets in. we There is frequent loss of memory; makes frequent faults in speech because he cannot find the right words.
Mental confusion and dizziness with tendency to fall sidewards. Vertigo on closing the eyes.
The patient is very impulsive. Does everything hurriedly, so much so that he evendrinks with great haste.
He has great fear of projecting buildings on street corners which creates a sensation as if it would fall over him. The sight of height makes him dizzy.

Suicidal tendency prevails on him. When crossing high places or bridge or looking out through a window, the impulse comes on him to jump down from it. Reserved, sad, taciturn with dullness of head. Feels as if a cloud hung over him. sxime passes very slowly (Alumina, Medorrhinum, Can Indica). Very excitable and easily angered which brings on pain in head chest, etc.
Ailments from : Apprehension and fear; eating ice and ice-cream; sugar and sugarcandy. Mental stress and strain, tobacco, etc.

PARTICULARS

Headache :
Causation: Headache of literary men, habitual or gastric in origin and from dancing. Also caused by prolonged mental exertion.

Location: In the frontal eminence or temple.
Sensation: OF EXPANSION of the head and face. Character of pain. Pressing, screwing pain in he frontal eminence or temples.

Modalities: Aggravation from mental exertion, during menstruation, bright light and relieved by sitting in a dark room tight ban daging, open air, cold application and complete mental rest.

EYES :
Causation: Gonorrhoea, catarrhal condition, fine needle work and eye strain.

Character: Argentum nitricum has got many eye troubles such as Ophthalmia neonatorum in young infants who contacted gonorrhoea during the passage through the birth canal of the infected mother there is profuse purulent discharge, cornea is opaque, ulcerated lids are sore, thick and swollen which agglutinate in the morning.

Granular conjunctivitis; scarlet red, like raw beef, eye strains from needle works.
Dilated pupil, with dimness of vision and intense photo-phobia. The inner canthi, are swollen and congested. Paretic condition of the ciliary muscles; defective accommodation.

Modalities:
* Aggravation: Worse in a warm room, sitting by the side of fire and bright light.
¢ Amelioration: From cold application and in a dark room.

Inflamed, with thick mucus discharge and feeling of rawness and soreness with splinter-like sensation in the throat; during swallowing, tingling with sensation of hair in the throat with hoarseness in the

evening.
Laryngitis of singers and public speakers.

Modalities:
¢ Aggravation: From sweet, ice cream, emotion and lying on left side.
¢ Amelioration: From eructation, pressure and abstaining from sweet and cold food.

Diarrhoea :
Argentum nitricum has got two kinds of diarrhoea, viz. (1) Nervous diarrhoea and (2) Diarrhoea due to gastro-intestinal disorders.
Nervous diarrhoea : It sets in as a result of any mental emotion, nervousness, etc. There is great apprehension when the patient is ready to go to church or opera or to appear for the examination, or before public or any other engagement, suddenly diarrhoea comes in (Gels.). Although there is no particular striking characteristic feature about the stool, there is watery stool with intolerable
offensiveness and urging. But immediately the person starts performing the task for which he was preparing, the diarrhoea disappears and he is perfectly well and accomplishes the assigntment quite satisfactorily.

 Diarrhoea due to gastro-intestinal disorders.
Causation: Sugar, candy, sweets, milk, salt, etc. After weaning in children, mental shock, after long mental exertion.

Sensation: As if the abdomen would burst with wind.

* Amelioration : From lying on right side, from eructation, from fresh air and from pressure.
Concomitants; Almost all the symptoms are associated with nausea and vomiting of glairy mucus.

Locomotor-ataxia with lightning like pain in the affected part. Convulsion followed by greatrestlessness with trembling of the body. Staggering and paralytic’ heaviness of lower limbs. Hysteria with complete but temporary blindness, Numbness in forearm at night. A kind of numb sensitiveness of the arms—a hyperaesthetic anaesthetic state; increased sensitiveness to touch but diminished sense of distinguishing sensations. Rigidity in calves with great weakness.

chapter : 30 ARNICA MONTANA
Leopard's Bane HAHNEMANN Compositae

INTRODUCTION
Arnica grows all over the world in the mountain region. Before proving. Arnica plant was used in any injury from fall with astonishing results. So it can be said to be the traumatic par excellence. Trauma in all its varieties and effects, recent or remote, is met by Arnica, more than by any other single drug.

CLINICAL
Abscess, Apoplexy, Boils, Brain affection,Bronchitis, Bruises, Carbuncle, Chest affections, Diabetes, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Ecchymosis. Eye affections, Fever, Haematemesis, Haematuria, Headache, Heart affection, Injury, Labour, Meningitis, Paralysis, Rheumatism, Rheumatic fever, Sprain, Suppuration, Typhoid, Urinary affection, Skin affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
The Chief action of Arnica is on blood and blood vessels particularly on capillaries. It is generally believed to possess the. power of absorbing blood.

PATHOGENESIS
By its action upon the blood, it produces anaemia, tendency to haemorrhage,capillary stasis, ecchymosis and defective nutrition. Arnica causes reabsorption of extravasated blood, prevents septic condition and recovery of the parts. On the muscular, serous and cellular tissues and tendons, it produces condition similar to those resulting from blunt injuries.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: Sanguine, plethoric persons, lively expression and very red face,who are disposed to cerebral congestion.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.
Temperament: Nervous temperament

Miasm: Psora is in the background

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. SORE, LAME, BRUISED FEELING ALL THROUGH THE BODY AS IF BEATEN,
. The patient is very much oversensitive to pain.
. EVERYTHING ON WHICH THE PATIENT LIES SEEMS too hard.
. Heat of upper part of the body and coldness of lower part.
. Tendency to small painful boils one after another.
. Stupor with involuntary discharge of faeces and urine.
. The patient bleeds easily; blood vessels seem to be relaxed and, therefore, extravasation is easy.
. Arnica is specially suited to cases where injury, however, remote, seems to have caused the present troubles. Master Hahnemann feels that this remedy is most suited to chronic cases.
. Arnica causes and cures haemorrhage of any kind; haemorrhage into the tissues of internal organs or the skin.
. Concussion and contusions, result of shock or injury without laceration of soft parts prevents suppuration and septic condition and promotes absorption.
. Local application of Arnica produces extraordinary growth of hair and checks falling of hair. .

 Mind : The patient remains unconscious; when spoken to, answers correctly, and completely, but immediately unconsciousness and delirium return (Phos. acid.; falls
asleep in the midst of answer—Baptisia). The patient is in a stuporous condition with involuntary discharge of stool and urine, specially typhoid. Indifferent to everything. Complete inability to perform continuous active work. He is morosed,
quiet, wants to be alone, with depression of spirit and absence of mind. Low muttering delirium or complete stupor in malarial or typhoid fever. Fears of being struck or even touched by those coming near him. Sudden fear of death rousing him up at night, with cardiac distress.

 Ailments from. Bad effects of mechanical injuries even if received years ago, falls, blow, concussion, contusion, hard work, spirituous liquor, charcoal vapour, fright and anger.

PARTICULARS
Eye:

For conjunctival and retinal haemorrhage with extravasation and intra ocular haemorrhage from injuries or cough. Arnica is an infallible remedy.
Gastrointestinal symptoms :
Stomach : Longing for vinegar. Distaste for milk and meat. Pain in stomach during eating. Belching and eructation are very much foul, putrid, like rotten eggs. Putrid smell from mouth.
Constipation :
¢ Causation: Due to enlarged prostate or retroverted uterus.
© Sensation: As if rectum is loaded, stool will not come out.
© Character: Ribbon-like stool.
Dysentery : Great straining and tenesmus.
© Character of stool: Very much offensive, brown, bloody, putrid and involuntary. Fruitless
urging. Long interval between two stools.
.® Concomitant: Dysentery with ischuria.
Urine : Involuntary urination; involuntary evacuation from bladder; vesical tenesmus, with very painful micturition. Ischuria during dysentery.
Retention and incontinence of urine after labour (Hyos., Op.).:

* Causation: Results from blow, fall, contusion, traumatic and mechanical injuries. Injuries from blunt instruments.

* Sensation: SORE, LAME, BRUISED FEELING ALL OVER THE AFFECTED PARTS. -
¢ Pain: Very much painful; sensitive to touch.
¢ Look of the skin: The affected parts become blue and black with extravasation of blood.
There may also be injury to conjunctiva and retina due to coughing, with extravasation of blood (Ruta. Ledum) and sore, lame, bruised feeling in the eye.
After difficult labour, there is soreness of part with retention or incontinence of urine. In acute case of injury, if Arnica is given when above mentioned symptoms are found:
“It controls haemorrhage.
It re-absorbs extravasation of blood.
It prevents suppuration and septic condition.
It prevents post-partum haemorrhage and puerperal complication.”

 Chronic injury: In chronic cases of injury, even if received years ago resulting in tremors, articular rheumatism, paretic and paralytic condition of parts, Arnica is infallible.
Consequent upon chronic injury, especially concussion of brain, received years ago, there is involuntary evacuation from bladder; involuntary faeces and urine.
Rheumatism:
Type: Ascending type of rheumatism (Ledum), (Descending type-Cactus, Kalmia).
Character of pain: oversensitive to touch, cannot bear pain. There is great fear of being touched or struck by persons coming near him. Pain in the back and limbs as if bruised or beaten. Cannot walk
erect on account of bruised pain in pelvic organs.
Modalities: Aggravation from touch and amelioration by lying down.
Skin :
Causation: Trauma or any mechanical injury.
Location: Underneath the skin; ecchymosis.
Sensation: SORE, LAME, BRUISED FEELING OF THE AFFECTED PARTS: very much sensitive to
touch.Tendency to small painful boils, which come one after another.

Fever :
Generally indicated in typhoid fever.

Symptoms during fever. Sore, lame, bruised feeling all over the body. Great restlessness (Rhus tox.,Pyrogen, Baptisia). EVERYTHING ON WHICH THE PATIENT LIES FEELS TOO HARD and that is why he becomes restless. Patient consequently moves from place to place in search of a soft spot.
During fever, there is low muttering delirium. The patient lies unconscious. Whenever anything is asked, he answers correctly and in-full, but unconsciousness and delirium at once return (Phosphoric acid—falls asleep in the midst of an answer, Baptisia). The patient says that there is nothing wrong withhim and there is no matter with him. During fever, there is involuntary evacuation from bowels and bladder.
In fever, it differs from Baptisia. In Baptisia fever, there is also sore, lame, bruised-feeling. In whatever position the patient lies, parts resting upon the bed feel sore, lame, bruised and hot, the bed feels hard as found in Arnica. In Baptisia, there is low muttering delirium, but delirium returns in the midst of the answer. Whereas in Arnica, the patient answers correctly and in full and then the delirium
returns (Phos. ac.). Offensiveness of discharge is of superlative degree in Baptisia e.g., stool, urine, sweat, etc. and even breath; all are horribly offensive, but not so much in Arnica.

In meningeal fever, when there is heat of upper part of the body and coldness of lower, after mechanical or traumatic injuries, from fall, concussion of brain, etc., Arnica can be thought of.
General Modalities :

Aggravation: From least touch, motion, rest, in damp cold weather.
Amelioration: From lying down.

Relations :
Complementary to Aconite, Hyper., Rhus tox.
Similar to: Bap., China, Phyt., Pyr., Rhus tox, Ruta arid Staphisagria for soreness as if bruised.
Follows well: Acon., Apis, Ham., Ipec. and Ver, alb.
Followed Well by: Sulph. ac.


cheapter : 31 ARSENICUM ALBUM
White Oxide of Arsenic HAHNEMANN 

INTRODUCTION
ARSENIC patient can be compared to a RACE HORSE as PULSATILLA to a SHEEP and ANTIM CRUD to a SWINE. Arsenic is a deadly poison. The fatal dose is 2-4 grains, Arsenic was used as a medicine from ancient times. Hughes says that Arsenic was used in China long ago and in India for cutaneous affection, neuralgia, chorea and _ cholera. Physiological dose will produce vomiting,purging and great prostration due to excessive secretion from gastro-intestinal tract. It produces feeble pulse. In short, it gives the full picture of a cholera patient or you may
imagine a dying man with burning sensation, continuously sipping warm drinks and wants to be carried from one place to another, with a cadaverous odour from his body. Kent even says that from the very odour itself you may recognise an Arsenic patient as soon as you enter his room.

CLINICAL
Abscess, Alcoholism, Anaemia, Asthma, Abdominal disorders, Cancerous affections, Carbuncle, Cholera, Cough, Delirium, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Duodenal ulcer, Fever, Gangrene, Gastric ulcer, Gout, Headache, Heart affection, Haemorrhoids, Kidney affection, Locomotor ataxia, Lung affection, Measles, Menstrual disorders, Pleurisy, Pneumonia, Rheumatism, Rickets, Skin affection, Throat affection, Vomiting, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Main seats of action of Arsenic are mind, nerves, mucous membrane, joints, Periosteum, liver, spleen, lymphatics, blood, lungs, skin, stomach and alimentray canal. Arsenic acts more promptly on vegetarians than on non-vegetarians (rev.—Nux vy; All sat).

PATHOGENESIS
Arsenic is a poison and causes constant and violent irritation to all tissues such as:—
. Acting on gastro-intestinal tract, it produces a picture like Cholera Asiatica.
. It attacks blood, causing septic changes i.e, exanthemata, ecchymosis, petechial haemorrhage, etc. .
. It attacks veins, varices which burn like fire, especially at night.
. It attacks serous membranes causing copious serous effusion.
. It attacks glands which indurate and suppurate.
. It causes inflammatory swelling with burning lancinating pains.
. It attacks periosteum.
. It attacks joints causing paleness, swelling, burning, pain, etc.
. It also causes general anasarca; skin pale, waxy or earth-coloured.
. It causes rapid emaciation.
. It also causes ulcerations which bum like fire, producing pains and dischargeswhich may be scanty, putrid and offensive.
. The skin is irritated producing violent itching and burning followed by eruptions,ulcerations, etc.

CONSTITUTION
 
 Physical make-up: The patient is lean, thin, debilitated having hippocratic face, dirtyand waxy look of the skin.
 Temperament: Very fastidious. Wants everything neat, clean and in order.
 Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient. There is internal chilliness and so the patient craves heat, excepting in outer head.
 Miasm: Arsenic has a combination of Psora, Syphilis and Sycosis.
 Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

. Arsenic patient has GREAT FEAR OF DEATH. Thinks that he is incurable, the disease is fatal and it is useless to take medicines.
. Mentally restless, but physically too weak and exhausted to move about. It is one of the trio of restlessness (others being Aconite for mental   restlessness and Rhus tox. for Physical restlessness). Just like a horse an Arsenic patient is always restless.
. Burning pain relieved by heat except in head. This is very much peculiar and characteristic of Arsenic. Kent says that the patient wants to    keep his body in a hot room but head in refrigerator.
. Great prostration is persistently present, sinking of strength out of proportion to a degree of illness.
. Gastric derangements such as diarrhoea, vomiting, etc., are due to food poisoning from spoiled eggs, fish or meat, decayed food, alcohol, ice   cream, etc.
. Complaints return periodically (usually annually), So it is a useful drug in intermittent fever.
. All discharges are acrid, scanty, putrid, dark and offensive with cadaverous odour(rotten egg—Sulphur; rotten cheese—Hepar Sulph; sour milk—  Calc. carb.; likefumes of sulphur Phosphorus).
.Thirst for small quantity of water at short intervals in acute states but in chronic state there is no thirst. For acute or chronic ptomaine    poisoning, Arsenic is an excellent remedy.
. Cannot bear the smell or sight of food (Colchicum, Sepia, Stannum),
. All symptoms are aggravated at MID-DAY AND MIDNIGHT. (1 to 2 a.m./p.m.) and ameliorated by heat.

 Mind : Arsenic patient exhibits peculiar and striking mental symptoms which ar as follows:—
.The patient is depressed, irritable, EXTREMELY RESTLESS AND ANXIOUS. 
.There is great FEAR OF DEATH or thinks that his diasease is incurable; fear of death is more marked when alone or when going to bed.
.He is extremely fastidious. Wants everything in order, neat and clean. Even a picture hanging on the wall slightly tilted must be adjust properly. So Arsenic patient is known as “A gold-headed cane patient.” Weak memory due to confusion in head.
.He suffers so much that he decides to commit suicide. Aversion to meet people, even with acquainted ones because he imagines that he has offended them, but knows not how, when and where; yet fears to be alone. Sad, tearful and anxious mood. .
The patient is very much depressed,melancholic, full of despair and indifference.
Still he is very ANXIOUS, FEARFUL, RESTLESS AND FULL OF ANGUISH. Yet he is very irritable, sensitive, peevish and easily angered. Although mentally very restless, he is physically too weak to move. Dreams are full of sorrow and fear; dreams of thunderstorm, fire, darkness and death.

. Ailments from, chill, in winter, taking ice, ice-cream, cold fruits, decayed food or animal matter whether by inoculation, olfaction or ingestion, poor diet, continued drainage of body fluids, anaemia, abuse of alcohol, sour beer, bad sausage, strong cheese, ptomaine poisoning, tobacco, abuse of quinine, iodine, climbing mountains and sea bathing.

PARTICULARS
Headache :
Causation: Exposure to cold, taking ice cream, decayed food, loss of vital fluid, abuse of alcohol, etc.
Location: According to Kent, Arsenic has periodical headache in all parts of head: even forehead is congested.
Character of pain: Headache with throbbing and burning. Occipital headache is so severe as to make the patient dazed, feels as if the skull would burst. Sensation as if there is vibration and looseness in brain. Head is hot. Headache every two weeks.

Modalities: Headache is aggravated by light, motion, commences from 1-3 p.m., goes upto mid-night. Relieved by cold application, in dark room, lying with head on pillow.

Concomitants: Nausea and vomiting; always chilly except in the head, during intermittent fever, head symptoms alternate with physical symptoms.

Gastro-intestinal symptoms :

Mouth : Unhealthy mouth with easily bleeding gums and offensive breath. Sore lips and ulcers in the mouth and eruption on the lips. Aphthae in mouth with foetid and bloody saliva.

Tongue : Blackish, brown, dry, coated white, black or brown with red streak in the middle, with req papillae. Dryness of the mouth, violent thirst yet drinks little at a time but quite often.

Throat : Throat is ulcerated, swollen and oedematous. Dryness with soreness, scraping and burning, Swallowing is very difficult and painful.

Stomach :

Causation; Taking ice-cream, cold fruits, decayed food or animal matter, sour beer, bad sausage, strong cheese, ptomaine poisoning, etc.

* Character: Food has no taste. Cannot bear the smell or sight of food (Colchicum, Sepia, Stannum). There is burning pain with intense heat in the pit of stomach and pressure in stomach, especially after eating. Great anxiety about the stomach, becomes restless and-rolls-about. Nausea and vomiting of entire food and water as soon as it touches the stomach due to inflammation and irrit-ation of
the mucous membranes—from Slightest irritation to the most destructive gastritis, gastro-enteritis with burning pain in the stomach and dry mouthy. Vomiting as soon as anything is taken; vomiting of both food and water (food is retained in Bismuth). Vomiting black bile and blood. The vomitus is dark,offensive, scanty and putrid. Vomiting with diarrhoea followed by great prostration. Spasmodic colic with
sensation as if the intestines become twisted with burning in abdomen. The patient is restless with fear of death; troubles are more during mid-day and midnight. Loathing of food in general.

Cholera :
Causation: During cholera time, taking ice-cream, cold frutis, decayed food, sour beer, bad sausage, ptomaine poisoning, etc.

Character of stool: Dark or black, watery, very offensive rice-watery stool with intense vomiting and profound debility. Corrosive stool, cutting pain in bowels with tenesmus. Burning in anus and rectum during and after stool. Small, offensive and dark stool with sudden and rapid prostration. Diarrhoea worse at night, especially at mid-Might, from 12-2 a.m.

Diarrhoea : After eating or drinking. Stool is yellowish, black, offensive, watery and bloody. Very offensive, having cadaverous odour, pain and corrosiveness, followed by great prostration. During diarrhoea, the patient is very much ANGUISHED, RESTLESS AND HAS FEAR OF DEATH.

Haemorrhoids : With stitching pain, when walking or sitting, but not at stool, preventing sitting or sleeping. Burning pain relieved by heat,

Respiratory system :
Asthma : Asthma comes on or aggravated by suppressed eruptions, cold things and cold food.The patient is very much worried about himself with anguish. He is unable to lie down for fear of suffocation: must sit or bend forward and abduct arms for relief (Lie down and abduct arms—Psorinum). Wheezing respiration with cough and frothy expectoration. There is darting pain through upper I/3rd of right lung which is worse after cold drink or cold food The sputum is scanty and frothy,

offensive and dark. There is loss of breath ;  -rdiately after lying down: whistiling sound due toconstriction of trachea. Hering says that there will be tightness of chest as if bound with koup
Modality: Aggravation from 12-2 a.m./p.m.
Relieved by heat in general.
Cardio-vascular system : Palpitation after, suppression of foot sweat (Tonsils—Baryta carb.).
Heart beats more rapidly and stronger when lying on back. Hering says that Arsenic will be of great use in Angina Pectoris. Sudden tightness of heart, agonising precordial pain. Pain goes to back, occiput and neck. Angina pain is worse from 12-2a.m. Pulse is thread like, incompressible and weak.

Skin : Skin has white pasty look, with painful black eruption, There may be pustules, vesicles, disquamation from head to foot. Burning and itching, followed by pain after scratching. Carbuncles, boils and abscesses with very offensive discharge which are hot
and burning, but relieved by hot application. Cancers with great pain. In gangrene, burning pain is relieved by heat.

Intermittent fever :
  Type: Quotidian, tertian, quartun, double tertian. Anticipates every 14 days, every year. Remittent and relapsing typhoid and malarial fevers    due to abuse of quinine derivatives.

  Sweat: There will be sweat at the end of fever which relieves pain; cold and clammy sweat, sour and offensive smell. Thirst during sweat stage.

Especially it acts upon mucous membr-anees of respiratory tract, digestive tract, and also acts upon heart, glands and skin.

No particular look or physical make up is present is Ars-Iod.

ARTEMISIA VULGARIS
Mugwort Compositae

CLINICAL:
Catalepsy. Chorea. Convulsions. Epilepsy.Somnambulism.
Like the other Artemisias this remedy has aprominent place in convulsive diseases. It is principal remedy for epilepsy, catalepsy, spasmodic twitchings as is seen in chorea, hysterical fits,
eclampsia and convulsion of various types such asoccur in hydrocephalus, teething etc. Its indications in epilepsy are as follows :

1) Epilepsy after fright or grief or bad news, afterblow on the head, after masturbation and with menstrual disturbances or with teething.
2) Attacks frequently repeated, then followed by a long J, interval of rest.
3) Several attacks of epilepsy in the same day.
4) Epilepsy without aura.
5) Attack accompanied or followed by profuse offensive sweat; by seminal ejaculations.
6) Fever : Profuse sweat, having a peculiar fetid, cadaverous or garlic like odour is a characteristic of the remedy.

In epilepsy Artemisia Vulgaris can be compared with Aethusa Cyn., Bufo., Cal.Garb., Cicuta V., Cuprum Met., Lachesis, Silicea., Aethusa Cynapium—Useful in
eases of children indicated by epileptic spasms with clenched thumbs, red face, eyes turned downwards, pupils fixed and dilated ; foam at the mouth, jaws locked ; pulse small, hard quick. After attack sleepiness & prostration,

Bufo : Aura starts from sexual organs or from solar plexus. Epilepsy from masturbation or self abuse. The attacks usually occur during sleep at night, during coition and at the time of menses.

Calearea Carb : It is useful in cases of children particularly in epilepsy occurring in scrofulous diathesis, Aura may begin in solar plexus and move upward or downward into
the uterus and limbs. In some cases aura causes a feeling as if a mouse was running oD the arm.

Cicuta.Virosa : It is indicated by strange movements of head and trunk, violent distortion of face, locked jaw, bluish countenance, protrusion of eyes, vomiting, a weak
and scarcely perceptible pulse, great venous congestion of the abdominal viscera and convulsion occurring during the act of parturition. Epileptic spasms from concussion of
brain, of teething children or from worms.

Cuprum Met : Epilepsy from a fall or blow upon the head ; from getting wet, from bad effects of re-percussed eruptions. Aura begins in knees and ascends. Aggravation at
night during sleep. Fits return at regular intervals, about new moon. Better by cold washing. There may be flexor type of cramps.

Lachesis : Epilepsy comes on during sleep ; from loss of vital fluids ; onanism, jealousy.

Silicea : Nocturnal epilepsy especially about the time of the new moon.

Arg. Nit : For days or hours before the attack the pupils are dilated and after the attack the patient is very restless and has trembling of hands.

Kali Brom : Congenital, Syphilitic, tubercular ; usually a day or two before menses ; at new moon, headache follows attack.

Epilepsy

cheapter:33 ARUM TRIPHYLLUM

Indian Turnip DR. JEANS Araceae

INTRODUCTION

Arum Triphyllum is the most important of the Arums. It is one of the sovereign remedies
for an acute cold. It should not be given in low potency or repeated often as bad effects often follow.

CLINICAL:

Aphonia. Coryza. Diphtheria, Headache.Mouth sore, scarlatina. Typhoid. Clergyman’s sore throat. Glandular swellings. Tongue cracked.

SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS :

It prominently affects left side. It has marked action on mucous menbranes of mouth, throat, larynx. It also acts on kidneys, brain, blood and skin. It is an irritant poison causing excitability & irritability of mind and body. It causes inflammation of the mucous surfaces and destruction of the tissue. Discharges are acrid causing painful, sore, rawness & burning of parts.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :
1) Constant picking at the nose until it bleeds, boring with the finger into the side of the nose.
2) Pick lips until they bleed, corners of mouth cracked & bleeding.
3) Acrid, ichorous discharges, excoriating mucous surfaces.
4) Painfully sore, raw and burning of parts.
5) Nose feels stopped, inspite of the watery discharge.
6) Aphonia complete, after exposure to northwest winds (Aco., Hep.) and from singing (Arg. Nit., Caust.)
7 ) Fluent Coryza with nostrils raw.
8) Children refuse food & drink on account of soreness of mouth & throat.
9) Tongue and buccal cavity raw and bleeding with profuse acrid salivation.
10) Ailments from—Exposure to northwest wind, getting cold, overuse of voice.
11) Mind—Children excessively cross & stubborn. They are nervous, restless and irritable. Persistently boring into nose or picking at lips, fingers at one spot until it is sore or bleeds.

PARTICULARS
Mouth : Mouth painfully raw, sore and inflamed. Corners of mouth cracked and bleeding. There isprofuse acrid secretion of saliva corroding the mucous menbranes of mouth. Patients pick and bore into raw bleeding surface though very painful. He screams with pain but keeps up the boring, This is key notesymptom in diphtheria, scarlatina & typhoid. Tongue cracked and bleeding. Children refuse food and
drink on account of soreness of mouth and throat.

Nose : Arum Triphyllum is one of the important remedies in acute- cold when the discharge is acrid and fluent. Stuffy nose inspite of the watery discharge, patient must breathe through the mouth. Sneezing worse at night. Constant picking at the nose until it bleeds. Boring with the finger into the side of the nose is another characteristic of this remedy.

Throat : Throat is raw, sore, painful on clearing or coughing. Patient cannot swallow. It is medicine for cleargyman’s sore throat or sore throat on one who speaks a great deal, orators, singers, actors. Voice is hoarse, uncertain, uncontrollable, chang'rg continually. Complete aphonia after exposure to north west winds and from singing.

Modality: Aggravation : Talking, speaking, or singing.

General Modalities :
Aggravation : Overuse of voice, talking, singing, northwest wind, heat, lying down, at night.

Relations :
Useful after—Hep, & Nit. Acid in hoarse, croupy cough. After—Caust. & Hep. in morning hoarseness & deafness and in scarlatina.

chapter : 37 AURUM METALLICUM

Gold (Au.) HAHNEMANN The Element

INTRODUCTION

The most precious thing which any creature likes and loves in the world, is its ‘own life’. Anything and everything could be sacrificed for its ultimate protection. But here is an element
which possesses the inherent power to destroy the very desire to survive. Gold is a very rare valuable metal, no doubt. Still it hasn’t got any direct utility as such in its natural form. It was
Hahnemann who found out the high therapeutic value of gold after it undergoes the process of potentisation.

CLINICAL

Alcoholism, Asthma, Gonorrhoea, Genital organs, Glandular affection, Haemorrhoids, Heart affection, Locomotor ataxia, Mental affection, Paralysis, Syphilis, Throat affection, Urinary discorders, Uterine troubles, Vertigo, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Aurum met. affects mind, nerves, bones, cardiovascular system, genito-urinary organs and glands.

PATHOGENESIS

Its actions on the mind and brain mainfest a strong tendency to profound melancholy and inclination to constantly dwelling on suicide. It affects bones and glands tending to destruction of tissues, while its action on heart results in degeneration of the tissue and their reflex symptoms. It degenerates even blood and causes haemorrhage.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body. Aurm met. is suited to sanguine, ruddy people, with black hair and eyes, old people who are tired of life due to their missdeeds, having no desire to live and low spirited, lifeless pining boys. Constitution broken down by bad effects of mercury and syphilis.

Temperament; Melancholic and irritable temperament.
Relation with heat and cold: Very chilly patient.
Miasm: Syphilis is in the background.

Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Suited to old people who are tired of life, in whom syphilis is implanted on a scrofulous constitution.
2. PROFOUND MELANCHOLY AND CONSTANTLY DWELLING ON SUICIDE.
3. Hurried and worried; uneasy and restless
4. Aggravation from sunet to sunrise (Merc. Syphi.).
5. Oversensitive to pain, smell, taste, hearing, touch etc.

 Mind : Aurum met. patient shows peculiar characteristic, rare and uncommon mental symptoms as follows: All mental affections are consequent upon and incidental to bad effects of mercury and syphilis.

He feels as if he has committed many unpardonable crimes and sins of enormous magnitude when young and on realisation of the paramount seriousness thereof, he becomes sad, repentant and despondent with despair of salvation and eager for redemption of sins. Therefore, he is sad and has complete disgust for life; very gloomy and taciturn. In order to get rid of these worries, he is constantly DWELLING UPON SUICIDE as the only way of solution. Consequently PROFOUND MELANCHOLY, prevails upon him throughout.

.He feels that life is a constant burden for him; feels hateful and quarrelsome and want to put a permanent end to it by COMMITTING SUICIDE.
.Aurum met. is the topmost medicine for depressive insanity.

.Self condemnation is inborn in a Aurum met. patient.

.He is very restless and anxious about the future. Has great desire for mental and physical activity, still connot do things fast enough.

.He is low-spirited, lifeless with weak memories. 

.He is very much hurried and worried; uneasy and restless; irritable and peevish; least contradiction excites anger in him.

.He feels that he is an unwanted element in society and has no right to live; even God cannot pardon his unlimited amount of sins and crimes, etc.

Ailments from : Bad effects of mercury, syphilis, alcohol, fear, fright, anger,contradiction, mortification, vexation, dread, reserved displeasure and disappointed love.

PARTICULARS :

Headache :

Causation: Headache from least mental exertion, fear, fright, anger or contradiction. Headache from

constipation.

Character of headache: Intense congestive headache with heat. Tearing pain through the brain to

forehead. Boring and tearing in skull bones.

Modalities: Headache is worse from every mental exertion and better in open air.

Concomitant: Falling of hair, especially in syphilitic and mercurial affections.

Eye:

Sees only the lower half (See only left half Lycopodiurm).

Heart :
Causation: Heart diseases are caused by syphilitic and mercurial affection with scrofulous base.

Sensation: As if the heart stood still; as though it ceased to beat; actually it stops for 2 or 3 seconds and then gives a sudden hard thump.
Character of heart disease: There is violent palpitation and anxiety with congestion of blood to head and chest after exertion. Pain in heart! region extends down the left arm to fingers. Pulse is small, feeble but rapid and irregular; visible beating of carotid and temporal arteries. There may also be fatty degeneration and hypertrophy of the heart (Phos., Kali carb.).

Bones :

Causation: Syphilitic and mercurial affections of bone. Caries of mastoid, palate and nasal bones with terrible pain. Otitis, otorrhoea, ozaena; excessive discharge with putrid and offensive smell.

Modality: Pain is worse at night, driving the patient to despair.

Testes :

Baptisia acts on blood, mind, nerves, mucous membrane of digestive tract; left side of the body.

Baptisia disorganises and decomposes the blood and thereby tends to putrescence. specially in low fevers as in typhoid, paratyphoid and dysentery, etc. The principal use of Baptisia is exact typhoid state. It can also be used as a preventive medicine against typhoid.

 Face and eyes are suffused so as to give it a besotted appearance and expression is like that of adrunkard.

 chapter : 41 BELLADONNA

Deadly Nightshade HAHNEMANN Solanaceoe

INTRODUCTION

Belladonna was known to the medical profession as early as 1500 A.D., but its full therapeutic value was not realised until it was potentised and 
proved by Hahnemann. The word “Belladonna” is a combination of two Latin words “Bella” and “Donna” which means “Beautiful Lady”. The Venetian 
ladies, of olden days used this plant as a cosmetic to brighten their eyes and flush the cheeks due to the property of its alkaloids, Atropin and 
Belladonnin. It was Hahnemann’s deep insight which could find out the immense curative value of these alkaloids and transformed them into a 
marvellous medicine through the process of potentisation. Belladonna is one of Hahnernann’s Polychrests which has its Paramount utility in ACUTE 
AND VIOLENT CONDITIONS. It is one of those medicines without which we might indeed to close our shops. Belladonna is one of CLARKE’S A.B.C. 
NURSERIES, others being Aconite and Chamomilla. WHILE BELLADONNA CAUSES TURMOIL IN BRAIN, ACONITE and CHAMOMILLA CAUSE TURMOIL IN CIRCULATION AND 
TEMPERAMENT RESPECTIVELY.

CLINICAL 

Abscess, Apoplexy, Boils, Brain affection, Carbuncle, Convulsion, Cough, Delirium, Dysentery, Epilepsy, Fever, Glandular affection, Headache, Heart trouble, Lung affection, Measles, Meningitis, Menstrual troubles, Mumps, Skin affection, Pleurisy, Disorders of Pregnancy, Rheumatism, Uterine affection, Vertigo, Whooping cough, Abdominal affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Its chief centre of action is cerebrum from where it radiates its influence upon the entire organism. Brain and its membranes, cardio-vascular system, heart, lungs, mucous membrane of eyes, mouth, throat, skin, glandular structures are also not spared.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on brain and its membranes and various organs produces a state of CONGESTION everywhere in the body leading to inflammation, delirium, illusion, delusion and hallucination and mania. General hyperaesthesia of both sensory and motor nerves, resulting in congestion of blood vessesls, heart and consequently reflex symptoms are produced.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Since Belladonna is more or less an acute remedy, there is no serious importance to be attached to its constitution. However, it is adapted to bilious, plethoric persons with red face and to a condition in them of local plethora, i.e.inflammatory state with throbbing pain and redness; and also to those having lymphatic constitution with fine complexion and delicate skin.

Temperament: Bilious, lymphatic and nervous temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Tubercular diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. Belladonna is predominantly a right sided remedy.

. Acute “SUDDEN and VIOLENT” onset is very characteristic of this drug. This aspect of the symptom is invariably present in every disease requiring Belladonna.

. “Congestion” is the key note of Belladonna. (Tension is the keynote of Aconite). Asa result of its action on the brain a state of active congestion is produced, resulting in furious excitement, irritability, convulsion, delirium and pain. Consequently,there is FLUSHED FACE, THROBBING CAROTIDS, HARD AND BOUNDING PULSE, rush of blood to head with wild delirium. Congestion causes redness of the
  face and eyes, rush of blood to head and face, throbbing of brain and carotids.


. “Redness” of Belladonna is very characteristic. Arising from congestion there is great redness of the inflamed part in particular and in    general, all over. The skin is very red and shiny. Smooth redness of the surface occurs over the whole body.

. “Heat” is yet another peculiarity. Due to the congestion there is great heat, especially at the congested and inflamed part. The heat is so       severe that the affected part imparts a burning sensation to the examining hand and the physicia is reflexly compelled to withdraw his hand.

. “Burning” sensation is another characteristic of Belladonna. There is intense burning anywhere and everywhere, both internal and external such    as in skin, brain, mouth, throat, tonsils, stomach, liver, etc.

. Sensitiveness to touch of affected part is very well marked in this great remedy. Cannot bear to be touched anywhere.

. Great dryness runs through the whole of this drug. This dryness is often associated with heat, redness, burning and throbbing. 

. Along with the above sings of inflammation, swelling or oedema are also found. The affected part is swollen, shiny, very red, h
  ot and sensitive to touch.


 Belladonna is a GREAT PAIN REMEDY, the characters of which are 

. pain comessuddenly, lasts indefinitely or goes away suddenly 

. pain is usually in short attacks 
. burning and throbbing character of the PAIN WITH REDNESS OF THE FACE AND EYES, fulness of the head and throbbing of carotids.
. pain runs from above e.g. head to downwards (Silicea and Gelsemium have pain running up the back).
. The patient is very much sleepy, but cannot sleep (Cham., Stram., Opium.).

. Belladonna patients are very much entertaining, jolly, well behaved and social when they are well, but becomes very violent and often delirious   when they fall sick.

. In Belladonna patients, sweat, if at all found, is only on the covered parts.
. Generally the patient is not thirsty, especially in fever.
. The complaints of Belladonna patient are aggravated by touch, jar and motion, draught of air and heat of sun; after 3 p.m., lying down and     uncovering and ameliorated by rest, standing or sitting erect and in a warm room.

 Mind : Belladonna is an excellent remedy for the delirious condition brought on by cerebral congestion. The cardinal mental symptoms are as 
 follows:

Great excitement and VIOLENCE run through the whole mental sphere of this wonderful remedy. © Causation: Draught of air, cold wind, uncovering the head, from hair cut and summer sun.

© Mode of onset: SUDDEN and VIOLENT is the onset of Belladonna fever.

* Symptoms of fever: There is severe chill in the evening mostly on arms with heat of head. Along with natural chill, there is external burning heat. Chill and heat often alternate. Extremities are usually cold.

There is high fever, sudden rise of temperature with RED face and THROBBING OF CAROHDS;pulse strong and quick. Intense burning heat both internally and externally. Sweat is only on the covered parts and on head or there may be complete lack of any sweat. Sweat, if it occurs, appears anddisappears suddunly, Generally there is no thirst.Pulse is frequent and full or slow and fulh Chill notrelieved by heat of stove. Fever comes at 3 p.m. (Apis).

© Concomitants: Confusion of mind, anxiety and trembling with FURIOUS DELIRIUM (See Mind). In teething children, there is convulsion with fever; which comes suddenly with head hot and feet cold.

Meningitis :

© Causation: Draught of air, cold wind, uncovering the head, from hair cut and summer sun.

Mode of onset: Sudden and violent.

 Symptoms during meningitis: There is stupefying stunning headache from the neck to the head
with heat and pulsation. Head is inclined to bend backward, boring the head into the pillow. There iscongestion and burning sensation in the head and brain. Spasmodic distortion of face and lips, grinding
of teeth, with inclination to bite. There may also be irritability and acuteness of the sense of taste, smell,touch, sight and hearing.
Urine retained or there may be involunatary micturition.

Skin : Skin shows a uniform, smooth, shining scarlet redness. Skin is dry, hot and burning, imparts a burning sensation to examining hand. Painful sensitiveness of the skin to contact. There may be eruptions over the skin. The eruptions resemble measles or scarlatina. Erysipelatous inflammation is also found. .

Boils : In boils,. Belladonna must be thought of in first stage before the pus formation takes place. The indications are, “REDNESS, SWELLING and HEAT of the part, THROBBING pain SENSITIVE TO TOUCH, aggravation from touch and amelioration by application of heat.”

Prolapse : There is sensation of pressing downward as if contents of the abdomen would push out through the vulva. Worse in the morning and relieved by standing and sitting erect.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From touch, motion, noise, draught of air, looking at bright shining objects, after 3 p.m., night, after mid-night, while drinking, uncovering, the head, summer sun, lying down, least jar and motion and stror smell.

Ameliorarion: Rest, standing or sitting erect, in warm room.

Relation :

Complementary to: Calcarea. Belladonna is the acute of Calcarea, which is often required to complete a cure.

It follows well: Ars.alb., Cham., Hepar sulph. and Merc. sol. Is followed well by: Dulc., Hepar sulph. Hyos. Lach. and Rhus. tox.
Antidotes; Coffea and Hyos.

Rheumatism & gout

chapter : 44 BERBERIS VULGARIS

Barberry Berberidaceae

INTRODUCTION

Berberis belongs to vegetable kingdom, the natural order of Berberidaceae, to which order also belongs Caulophllum and Podophyllum. It occupies a very important place, though of limitedscope, in our Homoeopathic Materia Medica. The main influence of the remedy is upon urinary system.

CLINICAL

Biliary colic, Bladder and urinary affection,Gall-Stone colic, Renal colic, Rheumatism, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts especially upon the kidney, urinary bladder, liver and gall bladder. It is a left sided drug.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on urinary organs, results in irritation and subsequent inflammation and formation of renal stone; it produces gall-stone colic. It also has marked action on the liver promoting the flow of bile or when there is stasis of bile, producing gall-stone. Therefore, it is an excellent medicine for jaundice and gall-stone. peace

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Berberis vulgaris is especially suited to those people who are pale, having earthy complexion with sunken cheeks, having blue rings around eyes.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS 

1. Left side is principally affected, left kidney and left ureter, ' mess
2. Bruised pain with numbness, stiffness in kidney region and in small of back.
3. Soreness of the kidney, bubbling sensation, worse from jar and motion.
4, Backache, worse when sitting or lying, especially when lying on bed in morning.
5. Sensation of numbness, stiffness and lameness with painful pressure in lumbar andrenal region.
6. Wandering, radiating pains from one part to another, especially along the course of left kidney and ureter.
7, Stitching pain in the liver region and gall-bladder, shooting up to left shoulder; worse by pressure. 
8. Fistula in ano alternating with chest symptoms (Cale. phos., Silicea).
9. Gall-stone colic followed by jaundice.
10. All the symptoms are worse from motion, jar and touch.
11. Urine is greenish, bloody, turbid)and full of slimy mucus.


PARTICULARS

Gall-stone colic :
It has got marked action on the liver and produces various kinds of manifestations.

Character of pain: There is short, sudden, stabbing, puncturing type of pain in the liver region. The pain is shooting, tearing, burning, stitching and tingling, wandering from one side to another.

Modality: Pain is aggravated from little jar and motion.

Concomitants: Gall stone colic is often associated with jaundice. Stool white, bileless, clay coloured. 

Urinary Symptoms :

Urine : Constant urging to urinate; sensation as if some urine remained after urinating, with burning pain in the bladder. The bladder becomes very irritable and urine very slow to flow.

Character of urine: Greenish, bloody with mucus and jelly like sediment. It may be dark, turbid, with copious sedimentation. 

Renal-colic :

Causation: Due to stone in kidney.

Location: Left sided, starting from left kidney to ureter, then to urinary bladder and coming down to urethra.

Sensation:

(1) Numbness in the kidney region.
(2) Bubbling sensation in the kidney region.
(3) Stiffness in the kidnty region.
(4) Lameness and painful pressure in kidney region
(5) Burning and soreness in the kidney region.

Character of pain: Stitching cutting pains from left kidney following the course of ureter, bladder and then to urethra, Pain run up to the kidney, burning, stitching in several successive waves in the region of kidney.In acute condition, the pain is more severe. There may be haematurla with soreness in urethra.The character of urine may be bloody, greenish withthick slimy mucus and Jelly-like sediment.In thronic condition the urine may be dark, turbid with copious sedimentation. Urine is very slow to flow with constant urging.

Modality:

Aggravation: From jar and motion. Movement brings on or increases urinary complaints.

Rheumatism :

Location: shoulder, arms, fingers, toes, and feet.

Sensation: Sore and lame feeling in joint.

Character of pain: Burning, stitching, tearing type of pain, whi ates: appears in one part of the body, then to another part.
Modality: Aggravation from jar, motion and walking.

Concomitants: Rheumatic and gouty complaints-are associated with urinary troubles.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From motion, walking or carriage riding, and sudden jerking or movement.

Relations :
Similar to: Lyco., Sarsaparilla in renal colic.
Antidoted by: Bell.
Antidotes to: Aconite.
Follows well: Bry., Sulph., Kali bi., Rhus tox.
N.B. An occasional dose of Lyco., helps the action of Berberis.

INTRODUCTION
Just like many other metals, Bismuth too has been found to be an excellent remedy which exerts its general influence in the stomach
region. It has been observed by Hahnemann that the hydrated oxide of Bismuth could be easily potentised to develop its curative power

CLINICAL

Abdominal, operation and Vomiting, Cholera, Cough _ Delirium, Diarrhoea, Gangrene, Headache, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION 

Bismuth predominantly acts upon the gastrointestinal tract, mind and nervous system.

PATHOGENESIS

Bismuth exerts its influence on the stomach and stomach region. It causes a PURE gastralgia, but not associated with catarrh, like that of Nux vom. There is ejection of water immediately after it is taken, but food is retained a little longer.

CONSTITUTION

Bismuth is mostly an acute drug, as such consideration of constitution does not have much bearing on its selection.

Miasm: Psora and Syphilis are in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

. Bismuth patient CANNOT BEAR SOLITUDE THE ALWAYS WANTS AND DESIRES COMPANY (Stram., Kali carb., Lil., Lyco.).
. He has MUCH ANGUISH and, therefore, moves about frequently—he sits, walks, lies, never long in one place.

. Pain in the stomach, relieved by bending backward and by eructation.
. Headache alternates with gastralgia, worse after eating and better by cold bathing and cold drinks.
. Motion relieves most symptoms except headache.

Mind : The most important mental symptom of bismuth which must be remembered is “SOLITUDE IS UNBEARABLE’. He wants and DESIRES
COMPANY ALWAYS. This is particularly noticed in children who hold mother’s hand for company (Stramonium) and would not let her go away.

Another characteristic mental symptoms is great ANGUISH AND RESTLESSNESS, He sits, walks and then lies, never remains for long in one place (Ars. alb.). Delirium tremens with loss of consciousness. Mental apathy with insensibility is found in Bismuth.

Ailments from : Syphilis, heat and summer complaints, abdominal operations.
PARTICULARS


Vomiting :

Vomiting of water in large quantity as soon as it reaches the stomach, but solid food is retained for a long time until large accumulation takes place in the stomach, which also is vomited out later on in decomposed form which is very offensive. There is convulsive gagging and inexpressible pain in the stomach due to accumulation of solid portion of food. Such pain may also appear after laparotomy.

Concomitants: Headache returns every winter, alternating or attended with gastralgia.

Stomach :

Due to accumulation of large amount of solid food particles and stool, there is great pressure as from a load in one spot. There is great pain which is crampy and spasmodic in nature, with irritation, cardialgia and pyrosis.

Stool :
Since food gets accumulated in the stomach .for several days, stool becomes very much profuse.
offensive and cadaverous smelling.

Cholera :
Bismuth is one of the best remedies for cholera infantum and cholera morbus, usually occurring is summer.

© Causation: Cholera is usually Caused in summer and in cholera epidemic time.
© Onset: The onset is sudden and its course is rapid.

© Character: There is profuse vomiting and purging. Water is vomited out the moment it reaches stomach but solid food is retained a bit longer. In Bismuth cholera, vomiting predominates over purging- Along with the predominant vomiting, there is purging and diarrhoea. Stool is watery, profuse, painless and very offensive.

© Concomitants; There is great prostration, with the face looking deathly pale and dark ring around the eyes, surface covered with sweat, but it is warm sweat. There is intense thirst for water. The patient is full of ANGUISH, RESTLESSNESS AND WANTS COMPANY ALWAYS. Bismuth patient may also suffer from toothache which is relieved by holding cold water in the mouth(Bryonia, Coffea, Pulsatilla, Natrum sulph.).

General Modalities :

Aggravation: by heat and summer weather.

But Homoeopathy offered it as a medicine of great value, telling when it may or may not be used, Kent also acknowledges the fact that Borax wasone of the main constituents amongst the domestic remedies used for all sorts of localconditions as a soothing substance and for healing purpose.

Aphthae, Diarrhoea, Ear discharge, Eye affection, Headache, Menstrual disorders,Leucorrhoea, ete.

This drug with a limited sphere of curative action is obtained from a globular fungus. Coceyx itching, Diarrhoea, Skin affection, Headache, Heart affection, Menstrual disordets, Leucorrhoea, Rheumatism, etc.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Adapted to old maids who suffer from tettery type of eruptions.

Temperament: Nervous temperament.

Miasm: Sycosis is in the background.

6. Menstrual flow only at night (Mag. carb., Kreosote).

It has pronounced leucorrhoea.

.

Unhealthy skin. The eruptions may be either dry or moist, with thick crust formed by very thick, tough, stringy and tenacious discharges from the eruptions. chapter 49 Bromine

It is a deep acting, constitutional, poly-chrestmedicine, It’s chief action is on the respiratory organsespecially larynx & trachea etc.

 Stony, hard, scrofulous, or tuburculous swelling of glands especially on lower jaw and throat.
