Dyspnoea : With inability to inspire deep cough. There i is sensation as if breathing through a sponge or the air passages are full of smoke or vapour of sulphur.

Sexual Symptoms :

Male ; Swelling & induration of testicles with pains worse slight jar.

Female : Menses : Too early ; too profuse with membranous shreds. Low spirited before menses.

Breast: Tumour in breasts with stitching pains, worse left. Stitch-pains from breasts to axillae: Sharp shooting pain in left breast, worse pressure.

General Modalities :
Aggravation : From evening, until midnight. when sitting in warm room, warm, damp weather., leftside.
Amelioration : From any motion, exercise, at sea.

Relations : Compare : in croup & croupy affections, chlor. Hep., lod, Spong. Bromium had cured croup after failure of lod,, Phos., Spong., Hep.,
Hard goitre was cured after lod. failed.

N.B. : “The Chief distinction between Brom. and lod. is, the former cures the blue-eyed and the
latter the black-eyed patients”—Hering.


chpter 50 BRYONIA ALBA

White Bryony HAHNEMANN Cucurbitaceae

INTRODUCTION
Bryonia is one of the remedies inHomoeopathy, which is especially useful in acute
diseases. It was one of the Hahnemiann’searliest provings—one of those “without which”as Dudgeon says, “We might indeed shut up our shops”. Hence, Bryonia finds its pride of place inevery handbook of Homoeopathy and into every domestic medicine chest

CLINICAL

Alcoholism, Asthma, Bilious attack, Brain affection, Constipation, Dropsy, Dyspepsia,Enteric fever, Headache, Heart affection. Measles, Meningitis, Rheumatism, Vicarious, Menstruation, Breast affection, Cough, Epistaxis, Gastric disorders, Pleurisy, Pneumonia, Respiratory affection, Thirst, Tongue, Toothache, Vertigo, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Serous membrane, mucous membrane, liver, fibrous tissue, respiratory system and brain are its main seats of acion. It is a right sided remedy.

PATHOGENESIS

It acts as an irritant and sets up a condition of sub-acute inflammation of synovial membranes, resulting in exudation and effusion in muscle fibres and joints, thus presenting a picture of typical rheumatic arthritic symptoms. Inflammation, dryness and lack of secretion, except in case of serous effusion, are the keynote actions of Bryonia. In all the mucous membranes of the body, there is great dryness and lack of secretion. It affects blood in its quantity, quality as well as circulation, increasing the flow and power of the heart’s action.


CONSTITUTION

Moke-up of the body: Tall, slender persons having dark hair, dark complexion, and firm muscular fibres.

Temperament: 

Irritable temperament. Relation with heat and cold: Patients are hot; aggravated by warmth in general.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Rheumatic and gouty diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. All complaints are worse from motion : This “worse from motion” in Bryonia is such a constant symptom with all sufferings and in all parts of the body, as to have become a GENERAL, ALONG WITH AMELIORATION BY ABSOLUTE REST AND PRESSURE.
. It is a very persistent remedy. All complaints develop slowly and have an insidious beginning (Gels).
. Bryonia causes dryness of all the mucus membranes e.g. lips, mouth, nose, respiratory tract, alimentary tract and thereby produces some of the most
 characteristic symptoms, e.g. DRY, HARD AND KNOTTY STOOL; DRY
 SPASMODIC COUGH, STITCHING PAIN, ETC.
, Great thirst for large quantity of cold water at long intervals; great appetite, eats voraciously.
. Stitching pain runs through the whole of Bryonia which is relieved by absolute rest and pressure and by lying on painful side.
. Bryonia is gourmand (Nux, an epicure).
. Dropsical effusion into the serous and synovial memberane, resulting in pleurisy, rheumatic arthritis etc.
. Desire: Desires for things, which when offered are immediately refused (China, Cham., Kreosote, Staph.); oysters, sweets, coffee, cold acid drinks and sour drink.
.Aversion: To milk, rich food, fatty and greasy food.
. Most complaints aggravate in summer and by heat; symptoms aggravate after a meal,
. There is intolerance of vegetable food.
. Vicarious menstruation; nose bleed when menses should appear (phos.); blood spitting or haemoptysis.
. Breasts are heavy, of a stony hardness, pale but hard, hot and painful; MUST SUPPORT THEM WITH HAND TO prevent least motion.

Mind : The patient is very morose and ill humoured; exceedingly irritable and inclined to be angry. There are great anxiety and mental depression. Delirium, talks
about daily business; worse at night; desires to escape from bed and wants to go home, although the patient is at home. Constant motion of the left arm and leg.
Desires for things which are refused when offered, Weakness of mind, as if he would faint.

Ailments from Anger, chagrin, mortification; complaints after taking cold or getting hot in summer; when the days are hot and nights are cold; cold food and
drink; from suppression of discharges and skin eruptions.

PARTICULARS

Headache :
Causation: Due to draught of cold air; from constipation, from ironing.
Character of pain: Bursting type, as if brain is going to burst, with stitching and sticking pain. Feels that the contents of cranium would be pushed out.
Modalities: Aggravation FROM MOTION, in the morning, when first opening the eyes and relieved by PRESSURE and lying on painfuf side.
Concomitants: Dry white coating of tongue and thirst for large quantity of cold water at long intervals.
Gastro-intestinal symptoms :

Mouth : As there is great dryness of the mucous membrane of the whole alimentary canal, the lips are dry, parched and cracked. Dryness of the mouth is well-marked, with great thirst for large
quantity of cold water at long intervals.
Stomach : There is pressrue in the stomach, as if a stone is lying at the pit of stomach. Dyspepsia with soreness in stomach is often met with. There is nausea and faintness when rising up. Vomiting of
bile immediately after eating, pain in the abdomen, aggravated after food, not relieved by pressure.
N.B. Most of the pains of Bryonia are relieved by pressure except gastric pain.

Constipation :
Causation: As Bryonia causes dryness of mucous membrane of colon, it produces a very bad type of constipaion.
Sensation.: No inclination or desire for stool.
Character of stool: Stool is DRY, HARD KNOTTY, AS IF BURNT.
Concomitants: Headache due to constipation, with dry tongye; and thirst for large quantity of cold water at long intervals.
Diarrhoea :
 Causation: After taking cold food and drinks (Puls., Arsenic, Argentum nit.), when the days are hot and nights are cold, during the spell of hot weather.
  Time: Morning diarrhoea, as soon as the patient gets up from the bed and puts the feet on the
  floor (Nat. sulph.),
  Character of stool: Dirty, watery stool, containing undigested food particles; very much acrid.
  Modalities:
  Aggravation: From SLIGHTEST MOTION.
  Amelioration; By COMPLETE REST.
 Concomitants: With dry tounge and great thrist for large quantity of cold water at long intervals

Respiratory symptoms :
Nose : Vicarious menstruation, nose bleeds at the time of menses. If the menstrual flow is checke!
suddenly from cold, nose-bleed will appear. Dryness of nose with frequent sneezing and loss of smell.
Cough :
Causation: After taking cold or getting hot in summer; from exposure to draught of cold wind.
Location: Right side of the chest is usually involved.
Character of cough: Cough is dry, hard with gagging and vomiting with stiching pain in the
chest. While coughing the patient holds the chest because slightest motion aggravates pain.
Modalities :
Aggravation: Cough is more towards night, from motion, when coughing, laughing, talking,from heat of room.
Amelioration: Relieved BY COMPLETE REST Jying on painful side and by pressure.
Concomitants: White coating of tounge with great thirst for large quantity of cold water at long intervals.

Pneumonia :
 Stage: In early stage of pneumonia Bryonia is usually indicated.
 Location: Lower lobe of right lung is affected (Kali carb., Lyco., Chelidonium).

 Sensation: There is stitching pain in the chest. While coughing, the patient holds the chest.There is frequent desire to take deep breath.

 Modalities:
 Aggravation: From SLIGHTEST MOTION entering a warm room, from deep inspiration.

Amelioration: By COMPLETE REST, lying on painful side and pressure.
Concomitants: Constipation, dry tongue, great thirst and mental irritability.

Breast :
Sensation: Mammae feels very heavy.
Character: STONY HARDNESS, very much hot and painful.
Modalities:
Aggravation: BY MOTION, patient must support the breast with hand while coughing or moving.
 Amelioration: By absolute rest and pressure.
Fever :
Bryonia is of great help in fevers of all kinds and even typhoid fever is controlled by this drug.
Onset of the fever is slow and insidious (Gels.—sudden onset, Aconite, Belladonna).
Causation: After taking cold in hot summer weather, from exposure to draught of cold wind, after
taking cold when getting warm.
Symptoms of fever: During fever, the patient lies very quietly on the bed; does not want to move;
even does not want to speak or open the eyes because a little bit of motion makes the patient worse.
During fever, there may be low muttering delirium. The patient talks about his daily business. Desires
to get out of bed and go home, although he is at home. The patient says during delirious stage
T want to go home.”
There is dry white coating on the tongue, with great thirst for large quantity of cold water at long
intervals.
Pulse is full, hard tense and quick.
During fever there is profuse perspiration.
Along with fever, the cough becomes dry and hard tuith siifching pain in the chest.
Patient holds the chest with hand while coughing; aggravated by MOTION and relieved by LYING on
PAINFUL SIDE AND PRESSURE.
There is dry, hard and knotty stool, as if burnt.
Modalities: Fever aggravates after slightest motion and is relieved by absolute rest.
In meningeal fever too, there is constant motion of left arm and leg with other generalities.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From slightest MOTION, exertion, touch, warmth, warm food and drink, warm room
and summer, suppressed discharges of any kind, at 9 p.m.
Amelioration: Complete rest, lying on painful side, pressure, cold, eating cold food and taking
cold drink.
Relations :
Complementary to: Alumina and Rhustox.
Alumina is the chronic of Bryonia.
Antidoted by: Acon., Alum., Camph., Chel., Ign., Nux., Puts., Rhus tox.
It antidotes; Alum., Merc., Rhus tox.
It follows well: Aconite, Nux vom. Op., Rhustox.
It is followed well by: Alum., Ars:, Kali carb,, Nux vom., Puls., Rhus tox. Sulphur.


 chapter 51:BUFO

The toad DR. CARL HENEKE Bufonidae

INTRODUCTION
This remedy is prepared from the poison expressed by cutaneous glands of the toad. The chief laurels of Bufo have been won in the treatment of epilepsy.

CLINICAL
Chorea. Epilepsy. Impotency. Lymphangitis. Panaritium. Breast-affection of. Skin-affection of.

SPHERE OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS
It acts on nervous system, skin, male and female genital system. It causes a desire for
intoxicating drink and produces impotency. Bufo causes low grades of inflammatory action, foetid
exhalations, and discharges.

CONSTITUTION
It is specially suited to feeble minded children who are prematurely senile. The patient has great sensitive-ness to cold. It is a deep acting antipsoric remedy.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Convulsive seizures or epileptic fits occur during sleep at night, (Cuprum Met, Lach.) also during coition and at the time of menses.
2) The epiletic aura start from the sexual organs or from solar plexus.
3) Desire for solitude in order to practice masturbation.
4) Panaritium where the pain runs in streaks/all the way up the arm. /
5) Lymphangitis of septic origin.
6) Mentals — In Bufo lack of development is found like Baryta Carb patients. They
always behave like children, feeble minded children, A state of confusion, loss of
memory & imbecility present in marked degree. The patient is sad, restless,
impatient and he is anxious about health. Desires for solitude in order to practice masturbation. There is also sensation of heart swimming in water.
 Ailments from — Self abuse, masturbation, injury.


PARTICULARS
It is a very important remedy in epilepsy, which is more or less connected with sexual derangement,
Epilepsy :

Causation — Masturbation habit or self abuse. Aura begins in sexual organs or from solar plexus.
The attacks usually occur during sleep at night, during coition, and at the time of menses. The patient
may or may not be awakened by the attack but when he does awake he will have violent headache.
Convulsion usually followed by profound sleep.

Modality — Aggravation — At night. During sleep. In warm room.

Skin : It is a valuable remedy when the whole, lymphatic course is affected after an injury. In
panaritium where the pain runs in streaks all the way up the arms. Every slight injury suppurates. There
may be itching and burning of skin.
There may also be loss of sensation in patches of skin. Blisters on palms & soles may appear.

Sexual Symptoms :

Male : Bad effects of onanism resulting in impotency, involuntary or too quick emissions. There is
disposition to hold organs. In these patients aura begins in sexual organs and they suffer from spasms
during coition.
Female :
Menses—Too early & copious clots and bloody discharge at other times. Epileptic attacks during
excitement and at time of menses.
Breast : Induration in breast. It is a great palliative medicine in cancer of mammae & especially
useful when the milk is mixed with blood.

General Modalities :
Aggravation—In warm room, on awakening, during sleep at night, during menses.
Amelioration—From bathing or cold air, from putting feet in hot water.

Relations :
Antidotes and antidoted by—Lach., Senega.
Complementary—Salamandra.


 chapter :52CACTUS GRANDIFLORUS
Night-Blooming Cereus RUBINI Cactaceae

INTRODUCTION
This important medicine was introduced to Homoeopathy by Dr. Rubini from Italy. The mother tincture is prepared from the young,tender branches and flowers. Dr. Hughes says
that it closely resembles Aconite in producing general rigor, followed by much heat and sweat,pain, haemorrhage and acute congestion in head and chest. But the differentiating point is that
while Aconite weakens the nervous system, Cactus never does so.

CLINICAL
Angina pectoris, Apoplexy, Asthma, Brain
affection, Fever, Haematuria, Heart affection,
Lung affection, Respiratory troubles,
Rheumatism, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts on heart, blood vessels, uterus and ovary in particular and the head and body in general.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces all types of overaction of the heart; from nervous palpitation to acute condition, hypertrophy due to valvular disease, angina pectoris and chronic palpitation, etc .

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: Plethoric, full blooded persons.
Temperament: Sanguine temperament.
Heat and cold relation: Neither hot nor chilly.
Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Constriction, contraction and congestion of any organ in the body, especially heart, uterus, throat, chest, bladder, rectum etc CONSTRICTING PAIN runs through the whole PATHOGENESISis of Cactus.
2. The whole body feels, as if caged and each wire is being twisted tighter and tighter.
3. Oppression of chest, as from a great weight; as if an iron band prevented normal  breathing and motion.
4, Sensation of a cord tightly tied around the lower part of chest marking attachment of diaphragm with heart.
5. Heart feels, as if clasped and unclasped BY AN IRON HAND: as if bound and it has no room to beat.
6. Fluttering palpitation day and night, worse when walking and lying on left side and at approach of menses.
7. Pains everywhere, darting, and springing up like a chain of lightning and pressing with a sharp vice-like grip, only to be renewed again.
8. Haemorrhage from nose, lungs, stomach, rectum, bladder, etc.
9. Cactus has the weakness and coldness of the extremities, which characterise many heart diseases. 
10. There is vertigo on deep breathing.
11. Dreams of falling down during sleep.
12. Fear of death because he believes that the disease is incurable (Ars.).
13. Menstrual flow ceases when lying down (Bovista, Causticum, Lil. tig.—rev. of Mag.,carb., Ammon. carb., Kreosote).
14. Periodicity is well marked. Fever paroxysms return at 11 a.m. and 11 p.m.
15. Many symptoms are aggravated when lying down or come on when lying down.
16. Aliments from : Rheumatism, sun, damp weather and disappointment of love.

PARTICULARS

Cardio-vascular system or Heart :
Causation; Rheumatism,

Sensation: of constriction in the heart, as if an iron band prevented its normal movement. AS IF
CLASPED AND UNCLASPED WITH AN IRON BAND and there is no room to beat. Whole body feels,as if caged and each wire is twisted tighter and tighter.

Charecter of pain and symptoms: Pains are of pricking nature, impeding breathing and
movements of the body. Oppression of Chest; cannot lie on the left side. Dyspnoea from least exertion-

There may be dull heavy pain, aggravated by pressure and leading to suffocating respiration.
Pulse is quick, throbbing, tense and hard, Sometimes, intermittent and feeble.

Pains in the apex of heart; shooting down to left arm and to the end of fingers.
Pains go round to axilla, back and scapula of the left side.

Endocardial murmurs; excessive impulse and increased precordial dullness, enlargement of right E ventricle.

Palpitation with vertigo and loss of consciousness.
Palpitation is preceded by rumbling in stomach. Palpitation of long standing, caused by unfortunate love.

Modalities:
* Aggravation: By walking, at night, by lying on left side and after eating.
© Amelioration: After sleep, rest, fresh air and open air.
© Concornitants: Blueness of face, hot head and hands and icy cold feet.

Fever :
Rheumatic fevers and intermittent fevers are often treated with this remedy.
Causation: Sun and damp weather.
Time: Fever paroxysms come, at 11 a.m. and 11 p.m. Slight chilliness towards 10 a.m.

Character: Chilliness with chattering of teeth. Chilliness not relieved by covering. There is burning
heat with shortness of breath Scorching heat at night with hot face. Heat terminates with perspiration,
coldness of back and icy coldness of hands and feet.
Intermittent fever of quotidian type, occurring every day at the same hour.

Concomitants: There is great dyspnoea, violent pain in the head, coma, stupefaction, insensibility till midnight, followed by unquenchable thirst and perspiration.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: At 11 a.m. and 11 p.m. and lying on left side.
Amelioration: By sleep, rest, fresh and open.air.
Relation :
Cactus is antidoted by Aconite and Camphor.
Follows Well: Aconite, Ars., Bry., Cham., Lach., Nux., Rhus., Belladonna, Gels, and Amica.

chapter;53 CALCARCA SULPHURIUM
Calcium Sulphate C. HERING CaSO,

INTRODUCTION 
This is one of the twelve tissue remedies by Schussler. In the last edition of his bio-chemic
therapy, Schussler discarded Calc Sulph. because it is not an actual constituent of the
tissues & he distributed its functions between Silicea & Natrum. Phos. Homoeopaths, having
no bio-chemic theory to support, continue its use specially as it was proved by Dr. Bering & Others.

CLINICAL
Abscess Carbuncles. Eczema. Fistula, Haemorrhages. Tonsillitis, Ulcers.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Liver, mucous membranes, skin, connective tissue and glands.

PATHOGENESIS
This drug has got a special affinity for suppuration. Calc. Sulph. resembles Hepar Sulph, but acts deeper and more intensely and is often useful after Hepar has ceased to
act. It is also useful when Kali Mur ceased to act. Calc Sulph. shares importance with Sulph. Tuber & Psorinum. The tendency to formation of abscesses.in the body in any
place is a strong feature of this remedy, and is quiet similar to Pyrogen.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1) Tendency to formation of abscesses in the body in any place.
2) Mucous discharges are yellow, thick and lumpy. 3] Burning & itching of
soles of feet.
4) Desire fruit, green sour vegetables, tea.
5) Inflammations of the eyes with discharge of thick yellow matter.
6) Yellowish discharge from posterior nose.
7) Tongue is flabby with yellow coating at the base of the’ tongue.
8) Pimples and pustules on the face.
9) The presence of pus with a vent.
10) Unhealthy skin : Ulcers do not heal rapidly.
11) Painful abscesses about the anus in cases of fistula.
12) Mind: Changeable mood. Sudden loss of memory. Absent-minded and irritable,Anxious, better in open air. Discontended, full of tears.

PARTICULAR
Head : Headache with nausea & with feeling as if eyes were sunken. Headache comes on from becoming cold, but made better by cool air.
Vertigo, with deadly nausea, on moving head quickly.

Gastrointestinal Symptoms :
Mouth : Inside of lips sore. Dry hot mouth, Gum boils.
Tongue : Tongue flabby, resembling a layer of dried clay. Sour Soapy acrid taste. Yellow coating at base.
Throat : Suppurating sorethroat. Last stage of ulcerated sore throat with discharge of yellow matter. Suppurating stage of tonsillitis when abscess is discharging.
Stomach : There is burning pain in stomach. Nausea with vertigo. Desire for fruit, cold drinks, acids, salt and sweet. Great thirst and appetite.
Abdomen : There is pain in the region of liver and in right side of Pelvis followed by weakness, nausea and pain in stomach.
Stool : Purulent diarrhoea mixed with blood, Pus like slimy discharge from the bowels. Diarrhoea after maple sugar and change of weather.

Respiratory Symptoms:

Cough : Cough associated with hectic fever and purulent and sanious expectoration, there is pain across chest. Burning & weakness in chest.
       Catarrh with thick lumpy, white yellow or pus like secretions is guiding symptom in respiratory complaints.
Skin : There are numerous skin symptoms in Calc Sulph. Unhealthy skin, cuts, wounds, bruises ete. do not heal quickly. Skin affections with yellowish scabs & purulent exudations., Burning and itching of
skin. Dryness of skin. Itching in bed and better by scratching. Ulcers bleed, burn & are scaly, crusty and deep. Ulcers discharge bloody pus, offensive, thick yellow.
Many little matterless pimples under the hair bleeding when scratched.

climacteric period, mental depression, weak heart Palpitation on ascending, etc., are the symptoms of
Calcarea; whereas mental anxiety, chill, great weakness, etc. are the symptoms of Arsenic. Dr. Hering
proved this drug on his own body.

CLINICAL
Asthma, Cholera, Constipation, Fever, Heart affection, Headache, Kidney and Liver affections, Nephritis, ete.

It acts on mind, heart, liver, spleen and kidney.

CONSTITUTION

Relation with heat and cold: Very chilly patient,

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

5. Epilepsy from valvular diseases of the heart.

Ailments from : Drinking alcohol, after abstaining from drinking, fleshy women approaching menopause and EMOTIONS.

Headache :
Weekly headache, violent rush of blood to head with vertigo. Pain in head, better by lying on painful side.
Heart :
Calcarea ars. is a great heart remedy.

Constriction and pain in region of heart, suffocative feeling. Oppression arid throbbing with pain in back extending to arms.
Rush of blood to head and left chest.
Epilepsy with valvular diseases of the heart. Aura felt in the region of heart.
Heart beat is missing at every fourth beat.
All these heart complaints are mostly found in fleshy and chilly women, approaching menopause.
Palpitation worse on exertion, emotion and on ascending.
Great craving for alcohol is present.

Nephritis; Kidney region is very sensitive to pressure. Albuminuria, urine passes every hour.

 chapter;55  CALCAREA CARBONICA
Middle layer of HAHNEMANN Calcium.Oyster Shell Carbonate (Ca Cos)

INTRODUCTION
This great Hahnemannian antipsoric is a wonderful constitutional remedy par
excellence. Dr. Mrs. Tyler remarks about
Calcarea that—
“With the chalky complexion goesFatness without fitness, Sweating without heat.
Bones without strength,
Tissues of plus quantity and minus quality,
Mere flabby, bulky with weakness and Weariness.”
“Some remedies are difficult to spot; the difficulty is to MISS Calcarea, when typical”
says Tyler. It is one of the greatest monuments of Hahnemann’s genius and is a great
polychrest remedy, and ranks with sulphur and Lycopodium at the head of anti-psorics.

CLINICAL
Abdominal disorders, Acidity, Anaemia, Bone affection, Breast affection, Cough, Dentition, Diabetes, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Dyspepsia, Eye troubles, Epilepsy, Fever,
Glandular affection, Headache, Leucorrhoea, Lung affection, Menstrual disorders, Miscarriage, Pregnancy disorders, Respiratory troubles, Rheumatism, Ricket, Skin
affection, Uterine affection, Vertigo, Worm troubles, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
The main seats of action of Calcarea carb. are bones, glands, blood, skin, mind and female genital organs.

PATHOGENESIS
Calcarea carb. produces impairment in nutrition of various organs, particularly BONES; alteration in composition of blood, with chief action on skin and bones,
manifesting increased local or general perspiration, swelling of glands, softening and bending bones, abscesses in deep muscles, polypi and exostoses.

CONSTITUTION
Calcarea carb. is adapted to “LEUCOPHLEGMATIC” constitution.
Make-up of the body: It is suited to FAIR, FATTY AND FLABBY patient who becomes easily fatigued and tired on walking, with much sweating, cold extremities and
sour smell of the body. There is TENDENCY TO OBESITY in youth. Slow in movement,
Make-up of the body of baby: Children who crow rar. chalky look with red face, large belly like an inverted saucer with LARGE HEAD opEN FONTANELLES AND SUTURES,
flabby muscles, pale skin, soft bonesi who SWEAT EASILY, SPECIALLY ON BACK SIDE OF THE HEAD AND NECK and swollen glands.
Girls who are fleshy, plethoric and grow too rapidly.
Relation with heat and cold: CHILLY PATIENT, DISPOSED to CATCH COLD VERY EASILY.
Miasm: It is one of the greatest anti-psoric and antisycotie remedies.
Diathesis: Scrofulous, rachitic and tubercular diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

.The patient has GREAT SENSITIVNESS TO TAKE COLD; gets frequent coryza which is chronic in nature and psoric in origin, CANNOT TOLERATE COLD (in acute stage, Belladonna).
.Disposed to grow fat, corpulent and uniwieldy.
.Sweat: Sweat of Calcarea carb. is very characteristic. HEAD SWEATS PROFUSELY, WHILE SLEEPING WETTING the pillow far around. Profuse perspiration mostly on back of head and neck or chest and upper part of the body.
.Sweat of single part, head, scalp, nape of neck, chest, axillae, sexual organs, hands, palm, knees, feet, sole, etc. with coldness. The sweat is Sour Smelling. Rawness of

Adenoids, Aneurism, Affections of Bone, of Glands, Cataract, Catarrrh, Constipation,

Jt acts on bones, enamel of teeth, skin, connective tissues & vessels. Also acts on

it acts best in spare subjects instead of fat, while it retains its wonderful power over tardy bones.

CLINICAL

Abdominal disorders. Anaemia, Ankle’s weakness, Back weakness, Bone affection, Brain- fag, Bright’s disease, Chorea, Cretinism, Debility,

SPHERES OF ACTION
Main action of this drug is on those tissues of body which have more calcium and phosphorus contents, such as bones, teeth, etc. Glands, digestive system, female genital
organs also come within the domain of its action.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces a state of malnutrition because of defective assimilation in regard % calcium and phosphorys, leading to improper bone formation, ossification and bending
long bones, spinal curvature, delayed dentition, resulting in rickets, etc.

CHAPTER :58 CALENDULA OFFICINALIS
Marigold Compositae
INTRODUCTION

Calendula is our favourite marigold. The mother tincture is prepared from its leaves and
flowers, together with blooms and buds. IT IS A GREAT HOMOEOPATHIC ANTISEPTIC. It
restores vitality of an injured part. Unlike Arnica, it has no irritating property and
consequently not capable of producing erysipelas. It is, therefore, suitable to all cases of injuries
where the skin is broken. It prevents suppuration and brings about healing promptly. It can also be
used externally with wonderful results. Calendula is a great healing agent in our Materia
Medica and it ranks first in our Homoeopathic surgical and first aid box for sueh conditions.

CLINICAL
Abscess, Burns, Carbuncles, Chillblains, Eye inflammation, Glandular affection, Injuries, Suppuration, Ulcers, Wounds, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts on muscles, tendons, nerves, scalp, skin, etc.

PATHOGENESIS
Its action on the muscles, tendons, nerves, etc. produces a condition similar to
lacerated injuries with solution of continuity of skin with suppuration.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
, Calendula is almost specific for clean cut, surgical cuts or lacerated wounds or suppurating wounds, It prevents suppuration, promotes healthy granulation of tissues
and rapid healing by first intention.
.Pain is excessive and out of all proportion to injury due to probable nerve involvement,
. Constitutional tendency to erysipelas,
, It can be used in the case of cancer as an intercurrent remedy.
. It is an excellent haemostatic in tooth extraction (Bov., Ham., Phos),

Ailments from : Loss of blood and post surgical injury.
PARTICULARS
Injury :
Causation: Clean cut injury, amputation, surgical operation, lacerated wounds, during labour,extraction of teeth, fracture of bones, etc.

Character of injury: Calendula it used in all cases of loss of soft parts, when union cannot be effected by means of adhesive plaster. Rupture of muscles or tendons, laceration and perineal tear during
labour; wounds penetrating articulations with loss of synovial fluids.

External wounds with or without loss of substance; torn and jagged looking wounds; post surgical operation; to promote healthy granulation and prevent excessive suppuration and disfiguring scars.

Exhausted from loss of blood (China, Ham.) and excessive pain. Traumatic and idiopathic neuroma; neuritis from lacerated wounds (Hypericum), after amputation (Cepa, Calc. phos.). Bleeding from
extraction of teeth (Arn., Bov., Ham. and Phos).
For old neglected, offensive injuries, threatening to a gangrenous condition, Calendula is ideally suited.

Ulcers :
Irritable, inflamed, sloughing and excessive secretion of pus; painful as if beaten (Am.), ulcers of varicose vein. Calendula has remarkable power to produce local exudation and helps acrid discharge and
makes ulcers healthy and clean. It has good reputation for external application in any cut or open wound surface or in any. ulcer. Calendula mother tincture, lotion or liniment can be applied externally.
General Modalities :
Worse in damp cloudy weather.
Relations :
Antidoted by: Arnica.

Follows well: Ars. alb.

repidly acting and short lasting medicines) hence requires very frequent repetition.” Master

 Quantity: There is not much discharge from the bowels, not much vomiting, sweat and urine,but suddenly the patient coLLAPsEs..
 Great coldness of surface, body cold to touch yet cannot bear to be covered. Throws off
 all the coverings. With collapse, there is great prostration and rapid sinking of strength.

Character of discharge: Stool rice-watery, involuntary, blackish, dark brown, faeces like coffee-ground, SCANTY with great tenesmus.
There is great retching and straining to vomit with SCANTY DISCHARGE.
Cramps: There are cramps in .the stomach and bowels spreading to other parts of the body, especially in calf muscles.
Look of the face: The face is cold, blue and shrivelled, very much anxious and pale.
Sweat: There is scanty sweat which is cold, all over the body, but more on the forehead, (Ver, alb.).
Tongue: The tongue is cold, flabby and trembling with cold breath
Pulse: Weak, small, slow, scarcely perceptible.

It differs in cholera from Cuprum and Veratrum album.

In Camphor, there is great PROSTRATION, BLUENESS, COLDNESS of the body and the body is cold and dry, yet the patient wants to be uncovered. And all the discharges are SCANTY.
In Cuprum, there is not so much prostration and coldness but there is more cramping and more convulsive tendency. So, the more the cramping the better the Cuprum is indicated,
In Ver. Alb., the more copius the discharge from bowels and the more profuse the vomiting and ‘sweat.
So scanty, cold and dry is Camphor; cold and copiousn discharge is Ver.alb.
The collapse of Camphor is sudden and overwhelming but not so in Ver. alb., due to excess oi purging and vomiting.
 Fever:
In eruptive fever, especially in measles, the face is pale, blue, cold and hippocratic face. The body is cold to touch, still the patient likes to he uncovered.
When eurptions do not appear or in repercussed eruption of measles and scarlatina, in all Sequelae of measles, Camphor is a great remedy.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: By motion, at night and in cold air.
Amelioration ; When thinking of exsiting complaints and warm air,
Relations :
Camphor antidotes nearly every vegetable medicine, tobacco, and opium.
Compare: Veratrum, Secale and Cuprum in cholera.
Antidoted by: Dulc., Phos. and Op.


CHEAPTER 60 CANNABIS INDICA
Indian Hemp. Urticaceae

INTRODUCTION
Cannabis Indica is said to be botanicallyidentical with Cannabis Sativa, “the difference in
soil and climate being responsible for thedifference in their properties”. Indeed, many
writers “lump” them together, as if there is nodifferences,— but it is Cannabis Indica which
provides such an extra ordinary wealth of mentalsymptoms and which is so astonishingly curative
wherever these provide the indications. Ourwriters seem to have given up can. Indica in
despair, probably because of the redundancy ofits mental aberrations.

CLINICAL

Catalepsy. Chordee. Clairvoyance. Delirium tremens. Delusions. Epilepsy.Gonorrhoea. Headache. Mania. Menorrhagia. Paralysis. Pros-tatitis. Satyriasis.
Stammering. Urinary diseases.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS : MIND :
.Very forgetful—forgets his last words and ideas; begins a sentence, forgets what he intends to speak, inability to recall any thought or event on account of
other thoughts crowding his brain (Anac., Lac. C.)
. Constantly theorizing.
. Laughs immoderately at every trifling word spoken to him.
. Full of fun and mischief, then perhaps moaning and crying.
. Great apprehension of approaching death.
. Delirium tremens, excessive loquacity, exaggeration of time and distance.
. Time seems too long (Arg. N.) a few seconds seem ages.
.Distance seems immense, a few rods seem miles.
. Sensation as if the calvarium was opening and shutting (Act.)
. Sensation of swelling in the perineum or near the anus, as if sitting on a ball (with great quantities of ropy mucus in urine-Cinch)
. Limbs and parts seem enlarged.
. Wonderful imaginations and hallucinations.
. Quickness of ideas and pleasant sensations.—constant succession of new ideas, each of which was instantly forgotten.
. Imagines that he is possessed of infinite knowledge and power of vision.
. Uncontrollable laughter, till the face becomes purple and the back and loins ache.
. Constant fear of becoming insane.
. Horror of darkness.

PARTICULARS
Head:
Sensation as if top of head were opening & shutting and as if calvarium were beinglifted. There is involuntary shaking of head. Uraemic headache & when associated with flatulency.
Un-usual excitment with loquacity usually precedes the attack of migrain.

Face :
Expression : drowsy & stupid.
Mouth and lips dry Lips glued together. Saliva thick, frothy & sticky.
Grinding of teeth during sleep.

Stomach :
Sensation of extreme tension in abdominal vessels as if bursting. Appetite increased. Pain at cardiac
oriPco oetter by pressure. Pyloric spasm.

Urinary Symptoms :
Stitches and burning in urethra. Dull pain in region of right kidney. Dribbling urine, patient must
strain. He has to wait some time before the urine flows. (Nat. Mur.) Urine loaded with slimy mucus.

Sexual Symptoms :
Male : Backache after sexual intercourse. Oozing of white glairy mucus from glans. Satyriasis Chordee. Prolonged thrill.
Female : Menses Profuse, dark, painful, without clots. Backache during menses. Uterine colic, with great nervous agitation & sleeplessness. Dysmenorrhoea with sexual desire.
Extremities : Pain across shoulders and spine. Must stoop; can not walk erect. Thrillirg through arms and hands and from knees down. Entire paralysis of the lower extremities.
Pains in soles, calves, ankles and knees ; very exhausted after a short walk.
Sleep : Obstinate and intractable forms of insomnia, Catalepsy. Nightmare. Dreams of dead bodies: 
Very sleepy but unable to sleep.

Aggravation : Morning, from coffee, liquor, and tobacco, lying on right side. Amelioration :Fro™fresh air, cold water, rest.

CHEAPER : 61 CANNABIS SATIVA
American Hemp HAHNEMANN Urticaceae

INTRODUCTION
This European and American Hemp is said to be botanically identical with Cannabis Indica. Both of
them belong to the same natural order. The difference in soil, and climate is responsible for the difference in
their properties. Cannabis saliva was first introduced accidentally in the field of Homoeopathic therapeutics
by Dr. O. Shaughsessy who also described the effects of the Indian hemp, Cannabis Indica.

CLINICAL
Asthma, Constipation, Gonorrhoea, Respiratory affection, Urinary affections etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts chiefly upon the urinary organs, especially the mucous lining of the urethra,sexual and respiratory organs.

PATHOGENESIS
It causes excessive irritation followed by inflammation of the mucous membrane of urethral passage producing mucus-like discharge, the whole condition closely simulating Gonorrhoea.

CONSTITUTION
There is no particular constitution of the patient as such. However, there is sycotic and syphilitic background for the troubles.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
.Acute inflammatory first stage of gonorrhoea.
. Urethra is very sensitive to touch and pressure. Cannot walk with legs close together. They hurt the urethra.
. There is tearing pain along the urethra in zigzag direction.
. Pain extends from external orifice of the urethra backwards, burning and bitting.Pain while urinating.
. Obstinate constipation causing retention of urine, with constriction of anus.
. Dyspnoea or asthma where the patient can breathe better only by standing up.
. Choking in swallowing; things “go down the wrong way.”
. Sensation as of drops of water are falling on or from a single part; on the head, from anus, stomach, heart, etc.
. Ailments from : Gonorrhoea.

PARTICULARS

Urinary Symptoms :
Cannabis sativa is adapted to urinary troubles, arising from or brought on by gonorrhoea, the cardinal symptoms of which are as follows:
Stage: In acute and inflammatory stage of gonorrhoea especially in the first stage; in urethritis,
Urethra is very much sensitive to touch and pressure. Cannot walk with legs close together.Keeps the legs wide apart because touch hurts the urethra.

Sensation: “Burning” sensation in urethra during and after urination.

Character of pain: Stiching and tearing pain along the urethra in a zigzag direction. Pain extending from orifice of urethra to backwards; burning and bitting while urinating. There is frequent, violent and
constant urging to urinate.

During urination: Most painful and diffucult urination. There is stitching pain in urethra while the urine flows. Violent pain at the close of urination.

After urination: Pressing out feeling at the orfice of the urethra after urination.

Character of Urine: Urine is mixed with blood; scalds when passing; there is thick, yellowish gonorrhoeal discharge from the urethra.

Modality: Aggravation from touch.

Respiratory symptoms :
Suited especially in bronchitis and asthma.
Sensation: There is sensation of weight on the chest.

Character of cough: Rattling cough with wheezing and dyspnoea where the patient can breathe
better only by standing up. Must have windows open.

Character of Sputa; Cough with green viscid expectoration, salty sputa with blood spifting.
Character of pain; During coughing there is Stiching pain in the chest.

Modéalities:
* Aggravation: By lying down.
© Amelioration: By standing up.
For threatened abortion complicated with gonorrhoea, this drug is an excellent remedy.
There may also be sexual over excitement in elther sex.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: From lying down and going upstairs.
Amelioration: By standing up.

Relations :
Antidotes: Camphor and Merc.
Similar to: Cantharis and Cup. met.

 CHAPTER 62 : CANTHARIDES
Spanish Flies HAHNEMANN Cantharideae

INTRODUCTION
This medicine is prepared from the Spanish Fly by reducing into a course powder and
saturating it later with alcohol to prepare the mother tincture. It was first introduced into the
parlance of Homoeopathy by our Master Hahnemann. To stress its importance, Dr. Tyler remarks “ANOTHER VEHEMENT DRUG OF STORM AND _ STRESS” tempered by
Hahnemann. Cantharides in its crude form is a powerful irritant and is hardly ever used
internally. After Homoeopathic proving, the same irritant drug is used for an irritant disorder on the basis of Homoepathic Law “Similia Similibus Curantur”.

CLINICAL
Bladder affection, Burns, Dysentery, Diarrhoea, Gonorrhoea, Kidney troubles, Neuralgia, Pleurisy, Pregnancy troubles, Haematuria. Skin affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts especially on urinary organs, urinary bladder, urethra, ureters, skin, respiratory system and gastro-intestinal canal.

PATHOGENESIS
It especially affects the urinary and sexual organs and prevents their function by setting up violent inflammation. It also causes inflammation of the whole gastro
intestinal canal, especially of lower bowels. Inflammation produced by Cantharides on lower bowels, kidneys, ovaries, meninges, pleura or pericardium is usually
ASSOCIATED WITH BLADDER IRRITATION.
GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. “Burning” in every part of the body; both internal and external, run through the whole remedy.
. Constant and intolerable uriging to urinate before, during and after urination is the key-note of Cantharides,
. Burning and cutting pain in urethra during micturition,
. Oversensitiveness of all parts.
. There is haemorrhage from nose, mouth, intestine, genital and urinary organs.
. Stool with scraping of intestine (Colchicum and Arg. nit.).
. Gastric complaints that are aggravated by drinking coffee (Boericke).
. Disgust for everything, drink, food, tobacco.
. Drinking even a small quantity of water increases pain in the bladder.
. Violent lancinating pains through, the kidney and back (Kent).
. Tenacious and ropy mucus from air passages (Kali bi.) with urinary symptoms.
. Aggravation from dazzling objects and by water, a typcial picture of hydrophobia(Nash).
, Cantharides expels moles, dead foetus, placenta and promotes fecundity(Guernsey).
. There is violent sexual desire.

PARTICULARS
Dysentery :
Cantharides is a good medicine for dysentery.
Before stool There is great urging for stool with violent colicky pain in the abdornen.
During stool. There is severe burning and cutting pain in the anus.
After stool: After stool colic is alleviated, but the tenesmus continues with great shuddering.
Character of Stool: White mucus like scraping of intestine, bloody mucus with streaks of blood or frank blood.
Concomitants: Dysentery is associated with dysuria.

Urinary Symptoms :

In whatever diseases or urinary complaints, such as urethritis, cystitis or renal colic, gonorrhoea, etc.. it matters little, if the following symptoms are present, Cantharides can be thought of'as an effective remedy.
Constant urging to urinate before, during and after micturition.Only a few drops of urine pass at a time.

There is VIOLENT TENESMUS. 
Burning during urination is always present.

Oversenstiveness of parts is well marked.

Haematuria :

Blood passes with urine. Aggravation after drinking coffee or cold water.

Character of pain: There \s violent pain WITH FREQUENT URGING TO URINATE. Cutting. lancinating and stabbing pain as from knives, in neck of bladder. Pain shoots off in different directions.
There is burning and cutting pain in urethra during micturition with VIOLENT TENESMUS: Violent lancinating pains through the kidneys and back. Over sensitiveness of the parts. There is sever
pain on urinating so that the patient screams on passing every drop.

Character of urine: Bloody urine; comes drop by drop. Urine scalds the passage; jelry like, shreddy urine.
There is retention or suppression of urine. Passes only a drop or two at a time.

Modalities:
  Aggravation : During urination, from touch, drinking cold water or coffee.
  Amelioration: By rubbing warm application (Clarke).

In gonorrhoea, there is violent burning and tenesmus of the bladder. There is severe cutting burning pain while urinating. The urine burns like fire in the bladder and about the genitals.

Skin :
Cantharides is usually indicated in burns, scalds and erysipelas.
Sensation: There is burning and raw sensation.

Look of skin: Inflamed with bleb formation. There is vesicular erysipelas with vesicles all over the body which are sore and suppurating.
Pain: There is severe burning pain with itching and smarting.

Modalities: Worse from touch and relieved by cold application (Boericke). Cantharides can be used externally also in burns before the blisters form and also when they have already formed. If the skin is
unbroken, Cantharides will promptly relieve pain and often prevent vesication.

General Modalities :
Aggravation : From touch, urinating, drinking cold water or coffee.
Amelioration: By rubbing.
Relation :
Antidotes: Aconite, Camphor and Pulsatilla.

CHAPTER :63 Cayenne or HAHNEMANN Solanaceae  Red Pepper 

INTRODUCTION

Master Hahnemann says—this Spanish pepper as it is called, was introduced as a spice to
season the sauces and to work as an appetiser. But in the rational therapeutic sphere, it has
gained enough deserving name and fame by its characteristic, though limited sphere of action.
Dr. Tyler remarks in regard to this remedy “these remedies of limited, but curious and
unique action, are most useful where they fit, one may need them seldom, But yet nothing on earth
will take their place where symptoms demand them”.

CLINICAL
Asthma, Abdominal disorders, Brain affection, Cough, Delirium, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Ear affection, Headache, Haemorrhoids, Home
sickness, Fevers, Lung affection, Pregnancy troubles, Rheumatism, Sciatica, Throat affection, Urinary troubles, Whooping cough.
Tonsillitis, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Capsicum affects principally mucous membranes e.g. of mouth tongue, abdomen. bowels, rectum, etc. Chest, lungs and skin may also be affected in rare instances. It also
affects the bones, particularly bones of the ear.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces inflammation of mucous membrane with mucus discharge from bowels throat, etc. It also causes well marked chill, fever and neuralgia with threatening dee?
seated abscesses.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: Especially suited to fatty persons with light hair, blue eyes, stout and plethorie who easily get exhausted, indolent, dread of any kind of exercise, persoDs
inclined to be jovial, yet angry at trifles. Children dread open air. A Capsicum child 8 fatty, dirty, clumsy, and is always chilly.
Temperament: Nervous temperament.

Capsicum 177

Relation with heat and Cold: CHILLY PATIENT.
Miasm: Psora is in the background.
Diathesis: Phlegmatic.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
, Burning and smarting sensation in the throat and other parts, not relieved by heat whereas aggravated from cold water (Clarke).
. Constriction in faces, throat, nares, chest, bladder, urethra and rectum.
. Pain in distanat parts on coughing e.g. bladder, knees, legs, ears, etc.
. The burning, spasmodic constriction and all other pains are worse between the acts of degulutition (Ign.).
. Every stool is followed by thirst and every drink is fallowed by shuddering.
. Burning is aggravated by application of cold water and slightest draught of cold air, but not relieved by heat.
. Home-sickness with red cheeks and sleepiness (Ign. and Phosphoric acid); much hot feeling in faces.

Mind : Mentally there are many striking features in Capsicum, Home-sickness is well-marked which runs through the remedy with sleeplessness and red cheeks
There is persistent thought of suicide. He does not want to kill himself; he resists the thoughts which persist and he is tormented by these sad thoughts. The patient
is very taciturn, peevish and obstinate; great clumsiness and awkwardness,
excessive peevishness, wants to be left alone at home.

PARTICULARS

Headache :
Sensation: Headache as if the head would fly to pieces, feels as if head were large.
Character of headache: Bursting and throbbing type of headache. Headache as if the brain would be pressed thorugh the forehead. Patient holds the head with hands.
Modalities:
 Aggravation: Moving the head, when walking or coughing and stepping.
 Amelioration: Lying down with head high.
Ear:
It has got peculiar action on the bones of the internal ear and MASTOID PROCESS. Location: Inflammation of mastoid, in mastoid abscess with swelling and behind the ears.
Character of pain: BURNING AND STINGING PAIN in the ears; aching and pressing pain with cough as if an abscess would burst.
Necrosis of the petrous portion of temporal bone and caries of the bones of ear, especially the mastoid process are successfully treated by capsicum.

Gastro-intestinal symptoms :
Abdomen :
Dyspesia with great flatulence, sinking at the pit of stomach, nausea and vomiting.The patinet has great craving for stimulants.
There is much thirst, but drinking causes shuddering.There is buring and smarting sensation in the abdomen.
Dysentery :
It is one of the royal remedies for dysentery. Character of stool: The stool is full of mucus and blood. During stool there is stinging pain.
After stool the patient is thirsty with shuddering.
Every stool is followed by thrist and every drink by shuddering. There is drawing pain in the back
with great tenesmus, smarting and burning in anus and rectum.

Piles :
For bleeding, PILES WITH SORENESS IN ANUS, Capsicum is marvellous. There is stinging pain during stool. Haemorrhoids protrude with smarting and burning pain, smarting like pepper. PILES STING
AND BURN AS IF PEPPER had been sprinkled on them.
After stool, there is drawing pain in the back.

Respiratory symptoms :
Causation: After taking cold and exposure to cold.
Cough: There is dry, hacking and explosive cough.
Every time the patient coughs, and at no other time, there escapes a volume of pungent, foetid air
from his mouth.

Modality: Cough is more violent in evening and at night.
Concomitants: Pain at distant parts of body while coughing e.g. bladder, legs, ears, etc. Headache as if the head is going to burst. 3:
Tonsillitis :
In inflammation of throat and tonsils, Capsicum is a royal remedy.
Sensation: Hot feeling in fauces, constrictive feeling in throat. Burning and smarting sensation.
Look of the throat; The throat is dark red, swollen and inflamed.
Character of pain: Pain and dryness in throat, extending to the ears, Sore throat of smokers and drinkers. There is burning and smarting sensation as from cayenne pepper in the throat.

Aggravation: Between acts of deglutition (Ign.) in case of burning spasmodic constriction and other pains.

There is burning and smarting sensation as from cayenne pepper in throat, not relieved by heat.

Intermittent fever :
Capsicum is a valuable remedy in intermittent fever.
The chill begins in the back. Thirst commences long before chill commences. There is great thirst, but drinking causes shivering and increase chilliness. The chill is relieved by heat, must have something
hot to cover up.
During the stage of chill, he becomes sensitive to noise. There is no thirst both in heat and sweat stages.

CHAPTER :65 CARBO VEGETABILIS
Vegetable Charcoal HAHNEMANN Wood Charcoal

INTRODUCTION
Carbon is an important constituent of each and every cell in the human body. It maintains
the vitality and integrity of all the organs andtissues. Carbo veg. is indicated mainly in the 1st
and 2nd childhood and when the resistance of the body is low and is incapable of coping up with the external envtronment.
Carbo veg. is rather an “inert” substance which is made medicinally useful and a powerful agent of great helping value by fine trituration.
Its true latent power of helping is developed when it is sufficiently potentized.
It is a chronic, deep and long acting anti-psoric medicine which enters deeply into
life. It mainly affects the VENOUS SIDE OF THE ECONOMY producing symptoms of IMPERFECT OXIDATION, BLUENESS, ECCHYMOSIS AND _  PASSIAVE
HAEMORRHAGE resulting from deficient capillary circulation. It is mainly indicated in
the last stage of exhaustive diseases which result in disintegration and improper oxidation of the tissue with ‘air hunger’.

CLINICAL

Acidity, Acne, Angina pectoris. Aphonia, Asthma, Bronchitis, Carbuncle, Cancerous affection, Cholera, Constipation, Cough, Debility, Diarrhoea, Dentition, Dysentery,
Dyspepsia, Disorders of Pregnancy, Emphysema, Eructation, Epistaxis, Fevers, Flatulence, Gangrene, Haemorrhage, Haemorrhoids, Headache, Heart affections, Lung affection,
Measles and Mumps, Orchitis, Otorrhoea, Stomach disorders, Skin affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Carbo veg. acts very particularly upon the sanguinous and nervous system and all the vegetative process of the body. Affects vascular system, particularly the venous side:
blood and capillary, mucous membrane, gastro-intestinal tract and lung.

PATHOGENESIS
It causes sluggishness, turbidity and swelling of the parts. Everything about the economy is sluggish, turbid distended and swollen, The head feels full and the limbs feel
dull and puffy. The veins are relaxed and paralysed. It also produces vaso-motor paralysis.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: Persons of advanced age, women at turn of life; prematurely old people. Cachectic persons, young or old. The face is puffy, bluish, pale and hippocratic
with cold sweat.

Temperament: Sanguine temperament.
Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient. Though the body is cold to touch, the patient WANTS constantly to be FANNED RAPIDLY AND FROM NEAR.

Miasm: It is a powerful anti-psoric remedy.
Diathesiss HAEMORRHAGIC DIATHESIS. Passive haemorrhage of black or dark blood from every orifice of the body e.g. bleeding from lung, bladder, uterus, stomach,
ulcers, etc. resulting from weakened circulation. Haemorrhagic tendency runs through the whole remedy.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. Exhausted vitality from loss of vital fluid.
. The surface of the body is COLD TO TOUCH, especially from knee to feet. The pulse is intermittent, thready and imperceptible.
. Weak Digestion, SIMPLE FOOD DISAGREES causing excessive flatulence; abdomen is full to bursting point especially on the upper part; aggravation from
 least food and relief from eructation and on passing flatus. It is one of Nash’s Trio of tympanitic and flatulent drugs (others being Lyco. and China).
. In the last stage of any disease with copious cold sweat, cold breath, cold tongue,voice lost, this remedy may save a life.
. WANTS TO BE FANNED RAPIDLY AND FROM A CLOSE DISTANCE in nearly every complaint.
. Wants clothing loose around the abdomen (Lach. and Bovista).
. The patient craves things which makes him sick. Old toppers crave whisky or brandy.
. Hoarseness aggravated in the evening (Aconite, Phos. and Rumex).
. Sysmptoms of imperfect oxidation, resulting from deficient capillary circulation,causing blueness of skin and coldness of extremities.
. Constant sour and rancid eructation.
. Mind : Slowness of thought and weakness of memory, dislikes darkness and fears ghosts.
 Ailments from ;: Loss of vital fluid, mercury, salt, salted meat or fish and from abuse of quinine, especially suppressed chill and fever; bad effects of long ago
 injury, persons who have never fully recovered from the bad effects of some previous illness.

PARTICULARS

Stomach :
Simplest food disagrees due to weak digestion with excessive accumulation of gas in the stomach and intestine particularly in the epigastric region with frequent eructation and passing of flatus.
Causation: Alcohol, wine, spoiled meat, fish, fat, salt and salted meat.
Sensation: As if the abdomen will burst open due to accumulation of excessive gas.
Location: Especially in the upper part of the abdomen (stomach and transverse colon). (Lower abdomen-lyco, whole abdomen-china).

Modalities:
* Aggravation: By lying down, after eating and drinking, rich food, butter, milk, coffee, etc.
° Amelioration: From eructation and passing flatus.

Concomitants: Diarrhoea and cadaverous smelling stool with burning in the rectum.

Diarrhoea : It is suited to painful diarrhoea of old people.

Character of stool: Frequent, involuntary, cadaverous smelling stool followed by burning in rectum. Soft stool voided with difficulty.

Cholera :Carbo veg. is very useful in the COLLAPSE STAGE of cholera.

Causation: Caused by great drain of the vitality due to profuseness of its discharges.

Character of stool: There is frequent, involuntary cadaverous smelling stool, followel by burning.

Look of the face: Hippocratic face eyes are sunken, cheeks are sunken with earthy complexion.

Look of the skin: There is deficient capillary circulation causing blueness of skin and coldness of extremities, vital power nearly exhausted.

Sweats: There is COLD SWEAT ON the forehead with coldness of entire body.

Relation with fan: There is GREAT DESIRE TO BE CONSTANTLY FANNED RAPIDLY AND FROM A CLOSE DISTANCE.
If Carbo veg. is given in last stage with copious cold sweat, cold breath, cold tongue, voice
lost, this remedy may save a LIFE.

Respiratory Symptoms :

Causation: Low vitality and neglected pneumonia (China, Plumbum and Lyco.).

Character of Cough: Cough with tingling and itching in larynx causing spasmodic cough with gagging and vomiting. Hoarseness worse- in the evening; aphonia more in the morning with rawness, soreness and burning, wheezing and rattling of mucus in the chest.
Modality: Worse in the evening, open air, after eating and talking Relieved by CONSTANT FANNING FROM A CLOSE DISTANCE.


Haemorrhage :

Carbo veg. is a very important remedy for passive capillary bleeding where there is constant oozing of dark blood, except in case of nose where blood is brigt red.

Causation: Low vitality, weak or feeble heart wilth relaxation of blood vessels and vaso-motor

paralysis.

Location: Especially on the venous side of the economy.

Modality: Relief BY FANNING.

Concomitants: Cyanosis. Desire to be fanned continuously and form near which gives relief.

Skin :

Skin is cyanosed, cold and ecchymosed due to venous stasis. Moist skin with hot perspiration old and clammy sweat, itching falling of hair due to general weakneis after exhausting disease.
Senile gangrene which bleed easily and gives off foul smell. Bedsore which bleeds easily and gives off foul smell. Varicose ulcers due to feeble circulation with burning pain.
Carbuncle purple in appearance with burning pain which imparts offensive smell: aggravated by heat and relieved by cold application. Ulceration of skin and mucous membrane from injury which does not heal readily due to relaxation of the blood vessels and feebleness of the tissue.
The ulcers give out a bloody, ichorous, acrid and thin discharge with offensive smell.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: In the evening, in open air, from cold, from hot food, butter, coffee, milk, warm damp weather and alcoholic drinks.

Amelioration: From eructation, from fanning rapidly and from a close distance and by cold
application.
Relations :
Complementary to: China, Kali carb, and Drosera.

chapter 66 CARBOLIC ACID

Glacial Carbolic Acid HAHNEMANN CoHs0H

INTRODUCTION

Carbolic acid is a great antiseptic and powerful irritant. In its crude form, it is capable of poisoning. This property hadled Hahnemann to potentise this drug for the cure of various
ailments. The potencies of Carbolic acid are made with alcohol, an exception to the rule for preparation of acids.

CLINICAL
Abdominal affection, Burns, Carbuncles, Cholera,Constipation, Diabetes, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Dyspepsia, Flatulence, Fever, Gangrene, Headache, Leucorrhoea, Skin affection, Small-pox, Uraemia, Urinary affection, Ulcers, Vomiting, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on nervous system, skin, all mucous membranes, especially of mouth, throat, gastro-intestinal tract and urinary organs.

PATHOGENESIS

It acts primarily on nervous system and produces deadly paralysis of respiratorycentres and various consequent reflex symptoms. It causes much debility and weakness.
It also produces inflammation of the skin resulting in ulceration and malignant manifestations of all mucous membranes and gastro-intestinal tract, in addition to
vomiting, dysentery, etc.

CONSTITUTION ;

Physical make-up: There is no particular constitution for this drug. Persons of any and every constitution are susceptible tcvthis remedy. The patient is however, VERY
CHILLY, having SYPHILITIC AND PSORIC BACKGROUND and is of irritable temperament.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. As in the case of all acids. DEBILITY AND WEAKNESS ARE very common symptoms; hence in Carbolic acid too, these symptoms are persistently present throughout.

2. Pains come suddenly, last for a short time and disappear suddenly, (Bell, Mag:phos.). Pains are burning, pricking and stitching,

3. The whole surface of the body is bathed in cold sweat with prostration and collaspe.

4. Sensation of band around the forehead, with dull and heavy frontal headache.

5. Ulceration all over the body and in internal parts, such as mouth, nose, throat,nostrils, rectum, vagina, from which a discharge comes out which is very offensive and putrid.

6. Great longing for whisky and tobacco.

7. It has cured cases of cancer of stomach and has apparently cured epithelioma of cheeks and nose with haemorrhage (Allen).

8. Constipation with HORRIBLY OFFENSIVE BREATH.

9. In dysentery, stool contains scraping of intestine (Cantharides, Colchicum).

10. Carbolic acid 30 is of great help in uterine displacement with or without discharge (Deschere). 

Cooper regards it specific in influenza in 3x potency for attack and 30 potency for resulting debility.

Particulars

Headache :
Location: There is dull and heavy frontal headache.

Sensation: During headache, the patient feels that there is a rubber band stretched tightly over the forehead from temple to temple (Anac., Sulphur).

Character: The headache is dull and heavy.

Concomitants: Along with the headache, the patient is very much prostrated, weak and debilitated.

Gastro-intestinal tract :

Mouth : Ulcerated putrid mouth is often found in Carbolic acid patients. THE BREATH IS VERY OFFENSIVE with bad taste in mouth, due to constipation.

Vomiting : Of drunkards or in pregnancy, in sea sickness or in cancerous condition of stomach.The character of the vomitus is dark or olive-green and very offensive.

Dysentery : The stool contains fluid mucus, like the scraping of intestinal mucosa. There will also be great tenesmus. The stool is very thin, involuntary; black and offensive.

Constipation : Along with the general character of constipation, in Carbolic acid, THERE IS HORRIBLY OFFENSIVE BREATH during constipation.

Leucorrhoea : is very copious, acrid, offensive and greenish.

Urine : Very dark, black or blackish olive-green.

Ulcers : There is great tendency to ulceration anywhere and everywhere, such as in skin, mouth,Nose, nostrils, throat, rectum, vagina, etc. From the ulcer, putrid and a very offensive discharge comes out continuously.
Burns lead to ulceration with ichorous discharge. There may be malignant scarlatina and variola. Various abscesses appear on different parts of the body consequent upon physical exertion, even by much
walking, but generally on the right ear. The ulcers are very painful. The pain comes suddenly, lasts  FORa short time and disappears suddenly. Carbolic acid is also an excellent remedy for lacerated wounds
with blunt instruments. Bones may be bare or crushed with niuch sloughing of soft parts. The patient craves both whisky (Syph.). and tobacco (Staphisagria).

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From cold in general.

Relations :

Compare: In burns with Arsenic and Kreosote, In ulcers with unhealthy offensive discharge with Merc. Sol., and Sulphur. Carbolic. acid is antidoted by dilute cider vinegar either externally or internally, when acid has been swallowed accidentally or taken for suicidal purposes.
Dr. R.K. Ghosh finds it admirable in cases of Cholera where Veratrum album seems indicated but fails (Clarke).

Cholelithiasis. Hepatitis.

PHYSIOLOGICAL ACTION
It has at least three special centres of action through the nervous system.
1) Liver—It acts upon the liver and portal system giving rise to jaundice and bilious disturbances.
2) Bowels—Here it acts as a laxative producing a catarrhal discharge.
3) Kidneys—lIt produces diuresis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

7) Complaints such as dropsy, haemoptysis, spleen affec-tions, influenza etc. when associated with liver derange-ment.
8) Modalities : Agg.—Lying on “left side, beer, eating, motion, pressure, from stooping.

chapter 72:CHAMOMILLA

Matricaria Charmomilla HAHNEMANN Compositae

INTRODUCTION

Chamomilla is an annual wind plant growing wild in cultivated fields amongst wheat and paddy. But finally it serves the purpose of an excellent remedy for all ailments BROUGHT ON OR AGGRAVATED BY ANGER. Just as the weed grows in a paddy field causing untold miseries, anger and pain to the farmers and grows at the cost of a useful product so also the patient displays similar manifestations and
develops uncivilised habits. But when the whole plant is crushed, mother tincture is prepared and subsequent potencies are succussed, it becomes a wonderful remedy capable of annihilating many diseases, especially of children, when given on the basis of symptom. similarity. It is an “ANGER AND PAIN REMEDY” which causes TURMOIL IN
TEMPERAMENT.

Acidity, Anger, Asthma, Abdominal affection, Breast affection, Colic, Convulsion, Cough, Dentition, Diarrhoea, Eye affections, Eructation, Fevers, Headache, Labour,” Menstrual disorders, Miscarriage, Mumps, Neuralgia, Pregnancy disorders, Rheumatism,
Toothache, Ulcers, Uterine affection. Whooping cough,-etc.

It acts on brain, nerves! mind, stomach and intestine.

Acting primarily on the nervous system, Chamomilla produces irritability of mind and even spasm and convulsion inflammation of the mucous membrane of the stomach and intestine setting in diarrhoea, dysentery etc.

It is another medicine which establishes the doctrine of signature i.e. the yellow colouration of its juice corresponds to the yellowishness of skin, conjunctiva, etc. in jaundice. The author has used this medicine with great success in physiological doses in thousands of cases of liver disorders resulting in Jaundice, Indigestion, Flatulence,
Constipation, Cholecystitis, Cholelithiasis, etc. In complaints resulting from taking adulterated foodstuff.

are also not beyond the reach of this medicine. IT IS A RIGHT SIDED DRUG.

PATHOGENESIS

On liver, it produces congestion, inflammation and sometimes degeneration. As 2 result of this there is enlargement of the organ with final consequential shrinkage and cirrhosis. Right lung, when affected, producees symptoms of pneumonia with jaundiced
skin and mucous membrane.

CONSTITUTION

chapter 75 CICUTA VIROSA

Water Hemlock HAHNEMANN Umbelliferae I

INTRODUCTION

Cicuta virosa can be nick-named as ‘CONVULSION’. It is very valuable remedy for violent convulsion from any cause with loss of consciousness. This drug has been derived from vegetable kingdom. The whole plant is very poisonous and is fatal to animals. The mother tincture is prepared from fresh root of the plant. When the poisonous property is transformed into dynamic power after potentisation, it serves as an excellent remedy for various nervous disorders manifested in the form of epilepsy, chorea,spasm, hysteria, convulsion, etc.

CLINICAL

Convulsion, Epilepsy, Hysteria, Meningitis, Numbness, Paralysis, Skin affection, Tetanus, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

The cheif centres of action of this drug are cerebro-spinal nervous system, especially medula oblongata, gastro-intestinal tract and skin.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes irritation of the cerebro-spinal nervous system producing local and generalised spasm and paralysis, tetanus, epileptic, and epileptiform convulsions,trismus and tonic and clonic spasm in general.

CONSTITUTION

There is no particular constitution or look of the patient as such.

Temperament: Nervous temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. According to Clarke, the two grand key-note symptoms of Cicuta virosa are:

(a) Twitching and spasmodic jerks.

(b) Bending of the head backwards or opisthotonos.

2.  Whatever be the nervous manifestation, whether it gets the name of epilepsy, chorea, hysteria, or eclampsia, etc., from any cause such as epileptic, hysterical,         gastric, worms, suppressed eruption, etc., it matters little, the first drug which we
    can think of is Cicuta virosa, provided in most cases the ATTACK IS VERY VIOLENT (usually) accompanied by loss of consciousness and renewed by slightest touch, noise        odour, etc. and are relieved by rest and in a dark room 
3. During convulsive attack, there is FRIGHTFUL DISTORTION of the face, limbs oyof the whole body.

4, Puerperal convulsion with frequent suspension of breath.

5. In children during dentition or from worms, there is spasm or convulsion of clonicor tonic type.

6. Abnormal appetite and craving for indigestible things such as chalk, coal charcoal,etc. (Alumina, Cina, Nit. Acid, Cale. carb.).

7. Eczema with no itching. The exudation from eczema forms into a hard lemon-coloured crust.

8. Brain disease from suppressed eruption.

9. When reading, the letters seem to turn, go up and down or disappear completely.

10. Ailments from : Nervous irritation, worms, suppressed eruption, shock and injury.

PARTICULARS

Convulsion :
Cicuta virosa is especially suited to women who are subject to epileptic or choreic convulsion or spasm of children during dentition period or from worms. During convulsion, the attack is VIOLENT. There is very FRIGHTFUL DISTORTION of face, limbs or of the whole body. The patient loses consciousness. Opisthotonos is a general feature (Natrum sulph..
Veratrurh vir.). The epileptic attack is renewed from SLIGHTEST TOUCH, NOISE OR JAR AND MOTION.Epilepsy is associated with swelling of stomach as from violent spasm of diaphragm. The patient
screams. The face may be red or bluish. Consciousness is lost, jaws are locked with distortion of limbs and face, BEYOND RECOGNITON. The attack is frequently at night; recurring first at short intervals and
then at long intervals. ,Guermsey says, “think of this remedy for convulsion which are excessively violent— whether epileptic, cataleptic clonic or tonic eclampsia.” According to Nash, .it it another remedy characterised by its . excessively VIOLENT convulsions. The body is drawn into all sorts of odd shapes and violent contortions, but one of the most invariable
symptoms is bending of head, neck and spine backwards (opisthotonos). It is on this account that it was tried for cerebro-spinal meningitis. Nash also thinks that it is as near a specific for this disease as there
can be.Kent says, that this remedy is of most extreme interest because of its convulsive tendency. It puts the whole nervous system into such a state of increased irritability that pressure on a part causes convulsion. The convulsion extends from centre to periphery. The convulsion spreads from above
downwards and in this it is the opposite of Cuprum. Between the interim period of convulsions the patient is mild, gentle, placid and yielding, (rev. of Nux yomica. In Nux yomica, between the convulsions too the patient is very irritable.) During puerperium, the lady gets convulsions with frequent suspension of breathing for a few
moments seems as if dead. The upper part of the body is mostly affected.The child gets spasm and convulsion during dentition or from worms. The baby grinds his teeth and orgums, compresses the jaws as in lock-jaw. Renewed by slightest touch, noise and light.Brain disease from suppressed eruption is also wonderfully cured by this remedy.The troubles are aggravated from slightest touch, noise, jar and motion and tobacco smoke, and
relieved by rest and in a dark room.

Cicuta virosa is a marvellous remedy for skin affections of a peculiar character as follows:-

Eczema with NO ITCHING. There is exudation from the eczema which forms into a hard, lemon-coloured crust.

The pustules run together and form a thick yellow scab, especially on head and face and other parts of the body, sycosis menti (Mandibular region).

For Barber’s itch or troubles after shaving, Cicuta virosa is an excellent remedy.

indicated (Hyper.).

Aggravation: From tobacco smoke (Ign.) touch, odour, jar, motion and noise.

Amelioration: By rest and in a dark room.

Relation :

chapter:77 CINCHONA OFFICINALIS (CHINA)
Peruvian Bark HAHNEMANN Rubiaceae China

INTRODUCTION

When we think about Cinchona, we are unknowingly taken to 1790 in the study room of Hahnemann because it was Cinchona bark which revealed to him the unique system of treatment, “Homoeopathy”. After passing the M.D., the then highest examination in Allopathy and practising it for about 10 years, Hahnemann became completely disappointed and disgusted with the crude, inhuman,torturing, troublesome and harmful system of allopathic treatment. He was master of many languages. Therefore, he decided to earn his livelihood by the most innocent, yet useful profession of translating various books into different languages. While doing so, he came across the fact that Cinchona bark has the power of producing malaria-like symptoms in healthy human beings, and this led him to conclude that if it has got the power to produce malaria-like symptoms in the healthy human beings, theri it is also capable of curing the natural disease manifesting symptoms similar to that of malaria in people naturally sick. With this idea in view, he himself took a little quantity of the juice expressed from the Cinchona bark and he was soon sick with symptoms similar to malaria. He tried the experiment on his family members and friends with the same results. This was the beginning of the historic invention of “HOMOEOPATHY”. THUS
CINCHONA TO HAHNEMANN WAS, WHAT FALLING APPLE WAS TO Newton.Following this pleasant experience and new idea, Hahnemann proved and established many remedies on the basis of “SIMILIA SIMILIBUS CURANTUR”. He also treated with great success many diseases t with the remedies he proved arid established,of which the first and foremost was Cinchona.

CLINICAL

Anaemia, Abdominal disorders, Bilious attack, Catarrhal affection, Constipation, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Dyspepsia, Deafness, Gall-stone colic, Haemorrhage, Headache, Intermittent fever, Jaundice, Labour, Liver complaints, Pain, Menstrual troubles, Rheumatism, Respiratory troubles, Spleen affection, Vertigo, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

China predominantly acts on blood, cardiovascular system, gastro-intestinal tract, liver, spleen, respiratory organs, nervous system, brain and mind.
PATHOGENESIS

It acts upon the nervous system, producing a condition of qeneral depression and exhaustion and it inhibits enzyme action, thus retarding tissue metabolism. It also destroys the oxygenating power of the blood; alters the quantity and quality of blood; initiates haemorrhage; affects the vegetative system involving liver and spleen, producin congestion, hyperaemia and jaundice. Above all, it has got the power to produce fever of varying types, especially intermittent type.

CONSTITUTION

To put in one word the constitution of China is “PUMPED OUT” (according to Dr. P.C. Paul of Calcutta) or “BROKEN DOWN’ constitution from exhausting discharges and loss of vital fluids and abuse of quinine.
Make-up of the body: Once robust, strong and healthy stout, swarthy person who has become weak, debilitated and exhausted by loss of vital fluids such as haemorrhage, diarrhoea, suppuration, lactation, etc.

Termparament: Nervous temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Haemorrhagic diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Great tendency to PERIODICITY is well-marked throughout the remedy.

2. Profound debility from exhausting discharges and loss of vital fluids and haemorrhage, etc. Great debility, trembling, “ aversion to exercise and very sensitive to touch to pain, to draught of air.

3. Excessiue irritability and sensitiveness of the whole nervous system is one of the prominent features of China.

4. Dropsy, either generalised or localised, from anaemia, loss of vital, fluid or haemorrhage is one of the criteria for China.

5. Pains are aggravated by slightest touch, but are RELIEVED BY HARD PRESSURE.Shaking chill all over the body is well-marked.

6. Debilitating sweat with noctural diarrhoeas is a peculiar characteristic of China.

7. Disposition to haemorrhage from every orifice of the body.

8. Painless nocturnal diarrhoea is found only in China.
