PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: Headache caused as a result of HAEMORRHAGE, SEXUAL EXCESS OR LOSS OF VITAL FLUID and sleeplessness or suppressed coryza.

Location: Headache from occiput over the whole head.

Sensation: Sensation as if the skull would burst. Sensation as if the brain were balancing to and from and is striking against skull, causing great pain.

Character of pain: Confusion and dullness of the head as if intoxicated. Intense throbbing of head and carotids. Head is inclined to draw backwards.

Modality: Headache is worse in open air, on stepping and better in warm room. Headache becomes worse by slight touch, contact and mental Exertion, but relieved by hard pressure. Headache is aggravated
          on sitting or by lying down; must stand or walk.
 
Concomitants: Vertigo on waking at night. Nausea and vomiting of sour food, bile and mucus.

Gastro intestinal tract :


Mouth : Toothache while the baby sucks the breast. Throbbing toothache, aggravated by slightest touch, but REELIEVED BY PRESSING THE TEETH FIRMLY AGAINST EACH OTHER and by hot application. Tongue coated white or yellow; tongue dirty; dryness of mouth with profuse saliva day and night; every thing tastes sour or bitter.

Stomach and abdomen : There is no desire for eating or drinking, although there is appetite. Vomiting of undigested food, of sour mttcus, bile or blood. TYMPANITIC ABDOMEN, with excessive

flatulence and belching which gives no relief and consequently great distension of entire abdomen and borborygmus. Sensation as if the abdomen is full of gas; to get relief from which the patient tries to belch, but on

eructation, there is no tangible relief. Each food particle seems vo have turned into gas (lod., Kali carb.).Worse from eating fruits, fish, wine, etc. Abdomen feels sore and tender; Aggravation by slight

touch, and RELIEVED BY HARD PRESSURE AND DOUBLING UP. There is canine hunger without any special desire to eat Haematemesis with great loss of blood. Gastralgia with acidity, bloating and sour

eructation. After eating, the abdomen feels full and tight There is agonising pain in the abdomen with pinching coll. COMPELLING THE PATIENT TO BEND DOUBLE, OBVIOUSLY TO GET RELIEF

(Colocynth). Pain in right hypochondrium, FROM GALL-STONE. Spleen and liver are enlarged and swollen, with jaundice. Liver is painful to touch, but relieved by hard pressure.

Diarrhoea : China is suited to both acute and chronic diarrhoea. The prolonged, long standing chronic diarrhoea causes the patient to be BROKEN DOWN AND PUMPED OUT, debilitated and non-
             recognisable. Diarrhoea persists only at night.

Causation: By taking fruits.

Character of stool: Loose, brownish, painless, with fermentation, belching and borborygmus in bowels with passage of excessively offensive flatus; with undigested food particles; sometimes
                    cadaverous smelling.

Modality: Aggravated at night with marked periodicity. Belching gives no relief.

Concomitants: With diarrhoea there is profound debility. In chronic cases, there is history of gradual onset, stool more and more watery, pale and pinkish with rapid emaciation of the body.

Liver : China is one of the best remedies in chronic liver troubles. There is pain in the right hypochondrium and often the liver may be left below the ribs, enlarged, hard and sensitive to touch, the
        skin is yellow, urine dark coloured, stool light, lacking the colour due to improper secretion of bile.

Anaemia : The quantity and quality of the blood are alterec becomes thin, watery; circulation lacks energy and general debility, anaemic conditions are set in.China is very useful in anaemia or debility that follows the LOSS OF VITAL FLUID. HAEMORRHAGE, PROLONGED and EXCESSIVE LACTATION DIARRHOEA, SUPPURATION OR SEXUAL excess. The face presents a pale, hippocratic expression; eyes are sunken and surrounded by
          dark rings, with ringing and, buzzing sound in ears and desire for sour things.

Neuralgia :Neuralgia pains are relieved by China when the pains are drawing and tearing in character. The part feels as though sprained or sore. At the slightest touch, the pain returns and increases to a great
           severity, and is relieved by hard pressure.

Rheumatic pains also show similar character.

Haemorrhage :

From every orifice of, the body, such as mouth, nose, bowels or rectum, long coulinued haemorrhage occurs with desire for sour things and ringing and buzzing sound on the ears.

Menses :

Time: First menses too early.

Quantity: Profuse with pain.

Duration: Too long lasting.

Character of blood: Dark clotted blood.

Modality: Parts very sensitive to slight touch, but relieved by hard pressure.

Concomitants: Purulent leucorrhoea in place of menses. Ovaritis from sexual excess. Anaemia may also be present. Insomnia after haemorrhage. Vertigo and menstrual colic are present. Along with this,
              there may also be ringing in ears.

Intermittent fever : Various Kinds of intermittent fevers are manifested by China. It may be of the tertian, or double tertian, quotidian type, or the paroxysms may return every seventh or fourteenth day. PERIODICITY is
                     well-marked in the fevers but it is never at night. Moreover, the fever is of anticipating type; anticipates several hours each succeeding chill. The various stages of fever are well-marked, i.e. chill, heatand sweat stages.

1. Chill: Chill is preceded by palpitation, anxiety and hunger and sometimes headache too. Chill comes generally in the forenoon, but anticipating type. Chill over the body, increased by
         drinking water. Chill of short duration. There is thirst before and after but not during the chill stage. The patient wants to be near the stove, but it increases the chill. Chill returns every week.

2. Heat: Long lasting heat which frequently sets in late after chill. The patient wants to uncover during heat stage. The heat stage may be thirstless or with thirst. Even if there is great thrist,
         the patient wants water only to wet the mouth. The face is fiery red during the heat stage. There is headache and often delirium if the heat is too seyere.

3. Sweat: Sweat stage comes immediately after heat. There is profuse debilitating sweat. There is great thirst during sweat. The sweat does not give any relief to the patient. Perspiration may
          be noticed in sleep too. Apyrexia is marked with debility, restlessness, loss of appetite or great hunger; anaemia, congestion,
           backache, oedema, scanty urine, soreness in the liver and spleen.

Respiratory organs :

Hoarseness of voice; suffocation and suffocative catarrh; influenza with debility. There is rattling in the chest with violent, hacking cough after every meal. Haemoptysis may be present. Oedema of glottis

and dyspnoea may be of regular and frequent occurrence. Cough is a constant factor, which is excited by talking and laughing. After coughing there may be expectoration of clearer blood stained mucous or

sputum, with oppression of chest and stitching pain in the chest.There may also be palpitation and congestion of chest with cold hands and intermittent weak pulse.

One hand icy cold and the other warm. Skin is extremely sensitive to touch, but relieved by hard  pressure. Coldness of the skin with debilitating sweat.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From slightest touch, draugh to air every other day, loss of:vital fluids, at night,after eating and bending over.

Amelioration: By bending double hard pressure, open air and warmth.

Relations :

Complementary to: Ferrum met.

Antidotes : Hepar sulph., Nux vom.

Antidoted by: Nat, mur. and Carbo veg.

Antidote to: Ars, Calc., Cham., Ferr., Hell., fod., Merc., Sulph. and Ver, alb.

Remedies of same family: Coffea, Ipeacac. Incompatible: After Dig., Selen.


chapter 78 CLEMATIS EREGTA

Virgin's Bower Ranunculaceae

INTRODUCTION

Clematis, like other Ranunculi, is a direct irritant of the skin producing inflammation and vesication. It was used by Stoerck before Hahnemann’s time in cancerous and other foul ulcers, inveterate skin eruptions, syphilis and
          rheumatism.

CLINICAL

Eye affection, Gonorrhoea, Headache. Glandular affection. Rheumatism. Stricture of urethra. Skin affection. Toothache.

SPHERE OF ACTION

It acts on skin, glands, genito-urinary organs, especially testicles, and mucous membrane.

PATHOGENESIS

It is a direct irritant of the skin producing inflammation and vesication. It inflames and infiltrates tis-sues and so causes swelling and induration of glands.

CONSTITUTION

It acts best on light-haired people; torpid, cachectic conditions.

All the three miasms—Psoric, sycotic and syphylitic are in the back ground. Chiefly Sycotic.
GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1) Painful swelling and induration of the glands.

2) Gonorrhoeal orchitis, the testicle is painful indurated and hard as a stone with pain along the spermatic cord, especially right side,

3) Toothache relieved by holding cold water in the mouth.

4) Interrupted flow of urine with burning sensation during micturition.

5) Aggravation of all skin symptoms by the heat of bed and-, from washing.

6) Nearly all symptoms aggravate at night.

7) Aggravation during increasing moon, amelioration dur-ing waning moon.

8) Ailments from : Suppressed gonorrhoea.



PARTICULARS

Headache :

Boring pain in temples with confusion and heaviness of the head which aggravates while bending head backward and amelioration in open air.

Toothache

Toothache from tobacco. Teeth feel too long (Mezerium.) Worse at night and better by holding cold water in the mouth and drawing cold air in. (rev. of Staphy.)

Urinary symptoms

The remedy is very useful for urinary troubles. There is frequent, scanty dribbling urination with burning and sense of constriction in urethra. Patient has to wait a long time before he can Urinate. The
flow is slow or interrupted. Pain worse at night.

Skin

It is one of the very good eruptive medecines. It produces vesicular eruptions which resembles Rhus. (Anac., Grot. Tig., Fago, Rhus Yen., Xerophyllum.) Vesicles filled with yellow fluid with induration under
the vesicles. Eruptions that come out upon the occiput, face and hands which look red, moist with burning and itches intensely. Eruptions red and moist during the increasing moon, pale and dry during the
decreasing moon. Patient has aversion to be washed. Aggravation while washing in cold water, in warmth of bed, at night. Amelioration in open air, from scratching, from sweating.

Relationship

Autidotes : Bry., Camph.


chapter 79 COCA

Erythroxylon Coca CLOTAR MULLER Linae

INTRODUCTION

Coca is used by the natives of South America as we use coffee, tea and tobacco. So it is like tea and coffee in arresting tissue changes and enabling those who take it to undergo unusual fatigues. It contains an
alkaloid called cocaine.

CLINICAL

Angina Pectoris. Asthma. Cough. Debility. Dyspnoea. Carries of teeth. Insomnia. Mountain sickness. Nervous exhaustion.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) The mountaineers’ remedy—Useful in complaints incidental to mountain climbing such as palpitation, dyspnoea, anxiety & insomnia.

2) Suited to persons wearing out under the physical and mental strain of a busy life, and who suffer from exhausted nerves & brain (Fl.Acid., Kali Phos., Nux Vom.)

3) Shortness of breath in old people and in those who use tobacco and whisky in excess.

4) Want of breath in those engaged in athletic sports.

5) Longing for alcoholic liquors and tobacco for the accustomed stimulants.

6) Violent palpitation : From incarcerated flatus (Arg.N., Nux V.) from over exertion, from heart strain (Arn., Bor., Caust.)

7) Sleepy but can find no rest anywhere.

8) Mind : Coca patients are extremely bashful & timid. They are always ill at ease in society. Melancholic from nervous exhaustion. They are sad, irritable & delights in solitude and obscurity. They lose all sense of right and wrong.

9) Ailments : Bad effects : From mountain climbing or ballooning (Ars.) Bad effects of stimulants, alcohol, tobacco.

General Modalities :

Aggravation : From Ascending, in high attitudes. Amelioration—From wine, from riding in open
air.

chapter 80 COCCULUS

Cocculus Indicus HAHNEMANN Menispermaceae Indian Cockle

INTRODUCTION

For this poisonous vegetable plant Hahnemann says, “This vegetable substance, used hitherto only for destroying some noxious agents and for stupefying fishes so that they may be caught by hand, was first employed by myself as a medicine”. It is the picrotoxin alkaloid content of Cocculus which possesses the toxic
effect when given in crude, form and serves the therapeutic purpose when administered in dynamic doses.

CLINICAL

Brain affection, Cholera, Colic, Convulsion, Fevers, Headache, Leucorrhoea, Memory weak, Menstrual troubles, Mental excitement, Paralysis, Rheumatism, Sea-sickness, Sleep affection, from loss of sleep, Somnolence,
Vertigo Vomiting etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It chiefly affects the cerebro-spinal system, voluntary muscular system and
sensorium.

PATHOGENESIS

Acting on the cerebro-spinal system, it produces great debility. It causes paralytic weakness of the spine and especially of its motor nerves resulting in weakness of the legs. Knees give out when walking. Soles of feet feel as if asleep. Convulsions, both clonic and tonic are a special characteristic of its action. It produces vomiting of cerebral origin rather than gastric.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Especially suited for women and children with light hair and eyes, who suffer severely Curing menstruation and pregnancy, unmarried and childless women. Also adopted to book-worms, sensitive romantic girls with irregular
menstruation, onanist and persons debilitated by sexual excesses.

Temperament: Mind and sluggish temperament, nervous persons. Relation with heat and cold: As a whole there is aggravation from sun.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.



GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Vertigo, nausea and vomiting from riding in carriage, boat or railroad car, or euen looking at a boat in motion; sea-sickness and car-sickness are the grand keynotes of Cocculus.

2. Great lassitude of the whole body: it requires exertion to stand firmly, feels too weak to talk loudly (Stan met.).

3. Sensation of weakness or hollowness in various organs e.g. head, chest, abdomen, etc,

4, Time Passes too quickly (rev. of Arg. nit., Alumina, Med.).

5. Trembling of the arms and legs, usually from excitement.

6. Many symptoms aggravate during menstrual period, such as piles. During menses debility, nervousness and anger etc.

7. Leucorrhoea in place of menses (Nux mos.).

8. When fever assumes a slow, “sneaking” nervous form with vertigo and disposition to anger, Cocculus may be thought of.

9. Aggravation from motion generally; even least jar is unbearable.

10. Mind : Times passes too quickly. The patient cannot realise that a whole night has passed. A week has gone, but it seems a moment. Cannot bear contradiction; easily offended, every trifle matter makes him angry. There is slowness of comprehension. Cannot find the right word to express his thoughts, so slowly does his mind work. What has passed, he.cannot remember.
Forgets what he has just read. Great lassitude of the whole mind. Feels too weak. All the mental symptoms are due to grief, anxiety, vexation, prolonged LOSS OF
SLEEP.

11. Ailments from loss of sleep, night watching, anger, grief, vexation and mental excitement.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

The patient has very severe sick headache.

Causation: Headache is caused due to loss of sleep, mental excitement, grief, anxiety or vexation.

Time: At each menstrual period.

Location: Headache starts at the nape of neck and occiput extending to spine.

Sensation: Sense of emptiness in head: opening and shutting sensation, especially in occiput.

Character of pain : As if tightly bound by a cord. There is pressing throbbing type of pain.

Modalities : Aggravation by lying on back and from carriage riding.


Cocculus 225



Vertigo : Sensation as if intoxicated pain in eyes, from rising in bed or by motion of the carriage, especially when rising or sitting up.

Abdomen : Sensation in abdomen of cutting and rubbing, on every movement, as of a sharp stone, hollowness. Crampy pain in stomach during and after meal. Loss of appetite with metallic taste in mouth. There is NAUSEA AND VOMITING FROM RIDING IN, CARRIAGE, BOAT, RAIL ROAD AND CAR OR even looking at a boat on motion.

Female gential organs :

Menses : Coculus is an excellent remedy for dysmenorrhoea.

Time: Too early.

Character of blood : Dark and clotted blood.

Character of pain: During the flow, there is spasmodic colic, pressing pain in uterine region, followed by haemorrhoids.

During menstruation, the patient is so weak that she is scarcely abje to stand from weakness of lower limbs.

Concomitant: Piles during menses.

Leucorrhoea : In place of menses or between periods. Copious discharge like the washing of meat, serous, ichorous and bloody.

Paralysis : Of face, muscles, limbs. For paralysis of the muscles any where, Cocculus is an excellent remely.

There is trembling of arms and legs from excitement. Pain in the limbs, lower limbs very weak; very much painful; painful when flexed.

Worse after sleep.

General Modalities :

Aggravation : From eating, drinking, sleeping, smoking, talking, CARRIAGE RIDING, motions, rising up, during menstrual period.

Relation :

Antidotes : Coffea, Nux vomica, Cup., Cham.

CHAPTER:81COFFEA URUUA

pe
Coffee HAHNEMANN Rubiaceae 


INTRODUCTION |

The effects of Coffea cruda have to be considered separately from those of Coffea tosta, since the roasting converts much of the Caffeine into Coffeone or Methylamine, which gives to
Coffee its aroma. But the effects are scarcely distinguishable, and I have not attempted to keep them strictly apart. Coffea Cruda is one of the Nash’s trio of pain remedies, others being
Aconite Nap & Chamomilla.

CLINICAL

Abdominal colic. Crural Neuralgia. Headache. Hyperaesthesia. Hysteria. Heart-affection of Joy-ill effects of. Migrain. Neuralgia. Sciatica. Sleeplessness. Toothache.

PHYSIOLOGICAL ACTION
It has seven special centres of action through the cerebrospinal nervous system.

1) Cerebrum : Here it stimulates the mentality and produces obstinate insomnia.

2) Cord, posterior columns : It paralyzes the sensory nerve filaments.

3) Circulation : It stimulates the vasomotor nerves and increases blood pressure.

4) Kidneys : Here it increases the arterial blood pressure, produces diuresis and
   diminishes the urea.
5) Sexual organs : Producing great excitement of these organs which is followed by paresis.

6) Digestive organs : It first stimulates the digestive organs and then prostrates them.

7) Vagi: It very powerfully stimulates the respiratory centre.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make up : It is suited to tall, lean, stooping persons with dark complexion.

Temperament: Sanguine choleric temperament.

Relation with heat » cold—Chilly patient.

Miasm : Psora.



Coffea Griff 227

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Oversensitiveness of all the senses ; sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch etc. become more acute.

2) Unusual activity of mind and body.

3) Pain : Great sensitiveness to pain, seem almost insupportable, driving patient to despair, tossing about in anguish (In Aconite, Chamomilla and Nux Vomica there is also irritability of high degree. But the difference is that Aconite is fearful

          and anxious, dreads things ; Chamo. is spiteful & uncivil, Nux Vomica is sullen, keeps the eyes shut, does not wish to speak or have anything to do with anyone ; and Coffea on the other hand is wakeful, on the constant move.)

4) Sleeplessness with physical excitement through mental exaltation.

5) Hasty eating & drinking (Bell., Hep.)

6) Headache from over — mental exertion, thinking & talking, worse in open air.

7) Toothache relieved by holding ice water in the mouth but returns when water becomes warm (Bis., Bry., Puls.; Cham.)

8) Mind : Mental symptoms of coffea are very peculiar & characteristic. Coffea is characterised by extreme sensitiveness, nervous agitation and restlessness. Great and unusual activity of the mind and body is an important point with Coffea
          cruda. The mind is full of ideas & is active with plans & fancies. There is oversensitiveness of all the senses such as sight, hearing, taste, touch, smell etc.and are equally acute. Due to all this mental exaltation patient becomes sleepless ; there is wide awake condition with impossibility to close the eyes. He feels pains
          intensely, it seems almost insupportable and drives him to despair. He, tosses about in agony. He is a great subject to ailments arising from sudden emotion and pleasurable surprise. He weBps from delight. Weeping alternates with laughing. He
          is hasty especially in eating and drinking.

9) Ailments from : Effects of sudden emotion, especially pleasurable ones, fear or fright, wine, overfatigue and long journeys, overmental exertion, thinking, talking.

PARTICULARS

Headache:

Causation : Overmental exertion, talking, thinking, effects of sudden emotion especially pleasurable Ones,

Location : One sided headache.

Sensation : There is sensation as from a nail driven into the brain ; as if brain were torn or dashed to Pieces ; as if head was too small, as if head would burst and fly to pieces if she moved.

Modality : Agg.—Mental exertion, thinking, open air.

Ame.—By warmth.




Toothache : Intermittent, jerking toothache temporarily relieved by holding ice water in the mouth but returns when water becomes warm. The pain is excessive and causes weeping, trembling, nausea & tossing
about. Coffea toothache can be compared with the following drugs.

Bismuth : Pressure in the region of malar bones relieved by running about and holding cold water in mouth but aggravated when water becomes warm ; the patient is ill humor, morose and discontented

but still solitude is unbearable.

Bryonia : Toothache relieved by cold water worse by taking anything warm in mouth. Pain shoots from one tooth to another, also in head and cheeks. Toothache momentarily relieved by lying on painful
side. Great thirst, constipated bowels and mental irritability, coated tongue are concomitant symptoms present with toothache.

Chamomilla : Toothache if anything warm is taken into mouth, on entering warm room, in bed, from coffee, during menses and pregnancy. There is irritable and whining mood during the pain.

Pulsatilla : Stitching digging pain worse in evening or early night. Toothache worse in warm room, warm bed, when eating but not from chewing from anything warm in mouth ; better from walking about

& ceases entirely in open air. Toothache with chilliness of body & no thirst.

Neuralgia : The neuralgia of the face is a common feature of old coffee drinkers. Coffea is a very good remedy for neuralgia when the pains are unbearable, driving patient to despair. Patient feels
perfectly discouraged and tosses in agony. He cries & throws about himself. There is fear of fresh air and of the least noise. Crural neuralgia worse by motion, afternoon & night, better by pressure.

Modality : Agg. : In open air, touch Ame. : By warmth.

Heart symptoms : Violent irregular palpitation of heart with trembling of limbs. Nervous palpitation after excessive joy, surprise. Rapid high tension pulse and urinary suppression.

General Modalities :

Aggravation : Excessive emotion (joy), narcotics, strong odors, noise, open air, cold night.

Amelioration : Warmth, from lying down, holding ice in mouth,

Relation : Compare ; Aco., Cham., Ign., Sulph. Incompatible : Canth., Caust., Coc., Ign.


CHAPTER : 82 COLCHICUM AUTUMNALE


Meadow Saffron STAPF Liliaceae


INTRODUCTION

It is a plant found in Europe. The fresh bulb is taken for preparation of mother tincture. It has received the name Colchicum autumnale because it blooms during autumn and usually the symptoms
are also aggravated during autumn. So it is a useful remedy for the autumnal dysentery. It is also an indispensable remedy for gout and _ rheumatism. Dr. Hughes says that this medicine has a
diuretic action and it increases elimination of uric acid of by the kidneys. Gout is a metabolic disease pertaining to defects in purine metabolism. It explains its usefulness
in cases of gout. The Allopathic school has used and abused this drug for any gouty condition, says Tyler.

CLINICAL

Cholera, Cough, Colic, Cramp, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Dysentery, Gout, Castro-intestinal disorders, Fever, Nausea, Rheumatism, Smell-intolerance of Vomiting, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Colchicum acts on disgestive tract, heart, pericardium, kidneys and joints.

PATHOGENESIS

This agent irritates the digestive organs and produces nausea, vomiting and loss of appetite, colic, diarrhoea and painful cramps. It also produces inflammation of intestine,
leading to sloughing which ultimately passes out of scrapping of intestine in stool with blood and mucous. It also produces inflammation of joints with sensitiveness to touch.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Robust persons of vigorous constitution and diseases of old people. Leucophlegmatic constitutions.

Temperament: Irritable and melancnolic temperament. Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Rheumatic and Gouty diathesis.



230 Text Book of MATERIA MEDICA


GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Nausea, VOMITING and FAINTNESS AT THE SMELL OF COOKING FOOD (Arsenic cannot bear the smell or sight of food; Sepia too has nausea from smell or sight of food. But in Colchicum, it is PAINFULLY ACUTE, especally the smell of cooking eggs, fish and meat.).

2. Abdomen is immensely distended with gas; feels as it would burst.

3. Dysentery usually in autumn; stool contains scraping of intestine with characteristic nausea; mucus and shreddy particles in large quantity pass out [Canth.,Arg. nit.].

4, Gout : The affected parts are very sensitive to touch and motion. Patient screams with pain when touching a joint or stubbing a toe.

5. Rheumatic pains are of drawing, tearing, pressing nature, shifts from one joint to another.

6. Colchicum Dysentery and Rheumatism are extremely painful.

7. Urine is dark coloured; inky urine.

8. Tingling in finger nails, is a characteristic of colchicum says T.F. Allen.oon

9. Aggravation from motion is marked as in Bryonia.

10. External impressions, such as light, noise, strong odours, contact, bad manners, etc. make him almost beside himself (Nux vom.), and his sufferings seem to be intolerable.

11. Ailments from grief and misdeeds of others; wetting; checked perspiration.

PARTICULARS

Gastro-intestinal System :

There is profuse secretion of saliva.

The smell of food causes nausea, even faintness and vomiting. There may be vomiting of mucus, bile and food. Buming or icy coldness in stomach with craving for various things.

Abdomen is enormously distended and feels as if it would burst. Dysentery, cholera, gastralgia, flatulence or autumna dysentery, etc. are successfully treated by Colchicum.

Dysentery : Causation; Autumn, getting wet, checked perspiration and night.

Character of stool: Very offensive stool and offensive flatus. Frequent stool, profuse and abundant in quantity. Yellowish stool, with whitish mucous and blood. Stoo! contains scrapings of intestine.
Stool sometimes passes with violent tenesmus. Constant ineffectual efforts to pass faeces (Nux vom.): Spasm of the sphincter during discharge of stool with shuddering over the back,

Modalities: Aggravation in autumn, mental exertion and amelioration by lying still.


Colchicum Autumnale 231

Urinary System :

Pain in the region of kidney. More the urging, more the discharge of urine. Urine is COPIOUS. WATERY DARK, TURBID AND INKY containing albumen and sugar. Tenesmus of bladder and burning in urethra.

Urine has sour smell and is acidic in reaction. Scanty urine with offensive smell may also be found. Decomposed blood may sometimes pass with the urine. Urethra hurts as if it is raw.


Gout or Rheumatism :

Causation: Getting wet, heat of summer, checked prespiration and exertion.

Location: Rheumatic pain of the clavicle, neck, shoulders, arms and back, preventing motion of head. Pain in the elbow joint, forearm, waist and ligaments of finger joints and of the great toes.

Pain with lameness in the arms which makes it impossible for the patient to hold the lightest thing.

Character of pain: Flying pain in the hips. Tearing pain in thighs and knee joints, with swelling in patella, tibia, calf muscles, ankles and toes. Tingling pain in toes. Patient screams with pain when

touched. The striking feature is that the pain has tendency to move about froni one joint to another: from one side to the other, from below upwards or from above downwards; with or without swelling.

Concomitants: Nausea, faintness at the smell of cooking food. Passes inky urine or pale urine. Great distension of abdomen. Sensation as if the abdomen would burst with gas. Involvement of heart

and pericardium with dropsical condition of hands, feet and abdomen.

Modalities: Aggravation by motion, summer weather, autumn and touch. Better by rest and lying down.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From cold damp weather, smell of food, MOTION, during autumn, mental emotion or exhaustion and effects of hard study.

Amelioration: By warmth and lying down quietly.

Relation :

Compare: Bryonia in vomiting. If the patient lies perfectly stilt, the disposition to vomit is less urgent. Every motion renews it (Bry.).

Antidoted by: Bell., Camphor, Cocculus, Nux vom., Puls, Spigelia. It antidotes: Thuja.

CHAPTER: 83 COLLINSONIA CANADENSIS

Stone Root DR. BURT Labiatae

INTRODUCTION
Collinsonia Can. is an important haemor- rhoidal remedy of our materia medica. Most of the symptoms of collin. are due to portal congestion ajid pelvic congestion. Due to its congestive action it produces severe
constipation, piles, dysmenorrhoea, headache and even heart symptoms etc.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS |

1) Congestion especially of portal & pelvic region resulting in dysmenorrhoea and haemorrhoids.

2) Chronic, painful, bleeding piles with sensation as if sticks, sand or gravel had lodged in rectum. Vascular engorgement of rectum. Most obstinate constipation with protruding piles. There is congestion of pelvic viscera with piles in later
   months of pregnancy, haemorrhoidal dysentery with tenesmus.

3) Constipation : It is very admirable remedy for constipation and usually presents in association with the haemorrhoids, headache and flatulence. In Collinsonia constipation is generally due to congestive inertia of lower bowel. (Sulph. Sepia).
                  Stool is sluggish and hard with pain and great flatulence. Dr. Nash has permanently cured a case of obstinate constipation with Collinsonia in a patient who averaged only two stools a week for years and had taken any amount of cathartics without
                  any lasting relief.
 
4) Heart complaints associated with piles. Palpitation in patients subject to piles and indigestion. Heart’s action persistently rapid but weak. In Collinsonia after relief of heart complaints old piles reappear or suppressed menses return.

5) Pruritus in pregnancy with haemorrhoids, unable to lie down. The genitals are swollen and inflammed.

Géneral Modalities :

_Agg. : The slightest mental emotion or excitement aggravate the symptoms (Arg Nit.), from cold: Ame. : By heat.


CHAPTER:84 COLOCYNTHIS

Squirting Cucumber fe

INTRODUCTION

In traditional medicine, Colocynthis has been used as a purgative. But in Hemoeopathy, during proving, the range of action of this medicine made Hahnemann place it high among  the remedies for COLIC. Nash says, “No remedy produces more severe coHc than this one and no remedy works more promptly.”

Colic, Biliary colic, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Dysmenorrhoea, Headache, Menstrual, Neuralgia, Rheumatism, Sciatica, Vertigo, etc.

Jt acts on visceral organs, colon rectum and nerves such as abdominal plexus, trigeminal and sciatic nerves.

2. Neuralgic affection and rheumatic troubles. Dr. Hughes quotes Dr. Bahr as saying that Colocynth is useful in rheumatic colic and Plumbum in neuralgic colic.

8. Rheumatic pains affecting the joints are much aggravated by motion and better by rest and pressure.

Relations :

Antidotes to: Causticum.

Antidoted by: Camphor, Coffee, Caust., Staph., Chamomilla.

Complementary to: Merc. Sol.

Compatible: Staphysagria, Chamomilla.

In Colic: Compare with Chamomilla and Mag. Phos.

Condor Plant J.P. DINSMORE

CHAPTER :86 CONIUM MACULATUM

Poison Hemlock HAHNEMANN Umbelliferae

INTRODUCTION
This is yet another important spinal remedy especially affecting the motor nerves, known as the “Balm of Gilead”. Conium maculatum is the remedy for the diseases of people of climacteric age, especially of women, if the symptoms correspond. What Conium is to the glands and capillary system, Aconite is to the heart and arterial system. In many cases, Conium may be regarded as the “Aconite of chronic diseases.” The plant contains the active principle, conine, which is very poisonous. It is notorious as an ingredient of the State poison of ancient Greeks, Socrates was killed by Conium. This poisonous property, when potentised, proves to be an excellent remedy, particularly suited to old men, old maids and old bachelors and it was Hahnemann who first showed how the remedy could be utilised
safely as well as effectively.

CLINICAL

Bladder inflammation. Breast affection, Bronchitis, Cancer, Cataract, Chorea, Cough, Eye affection, Glandular affection, Injury, Jaundice, Liver affection, Menstrual disorders, Paralysis, Testicles, Tumours affection of, Ulcers, Vertigo, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

The seat of action of this remedy is centred on the nervous system, particularly motor nerves first and later on the sensory nerves as well; heart, cardiovascular system, glands and female genital organs.

PATHOGENESIS

It powerfully depresses motor nerves leading to paralysis of the muscles of the body as far as voluntary and reflex motions are concerned. It causes paralysis of the motor nerve filaments of the cerebrospinal system. The sensory nerves, spinal cord and brain are affected later on. It depresses the vagus ganglia, resulting in fall of blood pressure and quick pulse, but lowers the temperature. Its effect on glands causes induration and hypertrophy.

CONSTITUTION
Make-up of the body: It is mostly suited to old men and women, old bachelors, during and after climacteric age. Persons having debility and diseases caused by blow or fall. Scrofulous people with rigid muscular fibres and light hair, or persons of lively quick sanguine disposition with marked development of glandular system. Those who lead sedentary life and are easily exhausted and excited and catch cold very readily.

Temperament: Melancholic and irritable temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Easily affected by slightest exposure to cold air.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. The strongest characteristic of Conium maculatum is its peculiar VERTIGO, which is much aggravated by TURNING THE HEAD SIDEWISE or LOOKING AROUND OR TURNING IN BED.
2. Sweats day and night as soon as the patient sleeps or even when closing the eyes (China, Thuja, Cactus rev. of Sambucus). Very offensive sweat.
3. Swelling and induration of glands after contusion or bruise.
4. Cancerous and scrofulous persons with enlarged glands.
5. Intermittent flow of urine: great difficulty in passing urine; urine flows, stops and flows again; from prostatic and uterine affections, or paretic, conditions.
6. Breast sore, hard and painful, especially during the menstrual period.
7. Objects look red, rainbow coloured, double vision, weakness of sight, aversion to light without inflammation, but, with intense photophobia.
8. Desire for warmth especially of the sun, coffee, acid and salty food.
9. Aversion to open air, light, business, study, bread. Craving for salt, coffnd sour things. Desire for warmth of sun.
10. Cough when lying down, aggravated from slightest exposure to cold air.
11. Cold stool and flatulence is a unique characteristic of Coniummac. (Hot stool and flatulence, Sulphur).
12. Ascending type of paralysis reminds of Conium.
13. Mind : The patient is morose and ill humoured and easily angered. He is very much quarrelsome and scolds always even at silly things. The patient cannot and will not      bear contradiction; excitement of any kind causes mental depression.The patient has no inclination to business or to study; very much indifferent and indolent; does not     take interest in anything. Very forgetful; weak memory; is uanble to sustain and mental effort.Cannot bear to be alone; dread of being alone; yet avoids society       (Kali carb., Lyco.).
14. Ailments from : Blow or fall, contusion, sexual excess, sexual abstinence or SUPPRESSED SEXUAL DESIRE: suppressed menses, excitement or over work.


PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: Headache is caused by blow or fall, sexual excess, suppressed menses, excitement or over work, insufficient evacuation.

Location: Lancinating pain especially on the vertex and forehead, in temples; semi-lateral.

Sensation: Sensation as if there is much foreign substance in the head. Sensation as if the brain has gone to sleep.

Character of headache: Stupefying pains in the head; excessive sensibility of brain. Tearing and lancinating pain as if the head were beaten to pieces or the contents of skull would be pressed out. Stitching in head while coughing. Headache with numbness of the brain. Attack of tearing headache which compels the patient to lie down. Obstinate shooting pain in the sinciput; heaviness and squeezing sensation. Apoplexy with paralysis of old people.

Modalities:
 Aggravation: When walking in the open air; from contact, motion and after eating.

 Amelioration: When lying in a recumbent position or while stooping; by external pressure and on closing the eyes.

Concomitants: Nausea and vomiting of mucus. Apoplexy with paralysis of old people.

Vertigo : The strongest characteristic of this drug, from the Homoeopathic point of view, IS ITS PECULIAR VERTIGO which aggravated by TURNING THE HEAD SIDEWISE OR TURNING IN THE BED, especially of old people. Feels as if bed were floating. Vertigo after intoxication even after taking a very small quantity. There is whirling Vertigo on rising and sometimes causes a fall, especially in the morning. Eyes, eye troubles are caused by injury or blow and eye strain; or Using artificial lightly students; sexual excess or suppressed menses and sexual suppression.

Character of eye troubles: There is aversion to light without inflammation of eyes. Ophthalmia with intense photophobia. Weakness and dazzling of the eyes, with giddiness and debility. Weakness of vision. Pupils dilated, the pain is worse at night and terribly aggravated by least ray of light, relieved in a dark room and by pressure.

Gastro-intestinal tract :

Tongue : Tongue is swollen, painful, stiff and paralysed. Consequently, there is difficulty in speech. Bitter taste in the mouth.

Stomach : There is no appetite. Eructations taste sour arid offensive. Terrible nausea with violent vomiting like coffee-ground; acrid heartburn; worse on going to bed, Amelioration from eating, but aggravation a few hours after meals, Cutting pain in the abdomen as from a knife. Severe aching in and around liver. Rumbling with painful tightness of abdomen.

Stool : Cold stool and cold flatulence. Frequent ineffectual urging to stool; passes little at a time. Burning in rectum during stool. Stool is full of undigested matter and painless; passes involuntarily duringsleep.

Urine : There is great difficulty in voiding urine; FLOW INTERMITS, STOPS AND THEN FLOWS AGAIN. Flow stops on straining, from enlarged prostate, uterine affections or paretic conditions. Pain when urinating. Urine 'is-pale with grey or white sediment. 

Menses : conium mac. is an excellent remedy for menstrual disorders, especially in old maids at climacteric age. Menses feeble or suppressed or stopped by taking cold ar putting hands in cold water.

Time: Too late.

Duration: Of short duration.

Quantity: Scanty.

Concomitants: Rashes of small red pimples over the body which cease with the flow (Dulc.). Breasts are sore, hard and painful before and during menses (Lac can., Kali carb.).

Leucorrhoea : Leucorrhoea appears about 10 days after menses (Bor., Bov.). The discharge is very much acrid, milky or bloody profuse, thick and intermits.

Glands : As a result of bruises and injuries, the glands are INDURATED AS OF A STONY HARDNESS AND ALSO ENLARGED especially mammae and testicles, in persons of cancerous
tendency with cutting and stitching pain. This remedy is extensively used for malignant affection of glands.

Respiratory organs :

There is spasmodic paroxysm of cough. Cough usually caused by a dry spot in larynx which constantly irritates and produces dry cough with itching in chest and throat (lod.). Violent spasmodic dry cough, only when lyingdownduring day or night. Cough is worse at night. Only when lying down and during pregnancy.

Heart : Conium is a very good drug for heart troubls and blood pressure. There is violent palpitation with irregular intermittent heart beat, especially of old people and old bachelor; usually after drinking. Pulse irregular in rhythm and unequal in strength; insufficiency of mitral valve.

Sweat : The sweat of a Conium patient is also very peculiar and characteristic. There is profuse sweat day and night, but only when the patient sleeps or even when lying down and closing the eyes (China, Thuja, Cactus-rev, of Sambucus).

General Modalities :

Aggravation: At Night, lying down, during or rising up in the bed, CELIBACY.

Amelioratiog: In dark, from letting the affected limb hang down and by motion.
Relations :

Patients requiring Conium often improve from wine or stimulants, though persons susceptible to Conium cannot take-alcoholic stimulants when in health.

Compare: Arnica, Rhus tox. and Ruta in contusions; Arsenic in cancer, and Calcarea carb. and Psorinum in glandular swellings.

It is followed well by Psorinum in tumours of mammae with threatening malignancy. Antidoted by: Coffea, Dulc., Nit. acid. It antidotes: Merc., Nit. ac.. Sulphur.

CHAPTER:87 CORALLIUM RUBRUM

Red Coral ATTOMYR & MELICHER Gorgoriaceae

INTRODUCTION

Red coral, the product of coralligene Zoophyte,contains carbonate of lime, Oxide of iron, gelatin and other elements. In old physic it was considered to have “strengthening properties” and to be astringent, sudorific, diuretic and absorbent.

CLINICAL

Catarrh. Eruptions. Post nasal catarrh. Cough-whooping, hysterical & other types of eough.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) “Minute gun cough” during the day and whooping cough at night.
2) Inspired air feels cold (Ars., Aesc., Brom.)
3) “Whooping cough or any other kind of cough when the attack comes on with a very rapid cough and the attack follows so closely as to almost run into each other’— Guernsey.
4) Violent paroxysm of cough with bleeding from mouth & nose.
5) Profuse secretion of mucus through the posterior nares obliging one to hawk frequently. (Nat. Garb.)
6) “Continuous hysterical cough”—Author has found it useful after Ignatia has failed.
7) Feels suffocated and greatly exhausted after whooping cough.
8) Skin : Red Flat ulcers. Coral-colored, then dark red spots, changing to copper colored spots. Psoriasis of palms & soles.

PARTICULARS

Respiratory Symptoms :

Nose : Post nasal catarrh. Profuse secretion of mucus dropping through posterior nares. Dry coryza; nose stopped up and ulcerated. Painful ulcers in nostrils. Odors of smoke, onions etc. *

Throat: Throat very sensitive, especially to air. Hawking of profuse mucus.

Chest: Dry spasmodic suffocative cough ; very rapid cough, short, barking. Cough with great sensitiveness of air passages. Feel cold on deep inspiration. Continuous hysterical cough. Patient feels suffocated and greatly exhausted after whooping cough. “Minute gun cough” during the day and whooping cough at night. Violent paroxysm of cough with bleeding from mouth & nose.

Relation :
Complementary : Sulph.
Compare : Bell., Dros., MephiU Caust.

CHAPTER: 88 Salfron STAPF Tridaceae

INTRODUCTION

One of the richest and very useful remedy of the Vegetable kingdom belonging to the family Jridaceae, is Crocus sativus, commonly named as saffron. Saffron is used frequently as a Condiment. It bears an individual characteristic, being brick-red in colour which, on proving produces haemorrhages of DARKISH RED hue. Of course, brightness may also be an occasional feature. VISCIDITY AND STRINGINESS are the other two characteristics of its blood picture.

CLINICAL

Brain affection, Chorea, Eye affection, Epistaxis, Headache, Haemorrhage, Heart troubles, Hysteria, Laughter, Lachrymotion, Menstrual disorders, Nose affection, Opthalmia, Threatened abortion, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts especially upon the female genital organs, but eyes, chest and abdomen may also be affected in rare instances. Brain and mind too are important centres for its action.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes chorea and hysteria. Acting on female genital organs; it causes abortion and produces HAEMORRHAGE, THE BLOOD BEING DARK, STRINGY AND CLOTTED.

CONSTITUTION

There is no particular constitution of the patient as such. The patient is however,having syphilitic background, HAEMORRHAGIC DIATHESIS and of nervous and hysterical temperament.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Frequent and extreme changes in sensation; sudden, from the greatest hilarity to the deepest despondency. (Ign., Nux mos., Platina) anger with violence rapidly followed by repentance, laughter quickly succeeded by tears.
2. Haemorrhage from any and every orifice of the body which IS DARK, VISCID, CLOTTED, IN LONG BLACK STRINGS, HANGING FROM THE BLEEDING SURFACE.
3. Sensation as something alive were moving in the stomach, abdomen, uterus, arms or other parts of the chest or body (Sabina, Thuja, Sulphur). This may be definite sensation or it may be a hallucination or a fixed idea.
4. Spasmodic contraction and twitchings of single sets of muscles (Agaricus, Ign., Zincum met. Aconite).

5. Mind : Crocus sativus patient shows very striking and rare mental symptoms
which are as follows : There is frequent and extreme change in sensation: sudden, from the greatest hilarity to the deepest despondency, (Ign., Nux mos., Platina). The patient is excessively happy, affectionate; wants to kiss every body, but the very next moment she is in rage; anger with violence, rapidly followed by repentance. Laughter quickly followed by tears. Chorea and hysteria with great hilarity; singing and dancing alternating with melancholy and rage. There is a very peculiar and important sensation found in Crocus ie. as if something alive were moving in the abdomen, chest, etc. It may be either a real sensation or a hallucination. It is equally serviceable in PHANTOM PREGNANCY where the sensation of movement in the pelvis, real or imaginary, leads to a definite
conviction of pregnancy.

PARTICULARS
Eyes:
Sensation in the eyes as if the room were filled with smoke, as if he had been violently weeping. A constant desire to wink and wipe the eyes with a feeling as though a film of mucus were over the eyes. The vision seems dim as though the whole room were full of smoke or as if cold wind is blowing across the eyes.

Lachrymation on reading. Tears rushes out from the dim eyes as soon as he begins to read. The lachrymation occurs only when the patient is in the room and not when he is in the open air. There is itching in the eyelids, pain as from excoriation and sensation of burning in the eyes and eyelids, especially when closing them or while reading.

Nose :
Epistaxis only from one nostril at a time. Nose bleeds. The character of blood is BLACK, VISCID,CLOTTED, FORMING INTO LONG, BLACK STRINGS, HANGING FROM THE NOSE, every drop can be turned into a thread with cold sweat in large drops on forehead.

Female genital organs :

Menses. Crocus is suited for DYSMENORRHOEA AND METRORRHAGIA.

Time: Too early.

Quantity: Too profuse,

Character of blood: Dark, stringy, viscid, clotted, forming long black strings, hangs from the

bleeding surface: rush of blood to genitals.

Concomitants: Headache before, DURING AND AFTER MENSES; during two or three days of accustomed menstrual flow.

Modality: Worse from least motion.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: From lying down, hot weather, warm room in morning before breakfast.
Amelioration: In the open air.
Relations :
Antidoted by: Aeon., Opium, Belladonna.
Compare: Ipecac., Platina, Sabina.

CHAPTER: 89 CROTALUS HORRIDUS

Poison of Rattle Snake HERING Crotalidae

INTRODUCTION

The first regular proving of this drug was made by Hering and by others under his personal direction. It is prepared from the venom of the deadly Rattle Snake of North
America. Dr. Tyler remarks to“Homoeopathic specifics” in her Drug Picture.There are drugs whose malignant effects on human body present an almost perfect
picture of some diseases and can be used asspecific for that particular symptom syndrome; examples being: Crotalus horridus and Black Water Fever. Arsenic and Ptomaine poisoning, Mere. cor. and Dysentery. Belladonna and Scarlet Fever. Even Master Hahnemann has said, “Where such correspondence occurs we have specifics.” Hence it is seen that Crotalus horridus is in intimate relation with the signs and symptoms of blood poisoning manifesting AS BLACK WATER FEVER, with characteristic haemorrhages here and there.

CLINICAL

Apoplexy, Boils, Cancer, Carbuncles, Convulsion, Diarrhoea, Diphtheria, Delirium, Dyspepsia, Ecchymosis, Epilepsy, Eye effection, Erysipelas, Fever, Haemorrhoids,
Headache, Heart affection, Jaundice, Liver affections, Lung trouble, Meningitis, Menstrual disorders, Skin affection, Tongue affection, Ulcers, Vomiting, Whooping cough,
etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts primarily upon cerebrospinal nerve centres and secondarily upon the fibrin of blood and liver.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes DECOMPOSITION OF BLOOD AND PRODUCES HAEMORRHAGE FROM ALL ORIFICES OF THE BODY e.g. eyes, ears, nose, mouth, throat and urethra.

It also acts upon cerebro-spinal nerve centres producing rapid and direct depressing influence on sensorium and medulla oblongata, deranging thereby both circulation and
nutrition. Acting on the liver it causes malignant jaundice and sets in oedematous swelling of the body and profoundly affects the organs of vision even to the extent of
destroying their functions completely.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Especially indicated in strumous, debilitated, broken down constitution, particularly in drunkards with tendency to carbuncles or blood boils.

Temperament: choleric temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Affected by heat, wants open air.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: HAEMORRHAGIC DIATHESIS.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. Haemorrhagic diathesis: blood flows from eyes, ears, nose and every orifice of the body and even pores of the skin; blood being fluid, dark, non-coagulable and     offensive.
. Malignant jaundice, haematic rather than hepatic.
. Mostly affects right side of the body.
. Great prostration of vital force.
. Bad effects of vaccination, especially blood poisoning as a result.
. There is general aggravation in the morning on waking or aggravation wakes the patient up at night.
. Tongue fiery red; smooth: and polished (Pyr., Fer. met., Apis), intensely swollen, difficulty in swallowing.
. Purpura haemorrhagica: sudden bleeding from all orifice skin, nails, gums, etc.
. Low spetic condition with blood decomposition.
. Black, coffee-ground and offensive stool.
. There is desire for stimulants and aversion to meat.

. Mind : The mental symptoms are well worth examining in this drug. There is low forms of delirium; great loquacity, wants to talk all the time with desire to escape
  from the bed. Delirium with langour, drowsiness, stuper. All the symptoms are more during sleep.

. Aliments from : Fright, sun, alcohol, foul water, and vaccination.

PARTICULARS

Headache :
There is severe sick-headache

Location: Right sided headache.

Sensation: Head feels too large, as if it would burst.

Character of headache: Dull, heavy, throbbing, occipital headache. The whole head is in a state of congestion. The headache is so severe in the back of head that it is 
impossible to raise it from the pillow, Headache extends into the eyes; bilious headache.

Modalities: Aggravation: During sleep; the longer he sleeps the more severe is the headache.

Throat :
In malignant diphtheria and scarlatina, this remedy is very useful.

Location: Right sided throat affection.


Sensation: There is sense of constriction.

Look of the throat: Oedematous and gangrenous look of fauces or tonsils. Fauces look swollen, dark red with much prostration. The patient can swallow liquid only.

Modality: Aggravation from empty swallowing.

Gastro-intestinal Symptoms :
Abdomen : Violent bilious vomiting, stomach is unable to retain any food. Vomiting of food, vomiting of blood, dark, coffee-ground vomiting. Constant nausea and vomiting, 
every month after menstruation. In cancer of stomach, with vomiting of blood, dark coffee-ground vomiting. There is intolerance of clothing around the stomach. Cannot lie 
orrright side.

Stool : Ulceration of bowels; haemorrhage from the bowels Diarrhoea from noxious effluvia, of septic origin, from foul water and food.

Character of stool: Black, thin, offensive, like coffee-ground there is intestinal haemorrhage.Blood oozes from rectum when standing on-walking. The character of blood is 
DARK, fluid and non- coagulable (Lachesis).

Liver : In malignant jaundice, haematic rather than hepatic. Pain in the region of liver with yellow colour of the face and conjunctiva. The abdomen is distended, hot and tender with constant nausea and vomiting, violent vomiting of food. Stomach is unable to retain anything. Billious vomiting. Intolerance of clothing around the stomach with faintness and sinking at stomach. Desire for simulants and aversion to meat.

Female Genital Organs :

Menses : This remedy is suited to dysmenorrhoea and prolonged menorrhagia. There is prolonged menses with copious dark, liquid blood which oozes out all the time. There is severe pain extending down to thighs; painful drawing in uterine ligament as though uterus would drop out. Vicarious menstruation, nose-bleed instead of menses.

Skin : Causation: Dissecting wounds, insect stings and bad effects of vaccination. There is great tendency to carbuncles and blood boils, pustular eruption, post vaccination eruptions, and effects of vaccination. Blood boils and eruptions are surrounded by purplish mottled skin and oedema. Great sensitiveness of skin of right half of the body. There is swelling and dis-colouration of whole body. Yellow colour of skin. There is purpura haemorrhagica. Blood comes out from all the orifices, skin, nails, etc., with bloody sweat. Cold and dry skin. Wants open air.

Haemorrhage :

In malignant diseases of uterus: Great tendency of haemorrhage. The blood discharge is DARK, FLUID, DECOMPOSED AND NON COAGULABLE. The blood loses all power of coagulation; hence clots are not usually detected in the haemorrhage (Lach., Naja coagulates the blood with long strings). In intestinal haemorrhage when occurring in typical septic or zymotic diseases where the blood is dark, fluid and offensive, Crotalus is a wonderful remedy. There is haemorrhagic diathesis. The blood flows from all the orifices of the body e.g. ear, nose, eyes, and even from the pores of skinr In blood poisoning, pulse can scarcely be felt. Completely collasped. Condition with great prostration of vital force and blood sweat. There may also be PURPURA HAEMORRHAGICA, coming suddenly from all the orifices e.g. skin, nails, gums, etc. During haemorrhage the skin becomes cold and dry. The patient wants fanning. Usually right side is more affected.

Fever :

In low septic typhoid or malarial fevers or in zymotic diseases. There is low state of vitality. The septic condition, the history of septic absorption with tremendous weakness, great prostration of vital force, petechial eruption and haemorrhage are clear indications of this drug. The skin is yellow and the sweatstains linen red, due to presence of blood in sweat. Putrescence is found everywhere.

The tongue is fiery red, smooth and polished, intensely swollen. The pulse is scarcely felt. Weak and slow pulse.
Comparison between Crotalus and Lachesis. Similarities:

1. Both are potentised from snake poison.
2. Both are haemorrhagic remedies.
3. Both are worse from sleep and sleeps into aggravation. _
4. Both are intolerant of pressure and tight clothing.
5. Both have loquacity.
6. Both have bluenesss of parts.
7. Both have bloody sweat.
8. Both have yellowness and jaundiced look of the skin.
9. Both want fanning.

Distinctions:
1. Crotalus affects right side more, Lachesis left.
2. Crotalus skin is cold and dry, but Lachesis skin is cold and clammy.
3. Crotalus has more haemorrhage than Lachesis.
4. Lachesis has more intense sensitivity to touch, pressure and constriction.
5. Crotalus has more specific effects on liver than Lachesis.
6. Lachesis is more suited to patients of climacteric age than Crotalus.
7. Malignant jaundice is more marked in Crotalus than in Lachesis.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: Lying on right side, open air, evening, morning and and after sleep.

Amelioration: By rest and fanning.

Relations :

Antidoted by: Lahesis.

Compare: Lachesis, Pyrogen.

CHAPTER: 90 CROTON TIGLIUM

Croton Oil Seeds HENCKE Euphorbiaceae

INTRODUCTION

Croton tig. is a very valuable remedy prepared from croton oil seed, having a limited range of action in therapeutic sphere. Mostly it is a remedy for the relief of acute troubles. Nevertheless, no other drug in Hemoeopathic Materia Medica is able to replace it for its peculiar affinity to mucous membrane of gastro- intestinal tract and skin ‘and thus the indispensability of this remedy has been well established.

CLINICAL

Cholera, Colds, Cough, Diarrhoea, Breast affection, Ear affection, Eczema, Skin affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
It acts especially on mucous membrane of gastro-intestinal tract and skin.
Respiratory organs are also within the domain of action of this remedy.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces both irritation and inflammation of skin, resulting in formation of vesicles and mucus discharge. Burning in oesophagus i is one of its metastatic pathological
actions. It also causes congestion of gastro-intestinal tract, copious watery stool and peritonitis. Hyperaemia of the glandular system too is within its range of action.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Profuse watery diarrhoea “coming out like a shot” as soon as the patient eats and drinks, followed by great prostration. The evacuation is yellowish or yellowish green.
2. On the skin Croton produces ERYTHEMA, ERYSIPELAS, ECZEMA, HERPES, PUSTULES, etc. There is intense itching of the skin but the patient cannot bear to
   scratch very hard as it hurts; a very slight scratch or a mere rub suffice to allay the itching.
3. Touch pressure and motion aggravate, Aggravation at night and summer.
4. Suffocating cough as soon as the head touches the pillow (Hyos., Drosera, Rumex, Belladonna, Conium).
5 Drawing pain through the chest from nipple to scapula of the same side when child nurses (Nipple to all over body—Phytolacca; nipple to uterus—Puls., Silicea).
6. Aggravation from eating and drinking and from every movement, followed by great Prostration.
7. For skin eruptions such as erythema, erysipelas, eczema, herpes, pustules,throughout the body which itch exceedingly, but very much sensitive to touch, Croton tig. is infaillible.

PARTICULARS

Diarrhoea :
Causation: Fron fruits, sweet-meat and hot summer weather.
During stool: Constant urging to stool, followed by SUDDEN EVACUATION. The bowels are moved as if by “SPASMODIC JERKS, COMING OUT LIKE A SHOT”.

Character of stool: Gushing of thin, yellow, watery stool, profuse in quantity, is the striking feature of Croton tig.
Concomitants: With stool, the stomach is greatly distended and very much sensitive to touch with much gurgling in bowels.

Modality: Aggravation from eating, drinking or even while eating and summer.

Cough :Cough especially at night, often compelling the patient to rise from a sound sleep.

Character of cough: Violent spasmodic with dyspnoea, choking, more at night, obliging the patient to sit up. Sensitive to deep breathing. Extreme irritation of air passage, so that the inhalation of air brings on cough.

Modality: Cough aggravated from lying down, as soon as the head touches the pillow at night.

Breast :

There is drawing pain through the chest from breast to scapula of the same side, every time the child nurses. (Pain extends from nipple all over—Phytolacca; from nipple to uterus—Puls., Silicea)

Skin :

Eczema all over the body, especially of scalp and genital organs, either-purely vesicular or pustular. The vesicles dry up and are followed by red, raw, inflamed surface.
Intense itching of skin, but it is so tender that the patient is unable to scratch, instead rubs gently to get relief. There is also severe itching on genitals in both sexes which may be vesicular or pustular but very much sensitive and sore but gentle rubbing gives relief and comfort.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: Diarrhoea by every motion, from eating and drinking, even while eating the least food and drink.

Relations :
Compare: Kali phos.
Antidoes: Rhus tox.
Antidoted by: Antim. tart.

CHAPTER: 91 CUPRUM METALLICUM

Metallic Copper HAHNEMANN Cu The Element

INTRODUCTION

Metallic copper, an insoluble substance when jt is pure, is made soluble by means of trituration. It was Master. Hahnemann who solved this problem of using insoluble substance, in the field of therapeutics. This medicine was first introduced by him as one of the weapons for the then prevailing cholera epidemic. By the members of the orthodox school, copper is used as copper sulphate for therapeutic purposes, especially for external application. They did not dare to use it internally because of its chemically poisonous effect, but Homoeopathy has made it useful through the process of trituration.

CLINICAL

Angina pectoris, Asthma, Cholera, Chorea, Convulsion, Cough, Cramps, Croup, Cyanosis, Dyspnoea, Epilepsy Gastric disorders, Gout, Throat affection, Measles,
Meningitis, Neuralgia, Paralysis, Spasm, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Cuprum met. acts prominently upon the alimentary canal and profoundly influences the nervous system and various nerve centres.

PATHOGENESIS

Cuprum met. causes gastro-intestinal inflammation, colic, diarrhoea and vomiting. Acting on the nerve centres it gives rise to SPASMODIC AFFECTIONS CRAMPS,
paralysis, convulsions, beginning in fingers and toes; violent contractive and intermitting pain with tonic and clonic spasm etc.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: “It is suited to fair haired people and the carbo-nitrogenoid constitution, women who have borne many children” (Clarke).
Relation with heat and cold: Symptoms are aggravated from cold air.

Miasm: It is an anti-psoric remedy WORKING FROM WITHIN OUTWARDS.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. It ranks with most important medicines for troubles arising from the “STRIKING INWARD” of diseases of failure of eruptions or discharges to come out or
repercussed eruptions resulting in brain affections, spasm, convulsions, diarrhoea, vomiting, etc.
2. Spasmodic affections, cramps, convulsions, beginning in fingers and toes and spreading over the entire body.
3. Clonic and tonic spasms: Convulsions and epileptic attacks.
4, Spasm and cramps, convulsions cough and pain are disposed to appear periodically and in groups.
5. A strong sweetish metallic coppery taste in the mouth with flow of saliva; constant protrusion and retraction of tongue like that of a snake (Lach).
6. When drinking, the fluid descends with a gurgling sound (Arn., Thuja).
7. Cholera morbus or Asiatic cholera with cramps in abdomen and calf muscles.
8. Complaints begin on the left side.
9. Cough in thrttacks successively (Stannum), cough is relieved by drinking cold water (Causticum).
10. Mental and physical exhaustion from over-exertion of mind and loss of sleep (Cocculus, Nux vom.).
11. Colic, vomiting, cough (hiccough) and spasm, relieved by drinking cold water; aggravated in the evening and at night; relieved by being mesmerised.
12. Ailments from : Fright, suppressed discharge, repercussed eruptions.

PARTICULARS

Respiratory Symptoms :

Cough : Cuprum rnet. is a favourite remedy in whooping cough. The attacks are SPASMODIC in nature.

Sensation: Cough with a gurgling sound in the throat as if water is being poured out of a boitle.
 
Character of cough: The cough is so long lasting and suffocative that the patient tums entirely breathless, blue and rigid. While coughing, the face becomes, livid or blue, The finger nails become discoloured,.the eyes are turned up and the patient coughs until he loses breath. There is also rattling in the chest. Whenever the respiratory organs are affected, there is spasmodic breathing and dyspnoea; more the dyspnoea, more likely is it that the thumbs will be clenched and the fingers cramped. Cough in three paroxysms successively, the patient is unable to speak; becomes breathless; blue faced, rigid and stiff, cataleptic spasm with each paroxysm. At the end of cough, he vomits out all the food taken plus a little quantity of tough gelatinous mucus. Modality: Worse at 3 a.m. Better by drinking cold water (Causticum).

Cholera :
In cholera morbus or Asiatic cholera, Cuprum met. is an excellent remedy. Its application is generallyconfined to the later part of the second stage and the early part of the third stage of the disease. When the CRAMP STARTS AND COLLAPSE BEGINS TO APPEAR, Cuprum met. is well indicated.

Character of stool and vomitus: There is gushing of profuse watery stool with copious vomiting.Due to the profuse discharge, the stomach and bowels are emptied of their contents.

Look of the face: During cholera, there is collasped condition, cyanosis; the face becomes blue, lips and nails turn blue, cold and mottled.

Cramps: During cholera, there is cramp in the extremities, pain in the soles and calves with great weariness of limbs. There is clonic spasm, beginning in the fingers and toes and spreading over the entire
body. Flexor type of cramps (rev. Secale cor.),

Tongue: Constant protrusion ahd retraction of the tongue like a snake.

Sweat: There is cold and clammy sweat over the entire body. There are three remedies which tend to collaspe and death. These are Cuprum, Camphor and Veratrum. These three drugs can be differentiated as follows: Cuprum for the cases of convulsive character. Camphor in cases characterised by extreme coldness and more or less dryness, and the main feature of Veratrum is that the sweat, vomiting and purging are “TOO MUCH” profuse and copious. Cuprum met. has twitching, shivering, trembling; also tonic contraction, so that the hands are closed violently. In this condition, the thumbs are first affected. They are drawn into the palms and then the fingers close down with GREAT violence. FLEXOR TYPE OF CRAMPS are usually noticed in Cuprum met. (Extensor type — Secale cor.). Tonic contraction; the limbs are drawn up with great violence.Epilepsy :

Causation: From a fall or blow upon the head, from getting wet, and suppressed exanthemata.

Aura begins in lower extremities especially in knnd proceeds upwards.

There is, generally great restlessness between the attacks either filling up the entire interval or only a part of it. During the epileptic spasm, the face becomes red and respiration is hurried and noisy, and arms and legs jerk, especially the left arm is convulsively jerked as if by electric shock. The first attack generally
comes during first sleep at night (Lahchesis).

Modality: Worse at night, during new and full moon.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: At night, from getting wet, from vomiting, contact, during new and full moon.

Amelioration: Drinking cold water.

Relations :

Complementary to: Calcarea carb,

It is antidoted by: Sugar mixed with milk and given freely, Hepar, Bell., Cham., Con., Dulc., Ipecac., Nux vom. It antidotes: Aur., Merc., Op.

CHAPTER : 92 CYCLAMEN EUROPAEUM

Sowbread PROVER : HAHNEMANN Primulaceae

INTRODUCTION
Cyclamen has a traditional reputation as a remedy for affections of the uterus and appendages. The later provings have demonstrated the correctness of this. It is in many
ways analogous to Pulsatilla, from which it differs mainly in having no better from open air ; and in not having thirstlessness as so frequent an accompaniment of other conditions.

CLINICAL
Acne. Anaemia. Chlorosis. Dyspepsia. Eyes affections. Headache. Heel pain. Menstrual disorder. Mental. Pruritus. Rheumatism.

SPHERE OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS

It acts upon cerebro-spinal system affecting sensorium, eyes, gastrointestinal canal and more especially female sexual system.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make up—Best adapted to blonde leuco-phlegmatic who are pale and anaemic. Temperament: Phlegmatic and irritable temperament. Heat cold relation :
Chilly patient. Miasm : Psoric and sycotic miasms are in the back ground.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1) Aversion to open air : The patient dreads open air (coryza and cough relief in open air.

2) Deranged Menses in pale, chlorotic women : attended with headache, vertigo and dim vision.

3) Weeping disposition : The patient is mentally sad, irrit-able, peevish, morose and desires to be alone.

4) Thirstlessness : There is no thirst all day but it occurs in the evening during fever.

5) (a) Desire: For lemonade. (Bell., Nit. Acid., Pills., Sabina., Sec-Cor,) Inedible things (Cale, Os., Cina., Cicuta., Psorinum etc.)

(b) Aversion : To fat, meat, bread & butter. Ordinary food and beer. Pork disagrees.

(c) Appetite : Satiety after a few mouthfuls (Lye.) and then he loathes food which causes nausea,

(d) Taste : Saliva and all food taste salty.

6) Flickering before eyes, as of various colours, fiery sparks, glittering needles, visions of smoke or fog, with headache or while getting up from the bed in the morning.

7) Pains : Pressive, drawing or tearing of parts where the bones are least covered ; as tibia, backs of hands etc. (Sang., Can., Rhus Ven.)

8) Menses : Too early, too profuse, black & clotted better during flow (Lach., Zinc.)

9) Sleep : Late sleep in the evening, but wakes up early, too tired and sleepy. Disturbed by anxious and frightful dreams.

10) Burning sore pain in heels, when sitting, standing or walking in open air (Agar.,Caust, Val., Phyt.)


11) Mind : Like Pulsatilla the mental conditions of Cyclamen are also worth mentioning. The patient is irritable, peevish, morose, and ill-humored ; there may
be great sadness with weeping disposition. She desires to be alone and dislikes company.Changeability of mental symptoms is the characteristic feature of this remedy. Alternations of moods such as sadness and cheerfulness, love of labour and indolence; joyous feeling & irritability. Memory alternately quick and weak etc.
Mental conditions arise from suppressed grief and terrors of conscience ; neglect of duty or commission of bad act. Mental symptoms are better during profuse menstrual flow.

12) Ailments from : Suppressed grief, neglect of duty, commission of bad act, suppressed menses, fats, pork, coffee, overheating, overexertion, complaints after wearing.

13) Headache : Causation—Headache from disordered stomach, fatty diet & stopping.

Location— One sided especially in forehead & temples.

Sensation : As if brain were enveloped in a cloth ; as if he had a cap on a scalp.

Character : Boring, darting, pressing & bursting headache on rising in the morning. 

Modalities-Aggravation by lying on painful side, by motion in open air. Amelioration by vomiting, cold appli-cation.

Concomitants : In anaemic patients with flickering before eyes, dim vision. Vertigo as if objects turn in circle when walking in open air and better in a room.

14) Gastrointestinal tract:
Mouth : Saliva increased and salty taste. Tongue white or yellowish. Taste is lost; bad, putrid feeling ; all food taste salty, burning & dryness in the throat and lips
with thirstlessness.

Stomach Causations : Eating fatty food, pork, coffee, overheating.

Nausea : Satiety after a few mouthfuls and then he loathes food which causes nausea in throat and palate.

Vomiting : Of watery mucus, in the morning after eating.



Eructations : Like hiccough worse after taking fatty food. Aching in the stomach, burning in oesophagus and colicky pain in abdomen ; all better by walking about,
Sensation of weight in stomach after eating. The whole abdomen is tender with stitching pains in stomach, liver & abdomen.

Diarrhoea : After coffee, fatty diet. Stool is watery, forceful, brownish, yellow & odourless.

Menses :

Causation : Suppressed from over exertion or being over heated (Getting wet-Puls.)
Time : Too early.
Duration : Prolonged.
Quantity : Profuse.

Character : Black, membranous, clotted, flowless when moving about.

Concomitant :

During menses : labour like pains from back to pubes ; mental symptoms are better.
(b) After menses : swelling of breast with milk secretion.
(c) In those ladies who are blonde, pale and chlorotic.

Modalities-

Menses aggravate while sitting and lying, at night and relieved while walking.
16) Comparison between Cyclamen and Pulsatilla.

Similarities :
(1) Both are predominantly womens’ remedies.
(2) Both are suited to blondes,—pale and anaemic.
(3) Both are thirstless.
(4) Both are weepy and dislike company.
(5) Both present changeability of mental symptoms.
(6) Both desire lemonades and to both pork disagrees.
(7) Both are. late sleepers.

Dissimilarites :

Cyclamen Pulsatilla
1) Aversion to open air which aggravates 1) Craves open air which relieves
