3) Aggravation from cold and relieved 3) Relief from cold and aggravation
by warmth in general. from warmth,
4) Menses — Too early, too profuse black 4) Menses - Too late, pale & scantly. and clotted.
5. Better during flow. 5) Worse during flow.
6. Secretions — neither thick, nor bland 6) Secretion — Thick, bland & nor yellowish-green yellowish-green
General modalities :
Aggravation — Open air, cold air, cold bathing, by rest, sitting, standing, at night, before menses.
Amelioration — During menstrual flow by moving about, rubbing parts. In warm room, indoors, after consuming lemonade.
Relations :
Antidotes : Camphor, Coffea, Pulsatilla.
Compare : China, Ferrum & Puls. in chlorosis and anaemic affections.
 

CHAPTER: 93 DIGITALIS PURPUREA


Foxglove HAHNEMANN Scrophulariaceae


INTRODUCTION

This is another excellent remedy from the vegetable kingdom, usually indicated in heart diseases. This is a wild plant grown best in siliceous soil in bushy grounds and
waste places of Europe. The fresh leaves from this uncultivated plant are gathered, and from this the mother tincture is prepared and subsequent potencies are made.

CLINICAL

Angina pectoris, Asthma,  Bright’s disease, Cyanosis, Delirium, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Headache, Heart affection, Lung troubles, Urinary troubles, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Its main seat of action is heart and circulation, gastro-intestinal tract and uro-genital organs.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action through cardiac peripheral end of vagus inhibits the activity of heart,resulting in SLOW HEART BEAT; prolonged diastole and rise of blood pressure. It also
causes suppression of urine producing oedema. It is also capable of irritating gastro- intestinal tract, producing vomiting and diarrhoea.

CONSTITUTION
There is no particular constitution or make-up of the body as such. However, the patient is light-haried scrofulous; children of fair complexion and people of climacfric age having weak heart, but without valvular complicaions. Blueness of the skin, with cyanosis of eye-lids, lips, tongue and nails. Relation with heat and cold; Chilly patient with great sensitiveness to cold air and cold weather; cold food and drink which aggravate.

Miasm: Psora and Sycosis are in the background,

Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis,

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Prostration from slight exertion.
2. Sensation as if the heart would stop beating if she moved (rev-Gels.).
3. Motion aggravates most of its complaints.
4. Slow and weak, irregular, intermittent pulse; intermitting every 3rd, 5thand 7th beat.
5, Enlarged, sore and painful liver.
6. White and pasty stool.
7. Blueness of the skin, with cyanosis of face, eyelids, lips, tongue and nails, face is cold and pale and is covered with cold sweat.
8. Great weakness and deadly sinking in epigastrium with nausea and vomiting from smell of food; clean tongue and great thirst.
9. Respiration is very difficult and he often takes deep breath.
10. Mind : There is great anxiety and apprehension. The patient is very much despondent and fearful. Music is unbearable. It aggravates all troubles.
The patient is very much forgetful. His memory is weak and thinking is difficult.
11. Ailments from : Alcohol, high living, sexual excess and tobacco.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: Alcohol, tobacco, and sexual excess.

Location: Forehead and temples.

Sensation: Sudden cracking sensation in the head.

Character; Throbbing headache in the forehead, with stitches in forehead and temples.

Modalities: Aggravated by sitting erect, motion, music, excitement and eating.

Amelioration by pressrue, frequent profuse micturition, When the stomach is empty and in open air.

Concomitants: Vertigo with anxiety and faintness.

Heart :

Causation: Heart troubles are caused by alcohol, sexual excess, tobacco and/or high living.

Sensation: Sudden sensation as if the heart would stop beating if the patient moved (Fears that unless constantly on the move, the heart would cease beating—Gels.).

Character: Weak heart without any valvular complications. There is uneasiness in the region of the heart and precordium. IRREGULAR INTERMITTENT PULSE, generally occurring at climacteric age, aggravated by least motion, Heart's action is feeble. Heart beats more frequently, but intermits; sometimes irregular, VERY SLOW AND WEAK, INTERMITTING EVERY 3RD, 5TH AND 7TH BEAT. Frightful stiches in region of heart, coming on every fifteen minutes, lasting only five or six seconds each time (Angina pectoris).

Concomitants: Sudden flush of heat followed by nervous weakness. There is feeling or faintness or sinking at the stomach with i exhaustion, EXTREME PROSTRATION; feels as if he were dying. There is great weakness of the chest; cannot bear to talk. Face is pale, of death like appearance and bluish-red with cyanosed skin, eyelids, lips and tongue. Venis on the lids, ears, lips and tongue are distended. Respiration is irregualr and difficult with deep sighing. Fatal syncope may occur when being raised to upright position. Dropsical condition of the body, when there are organic affection of the heart.

Kidney :

For all kidney diseases, brought on or aggravated by alcoholism, sexual excess or tobacco, Digitalis is an excellent remedy and the indications are as follows:

There is post-scarlatina dropsy, with suppressed urine. Dropsy of both internal and external parts.

There is frequent urging to urinate with a very small quantity passing at a time giving no relief whatsoever.

Urine is scanty, thick and turbid. Feeling of fulness of bladder continues even after urinating. Strangury and frequent urging to urinate. Urethra inflamed. Burning in 
urethra with purulent, thick and yellowish discharge.

Stool :

There is violent diarrhoea, especially of drunkards. The stool is very light, ash-coloured, delayed. chalky, almost white; involuntary and pipe-stem stool.

Geneal Modalities :

Aggravation: When sitting, especially when sitting erect, motion, Least motion aggravates palpitation as well as causes palpitation, aggravation at night.

Amelioration: Symptoms are relieved when stomach is empty.

Relations :
Cinchona antidotes the direct action of Digitalis but increases the anxeity. 

Antidoted by; Camphor.

CHAPTER : 94 DIOSCOREA VILLOSA

Fr namcamietees duane aac amma menace iS aaa
Wild Yam BURT Dioscoreaceae

INTRODUCTION

As a remedy for many kinds of pain, especially colic, and in severe, painful affections of abdominal and pelvic viscera, Dioscorea ranks with the polychrests of the Materia Medica. The pains of Dioscorea are neuralgic in character. It affects the ganglionic nervous system particularly of the umbilical region, thereby producing symptoms simulating an attack of bilious colic. Dr. Burt/ who made a heroic proving of this remedy, says—The grand sphere for the use of Dioscorea is among neuroses of the bowels and stomach; where the coeliac and umbilical plexuses are in a state of great hyperaesthesia, (the pain and spasm being unbearable. So whatever may be its action) It is one of the leading remedies for various kinds of colic, such as biliary, intestinal, flatulent, menstrual or renal when symptoms agree.

CLINICAL

Angina pectoris. Colic : Biliary, Intestinal, Renal, Flatulent, Menstrual, Gastralgia. Paronychia. Sciatica. Spermatorrhoea. Whitlow.

SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS

It chiefly acts on gastroin-testinal tract, liver, genito urinary organs and nervous system.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Colic pains worse from bending forward and while lying; better on standing erect or bending backwards (Rev.of Col.)
2) Violent twisting colic, occurring in regular paroxysms, as if intestines were grasped and twisted by a powerful hand. There is gripping pains in abdomen about umbilicus.
3) Persons of feeble digestive powers, often subject to vio-lent colic; tea drinkers with much flatulence after meals or after eating.
4) Pains radiate from abdomen to back, chest, arms-r suddenly shift to different parts, appear in remote localities such as fingers and toes,
5) Disposition to paronychia, early stage of felons when pains are sharp and agonizing, when pricking is first felt, nails brittle.
6) Sciatica : Pains shoot down thigh, worse right side, better when perfectly still.
7) Relaxation & coldness of genital organs with great despondecny.
8) Seminal emissions during sleep with vivid dreams of women all night and weak knees.
9) Ailments from : Tea drinking, excess in eating, fasting, errors in diet, onanism.

General Modalities :
Agg.: Lying, sitting, bending double.
Ame : Motion, walking difficult compelled to walk even though tired.

CHAPTER :95 DIPHTHERINUM

Trituration of A Nosode

Diphtheric membrane

INTRODUCTION

Diphtherinum is prepared like all nosodes and animal poisons, according to the Homoeopathic Pharmacopoeia and like all homoeopathic remedies, is entirely safe when given to the sick. Like all the nosodes it is practically worthless in potencies below the 30th, its cura-tive value also increases with increases of potency from the 200th to the M and C.M. It need not and should not be repeated too frequently. It will cure in every case that crude antitoxin will and is not only easy to administer but also safe and entirely free from dangerous sequellae. Besides, it is homoeopathic. Dr. H.C. Allen had used it for twenty five years as a prophylactic and had never known a second case of diphtheria to occur in a family after it had been administered. The profession is asked to put it to the test and publish the failures to the world.

CLINICAL

Croup. Diphtheria. Post diphtheritic paralysis. Epistaxis. Tonsillitis. Myelitis.

CONSTITUTION

Especially adapted to scrofulous, psoric or tuberculous persons, prone to catarrhal affections of throat and respiratory mucous membranes. Persons with weak or exhausted
vitality are hence extremely susceptible to the diphtheritic virus. Diathesis—Especially adapted to strumous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) When the patient from the beginning seems doomed, and the most carefully selected remedies fail to relieve or permanently improve.
2) In diphtheria when the attacks from the onset tends to malignancy (Lac Can., Merc.Cy.)
3) Painless diphtheria where the symptoms are almost or entirely objective. Patient is too weak, apathetic or too prostrated to complain. Sopor or stupor but easily aroused when spoken to (Bapt., Sulph.)
4) Epistaxis or profound prostration even collapse almost at very beginning. Pulse weak, rapid and vital reaction very slow.
5) Diphtheritic membrane, thick dark, grey or brownish black; temperature low or subnormal, pulse weak and rapid; extremities cold and marked debility; patient lies
  in a semistupid condition; eyes dull, besotted (Apis., Bapt.)
6) Dark red swelling of tonsils and palatine arches; parotid & cervical glands greatly swollen.
7) Discharges from throat, nose and mouth are very offensive. Breath is horribly offensive. Tongue is swollen, very red & has little coating.
8) Swallows without pain, but fluids are vomitted or returned by the nose.

Relation :

In laryngeal diptheria after Chlor., Kali Bi. or Lac. Can. fail. In post diphtheritic paralysis after Caust., Gels. fail.

CHAPTER :96 DROSERA ROTUNDIFOLIA

Sundew Droseraceae

INTRODUCTION

It is a drug prepared from vegetable kingdom. It was first introduced by our Master Hahnemann, but mastered equally well by Dr. Tyler as she remarks in her
Drug Picture in the following words. “A few years ago, I came to the startling conclusion that the only two people who really knew anything about
Drosera were Samuel Hahnemann and myself.” She proved her statement in her subsequent writings when she unfolded the therapeutic effects of this wonderful drug
in the sphere of respiratory affections, particularly the tubercular infection. Later on, clinical experiences confirmed that Drosera is not a drug with its spheres of action to whooping cough only but is capable of fighting the tubercular infection too, particularly of bones and glands.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Acts markedly upon the respiratory organs by its influence on the pneum nerve. It also affects bones and glands.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces spasmodic dry cough; stimulating whooping cough. Drosera can break down resistance to tuberculosis and should, therefore, be capable of raising it (Dr.Tyler).

CONSTITUTION

There is no particular constitutions of the patient as such. The patient is very chilly,having tubercular diathesis and a psoric background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS >
1. Crawling sensation in the larynx as from a feather.
2. Nocturnal cough of young persons in phthisis.
3. Violent spasmodic, frequent spell of barking cough, aggravated at night, after midnight, warmth, drinking, singing, laughing, weeping and LYING DOWN.
4. Cramping constriction runs all through the remedy,
5. Difficult swallowing of solids.
6. Gnawing pain in the joints.

PARTICULARS

Respiratory Symptoms :

Cough : Suited especially in WHOOPING cough with violent paroxysms which follow one another rapidly.
Time: Usually at night.

Sensatin: Sensation of a feather in larynx, which excites cough. Sense of constriction and crawling in larynx.

Character of Cough: Deep-sounding, hoarse, barking cough.

Spasmodic cough with gagging, retching and vomiting.

During cough, there is vorniting of water, mucus and often bleeding from nose and mouth.

Violent tickling in the larynx brings on cough, makes the patient get up from sleep, coming on every few hours.

There is spasmodic difficulties of chest and larynx, causing difficult breathing and suffocation.
Sensation as if something in the chest preventing breathing when talking or coughing.

The face becomes purple from spasms in larynx with suffocation. Severe attack of stitching in the chest when sneezing. Compression of the chest. Burning sensation in the chest, stitching pain in the chest. With cough there is copious sweat all over the body.

Character of sputa: Usually there is no expectoration. But where there is expectoration, the sputa is yellowish or greenish.

Modality: Aggravation after mid-night, by warmth, drinking, singing, talking, laughing, speaking, LYING DOWN as soon as head touches the pillow; after measles.

Laryngitis :

There is severe hoarseness with sore throat.

Sensation: Constriction and crawling sensation in the throat, tickling as from a feather like sensation in the larynx.

Character: Cle en’s sore throat with rough, dry, scraping sensation in deep fauces. Voice is hoarse, deep, toneless, cracked; requires great exertion to speak. The hoarseness and continued irritation cause coughing and scraping of the larynx.

Phthisis :
Drosera is especially suited in phthisical condition of the lungs and larynx.

Character of cough: There is violent deep sounding, hoarse, barking cough, which is spasmodic in nature with gagging, retching and vomiting. NOCTURNAL COUGH of young persons in phthisis.

Character of pain: With cough, there is stitching pain in the chest. The patient must hold the chest with both the hands to get relief.

Character of sputa: During coughing, there is bleeding from various orifices, especially from the nose, throat, larynx and chest, Bloody saliva and haemorrhage from the mouth with bloody or purulent
sputa. During coughing there is blue face with spasm of extremities.

Modality: Aggravation from talking, laughing, singing, and after mid-night.

Tuberculosis of bone : Drosera is a good drug for spinal caries with extreme deformity.
Sciatica : There is pressing pain in the hip region; aggravation from pressure, stooping, lying on painful side and relieved after rising from bed.
General Modilities :
Aggravation.: After mid-night, lying down, on getting warm in bed, drinking, singing and laughing.

Relations :
Antidotes: Camphor.
Complementary to: Nux vomica.
Follows well: After Samb., Sulph., Ver.alb.
Followed by: Calc., Puls., Sulph.
Compare: Cina, Coral, Cup., Ipecac and Samb., in spasmodic coughs.
Master Hahnemann advises that only a single dose of the 30th potency c ures within 7 or 8 days and not to repeat which spoils the cure.

CHAPTER: 97 DULCAMAKA

Bitter Sweet HAHNEMANN Solanaceae

INTRODUCTION
For this important drug and its exact and scientific use, we owe gratitude to our Master Hahnemann. It was regarded by him as “a very powerful plant” and he says that its duration of action is a long one. “Before the scientific proving of the drug was made”, remarked Kent “our mothers used to make ointments of Dulcamara for its astonishing, soothing effects on smarting wounds over the skin surface”. This effect has been proved and established rationally by a dozen of provers whom Hahnemann employed.

CLINICAL
Anasarco, Catarrh, Bladder affection, Cough, Cholera, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Dysentery, Fevers, Headache, Herpes, Influenza, Lumbago, Measles, Meningitis, Nettle rash,

Neuralgia, Ophthalmia, Nose affection, Skin troubles, Tonsillitis, Urinary affection, Warts, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Dulcamara affects subversively as well as curatively all mucous membranes, besides glands, skin and muscles.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes glandular enlargement, especially of the lymphatic system, cellular effusion and produces skin eruptions. It also produces catarrhal inflammation of mucous

membrane and skin, resulting in profuse secretion-of mucous membrane and skin.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up : Especially suited to persons of phlegmatic scrofulous constitution.
Temperament: Irritable temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Neither chilly not hot. Easily affected by sudden change from heat to cold or from cold to wet rainy weather.

Miasm: Sycotic and Psoric patient.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Duleamara is an excellent remedy for the troubles BROUGHT ON OR AGGRAVATED BY EXPOSURE TO COLD DAMP RAINY WEATHER or sudden changes in hot weather, when the days are hot and nights are
cold (Bry).
Consequent upon perspiration being suppressed, there is INCREASED SECRETION OF MUCOUS MEMBRANE which is a great symptom of Dulcamara.

Catarrhal condition and profuse discharges such as urine, saliva, loose stool, mucus in respiratory organs e.g., are very conspicuous.
General AGGRAVATION FROM COLD AND RELIEF BY WARMTH.

Urticaria and other various skin troubles all over the body without fever.
A curious regional effect of Dulcamara is at or about the umbilicus where pinching and shooting pain occurs again and again.There will be RASH and other eruptions on face, hands and arms before menses (Conium). There is a general tendency to throw out eruptions all over the body.
Whey-like and milky urine catarrhal ischuria; in grown up children with milky urine, from wading with bare feet in cold water; involuntary urine.

Anasarca: after ague, rheumatism or scarlet fever; dropsy after suppressed sweat, suppressed eruptions or exposure to cold.
There is mental confusion; cannot find the right word for anything.

Ailments from : Exposure to cold GETTING WET IN RAIN, damp cold, weather; wading in water with bare feet, washing checked perspiration, suppressed and
checked eruptions; when the days are hot and the nights are cold.

CHAPTER :100 Eupatorium Perfoliatum

Boneset HAHNEMANN Compositae

INTRODUCTION

Commonly known as Boneset or Ague-weed, Eupatorium perfoliatum is a remedy with which every Homoeopath is more or less familiar especially in the management of acute fevers like Dengue, Influenza, Malaria, etc. In regard to its common name “Boneset”. DR. N.M. CHOUDHURY SAYS “The name Boneset is very apt in as much as it conveys to the mind the supreme characteristic of the drug viz. it soothes painful bone. So important is this symptom that its absence may be regarded as a contra-indication for Eupatorium”.

CLINICAL

Bilious fever, Bone pains, Cough, Dengue, Influenza, Intermittent fever, Soreness, Headache, Rheumatism, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Eupatorium perfoliatum acts principally upon the gastro-hepatic organs and bronchial mucous membrane and fibrous tissue.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces, as one of its most characteristic conditions, bilious derangement with tenderness of hepatic region and vomiting of bile. It also produces sorenss and aching of muscles and bones which accompany some forms of febrile diseases like malaria and influenza.

CONSTITUTION

There is no particular constitution as such of this patient. However, the remedy is more adapted to diseases of people, having worn out constitution due to excessive abuse
of alcohol, cachexia, from prolonged or frequent attacks of bilious or intermittent fevers.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Brusised feeling as if broken all over the body (Arn., Pyrogen, Ham.).
2. Bone pains of all description appear in the remedy. Pains affecting back, head, chest, limbs, especially the wrists which feel as if dislocated. The more general and severe the pain, better the remedy is indicated and adapted.
3. Painful SORENESS runs throughout Eupatorium perfoliatum e.g., soreness in eye balls, cough with extreme soreness down trachea, soreness of chest, headache with soreness.
4. The chill is nearly always in the morning and is preceded for several hours by thirst, soreness and aching of bones.
5. Periodicity is well marked, i.e., every 3rd or 7th day. Postponing type, chill at 9 a.m. one day, at noon the next day and so on.
6. Insatiable thirst before and during chill and fever. Knows that chill is coming because he cannot drink water enough.
7. Pain comes quickly and goes away quickly.
8. Bilious vomiting between chill and heat stage of getting on hands and knees.
9. Vertigo with sensation as if falling to the left.
10. A characteristic of Eupatorium cough is, relief by getting on hands and knees.
11. Sweat relieves all pains except headache (Nat. mur, Psor.).

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Time: Periodical headache, every 3rd or 7th day.

Location: Pain at the base of brain.

Sensation: Congestive type of headache. Sensation as if head is going to burst.

Character of pain: Throbbibg pain in the head, pressure as if a cap of lead pressed over the whole skull; extreme soreness of the head.

Modality: Aggravation after lying down.

Concomitants: Vertigo with headache, sensation as if falling to the left.

Respiratory Symptoms :

Cough : Chronic loose cough with coryza and sneezing.

 Causation : From suppressed intermittent fever or after measles.

 Sensation ; Cough excited by tickling in the chest, causing tightness of the chest.

 Character of cough ; Hawking cough with difficulty in breathing; while coughing the patient

                      must support the chest with hands.

 Character of sputa ; With cough, there is scanty expectoration.

 Character of pain : Sharp pain through right chest on deep inspiration and with SORENESS
                     INCHEST.

ken * Modality : Aggravation from lying on back, from inspiration, relieved by lying on hands and
lees.

Extremities : In chronic cases of gout and rheumatism this medicine is of great help.


Causation: After malarial fever.
 
Location: There is gouty affection with oedema of lower limbs.

Sensation: There is gouty soreness in the joints.


 Character of pain: There is aching pain in back, aching in bones of extremities, aching in
arms and writst with soreness of flesh. Gouty soreness and inflmed nodosities of joints.
There is dropsy of lower extremities, feet and ankles with severe BONE-ACHE AND BONE PAIN

Concomitants: Headache is associated with gouty affection.

Intermittent fever :
Eupatorium perfoliatum is adapted to various types of intermittent fever e.g., tertian, double tertian, postponing and bilious fever.

Time: The time of paroxysms is generally between 7 and 9 a.m. Postponing type. i.e., one day at 7 a.m. the next day at 9 a.m. and then at 11 a.m. and so on.

Before the attack: There may be nausea and vomiting and sometimes there are spells of vomiting of bile. There is great thirst for several hours before the fever.

During the attack: There is extremely severe chill. Shivering runs down the back and spreads from the back to the extremities. There is SORENESS and pulsation in the back of the head. Violent pain in the occiput and back before and during chill. During the chill, the patient wants to cover up the whole body. There is bitter vomiting at the close of chill. There is bruised feeling as if broken all over the body, bone pain affecting back, chest, limbs, especially the wrists which feel as if dislocated. The more general and severe the pain, the better it is indicated and adapted.There is insatiable thirst before and during chill and fever. The patient knows that chill is coming because he cannot drink enough. He has violent thirst but the shivering becomes worse from drinking. So he dares not drink cold water. With- fever there is bursting type of headache. There is sweat which relieves all the symptoms except headache. Bryonia is its nearest analogue having free sweat but there, pain keeps the patient quiet while Eupatorium has scanty sweat and pains make the patient restless.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: Periodically and in open air.

Amelioration: Conversation, by getting on hands and knees, sweat (except in headache).

Relations :
Compare: Bryonia. Podo., Iris.

Is followed well by: Natrum mur., Sepia,

CHAPTER : 101 EUPHRASIA

Eyebright HAHNEMANN Scrophulariaceae

INTRODUCTION

Euphrasia is called, in common language, “THE EYEBRIGHT”. Its name is significant and a most appropriate one as is seen in both human provings and clinical practice. According to Grauvogl the “signature” of “a black spot in the coralla which looks like the pupil” marked Euphrasia as an eye medicine to the ancients and the Homoeopathic experiments have fully, confirmed its old time reputation.

CLINICAL

Cold, Cough, Cataract, Conjunctivitis, Eye affection, Fevers, Headache, Influenza, Lachrymation, Measles, Menstrual troubles, Nasal catarrh, Nose affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Especially acts upon the mucous membrane, particularly of the eyes, lids and upper portion of the respiratory tract.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces catarrhal inflammation of the mucous membrane, inflaming the conjunctival membranes, especially causing PROFUSE ACRID LACHRYMATION which is the chief characteristic of the drug.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Catarrhal affections of mucous membrane especially of the eyes, nose and upper respiratory tract.
2. Profuse acrid lachrymation with profuse and bland coryza (rev.—Alium cepa).
3. The eyes water all the time and are agglutinated in morning
4. Cough only in the daytime (Fer. met. Staphysagria).
5. Menses only one day or lasting only for one hour.
6. Profuse offensive expectoration of mucus by voluntary hawking.
7. Bad effects from fall, contusion, or mechanical injuries of external parts of the eye.
8. Aggravation in the evening, WARMTH and indoors,

PARTICULARS

Headache :
Euphrasia commonly has cattarrhal headache.
Sensation: As if the head is going to burst.

Character of pain: Bruised pain, stitching pain in the head. Catarrhal headache with profuse discharge from eyes and nose with dazzling of eyes.

Modality: Aggravation in the evening, from warmth and touch.

Nose :
Great sneezing and PROFUSE FLUENT CORYZA; the nasal mucous membrane is swollen. The discharge is BLAND and it occurs with ACRID LACHRYMATION.
After this coryza has lasted for a day or two, it extends into the larynx with a hard cough and much offensive expectoration.

Modality: Aggravation from exposure to warm, south wind, at night and while lying down.
Eyes :

Euphrasia is adapted to amblyopia, opacity.and ulceratin of cornea with catarrhal condition of eyes, and catarrhal conjunctivitis.

Sensation: Sensation of dryness, burning and biting in the eyes.

Character of discharge: The eyes water all the time which is COPIOUS AND ACRID. The eyes

are agglutinated in the morning. PFOFUSE ACRID LACHRYMATION WITH PROFUSE bland CORYZA (rev.—Allium cepa, where coryza is acrid and lachrymation is bland).

Look of the eyes: Margins of lids red, swollen and burning, very much sensitive to touch. There is violent itching of eyes leading to rubbing and winking. There may also 
be fine rashes about the eyes with

puffiness of lids and blurred vision.

Character of pain: Cutting pain in eyes extending to head, pressure in eyes as if caused by sand.

Modality: Aggravation in the evening, after exposure to south wind and BY WARMTH.

Cough :

Causation: After exposure to south wind.

Time: There is cough only in the daytime (Fer. met., Staphysagria),

Sensation: There is tickling sensation in the larynx.

Character of cough: There is terrible irritation in the larynx compelling the patient to cough followed by pressure beneath the sternum.

Character of sputa; Cough with copious expectoration, along WITH CORYZA AND LACHRYMATION, There is profuse expectoration of mucus by voluntary hawking.

Concomitants : During cough, there is EXCESSIVE LACHRYMATION (Natrum mur.). With cough there may also be dyspnoea and difficulty in inspiration. Loose cough with rattling in the chest.

Modality: Aggravation in daytime, on rising in the morning. Amelioration by lying down.

Female genital organs :

Menses : Euphrasia is suitable for amenorrhoea and dysmenorroea.

Time: Late or may be regular.

Quantity: Scanty.

Character of menses: Very much painful.

The menstrual flow lasts ONLY ONE DAY or sometimes only one hour with PROFUSE ACRID LACHRYMATION AND PROFUSE BLAND CORYZA.

Fever : It is indicated especially in eruptive fever like measles.

Stage: Suitable in the first stage of measles.

Time: The fever occurs mostly during the day.

During fever, there is chill with rash. There is profuse lachrymation with profuse bland coryza. The eyes water all the time. Fever is often associated with catarrhal headache as if the head is going to burst which is more in the evening. There is loose cough with rattling in chest and copious expectoration.

Look of face: The face is very much hot with coldness of body.

Sweat: Sweat especially at night, during sleep:, most profuse on chest.

Aggravation: In the evening, after exposure to south wind.

Note : Euphrasia is a wonderful medicine in measles though not so frequently indicated as Pulsatilla. But if it is given when the symptoms agree, it will back a violent attack of measles and turn it into a very
simple form, making the patient feel better, brings out eruption, control the fever and relieve the cough, Coryza and other catarrhal symptoms.

General Modality :
Aggravation: In the evening, in bed, indoors, warmth, moisture, after exposure to south wind and whery touched.

Amelioration: From coffnd in darkness.
Relations :
Antidoted by; Pulsatilla.

CHAPTER :102 FERRUM METALLICUM

Tron HAHNEMANN Fe, An Element

INTRODUCTION

The metallic iron suggests anaemia to many common people as well as to medical men. Iron plays a vital role in the manifestation of anaemia; hence the word “FERRUM” is
invariably associated with “ANAEMIA” and vice versa by orthodox school of medicine. WHAT ZINCUM IS TO NERVES, THE SAME, IRON IS TO BLOOD. Ferrum was proved by Hahnemann
who said, “most of the provings of iron were observed from the employment of the solution of the actuals of iron, yet the symptoms correspond to those of the metallic iron.”

CLINICAL

Aneamia, Asthma, Abdominal disorders, Chlorosis, Cough, Cramps, Constipation, Chorea, Convulsion, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Fever, Goitre, Haemorrhage, Headache,
Menstrual disorders, Rheumatism, Vertige. Whooping Cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Tron has chief action on the blood element, HAEMOGLOBIN OF R.B.C., skin and muscular tissues of the body are acted upon later after the blood has been primarily
affected. Gastro intestinal tract and uterus are the other seats of action.

PATHOGENESIS

Iron has an important place as a constituent of haemoglobin. Initially iron increases the R.B.C. count causing FALSE PLETHORA but later on it produces anaemia. A
disturbance of the equilibrium causes relaxation. The vessels walls dilate resulting in congestion, increased blood pressure and haemorrhage. In alimentary canal, peristalsis is weakened, producing vomiting, constipation, diarrhoea, etc.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Especially adapted to women who are PALE, weak, delicate and chlorotic, yet have a FIERY RED FACE.

Temperament: Sanguine temperament easily vexed, least contradiction excites the patient. Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Haemorrhagic diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Any RAPID EXERTION OR MOTION brings on weakness, dyspnoea, sinking and fainting.
2. A strange symptom running through Ferrum is that the PAINS AND SUFFERINGS COME ON DURING REST, such as palpitation, dyspnoea and
weakness. That is why the patient is ameliorated by MOVING ABOUT GENTLY in the house or in open air.
3. Complaints from LOSS OF VITAL FLUID as is China especially from haemorrhage.
4, EXTRENE PALENESS of the face, lips and mucus membrane which become red and flushed on least pain, emotion or exertion.
5. Red parts become white.
6. Haemorrhage from anywhere and everywhere; the character of the blood is BRIGHT RED COAGULABLE.
7. Profound prostration with general anaemia, but with tendency to flushing of face and head with headache.
8. Emaciation, weakness and trembling in frequent attacks.
9. Canine hunger or alternate loss of appetite with dislike for any food.
10. Dropsy due to loss of vital fluid, abuse of quinine, suppressed intermittents, etc.
11. Desire for bread; aversion to eggs, meat, milk, beer and sour things (Craving for eggs—Calc. carb.).
12. Fiery red tongue (Apis., Crot. hor, Pyr.).
13. Ailments from : Loss of vital fluid, abuse of quinine, suppressed intermittents, etc.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: Loss of vital fluid, abuse of quinine and suppressed intermittents.

Time: Periodic type of headache, every 2,3 or 4 days or every 2 or 3 weeks.

Character of pain: Hammering, beating, pulsating type of pain in head. Congestive type of headache, pain in the back of head. Pain compels the patient to lie down:

Modalities: Aggravation by coughing and amelioration by pressure and Slow walking about.

Concomitants: With headache, there is vertigo with balancing sensation as if on water; also there may be aversion to eating and drinking.

Vertigo :

When there is vertigo, the patient feels a peculiar sensation of balancing, as if on water, or the vertigo appears on seeing flowing water, or as if walking over water when crossing a bridge, or on descending.

Stomach :

There is canine hunger or alternate loss of appetite with dislike for all food. There may be regurgitation and eructation of food in mouthfuls afterdating. Distension and pressure in the abdomen after eating. The patient may also have flatulent dyspepsia with heat and burning in stomach. There is nausea followed by Vomiting immediately after eating. As soon as food is eaten, the patient leaves the table suddenly and with one effort vomits everything eaten. After vomiting, the patient
can sit down and eat again as before in stomachful. Vomiting sour, acid and full of the smell of ingesta.

Diarrhoea :
Time: At night (China, Puls., Chel).
Character: Painless, with ineffectual urging; stool contains undigested food particles.
Modality: Aggravation at night, WHILE EATING AND DRINKING.
Concomitants: With diarrhoea, there is good appetite and prolapse of rectum. The diarrhoea causes progressive emaciation of the patient.
Constipation :
Cause: From intestinal atony.

Character of stool: Stool is dry, knotty, with ineffectual urging. Stool is followed by backache and cramping pain in the rectum; prolapse of rectum and itching of anus at night.
Concomitants: Along with hard, dry, knotty, stool, there is prolapse of rectum and itching of anus.

Menses :
Time: Too early.
Quantity: Too profuse.
Duration: Too long lasting.

Character of blood: Bright red, easily coagulable. Discharge of long pieces of membrane from uterus; intermittent flow; returns after 2 or 3 days; in women who are too weak, debilitated, chlorotic and extremely pale,yet has a fierly red face with pale, watery, debilitating flow. Concomitants; With menses, there is ringing in the ears.
Cough :
Time: Only in the daytime (Euphrasia, Staphysagria).

Character: Dry, spasmodic, with cough there is pain in occiput. Chest oppressed with breathing difficulties. There may also be haemoptysis with red blood—stained sputa.

Modality: Cough is relieved by lying down and eating.

Rheumatism :
Side: Rheumatism of the left shoulder.

Character: Tearing pain, inability to raise the arm. Rheumatic pain in the deltoid muscle. Violent pain in muscles and along the nerves, tearing and stinging nature of pain. Rest brings on the pain of forearm.

Modality: Aggravation from the cold and rest, and relieved by slowly moving about.

Ferrum Metallicum

Anaemia :

Causation: From loss of vital fluid, abuse of quinine. Anaemic condition due to loss of blood, especially from haemorrhage. Due to anaemia, the patient is PALE and waxy, muscles become flabby and relaxed. There is dropsical condition of skin which pits on pressure. The skin is pale, waxy, yet the face shows an appearance of plethora. From every little excitement the face becomes flushed.

General Modalities :

Aggragation: At night, at rest especially while sitting still.

Amelioration: Walking about slowly and in summer.

Relations :

Complementary to: Alumina, Cinchona.

Antidoted by: Ars., Hepar, Ipecac., Puls.

Antidotes: Ars., lod., Merc.

CHAPTER: 103 FERRUM PHOSPHORICUM

Ferric Phosphate DR. J.C. MARGAN Fe3(PO,),

INTRODUCTION

It is one of organic tissue salts introduced: by Schussler. Its function is to: lend ‘colour or pigment to the blood corpuscles. It also carries oxygen to all parts of the body. The deficiency in this cell salt leads to disturbance of circulation: Disturbed circulation again in its trend ‘causes. other disturbances in the normal equilibrium of the human system. This remedy needs thorough proving for detail symptomatology. The symptoms available are derived from the writings of Schussler, proving by 
J.C.Margan & some clinical experiences of homoeopathic practitioners.

CLINICAL

Debility, Ear-affections of, Epistaxis, Fever, Headache; Haematuria, Haemoptysis. Haemor-rhages. Inflammations. Injuries, Pleurisy, Pneumonia, Rheumatism. Urine-

incotinece of, varicose veins.

SPHERES OF ACTION & PATHOGENESIS

The main action of this drug is on relaxed muscular tissue and the blood corpuscles.

GUIDING SYMPTOMES
1) First stage of all febrile disturbances and inflammations before exudation sets in.
2) In the early stages of febrile conditions, it stands midway between asthenic activity of Aconite and Belladonna and the asthenic sluggishness and torpidity of Gelsemium.
3) Nervous, sensitive, anaemic persons with false plethora and easy flushing.
4) Haemorrhages : Bright red blood from any orifice.
5) It corresponds to Grauvogl’s Oxygeniod Constitution.
6) Desire for stimulants.

CHAPTER:104 FLUORIC ACID

Hydrofluoric Acid HERING HFL

INTRODUCTION

Fluoric acid is a colourless liquid obtained by distillation. It unites with water violently and dissolves all ordinary metals. But heavy metals like platinum, gold, silver, mercury, lead, etc. are not soluble in Fluoric acid. It is a strong irritant and causes burns. It is a DEEP and LONG ACTING remedy.

CLINICAL

Abscess, Alcoholism, Bone affections, Cicatrix, Eye affection, Fistula, Goitre, Gonorrhoea, Haemorrhodids, Hair falling of, Hands perspiring, Headache, Locomotor ataxia, Nose affection, Ulcers, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on skin, deep tissue, veins and bones.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on the skin, causes ulcers of syphilitic nature and on the bones its action results in caries and necrosis.. Much weakness and premature old age are also

manifested by Fluoric acid.

CONSTITUTION
Make-up of the body: Premature old age. Young people too old (Arg. nit., Kreosote, Secale cor.).


Relation with heat and cold: The Fluoric acid patient is NEITHER HOT NOR CHILLY. It indicates PENDULUM-LIKE CHARACTER between heat and cold (Puls). He is less affected by the excessive heat of summer or cold of winter. However, his troubles are aggravated by warmth and relieved by cold.

Miasm: Psora, Syphilis and Sycosis—any or all of them may be in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Fluoric acid is especially suited to old people and complaints of old age; of YOUNG PEOPLE WHO LOOK OLD and attain premature old age,
2. Burning, unusual heat and acidity are the words that qualify a great many symptoms. Discharges from ulcers, eyes and nose are very much ACID AND EXCORIATING. Even the sweat is acrid.
3. As is common to all acids, PROFOUND WEAKNESS AND DEBILITY run through the whole drug.
4, The pain of Fluoric acid is very characteristic. It is LIGHTNING like and on a small spot. Pain comes suddenly, lasts for a short time and disappears quickly.(Bell.        Mag.phos.)
5. The patient has increased ability to exercise without danger. This is a very striking ., and unique characteristic symptom of Fluoric acid.
6. The patient is less affected by excessive heat of summer or cold of winter. This too is a very peculiar sypnptom of this valuable remedy.
7. For vicious bone diseases, in necrosis, caries, fistulous openings, fistula lachrymalis and fistula in ano, in calcareous degeneration, etc. Fluoric acid is infallible.
8. There is general aggravation by warmth and relief by cold application.
9. Ailment from : Syphilis, abuse of Mercury or Silica.

PARTICULARS

Ulcer :

Ulcer of syphilitic or psoric origin are very successfully treated by Fluoric acid. Old cicatrices become red and round edged and threaten to become open ulcers.
Varicose veins and ulcers in obstinate and long standing cases; especially in women who have borne many children, are admirably dealt with by Fluoric acid. The ulcers have red edges and vesiciles; decubitus, from which copious offensive and acrid discharge comes out, with violent lightning like pain. The pain is confined to a small spot; the Pains are aggravated by warmth and relieved by cold. All caries and necrosis, especially of long bones whether psoric, or syphilitic or caused by abuse of Mercury or Silica, it matters little, can be satisfactorily tackled by Fluoric acid. In the case of naevus of children and capillary aneurysm, Fluoric acid can be thought of as an effective remedy to give complete relief. Furthermore, for the exostosis of long bones or bones of face, rapid caries of teeth, fistula dentalis or lachrymalis. Flouric acid is an infallible remedy.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: By warmth.

Amelioration: By cold application.

Relations :

Complementary to: Silicea and Coca,
Followed by: Sulph., Nit. ac.
It follows: Sil. as Sil. follows Puls.

Gelsemium is said to be the “KING OF POLIO”, by virtue of its being a great paralyser. It is a drug of importance in Homoeopathy not for its great number of

It acts on brain, spinal cord, occiput, neck, motor nerves, eye lids, vision, mucus membrane, sexual organs and blood. It is a right-sided remedy.

PATHOGENESIS

Muscles refuse to obey the order of the will. It has functional paralysis of all descriptions. Tremor i: the key-note of this great remedy, and gradually total paralysis may take place. Hence, Gels, is said to be a GREAT PARALYSER.

Look of the patient: It is an acute drug. So consideration of the constiution is not very important. But is usually more suited to children, old people and anaemic girls.

CHAPTER: 106 GLONOINE
Nitro-glycerine HERING C3H,(NO,)O3
INTRODUCTION

Glonoine—Nitro—glycerine is a combination of two elements—Glycerine, which is a most inert and bland oil used as a constituent of toilet and Nitrogen,
which is a colourless, tasteless and odourless gas. When both of them are mixed in 1:4 proportion, potentised and proved according to the doctrine of
proving, it becomes one of the most valuable medicines with alarming characters Its SUDDENNESS, BURSTING, SENSATIONS, pains surging upwards which threaten to lift and shatter the cranium are very much striking and characteristic. Dr. Hughes points out in his pharmacodynamics that “though the old school uses Glonoine for various therapeutic purposes the medicine owes its introduction to eonstantine Hering one of the greatest disciples of the Master in the field of Homoeopathy.”

CLINICAL

Angina pectoris, Apoplexy, Brain affection, Bnght’s disease, Cenvulsion, Epilepsy, Headache, Heart affections,. Meningitis, Menstrual disorders, Menopausal syndrome,
Neuralgia, Rheumatism, Sun-stroke, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts especially on the brain, pneumo-gastric and vaso-motor nerves.

PATHOGENESIS
Acting upon the brain, especially medulla oblongata, pneumogastric and peripheral vaso-motor nerves, it produces cerebral hyperaemia, palpitation of heart, severe
headache, resembling those resulting from exposure to sun’s rays or sunstroke. It also causes violent and sudden disturbance in circulation with sensation of expansion,
bursting and throbbing.

CONSTITUTION
 
Physical make-up: Especially suited to plethoric sensitive persons who are very irritable and easily excited by slightest opposition.

Temperament; Nervous temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Glonoine acts violently and suddenly in acute diseases especially of brain causing fulness, tension, throbbing and bursting sensation. Its action is so local, so sudden
so definite and torturing that it is impossible to forget Glonoine.
2. Symptoms are WORSE IN THE SUN or exposure to sun’s rays.
3. Sensation of pulsation throughout the body.
4. Surging of blood to head and heart.
5. Bad effects of mental excitement, fright, fear, mechanical injuries hair cut and SUN STROKE.
6. General weakness and depression from heat of sun or summer.
7. Weakness and trembling of tongue, hands, legs and the entire body.
8. Ailments from : Sun, heat of fire, fear, fright, injury and hair-cut.

PARTICULARS

Headfiche :
Character: From working under gas light, when heat falls on the head or WALKING IN THE SUN, from heat of stove or hair cut during pregnancy and menopause.
Sensation: Head feels ENORMOUSLY LARGE as if the skull were too small for the brain and as if skull were being lifted up.
Character of headache: Severe THROBBING, PULSATING type of headache. The patient holds the head with both hands. There is intense pain. Sensation as if the head would burst; sometimes there is great soreness in the head. Heaviness of the head with rush of blood towards the head as if all the blood has gone towards thehead. SUNSTROKE and SUN HEADACHE— increases and decreases with the sun. Headache in place of menses.

Modalities: Aggravation from shaking jar, stooping, lying down, SUN’S RAYS and while working under the gas light.
Better by bending head backwards and from covering.

Apoplexy :

In threatened apoplexy with cerebral congestion or alternate congestion of the head and heart. The brain feels too large, full, bursting, with rush of blood towards he head, blood seems to be pumped upwards; throbs at every jar. Terrific shock in the head synchronous with the pulse. There is throbbing sensation. The patient holds the head with both hands, cannot lie down, even the pillow seems to beat. With high blood pressure, there is violent palpitation, Throbbing In carotids, heart's action is slow. In apoplexy when violent pressure keeps on and congestion, continues, if it is given, it will relieve the pressure provided the symptoms agree.

Meningitis :
Causation: During the time of dentition.

Location: In the cerebro-spinal region.
Sensation: As if the neck is drawn back.

Character: Convulsion of children from cerebral congestion. The face and eyes are intensely congested and hot. Violent congestion in brain and spinal cord with convulsion throughout the limbs; the
neck and whole body drawn backwards. Opisthotonos.

Modality:

 Aggravation: Warm room increases convulsion. Children get sick in the evening, when sitting
before an open coal fire or falling asleep there.

Comparison :
Glonoine differs from Belladonna, although both of them have many symptoms in common. In Bell., the circulation within the cranium is excited because the brain is irritated; but in Glon., the brain is irritated because the cirulation is excited. The pains of Bell, are sudden in onset and sudden to leave; those of Glon., are even more so. According tg Nash, Glonoine is better adapted to the first congestive stage of inflammatory diseases of brain. Bell, goes further and may still be the remedy after the inflammatory stage is fully established. Farrington, too emphasizes that Bell. and Glon. meet the congestion and inflammation of brain. But in Bell., cri encephalige is well marked while it is less marked in Glon. Bell. is worse by bending backwards while Glon. is better by it. In both, the head feels enormously large. Bell. is better by uncovering head while Glon. is better by covering it.

Menopausal Syndrome :
Flush of heat at the climacteric age. Intense congestion of brain, from delayed or suppressed menses. The congestion may also come on during the menstrual period. If uterine haemorrhage stops suddenly, then thereis violent headache as if all the blood rushes to the head. Headache may appear in place of menses.

General Modalities :
Aggravation : In the sun, exposure to SUN’S RAYS, gas-light; overheating, jar, stooping,ascending, touch of hat, having the hair cut.
Relations :
Compare; Belladonna and Gelsemium.
Antidoted by: Aconite, Camphor, Nux vom.
