Witch Hazel HERING Hamamelaceae

INTRODUCTION

No remedy has wider spheres of usefulness in case of haemorrhage and disordered blood-vessels than Hamamelis virginica. It also has a decided relation to the effects of mechanical injuries including burns of the first degree. As a local application it ranks with Arnica and Calendula. It is widely said to
be the “ACONITE OF THE VENOUS CAPILLARY SYSTEM”. When there is oozing out of venous blood from any where in the body, either from piles or varicose veins or from nose, bowels, uterus, lungs, open injury, etc, the great anti-haemorrhagic homoeopathic medicine that we can think of first, is Hamamelis.

CLINICAL

Bone affection, Bruises, Bums, Cancer, Consumption, Enteric fever, Eye affection, Gastric Ulcer, Haematemesis, Haematuria, Haemorrhage, Haemorrhoids, Injury, Leucorrhoea, Menstrual disorders, Epistaxis, Rheumatism, Scurvy, Testicles inflammation, Threatened abortion, Uleers, Varicose
veins, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on VEINS, CAPILLARIES, liver, portal system, rectum and generative organs.

PATHOGENESIS

Acting upon the coats of veins, it causes relaxation with consequent engorgement and even structural lesions and thereby produce PASSIVE VENOUS HAEMORRHAGE FROM ANY PART.

CONSTITUTION

There is no particular constitution but Ham. is suitable for those who are having HAEMORRHAGIC DIATHESIS and suffer from diseases like PHLEBITIES, VARICOSIS.
HAEMORRHOIDS and VENOUS HAEMORRHAGE.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Intense soreness of affected parts is the key-note of this remedy.
2. Bleeding from any orifice or from open wound; blood being DARK PASSIVE AND NON-COAGULABLE.
3. The part from which the blood flows feels SORE AND BRUISED.
4, For scapula rheumatism when there is pain at the top of left shoulder and under right shoulder blade which is worse during day but is entirely absent during night,
  Hamamelis is nearly a specific medicine.
5. Motion and exertion in general aggravate troubles. Aggravation in open air and in rainy weather.
6. Ailments from : Trauma or injury, haemorrhage, etc.

PARTICULARS

Haemorrhage :
It is better adapted to PASSIVE VENOUS HAEMORRHAGE from any orifice of the body; nose (RHINORRHAGIA, lungs, (HAEMOPTYSIS), stomach (HAEMATEMESIS), bowels (MALAENA), bladder (HAEMATURIA), uterus (MENORRHAGIA), etc.

The character of blood is PROFUSE, DARK, GRUMOUS. Haemorrhage after a fall or rough riding. There is intense sorness of the affected parts. Vicarious menstruation is also found in it.

Nose-bleed :
Causation: Idiopathic, traumatic, vicarious, of childhood. Flow is passive, long lasting and venous. Blood is non-coagulable (Crot.) profuse, which relieves headache.
Eye: It hastens absorption of intraocular haemorrhage.

Haemoptysis :
Ticking cough with taste of blood or sulphur; without effort or coughing; sometimes lasts for months or years. Chest feels sore and constricted.

Modality: Aggravation from motion and little exertion.

Haematemesis :

Throbbing pain in stomach. PROFUSE BLEEDING DARK BLOOD, SORENESS IN THE ABDOMEN, haemorrhage from intestine during typhoid or in dysentery, profuse bleeding, dark blood.
Anus feels raw and sore, Haemorrhage does not cause any mental anxiety.

Modality: Aggravation from motion and little exertion.

Haematuria :

Dark blood with increased desire to urinate.

Varicosity of veins :

May be in the oesophagus (Oesophageal varices), rectum (piles), abdomen, legs, pampiniform plexus of veins of scrotum, etc. Veins dilate, elongate and become tortuous and bleed easily. Blood is dark;ulceration of the varicose veins (Fluoric acid). Extreme soreness of the part. Hamamelis can be used both internally and externally in solution taking 1 part of mother tincture and 9 parts of aqua dest for such condition, at the same time, for rapid improvement.

Injury :
.Like Amica, Calendula, etc. Hamamelis is also a very good medicine for injury, where there is continuous bleeding from the injured surface.
.Bleeding may be internal, or external, the character of blood being PASSIVE, DARK WITH SORNESS OF THE PARTS. Wounds.from which continuous bleeding takes place, be it incised, lacerated or contused, or caused from falls, it matters little. Hamamelis can bring appreciable results.
.If the mother tincture of Hamamelis is applied on cuts or wounds, it will arrest bleeding, remove pain and soreness and prevent suppuration.

Traumatic conjunctivities :

Suggilation, or extravasation into chambers of eyes, from severe coughing; intense soreness (Amica,Calendula, Ledum) can be successfully treated by this great remedy. It hastens absorption of intraocular
haemorrhage.

Piles :
Bleeding piles. Bleeds profusely, with burning, soreness, fulness and heaviness as if back would break; urging to stool, bluish colour, anus feels sore and raw. Prostration is out of proportion to amount of blood lost (Hydrastis).

Femafe genital organs :
Menses : Flow dark and profuse, with soreness in abdomen; after a blow on ovary or a fall; all sufferings aggravate at menstrual period (Actaea, Pulsatilla).

Menorrhagia occurring mid-way between menstrual periods. Vagina is very tender. Vaginismus. Haemorrhoids and sore nipples, after confinement.
Rheumatism : Sore bruised feeling. When Arnica fails, think of Hamamelis.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From motion, mental or physical strain, warmth, moist air, touch, afternoon and bending forward.
Amelioration; Outdoor and open air.
Relations :
Complementary to: Ferrum met. in haemorrhages and haemorrhagic diathesis.
Compare: Arnica, Calendula, for trauma, and to hasten absorption of intraocular haemorrhage. 
Antidoted by: Arn., Cup., Puls.

CHAPTER :109 HELLEBORUS NIGERChristmas Rose

 HAHNEMANN RanunculaceaeINTRODUCTION

Helleborus is yet another of our Master’simmortal monuments derived from the vegetable kingdom—Chirstmas Rose, belonging to the natural order of Ranunculaceae. This is called
Christmas Rose because the flowers bloom in mid-winter. The mother tincture is prepared from the dried root. In its crude form and in physiological dose, it is poisonous but when it is
potentised, the poisonous effect is transformed into a wonderful dynamic power capable of curing brain, urinary and abdonimal symptoms.

CLINICAL
Apoplexy, Brain affection, Cholera, Concussion, Convulsion, Diarrhoea, Drospy, Headache, Hydrocephalus, Meningitis, Tetanus, Typhoid, Urinary affection, ete.

SPHERES OF ACTION
The main seats of action of Helleborus are brain, nervous system, meninges, kidney, serous membrane, urinry organs and gastro-intestinal tract.

PATHOGENESIS
Acting on brain and meninges it produces dropsical effusion leading to hydrocephalus and meningitis and many other reflex symptoms. It acts on kidney resulting in scanty
and high coloured albuminous urine; it irritates the digestive tract causing inflammation of stomach and intestine thereby producing jelly-like mucus and diarrhoea. It also causes
cerebral and general paralysis and through pneumogastric nerve, respiration is retarded and there may be cardiac paralysis.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: It is more suited to weak and delicate persons, especially children
who are prone to brain troubles with serous effusion.

Temperament: Irritable temperament,
Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient,
Miasm : Psora is in the background.


GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1.Weak and delicate patients, who are prone to brain troubles with serous effusion,
2.Melancholic, woeful and full of anguish; especially girls at puberty or when menses fail to return after appearing.
3.The patient is irritable and easily angered; does not want to be disturbed.
4. Consolation aggravates most of the complaints (Ign., Nat. mur., Lilium tig., sepia, Silicea).
5. Brain symptoms during dentition with threatened effusion.
6, Meningitis with exudation, brain-cry, and paralysis.
7. Convulsion with extreme coldness of body.
8. Diarrhoea during hydrocephalus or dentition or pregnancy. Stool contains jelly-like mucus like frog-spawn; involuntary stool.
9. Coffee-ground urine, red, black and scanty, suppressed and albuminous.
10. Dropsy of brain, chest and abdomen after intermittent fever, with debility and suppressed urine.
11. Aggravation from 4-8 p.m. (Lyco.).
12. Mind : Helleborus manifests very striking mental symptoms in many cases, such as in brain troubles with effusion, during dentition, meningitis, encephalitis,
hydrocephalus, typhoid, etc. which are as follows:

The patient is very much irritable and easily angered. Does not want to be disturbed. Very much melancholic, woeful, despairing; silent or extremely
anguished, especially girls at puberty or when menses fail to return after appearing. Consolation aggravates most of the complaints.
Brain Stmptoms during dentition (Belladonna, Podophyllum) with threatened effusion.
Unconscious and stupid when questioned answers slowly, giving a picture of acute idiocy.
. Aliments from : Dentition period, pregnancy or from suppressed exanthema.

PARTICULARS
Head :
In diseases of the brain and meninges, such as MENINGITIS, ENCEPHALITIS, HYDROCEPHALUS,
it matters little, Helleborous can be thought of if the following symptoms are present:-
The patient remains unconscious, lies in a stupid manner. When questioned, he answers slowly.
There is a picture of acute idiocy in him.
There is acute cerebro-spinal or tubercular exudation, as a result of which occur cerebral or complete
paralysis with cri-encephalique.
The look is vacant, thoughtless and staring; eyes are wide open. They are insensible to light; pupils are dilated or alternately contracted and dilated.


He has soporous sleep with occasional screams and shrieks during hydrocephalus which develops rapidly, wheather it is post-scarlatina or tubercular.
There is automatic motion of one arm and one leg.
During these troubles, there is convulsion with extreme coldness of the body, except in head or occiput which may be hot. The patient greedily swallows cold water; he bites the spoon, still remains unconscious.The mouth is in chewing motion; corners of mouth are sore, cracked; nostrils are dirty, sooty and dry.
The patient bores head into pillow, rolls head from side to side; beats the head with hand.
The patient also constantly picks his lips, clothes or bores the nose with his fingers.
There is stupefying headache. Forehead has wrinkled folds and is covered with sweat. Dull pain in occiput. Headache may culminate in vomiting.

Diarrhoea :

Patient requiring Helleborus, may suffer from diarrhoea especially during acute hydrocephalus ordention or during pregnancy. The character of stool is watery, clear, tenacious with colourless mucus or
with White jelly-like frog spawn and involuntary.

Urine :

The urine of Helleborus is alsb very characterstic The urine may be scanty or suppressed after dropsy. The colour of the urine IS DARK, RED OR BLACK, HAVING COFFEE-GROUND SEDIMENT
AND ALBUMINOUS. There is frequent urging to urinate but the child cannot urinate. Nash points out that an increase in the quantity of urine is a very good sign of the favourable reaction of this remedy in
many diseased conditions, then not to repeal but to wait.

Dropsy :

There may be dropsy after suppressed exanthema. Dropsy may be of the brain, chest or abdomen,with fever The urine may be suppressed or scanty. The skin is pale, shining and oedematous.
In chest affections or in hydrothorax, or pleurisy with effusion this remedy is infallible, and the patient can breathe easily when lying down but when sitting up there is frequent sighing. Respiration is irregular.
chest is constricted; gasps for breath during hydrothorax.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: Worse from evening until morning, especially from 4-8 p.m. and from uncovering.

Relations :
Compare: Apis, Aresnic, Belladonna, Bryonta. Digitalis Lachesis and Zincum met., in brain or
meningeal affections.

CHAPTER :110 HELONIAS DIOICA

Unicorn Plant TULLY Melanthaceae

INTRODUCTION

This plant is also called the “Blazing Star’,’. Medicine is prepared from the fresh root gathered before flowering. Just like Murex, this
remedy is chiefly a woman’s remedy and is regarded as a great uterine tonic.

CLINICAL
Albuminuris. Anaemia. Breast affection. Diabetes. Menstrual anomalies. Urinary complaints. Uterine disorder.

SPHERE OF ACTION
It has specific action over the female sexual organs including kidney, mind, muscles.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Generally called for women worn out with hard work mental or physical or weakened by luxury and indolence and who complain of tired feeling in the back and limbs.
2) A consciousness of a womb. Feels it moves when she moves, it is so sore and tender.
3) Feels complaints more when thinking about them, always better when occupied.(Cale. Phos. Medo. Oxalic Acid)
4) Sensation of heaviness and soreness in pelvis.
5) Mind : Profound melancholy and great lowness of spirit. Irritable and fault finding nature. She can not endure least contradiction or receive least suggestion. Restfess,
   wants to move around as she feels better when mind and body are employed. These mentals are always associated with uterine disorder.
6) For the bad effects of abortion and miscarriage.

PARTICULARS
Female genital organs :
Menses :
Time : Too early.
Quantity : Too profuse.
Character of flow: Passive, dark, clotted and offensive.
Concomitant:
i) Anaemic and debilitated states,
ii) Breast swollen, nipples painful and tender. Leucorrhoea : Foul, lumpy and curdled.

Prolapse : Tendency to uterine prolapse due to weakness and general exhaustion of the system.From atony, in women enervated by luxury and indolence. Uterus heavy, sore, tender and ulcerated. A consciousness of womb and it moves when she moves. There is also dragging sensation in sacral region
aggravated from motion and ameliorated when doing something.

Pruritus Vulvae : Intense irritation of the external labia, which are puffed, hot, red, itch and burn terribly. Even mucous surface of labia becomes red, swollen and covered with curdled deposits.

Urinary symptoms :

When affection of kidney is secondary to the uterine trouble. There is constant aching, tenderness and burning over kidneys.

In diabetes : Urine profuse clear saccharine, with great thirst, emaciation, mental restlessness, irritability and melancholiaAlbuminuria : It is needed in acute and chronic stage. In women during pregnancy r with great weaknes, drowsiness and unusual tiredness.
Relations:
Compare : Aletris Far, Lil, Phos.ac.
Similar: to, Alet. in debility from prolapsus, protracted illness, defective nutrition.

CHAPTER :111 HEPAR SULPHUR
Sulphurate of Lime HAHNEMANN (CaS)

INTRODUCTION

Hepar sulph. is a medicine possessing a place of importance no less than Nux vomica, even in the smallest homoeopathic domestic case. Hahnemann’s Hepar sulphuris areum is
prepared by a mixture of equal parts of finely powdered shells and pure flowers of sulphur, kept for ten minutes at a uniform heat. From this the potencies are prepared. Hepar has gained a fame to be a member of one of the celebrated “Boenninghausen’s Group Powders” others being Aconite and Spongia, all in 200th potency.

CLINICAL
Abscess, Asthma, Boils, Breast affection, Bronchitis, Burns, Carbuncles, Chilblain, Chlorosis, Cold, Consumption, Cough, Diarrhoea, Ear affection, Eczema, Erysipelas, Eye
affection, Glandular swellings, Headache, Hoarseness, Jaundice, Laryngitis, Leucorrhoea, Liver affections, Throat and Lung affections, Marasmus, Menstrual
disorders, Pneumonia, Rheumatism, Skin affection, Suppuration, Urinary affection, Urticaria, Whooping cough, etc.

The author highlights how the letter “H’ is appropriate in describing the Hepar patient, as an aid to memory, as follows:

Hepar patient is hypersensitive mentally and physically, to touch, to pain and to cold air. He is hyper impulsive and heavily sweating, hasty in speech and drinking. He has
hoarseness in the morning. Héepar hastens suppuration and cure and is ameliorated by heat, hot fomentation and covering.

SPHERES OF ACTION
Hepar sulph. acts especially upon lymphatic, glandular system, skin, respiratory organ, mucous membrane. Of course, the nerves are not left behind from getting affected
by this drug. It is a powerful remedy affecting both mind and body. This is a first class irritant (or temper, nerves and tissues. Hepar is hyper in all its actions.

PATHOGENESIS
It produces enlargement of lymphatic glands, suppuration, ulcers, eczmatous eruptions, unhealthy skin and a condition of non-healing moist eruption on the folds of
skin. It acts on nerves and causes GREAT IRRITABILITY, OVERSENSITIVENESS AND HYPERSENSITIVENESS. Locally it has special affinity to respiratory mucus
membrane producing croupous catarrh and inflammation and profuse secretion.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Suited to torpid lymphatic constitution, persons with light hair and complexion; muscles are soft and flabby.

Temperament: Irritable temperament: easily excited, slightest cause irritates the patient.

Relation with heat and cold: Highly chilly patient.

Miasm: Mainly anti-psoric. But all the three miasms are covered by Hepar sulph.

Diathesis: Lymphatic and scrofulous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
. Chilly patient, highly sensitive to cold air. Imagines he can feel the air if a door is opened in the next room. Must be wrapped up to the face even in hot weather
(Psor.). Cannot bear to be uncovered (Nux—Cannot bear to be covered—Camphor, Secale cor.).
. The patient is very much OVERSENSITIVE BOTH PHYSICALLY AND MENTALLY. Very sensitive to touch. According to Nash, its strongest characteristic is HYPERSENSITIVENESS to touch, pain and cold air.
. Sweats profusely day and night without any relief, which is sour and offensive. Easily sweats on every mental or physical exertion.
. Sensation of a splinter, fish bone or plug in throat (Arg. nitricum, Nit. acid, Anacardium).
. Diseases where the system has been injured by abuse of mercury.
. All the discharges are very much sour e.g. vomiting, stool, sweat, etc.
. The slightest injury causes suppuration (Graphites, Silicea, Mercurius).onan
. The skin is very sensitive to touch. Cannot bear even clothes to touch the affected parts (Lachesis).
. In diseases where suppuration seems inevitable, Hepar may open the abscess and hasten the cure if applied in low potencies.
. Aggravation: From COLD IN GENERAL, cold air, cold food, uncovering the part.
.Amelioration: From WARMTH IN GENERAL; covering from head to foot, from warm food and drink; IN DAMP WET WEATHER.
. The patient has great CRAVING for sour things, vinegar, wine, acids and strong tasting foods. AVERSION to fatty food; dislike for all kinds of nourishment.

12. Mind : Mentally the patient is very much OVERSENSITIVE AND IRRITABLE. The slightest thing irritates him. Very much impulsive: Mother may have impulse
to throw the child into fire. Impulse to do violence and to destroy.The patient is quarrelsome; hard to get along with; nothing pleases him. Everybody
is disturbed, peevish, easily becomes angry even at least trifles. Anguish in the evening and night, with thoughts of suicide, very much anxious without any reason,
The patient is very quick in action. Hypochondriacal, sad and depressed.

.Aliments from : Abuse of mercury, quinine, suppressed eruption, cold in general, gonorrhoea and syphilis.

PARTICULARS
Headache :
Causation: Exposure to cold and suppressed eruption.
Location: One side of the head and right temple.

Character: Headache when shaking the head or riding. Boring pain every morning. Constant
pressive pain on one side as from a plug or nail. Scalp is very sore and sensitive to touch.

Modalities: Aggravation from cold and amelioration from warmth, covering and in DAMP WET WEATHER.

Concomitants: Vertigo with headache. Boils on the head and neck. Humid eruptions, feel very sore and of foetid odour; itching and burning and sore on scratching.

Gastro-intestinal Symptoms :

Mouth : There is offensive odour from mc*ith. Gums and mouth are painfuil to touch; gums bleed easily. Ulcers in gums and mouth. Toothache after drinking cold things or opening the mouth. Toothache
better in a warm room, from biting teeth together.

Throat : Pressive and constructive sensation in throat. Stitches in the throat which extend to ear. Smarting soreness in throat, worse on swallowing. Sensation as if a fish bone or a splinter were
sticking in the throat. Also sensation of a plug or internal swelling in throat when swallowing.

Stomach : Putrid, bitter, sour, metallic taste arising from stomach. Eructation after eating. Stomach is painful on walking as if it were hanging loose. Frequent, but momentary attack of nausea, followed by
vomiting of bile every morning. Feeling of distension in pit of stomach. There is heaviness and pressure in stomach after a slight meal. Stiching pain in the region of liver when walking, coughing, breathing or
touching it. Colic with dry cough.

Stool : Stool is clay-coloured and soft; sour srneffing and white, containing undigested food particles. Although stool is not hard, it is expelled with great difficulty. Usually diarrhoeic stool with tenesmus.

Urine : Urine is dark and hot; burning, corroding the prepuce. Bladder is weak; flow impeded. Urine is voided slowly without force, drops vertically. Flow intermittent; cannot empty the bladder
thoroughly. The patient has to wait for a long time before he can pass urine (Nat. mur, Staph, Mur, acid).

Respiratory Symptoms :
Cough :
© Causation: From cold air and when any part of the body is uncovered.
¢ Sensation : With cough there is Splinter like sensation in throat as if a fish bone or plug is
sticking in the throat. The throat is very much sensitive to touch.

© Character of cough: Dry cough, deep, rough, barking, DRY, CROUPY COUGH WITH
CHOKING, gagging and with great soreness of chest.

* During cough: The patient goes on coughing and sweating. He coughs and sweats. There is much sweating without any relief.

Modalities: Cough is worse in the morning, from exposure to dry west wind, cold air, cold drinks, before mid-night and towards evening.
Amelioration by warmth and in damp wet weather.
Asthma :
Causation: After suppression of skin eruption.
Character: Breathing difficult, with rattling and wheezing sound in the chest. The patient has to take deep breath with threatened suffocation. 
Modality: The patient must bend head backwards and sit up which gives him temporary relief. Better in DAMP wet weather and by covering the body.

Skin :

Hepar sulph. is a great remedy for skin affection; whatever may be the name of the disease, such as eczema, itch, herpes, psoriasis, urticaria, acne, boils, abscess, rash, eruptions of all catogories. It has
unhealthy suppurating skin. EVERY LITTLE INJURY SUPPURATES (Sulphur, Graphites, Silicea). Theskin is very much sensitive and sore to touch. The skin and eruptions are so sensitive that the
patient cannot bear even the touch of the cloth. Eczema spreads by means of new pimples appearing justabove the old ones. Boils, abscesses and papules are prone to suppuration. Ulcers are very sensitive to
contact, easily bleeding, burning and stinging. Cannot bear to be uncovered; wants to be wrapped up warmly.
In ABSCESSES AND BOILS where suppuration is inevitable, Hepar, if given in high potency, aborts
the abscess and in low potency it hastens suppuration and heals quickly.

Hepar Sulph. is prepared by mixing Calcarea carb, and Sulphur. Its symptoms, however, show widerange of variations, in contrast to sulphur, particularly in relation to skin affections. Both of them are very
good remedies for skin troubles.Both have unhealthy skin and the eruptions suppurate but moresuppuration is found in Hepar, while severe scratching followed by burning is found in Sulphur. Hepar
skirt is highly sensitive: and sore to touch, even of cloth, but it is not so in Sulphur. Hepar is aggravatedby uncovering, whereas Sulphur is relieved by it. Sulphur is aggravated by heat of bed and washing but
Hepar is relieved by hot application and as such wants covering always. Dishcharges of Hepar arecorroding and smell like old cheese, which is not so in Sulphur. Hepar skin sweats profusely without any
telief, but Sulphur skin does not do so. Hepar has splinter-like pain, Sulphur has burning everywhere in its stead.

Comparison :
Between the two great suppurative medicines viz., Hepar and Silica.
The discharge of Hepar are very offensive. Hepar promotes and regulates suppuration in a remarkable manner (second only to Sil,), but is generally required at a stage earlier than Silica (Farrington).
But the genius of the two ‘remedies is dissimilar, because the modalities are poles apart. While Silica has in it, want of self-confidence, lack of “grit”, timidity, sufferings from anticipation as when having to appear
in public—Hepar is sensitive beyond all bounds of reason, irritable and impetuous, sensitive mentally and even subject to sudden murderous impulses.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: From cold air, uncovering, eating and drinking cold things, slightest draught of air, touching affected parts, abuse of Mercury, lying on painful side and in clear fine weather.
Amelioration: Warmth in general, from wrapping up and in damp wet weather (Medo., Nux vom., Causticum—rev. of Natrumsulph).
Relations :
Complementary to: Calendula in injuries of soft-parts.

Anfidofed by: Bell., Cham., Sil.
Antidotes : Nit. ac., lod., Calc. carb.

CHAPTER:112 HYDRASTIS CANADENSIS

Golden Seal BURT Ranunculaceae
Orange Root

INTRODUCTION

Hydrastis is a slow and deep acting remedy.The mother tincture is prepared from fresh root of the plant which is grown.abundantly in the United States of America. It is called “Yellow Root” or “Indian Turmeric” and thrives in various parts of India. It has got particular affinity for the LIVER AND GASTRIC AFFECTIONS resulting in poor digestion and obstinate constipation. The power of Hydrastis over SMALL POX is seen in modifying the disease, abolishing its distressing symptoms, shortening its course, lessening its severity and greatly mitigating its bad effects and completely protecting the patient from its dangerous consequence. This remedy is required in many trophic disturbances where there is emaciation, catarfhal condition and ulceration, even malignant ulcerations.

CLINICAL

Alcoholism, Asthma, Cancer, Catarrh, Constipation, Corns, Dyspepsia, Ear affections, Fistula, Gonorrhoea, Gastric affections, Haemorrhoids, Jaundice, Liver affection,
Leucorrhoea, Throat troubles, Ulcer, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on mucous membrane, especially of respiratory tract, gastro-intestinal tract, glands, liver and skin.
PATHOGENESIS

Acting on mucous membrane, it relaxes them and produces a THICK, YELLOWISH, ROPY, AND STRINGY, VISCID SECRETION, particularly in the catarrhal conditions,
which may be anywhere from the body. It produces a malignant or CACHECTIC DYSCRASIA and also alters the course and severity of small-pox.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: Hydrastis is specially suited to old, easily TIRED PEOPLE, cachectic persons with great debility and scrofulous constitution, which has been broken
down by alcoholism. The skin has a jaundiced look, mottled and puckered, with yellowish white colour of the face.

Temparament: Lymphatic temperament. Relation with heat and cold: Not so well marked.

Miasm: It covers all the three miasms viz. Psora, Syphilis and Sycosis.

Diathesis: Cancerous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Catarrhal condition and diseases- of various parts which are characterised by profuse, thick “YELLOWISH” ROPY AND STRINGY DISCHARGE from mucous membrane such as nose, throat, stomach, urethra, uterus, etc., (Kali bich., Bovista),
2. Cachectic or malignant dyscrasia with derangement of gastric and hepatic functions in persons broken down by excessive use of alcohol.
3. Cancer and pre-cancerous state, ulceration has taken place when pain is the principal symptom. Pains are knife like, sharp and cutting.
4. Cancers are hard and adherent, skin mottled and parched. Nipple retracted (Sars. Sil.).
5. Tongue large and flabby; shows imprint of teeth (Merc.sol., Chel., Podo.). Yellowish white in colour.
6. Constant empty aching “GONE FEELING” at stomach is a grand characteristic of Hydrastis.
7. Constipation is also a leading feature of Hydrastis. With constipation, there is constant pain in head and bad taste in mouth.
8. Leucorrhoea is ropy, thick, viscid and yellowish, hanging from os in long strings (Kali-bich., Bovista), with pruitus vulvae.
9. Profuse perspiration with unhealthy odour, especially in axillae and groin.
10. Intense backache is yet another great symptoms of this remedy.
11. Mind : Depressed mind due to prolonged suffering, weakness and debility. The patient ts sure of his death and he desries and prefers to die.
12. Ailments from : Abuse of mercury, chlorate of potash, alcoholism, ailments caused by syphilis and gonorrhoea.

PARTICULARS

Stomach :
Caused by alcoholism.
Sensation: Empty sinking feeling in the epigastrium.

Character: There is burning pain in stomach, with no appetite, weak digestion, atonic dyspepsia
and catarrhal condition. Nearly all food cause disorder of stomach, particularly bread and vegetables.
Enipty faint feeling is stomach with loathing of food; great weakness and prostration. Feeling of weight
in stomach long after taking food, with pulsation in the epigastrium. Chronic gastric ulcer or cancer with
burning pain.

Modality: Aggravation from food, particularly bread and vegetables.

Concomitants: Sour and yellowish, stringy vomiting, bitter taste in mouth. Dull frontal headache and
fulness of eyes.


Hydrastis Canadensis 

Liver :
Hydrastis is very useful in chronic inflammation of liver, jaundice, gall-stone colic with jaundice

Causation: Liver troubles are mainly due to excessive use of alcohol. Liver is enlarged, hard torpid and nodular, with deranged hepatic function. There is distress in the right hypochondrium. Skin is jaundiced with light or even white stool, showing absence of bile. Large, flabby, yellowish tongue; yellowish skin.

Modalities: Pain aggravated from motion and relieved by rest and also by passing flatus and by pressure.

Rectum -

There is obstinate piles with prolapse of rectum. Anus fissured. Inflammation of anus which causes contraction and spasm of the sphincter ani. Paresis of the rectum which results in most obstinate constipation with no desire for days together. Constipation with feeling of GONENESS in the stomach. Stool is hard and nodular. Smarting pain in anus during and after stool which lasts for a long time.

Respiratory Symptoms :

Hydrastis is indicated in chronic bronchitis, and the symptoms are as follows:-

Sensantion: There is rawness, soreness and burning in the chest.

Character of cough: Cough is dry hard with rattling .of mucus in the chest.

Character of sputa: There is expectoration of thick, YELLOWISH AND TENACIOUS MUCUS. Feeling of suffocation when lying on left side.
Aggravation from lying-on left side.

Concomitants: With cough there is profuse discharge of thick yellow, stringy mucus from nasal passage. Hawks yellow, viscid mucus from the posterior nares and fauces with ulceration.

Modality: Aggravtion from lying on left side (Phos).

Leucorrhoea :

There is THICK, YELLOWISH, ROPY, STRINGY AND VISCID LEUCORRHOEA, hanging from the os in long strings. There is chronic catarrhal condition of the vulva.
Leucorrhoea is worse after menses. It is offensive, acrid and excoriating. Excoriation and erosion of the cervix. Pruritus vulvae with sexual exicitement. Sore in vagina during coition. There is burning pain in vagina with soreness.

Modality: Aggravation after menses and coition.

Concomitants; Leucorrhoea is often associated with pruritus vulvae and sexual excitement.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From motion; skin symptoms by warmth.

Amelioration : By rest and pressure.

Relations :

Antidoes: Merc. Sol.
It is antidoted by: Sulphur.

Indian Pennywort BOILEAU Umbelliferae

CLINICAL

Acne. Elephantiasis. Eczema. Lupus. Leprosy. Pemphigus. Uterus-affection of. Pruritus, Vulvae. In Bengal this remedy goes by the name of “Thankuni”. The skin and the female generative organs are the chief seats of its action, though the liver, the nerves and the mucous membrane are also powerfully acted upon.

CHAPTER: 114 HYOSCYAMUS NIGAR

Henbane HAHNEMANN Solanaceae

INTRODUCTION

Hyoscyamus, one of the TRIO OF DELIRIUM, is also a gift of vegetable kingdom. Like Belladonna and Stramonium, Hyoscyamus too is poisonous in crude from. The fresh root of
the plant is used to prepare mother tincturewhen it possesses maximum medical powers. Poisoning, provings and _ experience of Hyoscyamus show its very definite range of
action as well as different striking resemblances to its natural relation with Belladonna and Stramonium from which it can easily be distinguished.
Hyoscyamus is said to be especially poisonous to fowls, hence the name, but for other animals, it acts like a purgative. Old school uses Hyoscyamus as a “Cerebral depressant” in acute mania, delirium tremens, febrile delirium and insomnia. It is mostly used by them in asylum practice.

CLINICAL

Angina Pecforis, Bronchitis, Brain affections, Chorea, Coma vigil, Cough, Delirum, Diarrhoea, Enteric fever, Epilepsy, Haemorrhage, Headache, Mania, Meningitis,
Neuralgia, Paralysis, Pneumonia, Urinary disorders etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Hyoscyamus acts upon the nervous system, sensorium, muscular system, mucous membrane and skin.

PATHOGENESIS

It irritates nerve centres, producing increased cerebral activity, but non- inflammatory in type, delirium, hysteria and delirium tremens. It also irritates mucous membranes and skin. Its pathogenetic action besides producing epilepsy, melancholia and mania also covers coma vigil. Non-inflammatory increase of cerebral activity may
also be noticed in a few cases. It produces a sensation of fulness and heat of the head with a flushed face without pronounced hyperaemia.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Like other members of the TRIO, Hyoscyamus too is more or less an acute drug and as such, consideration of constitution is not of much importance.
However, these patients are usually light-haired with pale or bluish face.

Temperament: Sanguine, irritable, nervous and hysterical temperament.
Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient (Clarke).

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1 “Increased cerebral activity”, but of a non-inflammatory type can be noticed throughout this drug. Hyoscyamus has many points in common with Belladonna and Stramonium. Each one has got an individuality of its own. Hyoscyamus doeg not produce the intense cerebral congestion and inflammation of Belladonna, nor the intense maniacal delirium and sensorial excitement of Stramonium. In delirium too, Hyoscyamus occupies a place midway between Belladonna and Stramonium. Jt lacks.the constant cerebral congestion of the former and the fierce rage and maniacal delirium of the latter.

2. One peculiar symptom pre-eminently found in Hyoscyamus is “DESIRE TO UNCOVER”. The patient throws off the bed-clothes not because they are too warm, but because he will not remain covered. Wants to expose his body fully.

3. Another striking feature of Hyoscyamus is that the patient HAS NO WANTS AND MAKES NO COMPLAINTS. The patient ceases to complain of his symptoms; he is hot, does not desire to drink; does not know whether to take this or that, does not recognise those around him, he abuses them, makes irrelevant answers, wishes to run away, cries aloud or whines, but without being able to say why he is doing so.

4. Hyoscyamus is famous for its delirium. In delirium it has its own peculiar features. The non-inflammatory type of increased cerebral activity, ridiculous gestures and
display of a comical alienation of mind, and the horrible lascivious mania and the desire to remain uncovered are symptoms peculiar to Hyoscyamus alone.

5. The choreic symptoms of Hyoscyamus are well defined. Every muscle of the body twitches, from the eyes to the toes. There is a constant state of erethysm. Not a single
part of the whole body, or a solitary muscle is in a quiet state for a moment. Convulsive motions, spasm, both tonic and clonic, without consciousness, but with | restlessness are all characteristic of this drug.

6. Fear, suspicion and jealousy prevail always in a Hyoscyamus patient. (Lach..Puls., Rhus tox. Nux vom., Stram.). Fear of being alone; of being poisoned, of being
bitten, being sold. Suspects to eat or drink or to take what is offered; suspicious of some plot, of every body.

7. Intense sleeplessness of irritable, excitable persons, from embarrassment, often imaginary.

8. Mind : Hyoscyamus is a great remedy for distinct and characteristic mental symptprns which are as follows: Diseases with increased mental activity, but of a noninflammatory type: Such as hysteria, delirium tremens or delirium. The patient is very restless. Would not stay in bed. He jumps out of bed and tries to escape. Makes irrelevant answers and thinks that he is in the wrong place; behaves like a mad man; does foolish things; abuses those around him. Talks of imaginary doings, but has no wants and makes no complaints. Low muttering delirium, continues even while awake.The patient is very fearful. He is afraid of everything. FEAR of being alone; of being poisoned; of being bitten or sold. Fears to eat or drink, or to take what is offered.Anxious apprehension.Jealousy and suspicion run through the whole of this remedy. He suspects others of making some plot against him; being , poisoned; being injured etc.In Hyoscyamus, LASCIVIOUS MANIA is of the highest degree. The person will not be covered. Kicks off the clothes, immodesty; exposes the person. Sings obscene songs, lies completely naked in bed and chatters..He is inclined to laugh at everything; incoherent speech even followed by epilepsy. Silly expression and loquacity, cries and laughs alternately..Stupor and unconsciousness are well-marked in this drug. The patient does not reply or gives irrelevant answers. Does not recognise anyone. Sometimes answers properly, but stupor returns at once..Illusion and delusions of all senses. Sees persons who are not actually present there. Thinks he is in a wrong place.

9. Aliments from : Fear, fright, intestinal worms, unfortunate love, jealousy and rage.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: Fear, fright, jealousy and rage.

Location: Headache is usually felt in the forehead.

Sensation: Swashing sensation in the brain.

Character: Pressing and stupefying pain in the forehead. Brain feels as if were loose. The patient

shakes the head to and fro or rolls head from side to side.

Modality: Aggravation at night, by mental affections, during menses and when lying down.

Concomitants: Confusion and vertigo as from intoxication, hiccough and dimness of vision.

Cough :

There is dry spasmodic cough, especially at night. The cough is worse and aggravated by lving down, but relieved by sitting up (Drosera, Belladonna, Croton tig., Rumex). Cough compels the Patient to sit up and when he does so, there is appreciable relief and the cough disappears. Cough is aggravated at night after eating, drinking, talking and singing.

Urine :

For paralysis of bladder after labour with subsequent retention or incontinence of urine. For no desire to urinate in lying-in woman, Hyoscyamus is an excellent remedy (Arn., Opium)

Fever :
.In Pneumonia, Broncho-pneumonia or even influenza which tunrs towards typhoid, its pecular mental symptoms and delirium are very valuable guides (see Mind).

.During fever, the sensorium is clouded; with staring eyes; grasping at flocks, and picking up of bed clothes. Subsultus tendinum and carphology are well marked.
Typhoid state may also prevail.

.Tongue is dry and unwieldy; dry or brown; cracked, parched and white; looks like burnt leather.

 Tongue paralysed; difficult speech. Tongue protruded wife difficulty, can hardly draw it in.

.Teeth are covered with sordes. Breath is offensive, putrid and bad taste in the mouth.

.The patient may also pass involuntary stool and urine.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: In the evening and at night, from mental affections, from jealousy, unhappy love, cold air, from approach of menstruation, when lying down and from touch.

Amelioration : On stooping, from sitting (cough), motion, walking and warmth.

Relations : ,

Follows Belladonna well in deafness after apoplexy. After Hyoscyamus, Phosphorous often cures lasciviousness. Nux or Opium, in haemoptysis of drunkards.

Antidoted by: Vinegar, Belladonna, Camphor, Cinchona, Stram. Hyoscyamus antidotes Belladonna, Plumbum, Stram.

Remedies following well: Bell., Puts., Stram., Ver. alb.

Comparison Belladonna Hyoscyamus

1. Onset Sudden and violent. Gradual.
2. Delirium Violent and furious. Low muttering.
3. Mania Violent and furious. Lascivious.
4. Fever High rise of temperature. Low grade, temperature.
5. Face Red. Pale or bluish.
6. Melancholia Not marked. Well marked.
7. Suspicion and jealousy Not present. Well marked.
8. Jerking of muscles Not much. Every muscle jerks.
9. Throbbing of carotids Present. Not present.
10. Physical weakness Not found. Well marked.
11. Typhoid state Not present. Present.

CHAPTER:115 HYPERICUM

t. John’s Wort C. HERING Hypericaceae

INTRODUCTION

Hypericum is a remedy from the vegetable kingdom. The plant grows well in Europe, Asia and Africa. The mother tincture is perpared from the whole blooming plant.

CLINICAL

Bruises, Fractures, Corns, Diarrhoea, Headache, Paralysis, Neuralgia, Rheumatism, Sciatica, Spinal irritation, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Its action directly influences spinal cord, brain and the whole nervous system.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes irritation of spinal cord and nerves producing vesicular erethysm and congestion.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Hypercium is suited to mechanical injuries of spinal cord, bad effects of spinal concussion and pains after fall on coccyx.

. It is especially suited for injuries of PART RICH IN SENTIENT NERVES.

. Punctured wounds or injuries from treading on nails.

. It prevents lock-jaw as in tetanus.

. It preserves integrity of torn and lacerated parts when almost seperated from the body (Calendula).

. For all consequences of bad effects from shock, fright or mesmerism, Hypericum is a good remedy.

. It modifies and arrests ulceration, sloughing and tetanus after traumatic injuries.

. Vertigo with sensation, as if, the head became suddenly elongated with urging to urinate.

. Headache after a fall on coccyx with sensation as if being lifted up into the air.

. Bunions and corns with severe excruciating pain showing involvement of nerves.

. Convulsion after blow on head or concussion.

. Ailments from : Mechanical injuries of spinal cord, spinal concussion, fall on coccyx, injuries of any kind, rat bites.

PARTICULARS

Injury :
Hypericum is an excellent remedy for injuries involving NERVES, the symptoms of which are as

follows:-
Causation: Injuries are caused by mechanical affections of spinal cord, bad effects of spinal concussion, pains after a fall on coccyx. Punctured, incised or lacerated wounds, whidh are very sore and painful. Injuries from nails, needles, rat-bites, with severe pain as from splinters. Injuries of parts which are RICH IN SENTIENT NERVES, such, as fingers, toes, matrices of nails, palms and soles, having intolerable pain, indicating that nerve are severely involved.Nervous depression following wounds or surgical operation. It also removes bad effects of shock, fright or mesmerism.Hypericum is capable of modifying and sometimes arresting ulceration and sloughing (Calendula); crushed and smashed finger tips or tetanus after traumatic injuries. Hypericum also can preserve the integrity of a torn and lacerated member when it is almost entirely separated from the body.Convulsion and spasm after injury, blow or concussion, especially of head. Excessive pain and.soreness of the affected parts. Violent pain and inability to walk or stoop. Feeling of weakness and trembling of all the limbs and numbness and cramping feeling.Spine is very sensitive to touch after a fall; slight touch of arms or neck causes severe pain and the patient screams and cries with pajn.

Headache :

There is severe headache after a fall upon coccyx. During headache, there is sensation as if being lifted up high into the air and consequently there is a great anxiety of falling from the height.

Vertigo :

Vertigo with sensation as if the head suddenly became elongated; especially at night with urging to urinate.

For bunions and corns (Antim crud., Ran. bulb.), with severe excruciating pain, showing involvement of nerves, Hypericum is a gret remedy.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: In cold dampness; in fog, in a closed room, least exposure, touch.

Amelioration: Bending head backwards.

Relations :
Compare: Arnica, Calendula, Ruta, Staph. In wounds where formerly Aconite and Arnica were given alternately, Hypericum cures.

Antidoted by: Arsenic.

Antidotes: Sulphur.

CHAPTER:116 IGNATIA AMARA


IGNATIA AMARA

St. Ignatius’ Bean HAHNEMANN Loganiaceae

INTRODUCTION

Ignatia is famous as “a REMEDY OF GREAT CONTRADICTIONS”. It is A WOMEN REMEDY, and is the “feminine” of “masculine” Nux-vomica. The deep insight of Hahnemann penetrated into the curative value of this very useful drug. All the leading physicians, from time to time, were undoubtedly unanimous about its very contradictory nature as verified in the daily practices but for every true practitioner this is an indispensable remedy. The full implication of the numerous contradictory symptoms of the drug on one hand and those of the actual disease on the other, for which this remedy is aptly used with sure success, can hardly be understood by any person without exercising his prudence. Still the utility of the remedy has been well recognised by one and all, in their own way through daily practice.

CLINICAL

Abdominal disorders, Anxiety, Appetite, Chorea, Convulsion, Constipation, Croup, Debility, Genital organs, Epilepsy, Flatulence, Haemorrhoids, Headache, Heart affection,
Hysteria, Intermittent fever, Locomotor ataxia, Menstrual disorders, Melancholia, Numbness, Paralysis, Sleep, Throat and respiratory troubles, ete.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Ignatia’s domain of action is predominantly on entire nervous system, especially medulla oblongata, spinal cord and consequently the whole nervous system.

PATHOGENESIS

It acts especially on medulla oblongata and spinal nervous system, producing convulsion, spasm, chorea, hysteria and dyspnoea; intense acuteness of nerves resulting
in HYPERAESTHESIA, EMOTIONAL DISTURBANCES. INCOORDINATION AND VARIOUS CONTRADICTORY SYMPTOMS.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: Dark looking lady, with dark hair and dark complexion.

Temperament: Nervous temperament, VERY SENSITIVE, easily excited, quick in Perception and rapid in execution.

Relation with heat and cold: No definite stamping can be made on this aspect due to the contradictory nature of the drug. The patient is, however, affected by cold, pain, touch, odour, noise, etc.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

It is a remedy of great contradiction, such as, 

(a) Roaring in ears relieved by music,

(b) Sore throat relieved by swallowing solid,

(c) Liquid is more painful than solid to swallow,

(d) Cough is aggravated by more coughing,

(e) Cough more on standing, less or nil on walking,
 
(f) Empty feeling in the stomach not relieved by eating, 

(g) Piles relieved when walking, 

(h) Piles protrude when the stool is soft, but not during hard stool,
 
(i) Prolapse of anus with soft stool, 

(j) Spasmodic laughter from grief instead of weeping, 

(k) Sexual desire with impotency.
 
(1) Thirst during chill and heat without thirst. Red face during chill, pale during heat .

(m) Relieved by external heat and aggravated hoovering,
 
(n) Mental conditions suddenly change from joy to sorrow and vice versa.

ltw1ltw1Long involuntary sighing.

Hypersensitiveness to all external impressions, such as pain, touch, odour, noise,etc. Pain, on a small spot that can be covered with the tip of a finger (Kali. bich,).
All symptoms are caused and aggravated by tobacco. There is utter inability to TOLERATE TOBACCO IN ANY FORM.There is sweat on face or on the tip of the nose on a small spot only while eating.Desire for cold food, acid things, onion, fruit, bread, butter, great variety of undigestible things and wants to be alone. Aversion to work, meat, milk, warm food,open air and mental exertion.

Mind : Ignatia patient develops peculiar mental conditions which are as follows:-

Mental symptoms are caused by ill effects of bad news, fright, anger, grief, vexation, disappointed love, suppressed sexual desire, reserved displeasure and a feeling of
shame and mortification. There is RAPIDLY CHANGING mental condition from laughing to weeping; from joy to sorrow, one moment excessively happy, the next moment in rage, etc.

The patient broods in solitude over imaginary troubles; full of suppressed grief. Involuntary sighing (Lachesis, Calc. phos.).

Desires, tobe alone, MOODY. Taciturn, sad, melancholic and indifferent.There is weakness of memory. Unreasonable; howls and cries; slightest fault finding or contradictions excite anger; very short-tempered patient. jgnatia Amara  Finely sensitive mood and delicate conscience. Inconsistent, impatient, irresolute and quarrelsome. Good-natured when well, but quickly disturbed by slightest emotion and easily offended. Persons physically and mentally exhausted by long CONTINUED AND

Consolation aggravates all troubles (Hell., Nat. mur., Lil. tig., Silicea, Sepia).

9. Ailments from : Anger, grief, disappointed love, fear, jealously, suppressed sexual desire, bad news, vexation with reserved displeasure, suppressed mental suffering
   from shame and mortification, TOBACCO, coffee, tea and alcohol.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation: From TOBACCO, anger, grief, sorrow, bad news and suppressed mental sufferings.

Character of pain: There is congestive and throbbing headache. Heavy headache as if a nail was driven through the side, relieved by lying on it. Throbbing pain at occiput with every beat of heart.

Modalities: Headache is worse on stooping, jar and motion by SMOKING OR SMOKING

TOBACCO worse when pressing for stool relieved by lying on painful side and by profuse urination (Gels

Mouth : While talking or chewing bites inside of cheek. Stitching pain in the palate, extending to ear. Toothache from drinking coffee or from tobacco smoking, sour test in mouth.

 Causation: From grief, anger, bad news, SUPPRESSED MENTAL FEELING. etc.

Relations :
Ignatia, bears the same relation to the diseases of women that Nux does to sanguine, bilious men.

CHAPTER : 117 IODUM

Iodine HAHNEMANN The Element

INTRODUCTION

It is a drug proved and recorded in chronic diseases by Hahnemann, who speaks of it as a heroic medicine, even when employed in the highest
potency. Iodine, belongs to a family of Halogens, others being Chlorine, Bromine and Fluorine. If atall a student wants to remember lodum in rhymes,
the following few lines may be helpful.

“Ravenous Iodine howls for her dinner,
Eats much sand eats often, but only grows thinner,Her phenomenal meals she’s ever repeating,
Because all her Symptoms are better by eating,She is fidgety, fearful, unable to rest;
While, she eats, while she wkfqalks, in the cold, she feels best Air her glands (save the mammae) congested appear, With corrosive, destructive to clothes leucorrhoea.”

CLINICAL

Appetite disordered, Atrophy, Brain affection, Constipation, Consumption, Cough,Debility, Diarrhoea, Diptheria, Goitre, Glandular affection, Headache, Heart affection,
Jaundice, Laryngitis, Leucorrhoea, Liver affection, Menstrual disorders, Pneumonia,
Rheumatism, Rickets, Throat and lung affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

lodum especially acts on all the glandular system, lymph glands, thyroid, liver.
spleen, breasts, ovaries, testes, salivary glands, etc. Mucus membrane of eyes, nose.
respiratory tract and even blood vessels are not spared from its action.

PATHOGENESIS

When acting on the glandular system, it leads to HYPERTROPHY, ENLARGEMENT AND INDURATION, EXCEPTING THE BREASTS WHICH DWINDLE AND ATROPHY. The hypertrophy of glands is at the expense of muscles, generalised get Constricted, vaso-constriction, capillary congestion followed by oedema, ecchymosis
haemorrhage and nutritive disturbances.



CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Persons of dark or black hair and eyes with a low cachectic condition. Profound debility and GENERAL EMACIATION overgrown body with hypertrophy and induration of gland.

Temperament: Irritable temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Very HOT PATIENT, RATHER he is the HOTTEST patient. ‘

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Scroufulous diathesis with glandular enlargement. Tubercular diathesis,

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Ravenous hunger; feels relieved while eating and after eating.

2. Losing flesh while eating well (Abrot., Nat. mur., Tuber.).

3. All glands of the body are HYPERTROPHIED AND ENLARGED EXCEPT THE MAMMARY GLAND.

4, All the symptoms are WORSE FROM WARMTH in general and better from cold in general e.g. cold air.

5. Profound debility and loss of breath on going upstairs.

6. Discharges are acrid and corrosive ».g. foot-sweat, leucorrhoea, etc.

7. Pulsation all over the body e.g. stomach, back, even arms and fingers.

8. Sensation of constriction and squeezing, especially in heart.

9. Intense restlessness with apprehension.

10. Mind : The lodum patient is very much weak in mind; forgetfrul, cannot remember a little thing. He forgets what he was about to say or to do. The forgetfulness is
extensive. There is great anxiety, especially when quiet, with depression. The patient must keep himself busy. Though mentally exhausted, he is compelled to keep busy and continue the work. Again there is Sudden impulse to do some violence; he wants to do something hurriedly; he has impulse to kill. In this it is very closely related to Aresenic, Hepa® and Natrum Sulph.—all these have got impulse to murder without any cause but the difference is in sensitiveness to heat. While lodum is very warm blooded, others are always chilly.

PARTICULARS

Gastro-intestinal Symptoms :

Stomach : Throbbing pain at the pit of stomach. Empty eructation day and night as if every particle of food were turned into air (Kali carb.). Indigestion from over-eating with much flatulence, sour eructation and belching. jodum There is RAVENOUS HUNGER, suffers from hunger; must eat every few hours; anxious and worried w1bd268bd268ltw1 if he does not eat; feels relieved while eating or after eating and when stomach Is full (Anacardium, Chelidonium, Psorinum, Sepia).

Respiratory System :

Throat : Enlarged thyroid Goitre with sensation of the constriction. Sub-maxillary glands are

swollen.

children. :

 Stage: lodum is ideally suited to the hepatisation stage of pneumonia.

 Location: Right side of lung affected.

Uterus is enlarged with tedency to menorrhagia. There is wedge-like pain from ovary to uterus. Swelling and induration of uterus and ovaries.

Time: At the time of menses.

Quantity: Profuse and abundant.

Character: Thick, slimy, acrid, corrosive, staining and corroding the linen, Leucorrhoea with swelling and induration of cervix. The Leucorrhoea js thick, slimy and sometimes bloody. Leucorrhoea is most abundant at the time of menses, rendering things sore and corroding the clothes.

Glandular System :

Hypertrophy of all glands of the body, except the breasts. Hypertrophy runs through the whole remedy.

There is enlargement of liver, spleen, ovaries, testes, lyrriphatic glands, cervical glands, i.e. all sorts of glands, except mammary glands, The mammae dwindle while all other glands become enlarged, hard




and nodular. This enlargement is mostly found in the lymphatic system, especially of abdomen and mesenteric glands.

lodum Baby : Especially suited to those children who are dark and have black hair and eyes. The baby is VERY HOT, rather the HOTTEST BABY, there is aggravation from warmth

CHAPTER :118

IPECACUANHA

Ipecac HAHNEMANN Rubiaceae

INTRODUCTION

Ipecacuanha is an interesting drug standing on the ceasefire line between the absolutely opposite ways of therapeutics. Old school usuallystudies, experiments with and uses drug for their physiological actions and lays down maximum non-lethal doses for adults and children, while Homoeopathy uses them for their exactly opposite effect and in dynamic dose for vital stimulation. Ipecac is interesting as being one of the drugs that Allopathy uses to cure Homoeopathically. It is used in both ways, in fact
to PROVOKE AND TO CURE VOMITING. According to Hahnemann Ipecac is a short acting medicine.

CLINICAL

Anaemia, Asthma, Bone affection, Chorea, Convulsion, Constipation, Colic, Cough,Diarrhoea, Deafness, Dysentery, Eye affection, Fever, Gall-stone colic, Gastric ulcer,
Haematemesis, Haemorrhage, Menstrual disorders, Nausea and vomiting, Pregnancy disorders, Stomach disorders, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

The chief action is on the ramification of the pneumogastric nerve, on medulla oblongata, on mucous membrane of respiratory and gastro-intestinal tract and arterial
vascular system.

PATHOGENESIS

When acting on pneumogastric nerve, it produces spasmodic irritation in chest and stomach, the former gives rise to ASTHMA and latter to NAUSEA AND VOMITING.
When acting on mucus membrane, it produces a catarrhal condition, pulmonary congestion, even hepatisation, nausea and vomiting.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: It is especially suited to stout persons of lax fibre; fair people; women and children; emphysematous persons; persons who have a history of epistaxis
and other forms of blood loss. Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Temperament: Irritable temperament.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Haemorrhagic diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Most of its acute complaints commence with NAUSEA and VOMITING or all complaints requiring Ipecac are attended more or less with nausea. Nausea constant, continuous and persistent with or without vomiting. Nausea not relieved by vomiting. Thirstlessness runs through the whole drug (Nux-mos., Puls., Aethusa, Gels., Apis). Clean tongue (Cina) with much saliva, but no thirst.

4 Bright red haemorrhage from natural orifices like nostrils, mouth and especially from uterus.

5. Oppressed breathing especially with respiratory and/or gastric complaints. Anxiety about the stomach is very much prominent.

6. Cold sweat on forehead (Carbo veg., Ver. alb.).

7. Wheezing and rattling of chest without expectoration especially in respiratory troubles of earlyistage (late stage rattling, Antim tart.).

8. Desire for sweets and dainties. Aversion to all food.

9. Mind : The person is irritable and short tempered. Full of desire for many things

10.out which he knows nothing, in other words, desire for a number of things without knowing exactly what it is and what it is for. The person is very much oversensitive, cannot endure east noise. Children cry, howl and scream continuously without any cause.

Ailments from : Undigestible food, raisins, cakes, anger, reserved displeasure, injuries, suppressed eruption, quinine.

PARTICULARS

Gastro-intestinal tract :

Mouth : Clean tongue with no thirst.
Copious secretion of saliva; constantly obliged to swallow saliva, Often indicated in salivation during

pregnancy.

Stomach : Should be thought of in ALL DISEASES WHICH COMMENCE OR ARE ATTENDED WITH continuous and persistent nausea and even vomiting but without any relief to the patient such as, in gastritis, cholera, abdominal pain, dysentery, bronchitis, pneumonia, asthma and intermittent fever etc. In such symptoms Ipecac tops the list.

Modality: Nausea not relieved by vomiting; vomiting of white glairy mucus in Jarge quantities or of green jelly like mucus.


Ipecacuanha 335_

Diarrhoea :

Causation: Undigestible food, raisins, cakes, anger and suppressed eruptions.

Character of stool: “Green mucus, as green as grass, but black stool looking like frothy molasses also indicates this remedy occasionally.

Concomitants: Colicky pain around umbilicus with nausea, clean tongue and no thirst. Asiatic cholera where nausea and vomiting predominate, with clean tongue and no thirst. The patient becqmes drowsy and sleepy after vomiting (Aeth), aggravation from slightest-motion.

Colic :

Causation: Flatulent colic, gall-stone colic.

Location: Colic around the region of navel, cutting pain across abdomen as from a knife, goes from left to right.

Sensation: Cutting pains, gripping pains as though intestine were tightly grasped with hands.

Concomitants: Nausea, vomiting, clean tongue and no thirst.

Respiratory system :

Pneumonia : Most of the symptoms are indicated in early stage ot the disease with all general characteristic symptoms of pneumonia. Pneumonia of infants. In infantile pneumonia chest loaded with mucus, rapid wheezing respiration, blueness of skin and pale face. Although the chest seems full of phlegm, and there is so much of fine rattling, the phlegm does not seem to yield to cough. Cough causes nausea and vomiting. There may be wheezing with threatened suffocation.

Asthma : Spasmodic form of attack, with violent contraction and constriction in throat and chest. Threatened suffocation from constriction. Wheezing is present, nothing is expectorated.

* Modality: Aggravation by motion.

* Concomitants: With nausea vomiting, clean tongue and no thirst.Cough. Cough is dry, spasmodic, constricted and asthmatic. Incessant and violent with every breath.

Whooping cough : Child loses breath, turns pale or blue in face, stiff; strangling with gagging and vomiting of mucus, bleeding from nose and mouth. Every fresh attack sets in with a long-drawn difficult, howling and sighing inspiration.

Haemorrhage : Ipecac is a GREAT HAEMORRHAGIC REMEDY. Bleeding from all orifices of the body, from uterus, bowels, kidney, stomach, nose, lungs, etc. Character of the blood is profuse and steady flow of BRIGHT RED BLOOD.

Concomitants: Nausea, oppressed breathing, thirstlssness and clean tongue.

Bones :

Bones of skull feel bruised; Pain enters from teeth and root of tongue. Pains as if bones were all torn into pieces (Lac can, Tuber). Pains as from a bruise in all the bones. :

Intermittent fever : Ipecac is indicated almost in all cases of malaria if symptoms tally. Causation: Malarial fever drugged with quinine and arsenic. Relapses with irregularities and indiscretion in diet.

Before chill: Yawning, stretching and waterbrash in mouth. Chill; Short chill, chill more in warm room, from external heat.




* During Chill: Icy coldness of hands and feet; redness of one cheek and paleness of the other. Prostration, lassitude and weakness, most pronounced chill.

* Heat: Long lasting with nausea, vomiting with or without oppressed breathing.

Sweat: Sour sweat mainly on upper part of the Body (quantity of sweat is profuse only if quinine had been abused),

N.B. When indications are not sharp, or when a case does not present itself with a well defined symptomatic featurejperac serves to clear up the case and paves the way to some other remedy, the symptoms of which will then manifest themselves.

General Modalities : 

Aggravation: Periodically, winter, dry weather and least motion.

Amelioration : By rest, pressure and closing eyes.

Relations :


Complementary to: Cuprum met.

Compare: With Antim. tart, Ipecac has more nausea, clean tongue, but Antim. tart, has mere retching and vomiting and thick coated tongue.

It antidotes: Arn., Ars., Nux vom.

Antidoted by: Alum., Apis., Arn., Ars., Dulc., Ferrum., Op., Sulph., Ant. tart.

Potassium bichromate—readily available from mineral kingdom has attained a position in the Homoeopathic Materia Medica because of some very marked and characteristic features, all its own. CLINICAL

Abdominal and stomach disorders, Anaemia, Asthma, Bronchitis, Bone affection, Catarrh, Cough, Constipation, Diphtheria, Dyspepsia, Exostosis, Eye affection, Fever,

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts mainly on the mucous membrane, skin, glands, kidney, fibrous tissue and periosteum. :


PATHOGENESIS

It is an irritant of mucous membrane causing erosion, ulceration and SECRETING TOUGH AND STRINGY DISCHARGES a hallmark of the remedy. Mucous membranes
especially acted upon, are those of the respiratory and alimentary tracts. Kidneys, when affected, show congestion and inflammation. Urine becomes albuminous. Skin, just like mucous membrane, ulcerates discharging the characteristic discharge with papules and pustules. Periosteum is congested and inflamed. Nasal septum may be totally destroyed.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up : Fatty persons having light hair, fine complexion and suffering from catarrhal affections, Babies are fat, chubby and Short necked (Long neck, Nat.
mur.), disposed to croup and croupy affections,

Relation with heat and cold ; Chilly patient.

Miasm. It covers all the three miasms, but especially syphilis is in the background.

KALI BROMATUM

Potassium Bromide K Br

INTRODUCTION

Potassium Bromide occurs as a colourless or white odourless or white cubical crystals or granules. It is odourless and has a pungent saline taste. It abates all forms of nervousness,fidgetiness or even spasms and creates a tendency to mental calm and indifference.The greater part of the pathogenesis of this drug is made of symptoms observed in Allopathic overdosing though it has been proved.

CLINICAL

Acne. Aphasia, Asthma, Cholera infantum. Cough-colic. Diabetis. Epilepsy, Gout. Impotence. Locomotor ataxy. Nightmare. Paralysis. Paralysis agitans. Psoriasis. Self-
abuse. Sensibility. Sleeplessness. Somnambulism. Stammering. Speech -affections of.Urine-incontinence of.

SPHERES OF ACTION

This remedy acts profoundly on mind, cerebro-spinal nervous system, skin and sexual organs.


PATHOGENESIS

The prolonged administration of the Bromide of Potassium, produces a peculiar state of the system and is known as Bromism. Kali Brom. affects the mind and nerves producing failure of mental power, general numbness, and anaesthesia of mucous membrane esp. of eyes, throat and skin, weakens the heart and lowers temperature.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make up : Kali Brom. is more particu-larly adapted to persons inclined to obesity ; to children ; to nervous women.

Termperament: Patient is depressed, melancholic and weepy. Relation with heat and cold: There is no stamping heat-cold relation. Patient is heither hot nor chilly.

Miasm : Psora & Syphilis are in the background.


GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Loss of memory : forgets how to talk; absentminded ; has to be told the word before the can speak it (Anac.).

2) Loss of sensibility of the fauces, larynx, urethra, entire body.

3) Fidgety hand ; hands and fingers in constant motion.

4) Nervous, restless, cannot sit still, must move about on keeping occupied.

5) Staggering, uncertain gait ; feels as if the legs were all over side-walk.

8) Nervous cough during pregnancy ; hard, dry, almost incessent cough ; threatening abortion. (Con.)

There is fits on uncontrollable weeping with profound melancholic delusions and feeling of moral deficiency. Brain Fag. He is nervous, restless, cannot sit still, must move about or keep occupied. Loss of memory, forgets how to talk, has to be told the word before he can speak it.Fear of being poisoned. Night terrors of children, with grinding of teeth in sleep. Child screams, moans and cries. KALI CARBONICUM
Potassium Carbonate HAHNEMAN K,CO,

INTRODUCTION

Postassium carbonate, from which this treasure has been prepared, is a drug about which Farrington says, Kali carb. is indicated in a great variety of diseases, but is a drug much neglected in everyday practice, perhaps because, except in a few of its uses, as in Asthma andPneumonia, it does not appeal strongly enough tothe imagination and, therefore, is not—so to speak “on the spot,” Kent says about the Kali carb. patient, “The Kali carb. patient is a hard one to study and the remedy itself is a hard one to study.” It is a right sided medicine.

CLINICAL

Aneamia, Asthma, Backache, Biliousness, Catarrh, Cough, Cold, Consumption, Ear and Eye affections, Gastralgia, Haemorrhage, Headache, Haemorrhoids, Hysteria, Kidney affection, Liver affection, Menstrual discrders, Preganancy disorders, Stomach and abdominal disorders, Sciatica, Throat and lung affections, Urinary troubles, Uterine affection, Vertigo, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Kali carb. acts specifically on the respiratory mucus membrane, digestive tract, and upon the ovaro-uterine system, heart, liver, kidney, etc.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces a condition of excessive irritation giving rise to a state bordering on inflammation, yet hardly reaching that point. The serous and mucous membrane become extremely dry, as a result of which there is SHARP STITCHING PAIN, enfeebles the heart, lowers the temperature, causes anaemia, promotes tissue waste, increases the amount of urine and its solid constituents especially uric acid and urea.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: The patient is dark skinned and haired, but of lax fibres with inclination to obesity. Especially helpful in diseases of old people who are fleshy with dropsical condition. Kali Carbonicum

CHAPTER 127 LAC CANINUM

LAC CANINUM

Dog's Milk SWAN

INTRODUCTION

Lac caninum is an animal product, used as food of early animal life and, therefore, corresponds to the, beginning of our innermost physical nature. In crude and natural state, milk is a complete food, but when it is potentised it is an infallible remedy for many diseases, if symptoms correspond. Persons who dislike milk will become sick from taking it in. potentised form. It is one of the ‘Ladies Remedies’.

CLINICAL

Breast affection, Backache, Female sexual ovans, Headache, Menstrual disorders, Leucorrhoea, Neuralgia, Nose and Throat
affection, Rheumatism, Sciatica, Stomach affection, Uterine troubles, Vaccinosis, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Lac caninum acts especially upon the mucous membrane, female uro-genital system, uterus, cervix, throat and mind.

PATHOGENESIS

In the throat it produces an inflammation, particularly of the left side; of course, it extends to right side, but again settles back to the left. It inflames and congests the ovaries and uterus.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Alteration of sides is a great characteristic of this remedy e.g., in diphtheria, rheumatism, pain and even eczema.

2. Erratic disposition of symptoms such as pain constantly flying from one part to another which is yet another striking feature of Lac can.

3. Hyperaesthesia of skin and all parts is another keynote symptoms of Lac can., e.g. during,diphtheria and tonsillitis throat becomes       exceedingly sensitive to touch (Lach).

4. Chronic blue condition, everything seems dark.

5. SHINING, GLAZED APPEARANCE OF THROAT during diphtheria, chancres in syphilis and ulcers having glistening look reminds of this remedy.

6. Breasts and throat get sore at menstrual period. They cannot bear jar; must hold them firmly when stepping up or going downstaris.

7. The patient is very hungry; cannot eat enough, as hungry after eating as before. Faintness in the stomach, with sinking feeling in    epigastrium. EI Discharge of flatus from vagina (Lyco., Nux mos., Sang.).

9. While walking seems to be walking in the air, when lying does not seem to touch the bed.

10. Mind : Very forgetful, absent-minded; makes purchases and walks, away without them ; forgets her own name. In writing makes mistakes; uses 
too many words, but not the right one, omits the final letter. Cannot concentrate the mind to read or study. Fears to be alone (Kali carb.), of 
dying, of becoming insane. The patient is Very much nervous, fears of falling downstairs. Despondent, hopeless, thinks her disease is incurable; 
has not a friend living; nothing worth living for her; could weep at any moment. Attack of rage with cursing and swearing at slightest 
provocation (Lilium tig. Nitric acid, Anac.). Another strange state is that when walking she seems to be on air and when lying

seems as if she is not on the bed and touching the floor. Visions of snakes. (Lach).

PARTICULARS

Headache :

* Amelioration: By going into open air.

Modalities:

 Amelioration: By cold and cold drinks.

In throat troubles, it differs from Lachesis where left side of the throat is affected. Both are very much sensitive to touch. But in Lachesis, there is DARK BLACK, BLUISH, PURPLE COLOUR of the membrane whereas in Lac can., there is SHINING. GLAZED APPEARANCE OF diphtheritic membrane.
In Lac can., the pain shoots to the ear. This is not found in Lachesis. Aggravation after sleep of Lachesis is not present in Lac can.

Inflamed breast.
