CLINICAL

Constipation. Dropsy. Diabetes. Headache. Vomiting. Globus hystericus. Menses suppressed. Obesity. Lactation defective.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make up—pale, sickly, anaemic look, wornout, wasted persons with sallow complexion. Relation with heat & cold: Chilly patient. The patient is chilly all the time even in warm room, near fire. Miasm : Psora and syphilis in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Great prostration is felt whether she does anything or not, great fatigue when walking.

2) It is one of the top most medicines for sick headache.

3) Constipation : Stool large, hard, painful, extorting cries.

4) Aversion to milk.

5) “Milk sickness”—It is most useful and frequently needed remedy for those who cannot take milk, who suffer from various complaints    like  disordered stomach, headache etc.

6) It is used in cases of defecient milk secretion in young mothers, (to dry up milk- Asaf., Lac Can.)

7) Menses : Delayed or suppressed by putting hands in cold water, drinking a glass of milk will promptly suppress flow until next period.

8) Great restlessness, extreme and protracted suffering from loss of sleep (Coc., Nit. Ac.)

9) Globus hystericus : Sensation of a large ball rising from stomach to throat, causing sense of suffocation (Asaf., Kal.)

10) Sensation : as if cold air was blowing on her, even while covered up, as if sheets were damp.

11) Nausea and vomiting : With no relation to eating. First there is vomiting of undigested food, instensely acid, then of bitter water, of     pregnancy.

12) Causations : Injuries, milk, loss of sleep, defective nutri-tion, putting hands in cold water, suppressed malaria.
 
13) Mind : Mentally the patient is despondent, he does not care to live and has no fear of death, but is sure he is going to die.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Causation : Milk, loss of sleep.

Location : Begins in forehead extending to occiput (Bry., Nux V., Sepia, Tuber.).

Sensation : As if head would burst. There is also a sensation as if top of head was lifted off and brain was coming out.

Character of pain : The pain is most excruciating and unbearable. Intense throbbing pain in forehead.

Modalities : Aggravation—In morning on rising, noise, light, motion, during menses, conversation. periodically (every 8 days).

Amelioration : Pressure, tight bandaging, profuse urination, cold application.

Concomitant : Headache in anaemic, chilly patients who have tendency to constipation. Headache associated with intense photophobia, great               postration, nausea and vomiting and blindness. Headache alternating with tonsillitis (Clarke).

Constipation : It is needed in inveterate, intensely chronic cases where the most powerful purgative fails. It is usually associated with periodical headache and vomiting. The feaeces are dry hard and large and they lacerate anus extorting cries with ineffectual urging. Dropsy : It has been used in dropsy from organic heart disease or weak heart, from chronic liver complaint, far advanced albuminuria also from suppressed malaria.

Relations :

Compare : Nat. Mur.



CHAPTER:129  LACHESIS


Surukuku Snake Poison HERING Ophidia


INTRODUCTION

Of all the remedies derived from snake poison, Lachesis predominantly leads and serves as the most, valuable one. The curative power of
this virulent venom of Surukuku Snake of South America, was quite unknown untill Dr. Constantine Hering had potentised and proved it first on himself, to be of immense benefits for millions. The idea GREATER THE POISON, GREATER THE REMEDY eventually struck him, resulting in his greatest contribution to generations of patients suffering from many desperate diseases, especially at, during and after climacteric age for those who have been changed both mentally and physically and are thin and emaciated rather than fleshy.

CLINICAL

Alcoholism, Apoplexy, Asthma, Boils, Carbuncles, Change of life, Cough, Diphtheria, Epilepsy, Enteric fever, Flatulence, Gangrene, Haemorrhage, Haemorrhoids, Heart affection, Headache, Jaundice, Laryngitis, Liver affection, Mental disorders, Malignant pustules, Neuralgia, Pneumonia, Puerperal fever and convulsion, Purpura, Pyaemia, Quinsy, Skin affections, Throat and lung affections, Ulcers, Varicose veins, Vertigo, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Being a constitutional DEEP AND LONG ACTING POLYCHREST REMEDY, Lachesis has great affinity for almost any and every organ in the body. However, its action are more manifest on the nervous system, mind, cardio-vascular system, skin and mucous membrane, respiratory organs,heart,kidney.female genital organs, etc.

PATHOGENESIS

Like any other poison, Lachesis disorganises and decomposes the blood, making it More fluid and non-coaguable, resulting in haemorrhage, asthenic and malignant inflammation, ecchymosis, gangrene, abscess, pyaemia, general typhoid condition and jaundice, It irritates peripheral nerve, setting in hypersensitiveness, While its action on Pneumogastric nerve causes irritation of throat, larynx, bronchus and heart, it poisons
the nerve centres, producing profound prostration, convulsion and unconsciousness implicating the functional integrity of brain.




MAIERI

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: It is ideally suited to thin and emaciated subjects DURING AND AFTER CLIMACTERIC AGE, who have been changed both mentally and physically by their illness; to persons having disposition to low spirit and indolence with BLUE AND PURPLE LOOK.

Temperament: Melancholic and sad.

Relation with heat and cold: Lachesis patients cannot bear heat. They are HOT PATIENTS and are easily affected by heat in general, under all circumstances and in all cases.

Miasm: In Lachesis we find one of the greatest anti-psoric remedies. Psora is in the background for all troubles.

Diathesis: Haemorrhagic diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Lachesis is predominantly A LEFT SIDED REMEDY. All complaints commence on the left side and go to right excepting the lower limbs.

2. All symptoms are worse during and after sleep. Lachesis “sleeps into aggravation and aggravation from sleep”. Because of increased sufferings    such as suffocation, pain, etc, the patient is terribly afraid to go to sleep in spite of the fact
   that sleep is really needed.

3. Great sensitivenesss to touch, all over, especially throat, abdomen, etc. Even cannot bear clothes to touch which cause uneasiness and produce    nervousness. There is great intolerence of tight clothings. Wants everything loose (Apis).

4. Most of the complaints ARE RELIEVED BY MENSTRUAL FLOW (Zinc).

5. Climactric ailments, “Have never been well since that time” says Lachesis patient referring to menopausal period.

6. Burning all over the body: HOT FLUSHES AND HOT PERSPIRATION, hot haemorrhages; burning on vertex, etc.

7. Blueness and purple colour in every trouble amply singles out Lachesis—blue and purple face inflamed spot is purple, skin is blue, ulcers are    blue, etc.,

8. A sense of constriction and tight feeling everywhere-—heart, throat, etc.

9. Sensation of a ball in the inside or organs, especially urinary bladder.

10. Great desire for fanning, but slowly and from a distance (Med.—rapidly and from near, Carbo. veg).

11. Great physical and mental exhaustion, trembling in whole body.

12. Trembling tongue: Difficult to protrude. Trembles like that of a snake. Tongue is black.

13. Desire for wine, liquors, coffee. Aversion to food, acids and drinks.


Haemorrhagic diathesis : Small wounds bleed easily and profusely (Crot. hor.,

Kreosote, Ham., China, Secale cor., Phos); bleeding with malignant and asthenic inflammation, gangrene and pyaemic condition. Character of blood is dark, watery, offensruie and non-coagulable.

Mind : Lachesis patient develops very striking mental symtpoms which are as follows :-

Great loquacity : Wants to talk all the time, but without any relevancy or consistency; no head or tail; jumps from one idea to another, each word leading to a story. The patient thinks that he/she is under the control of some super-human being and has power to bless or curse, even has command over others and actually expects that others should obey him/her. Feels she is empowered from heaven above
to steal and/or to commit murders, etc.

She is possessed of some religious mania and insanity.

She is very JEALOUS AND SUSPICIOUS. The aspect runs through the whole of the mental plane. Suspects everything around her; has no confidence in others.

Dreams of snakes (Lac can.); of own death and funeral, etc.

Sometimes overjoyed and sometimes melancholic and sad, unhappy, depressed; aggravated in the morning on waking.

Memory is weak and there may be inability to think.Feels she is full of wickedness and has committed some serious and unpardonable sin and crime; that she is going to die and will go to hell etc.

All mental symptoms are worse after sleep.

Ailments from ; Long lasting grief, sorrow, fright, jealous, vexation, disappointed love, ete. (Aurum met., Ignatia. Phosphorus). Bad effects of poison, wounds postmortem, suppression of quinine.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Headache in drunkards with high bleod pressure.

Location: Left sided headache, tendency to go to right.

Sensation: As if all the blood has gone towards the head.

Character of headache: Congestive type of headache as if skull would burst.

Character of pain: There is pressing and bursting pain in temples, The head Is very much sensitive to touch.

Modalitiy: Aggravation from motion, pressure, after sleep. Amelioration by menstrual flow (Zincum

met., Allium cepa).

Throat :

Lachesis is especially indicated in tonsillitis and diphtheria,

Location: Begins on the left side and extends to the right.

Sensation: Soreness, dryness and constriction in the throat.

Look of the throat: Dark purple appearence of membrane. Throat seems as a large lump has settled over there. Liquid is more painful than solid                     (Ign., Bell,). When swallowing, throat is very much sensitive to touch. Prostration is odt of all proportion to appearence of                     throat complication.

Modality: Aggravation AFTER SLEEP. FROM HOT DRINK AND FROM TOUCH.

Heart :

There is violent palpitation; must sit up; very restless and trembling. There may be suffocation on lying down. Constrictive feeling in chest, with precordial pain.Unable to lie on left side, with fainting and anxiety. It may also be associated with left sided apoplexy.There is blueness and purple look of the body with collapsed condition; with cold sweat. The patient wants to be fanned but slowly and from a distance. Precordial region is very painful and sensitive to touch.

Epilepsy :
Consequent upon loss of vital fluid, sexual excess, onanism or jealousy, COMES ON ONLY DURING SLEEP (Cuprum met., Bufo. During waking hours, Agaricus mus.).

Female genital organs :

Lachesis has special affinity for female genital organs, especially left ovary, causing Inflammation of glands, cellular tissue and engorgement of veins, showing purple and mottled appearnece.

Concomitants: There may be hot flushes and hot perspiration. Extremes of heat and cold cause great debility. Along with menses, there may be haemorthoids, burning vertex and headache.

Menses : Menses at REGULAR TIME.

Duration: Short.

Quantify: Scanty.

Character of blood: Blood is dark, watery, and non-coagulable.

Modality: All troubles are relieved by menstrual flow (Zincum met., Lac can., Mag. Phos.).

Skin :

Causation: Bad effects of poison, wounds, post mortem, etc. Indicated in boils, carbuncles, ulcers, etc. with intense pain, dark, bluish or purple coloured appearance with tendency to malignancy. Hot haemorrhage with bloody sweat. On the skin there may be numerous ulcers, gangrene and pyaemic condition, malignant and asthenic inflammation from which continuous and profuse blood oozes along with other offensive and ichorous discharges. Look of Skin ; Bluish purple appearence; bolls and carbuncles with purplish surroundings. The
skin is very sensitive to touch.

Character of discharge: The discharges are ichorous and offensive.

Fever:

Lachesis is better indicated in the 2nd and 3rd week of TYPHOID; with stupor or muttering delirium; sunken face; typhoid state, falling of lower jaw; tongue trembles dry and black, protruded with difficulty and catches between the teeth when producing. Perspiration is bloody and cold, stains yellow.There may also be haemorrhage from bowels during typhoid fever due to perforation of intestine, Conjuctiva yellow; great physical exhaustion and trembling of whole body; weakness and sinking feeling.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: AFTER SLEEP (Apis), heat in general, extremes of temperature, alcohol, acids. mercury; quinine, pressure or constriction, summer and heat of sun.

Amelioraion: With appearence of discharge and cold application.

Relations :
Complimentary to: Hepar., Lyco., Nitric acid. In intermittent fever Natrum mur. follows Lachesis when the type changes.

Antidotes: Alum., Bell., Hepar., Merc., Nit. ac., Nux vom.,


CHAPTER:130 LEDUM PALUSTRE

Marsh Tea HAHNEMANN Ericaceae

INTRODUCTION

Ledum is one of the frequently used medicines for injury, skin affections, rheumatic and gouty complaints. It is a remedy gifted by the
vegetable kingdom; particularly so from a wild plant which normally has no utility, But Hahnemann found its usefulness in a number of ailments after potentisation.

CLINICAL

Ascites, Asthma, Bruises, Gout, Injury, Rheumatism, Skin affection, Wounds, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Its seat of action is mainly on skin, serous and mucous membranes, fibrous tissues, circulatory system and joints.

PATHOGENESIS

The action of Ledum on skin retards capillary circulation, especially on the external surface of the body and the extremities, resulting in coldness of the surface afed due to its affections on the fibrous tissues and joints, joints are enlatged and become the seats of nodosities and “gout-stones”.

CONSTITUTION

Since it is more or less an acute drug, consideration of constitution is not of much importance. However, Ledum patient is very chilly, with psoric and syphilitic background having rheumatic diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. There is general lack of animal heat; yet heat of bed is intolerable. The patient is unnaturally cold.

2. Complaints of people who are cold all the time; cold to touch but not cold subjectively to patient.

3. In spite of coldness of the body, the symptoms are relieved by cold application (like Secale cor., Rev. of Arsenic).

4. Relief from cold, is so prominent that sometimes the only amelioration is obtained by putting the feet into ice-cold water,

5. Swelling and shooting pain in knees when walking.

6. Stiffness of all joints; can only move them after applying cold.

7. Rheumatism or gout in lower limbs which ascends. (Arnica—descencds, Cacutus and Kalmia).

8. Swelling of feet upto,knees, with unbearable pain when walking as from a sprain or false step; ball of great toe swollen, painful heels as if    bruised.
9. Punctured wounds : From sharp pointed instruments, as awls, rat bites, nails, particularly if the wounded parts are cold.

10. The swellings are pale, sometimes odedematous and aggravated at night in the heat of bed. Uncovering or cold water relieves.

11. Eruptions which burn and sting like the bites or stings of insects.

12. Emaciation of suffering parts, after infected injuries to nerves.

13. Ailments from : Abuse of alcohol, colchicum, injuries from sharp pointed instruments, rat bites, stings of insects especially mosquitos.

PARTICULARS

Eye:

Haemorrhage into interior chamber of eyes after iridectomy (Amica, Ruta).

Cataracts with gout.

Face:

Red pimples on forehead and cheeks, stinging when touched, crusty eruption around nose and mouth.

Injury :

Causation: Punctured wounds, by sharp pointed instruments, as awls, nails, rat bites, mosquito bites or blows.

Location: Punctured wounds anywhere on the body. Haemorrhage into anterior chamber of eyes after iridectomy (Arnica, Ruta). Contusions of eyes and lids, especially if much extravasation of blood, causing ecchymosis of lids and conjunctiva.

Sensation: Pain es if the whole body is bruised and beaten.

Character: Pain in ankles as if sprained or from false step. Pains are of sticking, tearing and throbbing type.

Modalities : Aggravated by motion and at night, by warmth of bed and covering. Amelioration by applying ice-cold water.

Concomitants : Long remaining discolouration after injury. Black and blue places become Steen. Emaciation of affected part (Graphites). Parts are very cold to touch but not cold subjectively to Patient,

Skin:

Causation : Due to injury, loss of vital heat, etc.

Location: Acne on forehead, facial eczema, itching on feet and ankles. Red pimples or tubercles on forehead and cheeks as in brandy drinkers. Stringing when touched, easy spraining of ankles,

Sensation : Pain as if the whole body is bruised and beaten. Pain in ankles as if sprained or from false step. Pains are sticking, tearing and throbbing.

Character : Emaciation of suffering parts. Intense itching of feet and ankles, aggravation from scratching and warmth of bed. Long remaining discolouration after injury. Black and blue places become green. Long continued warm sweat on head and feet.

Swelling : Swelling of feet upto knees with unbearable pain when walking, as from sprain or false step ; ball of great toe is swollen, painful in heels as if bruised.

Abscess and septic conditioos very tender, relieved by cold water.

Modalities : Worse at night, from heat of bed and by scratching but relieved by cold water.

Rheumatism and gout :

In both acute and chronic rheumatism or gout, Ledum is efficacious.

Causation: Due to altered secretion and deposit of solid substances, like uric acid, sodium biurate and other crystals, earthy matter, etc. in the tissues.

Rheumatic and gouty diathesis, have “GOUTSTONES” i.e. stones in the joints like wrist, fingers, toes, etc.

Sensation : Throbbing pain especially in left shoulder. Tearing pain and sticking pain left shoulder and right hip joint.

Location: Small joints like toes, fingers, ankles, wrist.

Character of pain:

(a) In acute type, the joints are swollen and hot. Inflamed parts are red or pale and worse at night. The patient cannot tolerate the heat of bed     and wants to be uncovered.

(b) In chronic type, the joints are swollen and very painful. Painful hard nodules, first in joints of feet and then in hands. Periosteum of      phalanges is very painful on pressure. Usually it affects the left shoulder and right hip (Antim tart., Stram.). The ankles and soles are         very painful and sensitive; can hardly step on them. There is swelling with shooting pain in knees when walking.Stiffness of all joints; can      only move them after applying cold water. Rheumatism and gout begin in lower limbs and ascend. Swelling of feet upto knees, with unbearable       pain when walking as from a sprain of false step; ball of great toes swollen and painful. Pain in heels as if bruised.

Modalities; Worse at night, from heat of bed and on walking. Better from cold water and holding feet in ice-cold water.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From heat of bed, at night, on touch and motion,

Amelioration: From cold, putting feet in icy-cold water.

Relations :

Antidoted by: Camphor.

It antidotes: Apis., China.





CHAPTER:129 LILIUM TIGRINUM

pH Tiger Lily W. PAYNE Liliaceae


INTRODUCTION

Tiger lily is a powerful poison, therefore, a good medicine, says Dr. Tyler. It is a precious remedy for most distressing conditions. Well proved 
and of very definite and distingusihing symptoms, yet not sufficently used and understood is Tiger lily. Unfortunately, this important female 

remedy is unknown to old school practitioners. It is a drug of such vehement action as to be safe and useful only in the hands of those who have 
leamt from Hahnemann how to prepare and prescribe such a remedy.

There are a few intellectual persons possessing poetic faculties, who can better grasp and remember things when presented in rhyme, and for them 
appended below is a Tiger

lily rhyme;—

Tiger lily hurries about, Feels, her insides being all dragged out, Frequent urging to micturition,

Almost approaching a Cantharis condition, Rectal distress a band,

Constricting the heart (just like Cactus grand.), Pulsatilla-like tears, her salvation’s a worry, With silver nitrate, she’s “duties” and hurry.

CLINICAL

Angina pectoris, Constipation, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Eye affection, Heart troubles,Hysteria, Menstrual disorders, Ovarian and Uterine affections, 
Pruritus vulvae, Urinary troubles, Prolapse of uterus, Uterus displacement of, Sub-involution, ete.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Acts especially on pelvic organs; such as uterus, fallopian tubes, ovaries, brain, the vessel walls and the heart.

PATHOGENESIS

The drug can produce various types of pathological states of the pelvic organs in Seneral and female genital organs in particular. The various clinical symptomatology are due to reflex states dependent on those pathological conditions. It leads to forceful contraction and palpitation of heart.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Especially suited to unmarried woman who suffers from uterine troubles.

Temperament: Irritable, nervous and hysterical temperament. Relation with heat and cold: Very hot patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Affects principally /eft side of the body (Thuja, Lach., Lac can., Berberis vulgaris, Colocynth)

2. Hot Patient: Wants cold air, open air and cool room (Puls., Sabina, Nat. mur.).,

3. Bearing down sensation, dragging sensation in abdomen and pelvis as if all the organs would escape (Murex, Sepia, Bell.),

4. Consolation from others aggravates the sufferings (Nat. mur., Ign., Silicea, Sepia, Halleborus.,—Consolation relieves, Pulsatilla).

5. Frequent urging to urinate.

6. Shifting pain; pain flying from one part to another.

7. Pulsation all over the body (Kreosote) and full, distended feeling as if blood would burst through the vessels.

8. Sensation as if the heart was grasped in a vise (Cactus) as if blood had all gone to heart; feels full to bursting, inability to walk erect.    Clasped and unclasped feeling in heart as if by an iron hand. Rapid heart-beat, 150 to 170 per minute.

9. Mind : It produces various types of mental symptoms which are as follows: - Weeping disposition; can hardly avoid weeping (Puls., Sepia,         
 Med.); very much timid and fearful. There is profound depression of spirit; patient is quite indifferent about what is being done for her,
  
 Consolation aggravates the complaints, Furthermore, there is great irritability of mind. She can hardly speak a decent word to anybody. She    

will snap even when spoken kindly to. She is so irritable that her friends cannot pacify her. There is great fear of being alone, about her       
diseases as if she is incurable, fear of organic disease of heart and insanity etc. The patient is very much hurried and worried; desires to      
do something in a hurried manner; there is aimless hurried motion. There is an irresistible desire to curse and swear (Anac, Lac can.,      
Nit.ac.).The patient tries to describe an indescribable feeling. There is a wild crazy feeling on the vertex as if the ideas are scattered;       
confused ideas. When concentrating the mind upon a particular thing, something else comes back to mind. There is disposition to curse, swear,     
strike or think obscene things. The patient becomes very much listless, yet cannot sit still; restless, yet does not want to walk. She            
sits, broods and thinks over the past. Tormented about her salvation. Great sexual desire. She must keep herself busy to suppresss her sexual     
desire. All the above mentioned mental symptoms alternate with physical symptoms and are more or less due to and arising from or associated     
with uterine symptoms.

PARTICULARS

Uterine symptoms, Prolapse :

There is weakness and atonic condition of pelvic tissues, uterus and ovaries resulting in anteversion, retroversion, subinvolution from paralytic 
condition. There is GREAT BEARING DOWN SENSATION, dragging sensation in abdomen and pelvis as if all the organs would escape (Lac can., Sepia, 
Murex, Bell.); relieved by supporting the vulva with hands.Here it differs from SEPIA. Both have got bearing down sensation and intolerance of 
sympathy. Both support the vulva during prolapse, but Lilium tig. feels heat more abd Sepia feels cold more. Sepia is INDIFFERENT AND APATHETIC 
whereas Lilium is always hurried and worried. Tiger lily craves meat while Sepia has got aversion to meat. Sepia has no sexual desire. Tiger lily 
has great sexual desire, nevertheless, in order to suppress the sexual desire, she keeps herself busy.

Menses :
Time: Too early.

Quantity: Scanty.

Character of blood: Very much dark and offensive.

Character of flow: Flow only when moving about. Flow ceases when she stops walking.

Character of pain: Shifting pain in small spots that can be covered with the tip of a finger (Kali bich., Ign.).

Concomitants: Bearing down sensation, dragging sensation in abdomen and pelvis as if all the organs would escape; relieved by supporting the 
vulva with hands.

Constipation :

Causation: Inactivity of rectum.

During stool: There is great tenesmus in rectum with MUCH URGING. Sits for a long time in the closet to pass stool. Although there is great 
urging and greatstraining, no stool or little stool passes out. Along with frequent urging to stool, there is sensation of a ball in the rectum. 
Due to retrovefsion of uterus, there is sensation as if the rectum were full of faeces, which brings on repeated urging to stool and the patient 
sits and only strains but no stool passes out. With desrie for stool and bearing down sensation in abdomen, there is great pressure in rectum.


Urine :

Great tenesmus of bladder. The patient sits for a long time to urinate. Frequent urging to urinate. If the desire is not attended to, there is sensation of congestion in the chest. Urine is milky, scanty and very hot.

Heart : All the heart symptoms are associated with and arise as reflex symptoms of uterine troubles.

Sensation: As if the heart was grasped in a vise (Cactus) as if all the blood has rushed to the heart which feels and seems like bursting. Great palpitation with fluttering, faint, hurried and anxious feeling about the apex.

Pain: Sharp pain in left chest, shifting in nature, flying from one part to another and can be covered with tip of a finger.
Pain in the cardiac region with feeling of load on chest. 

Pulse : Pulse is very much rapid and irregular, with rapid heart beat, 150 to 170 per minute.

Modality: Aggravation after eating, lying on either side.

Concomitants: Pulsation all over the body. Full distended feeling, as if blood would burst through the vessels. Heart symptoms alternate with               uterine troubles.

Sweat :

There is coldness of the whole body, extremities cold and covered with cold sweat.

General Modalities :
Aggravation: By consolation and in a warm room.

Amelioraton: In open fresh air.

Relations :
Compare: Cactus, Murex, Sepia.
Antidoted by: Platina, Nux v., Puls.




CHAPTER :130 LITHIUM CARBONICUM

Carbonate of Lithium DR. HERING LixCO,

INTRODUCTION

Dr. Constantine Hering introduced and made the first provings of Lithium Carb.

CLINICAL

Eyes-affection of. Gastralgia. Headache. Heart-affection of. Prostatitis. Gout. Rheumatism.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS :

1) Uric-acid diathesis.

2) “Soreness” is the one of the great characteristics of Lith. Carb. Like Arnica, bones, joints, muscles whole body sore as if beaten.

3) Rheumatic & Gouty symptoms: Lithium Garb, has Rheumatic and gouty diathesis. This is an invaluable; remedy in chronic rheumatism when
   accompained with heart or eye symptoms and recurring attacks of acute inflammation of the small joints. Another peculiarity of this rheumatism    consists in the appearance of an erup-tion on the affected part. There is great tenderness, swel-ling and redness of the joints.

Modalities :

Worse : At night or in morning.

Better : Rising or moving about ; hot water.

4) Heart symptoms : Heart symptoms when associated with rheumatic symptoms. There is Rheumatic soreness in cardiac region. Throbbing, dull stitch
in cardiac reg-ion. Throbbing and fluttering in heart, extending to back.

Modalities :

Aggravation : Bending forward. Before urination.

Amelioration : After urinating.

5) Urinary symptoms : Urine of Lith. Carb, is turbid, strong, scanty flocculent and full of uric acid deposits while passing urine, flashes of .pain are felt in the region of the bladder, extending into spermatic cord and patient may feel pressure in heart. Pain in right kidney & ureter.

6) Eye symptoms : There is sensation of dryness and pain in eyes after reading. It has. entire vanishing of right half of whatever the patient    looks at. It may be the result of excessive use of eyes with insufficient light or direct exposure to the blinding effects of strong sunlight.

7) Stomach symptoms : Gnawing in stomach with pain in left temple better by eating. Nausea better by eating. Acidity. Patient cannot tolerate    slightest pressure of clothes from fullness in pit of stomach.

8) Headache ceases while eating. There is a tension as if bound. Better by sitting up and going out.

9) Many symptoms of Lith. Carb, have concomitants in other parts.

10) Ailments from—Bruises, falls.

11) General modalities :

Agg.—In morning, at night, right side.

Ame.—Rising, moving about.





CHAPTER :131 LYCOPODIUM CLAVATUM
pe
Wolf's Claw; HAHNEMANN Lycopodiaceae
Club Moss

INTRODUCTION

According to Darwin’s Theory of evolution, moss was the first plant in the vegetable kingdom to take shape in the world. Ordinarily,
moss has got very little or no value; on the other hand, occasionally it proves to be a nuisance to farmer. The fact is that it possesses immense
inherent curative power in latent and dormant state in its crude form, for, people in extremes of life, could only be found out by the deep penetrating intelligence of Hahnemann. When this power is dynamically aroused, it finds its respectable place in the hands of every Homoeopath, bringing in immense relief to thousands of suffering people Lycopodium is a wonderful CONSTITUTIONAL, DEEP ACTING REMEDY FOR
DEEP SEATED, PROGRESSIVE CHRONIC DISEASES. It is nicknamed as “Vegetable Sulphur”.

CLINICAL

Abdomen distended, Aneurysm, Asthma, Bililousness, Cancer, Constipation, Consumption, Cough, Colic, Diphtheria, Dysentery, Dyspepsia, Eczema, Flatulence, Gall- stone, Gout, Headache, Heartburn, Hernia, Hysteria, Impotency, Liver affection, Locomotor ataxy, Lung affection, Male and female pexual orgns, Menstrual disorders, Physometra, Pneumonia, Renal colic, Rheumatism, Stomach disorders, Throat affection, Typhoid fever, Urinary troubles, Whooping cough, Worms, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts powerfully upon the vegetative system specially upon the mucous membrane of respiratory tract, dfgestfae system, genito-urinary tract, kidney etc. It shows its most important: local action upon the liver and digestive tract.

PATHOGENESIS

It depresses the vegetative system causing slowly, advancing weaknes and decay of tissues, Acting upon the genito-urinary tract and kidney, it produces lithic and uric acid, diathesis. On the liver and digestive system, it disturbs the digestion and produces Constipation. The lymphatic system becomes weak and thereby their glands are swollen and indurated, especially of the neck.





CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: It has Grauvogl’s Carbonitrogenoid constitution. Suited especially for extremes of life, both for children and old people. 
Lycopodium patients are INTELLECTUALLY KEEN, BUT PHYSICALLY WEAK. Upper part of the body ig emaciated, lower part semi-dropsical. Unhealthy 
complexion, anaemic and pale complexion, looks older than he is (Arg. nit., Sanicula, Kreosote, Secale cor., Flouric atid),

Relation with heat and cold: The patient is sensitive to cold and there is marked lack of vital heat and worse in general from cold and cold-air and from cold food and drink (Kent).

Miasm: Lycopodium covers all the three miasms. It is anti-psoric, anti-syphilitic and anti-sycotic.

Diathesis: Lithic and uric acid diathesis, pre-disposed to lung and hepatic affections (Sulph., Calc. Phos).

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. It is a leading RIGHT SIDED REMEDY. Suited for deep chronic, progressive diseases. Complaints start on right side arid go left-throat, chest,    abdomen, liver, ovary, kidney, etc.

2. Nearly all diseases are WORSE IN THE AFTERNOON FROM 4 TO 8 P.M. This is a very strong feature of Lycopodium.

3. Sourness of the discharges: Everything tastes sour, e.g. eurctation, heart-burn water-brash, sour vomiting.

. Intolerance of cold drinks; craves everything warm.

. Desire for sweet things: warm food and drink. Aversion to tobacco, bread, coffee. Cannine hunger, but a few mouthfuls fill up to the throat.

. Acidity, wind and bloating of abdomen, especially the lower abdomen.

. Red sand in urine. Child cries before urinating. Coon nan sp

. Impotency of young men from onanism or sexual excess.

10. Constipation since puberty, since last confinement, when away from home.

12. Right sided hernia is successfully treated by this drug.

13. Hemiopia: ses only the left half of the object (Aurum met., sees only lower half).

16. Right foot hot and the left cold.

17. Dryness of the parts such as vagina and skin especially palms, also suggests Lyco.

18. Mind : The mental symtpoms of Lycopodium are numerous and very characteristic. The patient is tired; he has a very tired state of mind, a     
chronic fatigue. Dread of appearing in public, often in professional man like lawyers and ministers who have to appear in public, there is a 
feeling of complete incompetence and inability to undertake the task, although he has been accustomed to it for many years. A laywer cannot think 
of appearing in court; he delays, until he is obliged to appear because he has a fear that he will stumble, that he will make mistakes, that he 
will forget and yet when he undertakes, he goes through with ease, competency and comfort.Furthermore the patient wants to be alone; yet has 
drend of solitude. The patient dreads the presence of new persons, or visitors. She wants to be only with those who are constantly surrounding 
her, but also does not want to be entirely alone; wants to feel that there is somebody else in the house, but does not want company, does

not want to be talked to or forced to do anything. Desire to be alone. Wants to keep silent; yet very glad to feel that-there is somebody else in 
the house. The patient prefers to remain in a room by herself but wants to have somebody in the adjacent room. Great anticipation: Lack of 
confidence, weakness of memory; confused thoughts; loss of confidence in himself.

Easily angered; cannot endure opposition or contradiction Seeks dispute. Greedy and miserly, malicious, avaricious and pusillanimous; very much sensitive; even cries when thanked.FOR PERSONS INTELLECTUALLY KEEN, BUT PHYSICALLY WEAK, it is very useful.

Headache :

CHAPTER:133 LYSSIN (HYDROPHOBINUM)

The Saliva of Rabid dog DR. HERING A Nosode (of rabies) (First proved in 1833)

INTRODUCTION

Deep acting constitutional medicine. Polychrest remedy. (An analogue of many animal poisons especially Lachesis & Vipera).

CLINICAL

Convulsions. Diarrhoea. Dysentery. Headache. Hydrophobia. Leucorrhoea. Lysophobia. Mania. Paralysis. Prolapse Satyriasis. Throat complaints. Urinary complaints.Wounds and Ulcers.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It affects principally the nervous system, then oesophagus, female genitalia etc.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) The sight or sound of running water or pouring water, even thinking of it aggravates all complaints.

2) Cannot bear heat of sun (Gels., Glon., Lach., Nat.Mur)

3) Excessive sensitiveness to external stimuli like sound, noises, air, running water,light etc.

4) Profuse salivation—Saliva is tough, ropy, viscid, frothy with constant spitting.

5) Hypersensitiyeness to smell (esp.of tobacco) taste, touch.

6) Dysphagia, even spasm of oesophagus from swallowing liquids.

7) Craving for salt and aversion to fat food.

8) Ravenous hunger or anorexia,

9) Complete absence of thirst or great thirst for cold water but unable to drink.

10) Frequent desire to urinate on seeing running water (Cantharis, Sulphur).

11) Complaints resulting from abnormal sexual desire, (from abstinence, Conium.)

12) Long lasting prolapse of uterus, rectum or any organ.

13) Sleep—Persistent insomnia is another characteristic of Lyssin.

14) Delayed healing of wounds, ulcers, sinuses etc. Bluish discolouration of wounds (Lach.)

15) Mind—The mental symptoms of Lyssin are very striking and are as follows—

The patient is highly impulsive especially of destructive nature, e.g. desires to kill himself or some other. Patient suffers from Lyssophobia that is intense fear of becoming mad. The chain of strange thoughts and ideas always circulate, fill-his mind. Great apprehension as if something terrible is going to happen is another guiding feature of Lyssin. He may suffer from violent mania of any kind. Rapid speech and impatience are very notice-able. There is state of confusion, patient reses his self-identity and very often asks “who am I” ?  Mental emotion or mortifying news always makes him worse.

Causation : History of dog bite (whether rabid or not), abnormal sexual desire, mental emotion or exertion, mortifying or bad news etc.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

It is usually needed in chronic headache from bites of dog or from mental emotion of exertion.

Location : There is violent headache from temple to temple, also frontal.

Sensation : Pain as if head would burst.

Character of pain: Maddening, outward pressing pain in forehead; patient presses his head against the wall, beating and throbbing pain with                    peculiar lightness of head.

Modalities : Aggravation on seeing water, during day, from writing. Amelioration from cold air.

Concomitant : Headache with dizziness, nausea, and backache. It may alternate with hot flushes in face.

Convulsions :

From dazzling or reflected light from water or mirror (Stram.); from even thinking of fluids of any kind; from slightest touch or current of air.

Throat:

Sore throat, constant desire to swallow (Lac.Can., Merc.) Difficulty in swallowing ; even spasm of oesophagus from swallowing liquids; gagging 
when swallowing water. Saliva is tough, ropy, viscid, frothy in mouth and throat with constant spitting. (Hydr.)

Male :

Lascivious; priapism, with frequent emissions. Complaints from abnormal sexual desire. Atrophy of testicles. No emission during coition.

Female :

Sensitivenes of vagina, rendering coition painful. Conscious of womb.

Prolapsus uteri; many cases of years standing cured.

Stool : Desire for stool on hearing or seeing running water. Profuse, watery stools, with pain in bowels; worse evening.

General Modalities:

Aggravation: Sight or sound of water, bright dazzling light, carriage riding.

Relations :

Compare : Bell., Canth., Stram in hydrophobia.





CHEAPTER: 134 MAGNESIA CARBONICA

Carbonate of HAHNEMANN (MgCO3),Mg Magnesium (OH), + SH,O



INTRODUCTION

Magnesia carbonica was used in ancient days in the form of Gregory's Powder, other constituents being Rhubarb and Ginger. This
powder was used, to sweeten the stomach; hence occupied a position of much repute in the Allopathic Nursery. The properties of Mag. carb., from the old school’s stand point are summed up as “Laxative, antacid and antilithic’. In Homoeopathy we use it with great advantage for complaints arising in people who have been taking the drug to “sweeten the stomach”.

CLINICAL

Acidity, Catarrh, Constipation, Cough, Diarrhoea, Dyspepsia, Flatulence, Menstrual disorders, Neuralgia, Pregnancy—nausea of, Toothache, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts especially on the gastro-intestinal system, liver and also female genital organs. It also has got action over the nerve, especially the facial and dental nerves.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces gastro-intestinal catarrh with marked hyper acidity and sour diarrhoea. 

It also causes nervous exhaustion and sleeplessness.



CONSTITUTION

Physical make up: It is especially suited to women having broken down or worn-out constitution with uterine and climacteric disorders and with lax fibres and sour smell of the whole body.

Temperament: Nervous temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Very much sensitive to cold air.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Aggravation of all the symptoms, especially pains from rest and relieved by walking about.


2. The patients are extremely sensitive both mentally and physically, e.g., sensitive to touch, cold air, etc.

3. Extreme acidity and sourness which run throughout the length and breadth of Mag. carb.,(N.M. Choudhury),e.g, sour eructation, sour vomiting    and sour stool.

CHAPTER :135 MAGNESIA MURIATICA

Chloride of Magnesia HAHNEMANN Mg 

INTRODUCTION

Magnesia Muriatica is the most neglected liver remedy in our Materia Medica. It is particularly a woman’s remedy who suffers from hysterical complaints with uterine diseases and indigestion.

CLINICAL

Cardialgia, Constipation, Dyspepsia. Diarrhoea. Dysmenorrhoea. Headache. Hysteria. Leucorrhoea. Liver complaints. Toothache.

SPHERE OF ACTION

Gastro intestinal tract, liver, nerves, uterus, heart, urinary bladder.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make up—It is especially suited to hysterical nervous women who suffer from hepatic and uterine disorders. Puny, rachitic children during dentition, Relation with heat & cold—chilly patient. Miasm—Psora.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Patient, though chilly, desires fresh open air which relieves.

2) Great sensitivenes to noise (Phos., Theridion., Nux Vom.)

3) Affections of the right side with liver affections.

4) Stool dry, knotty, difficult to evacuate, like sheep dung crumbling at verge of anus (Ammon Mur., Nat.Mur.)

5) Great tendency to head-sweat. (Calc. Sil., Sani.)

6) Pressing pain in enlarged liver, pain radiates to spine. Aggravation by lying on right side, better by hard pres-sure.

7) Profuse dark pitch like menses with cramps, backache, pain in thighs and indigestion.

8) Leucorrhoea after every stool, two weeks after menses.

9) Craving for sugar.

10) Intolerance of milk.

11) Aggravation while sitting.

12) Palpitation relieved by motion or lying on left side.

13) Continual rising of white froth into the mouth.

14) Eructations tasting like rotten eggs (Arn., Ant.T., Graph. Psor).

15) Headache : Worse from motion and in open air better from strong pressure and wrapping up warmly (Sil., Stron.)

16) Urine, Pale, yellow can only be passed by pressing abdominal muscles.

17) Ailments from—Sea bathing.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Sine : Every six weeks.

Location : Forehead and around the eyes.

Sensation : As if it would burst.

Character of headache : Congestive headache at menstrual period in hysterical women.

Modalities : Aggravation—from motion, in open air.

Amelioration : From lying down, strong pressure, wrapping up warmly.

Gastro-intestinal Symptoms

Mouth : Blisters on lips. A coated large flabby yellow tongue. Tongue feels burnt. Swollen and easily bleeding gums. Toothache unbearable when food touches the teeth.

Stomach : Appetite poor, bad taste in mouth. Eructations like rotten eggs. Continued rising-of white froth into mouth. Cannot digest milk, it causes pain in stomach and passes undigested. Complaints aggravated from salty food & sea bathing.

Liver: Chronic liver complaints with tenderness and pressing pain extending to-spine and epigastrium. Enlarged, sore mvt with flatulence.

Aggravation : Lying on right side, after food.

Amelioration : By hard pressure.

Constipation : It is mostly indicated in obstinate constipation and of infants during dentition. The characteristic stool is hard, knotty, scanty, passes with difficulty with crumbling at verge of anus. After stools rectum feels sore & painful. Constipation at sea (Bry., Platina.)

Menses : The flow is black and clotted. Profuse at night, in bed causing hysterical symptoms. The Menstrual pain is generally relieved by having back pressed. There is great excitement at every period, and pains in the back while walking and in the thighs when sitting. Eruptions on face and forehead worse before menses.

Leucorrhoea : After exertion, after every stool, or following uterine spasm. It may be followed by Metrorrhagia. Leucorrhoea two weeks after menses for three or four days.

General modalities :

Aggravation—Lying on right side, sea bathing, immediately after eating.

Amelioration—From pressure, motion, open air (except headache).

Relations :

Antidotes : Cham. Camph.
Compare : Chamomilla in diseases of children.





CHAPTER :136


MAGNESIA PHOSPHORICA


Phosphate of HAHNEMANN MgHPO,7H,0 Magnesium

INTRODUCTION

Phosphate of magnesium is one of the most important of the twelve tissue remedies. It is a precious gem derived from biochemical studies of
Dr. Schuessler the father of Twelve Tissue Remedies. This salt is one of the important constituents of various cells in our body, especially blood corpuscles, muscles, brain, spinal marrow and various other tissues. Disturbance of its molecules results in pain, cramps and paralysis. In Homoeopathy it was MASTER HAHNEMANN who first used it in the treatment of dysmenorrhoea. He remarked that “Mag. phos.” is one of the greatest, if not the greatest of the remedies for dysmenorrhoea, but only one of its own kind. N.M. CHOUDHURY also says that a careful study of Mag. phos. will convince every student of Homoeopathy, the utter need of discrimination, careful cool judgment and a constant burning of incense before the Goddess of Materia Medica.

CLINICAL

Colic, Convulsion, Cough, Dentition, Headache, Intercostal neuralgia, Locomotor ataxia, Menstrual disorders, Neuralgia, Toothache, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Especially it acts upon brain, nerves, muscles, intestine and uterus.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces neuralgic pain in the head, teeth, etc. which is sharp, cutting, lightning like, shooting and almost unbearable. It also produces spasmodic pain, especially in the abdomen.


CONSTITUTION

Physical make up: Mag. phos. is especially adapted to the affection of thin, emaciated persons of a highly nervous organisation and of dark complexion. Jt affects, right side of the body. Hering says that it is suited to young and very strong persons and teething children.

Temperament: Nervous temperament.


Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background. agiiesia Priospngre

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. It affects the right side of the body, generally head, ear, face, chest, ovary, sciatic nerve (Chel., Lyco., Ciusticum, Kali carb., Bry.,    Mere. sol.).

2. Great desire of cold air, of uncovering, of touching the affected part, of cold, of bathing or washing.

3. Colicky pain in abdomen forcing the patient to bend double, RELIEVED BY HEAT AND WARMTH. RUBBING AND HARD PRESSURE (colocynth).

4. It is the best medicine for all sorts of pain, especially CRAMPING. SHOOTING LIKE A LIGHTNING. Pains are sharp, cutting, stabbing, stitching,    lightning like coming and going rapidly. The pain rapidly changes from place to place. It is RELIEVED BY HEAT, WARMTH AND BY PRESSURE but    aggravated by COLD IN GENERAL, from motion and in open air.
   
. During menses, pain is relieved when flow begins (Lach., Zincum met.).

. All the symptoms are worse from 4-9 p.m. (Colocynth).

. Enuresis after catheterization.

. Ailments from : Standing in cold water or working.with cold clay; dentition, cold winds, cold water, catheterization. on nan

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Suitable specially for headache of school girls (Calc, phos., Nat. mur., Psor., Tuber.).

Causation: From cold air.

Location: Right sided headache.

Sensation: As if a cap is on head.

Character of headache: Headache begins jn the occiput and extends over the head, especially in right side (Sang., Sil.) with sudden flushes and red face. Pain is neuralgic in character. The pain is darting, stabbing, shooting, stitching and rapidly changing. Pain comes suddenly and goes suddenly.

Modalities: Aggravation from 10 to 11 a.m., or 4 to 5 p.m. from mental exertion or hard study, emotion, touch, open air, and relieved by external heat, hard pressure and rubbing.

Neuralgia :

Mag. phos. is one of the GREAT ANTI NEURALGIC REMEDIES, Neuralgia, especially of face, supra or intra orbital; right sided neuralgia. It is sharp, shooting, cutting and is almost unendurable. The pain darts along the course of a nerve like a lightning flash and rapidly changes place. There is intermittent Paroxysm which is almost unbearable driving the patient to frenzy. The pains are aggravated by motion and DRAUGHT OF COLD AIR and are invariably better BY HEAT, WARMTH, pressure and bending double.

Toothache :

Ulceration of teeth, with severe neuralgic pain. There is sharp, cutting, stabbing, shooting pain in lightning like flash and rapidly changing place. Comes in intermittent paroxysms, almost unbearable,


Modalities: Toothache is aggravated at night, from eatinc, drinking, especially cold things and relieved by heat (relieved by cold-Bryonia, Puls., Coffea).

Gastro-intestinal Symptoms :

Colic : For abdominal colic, Mag. phos. is an excellent remedy.

Location: Pain at the pit of stomach or anywhere in the abdomen.

Sensation: Bloated; full sensation in stomach.

Character of pain: Sharp, cutting, stabbing, shooting, stitching type of pain, coming and going like a_ lightning. Cramping pain, there is intermittent type of pain, comes in paroxysm, unbearable, rapidly changing place. Pain compels the patient to bend double. Great distension of abdomen. The patient wants to loosen clothing, walks about and constantly passes flatus which gives no relief. The tongue is clean.

Modalities:

© Aggravation from touch.

° Amelioration: By rubbing, warmth and pressure.

Here it differs from Colocynth. Both have got severe colic making the patient to bend double; both are relieved by warmth and hard pressure. But the colic is not so markedly relieved by heat in Colocynth as in. Mag. phos. but is relieved by pressure. Mag. phos. has right sided colic, buj Colocynth usually left sided. Anger with indignation is the causative factor in Colocynth, but not in Mag. phos. In Mag. phos., the colic is not so markedly relieved by pressure, bdt is relieved by heat. MAG. PHOS. SHOULD BE USED WHEN COLOCYNTH FAILS TO RELIEVE.

Menses :

In membranous dysmenorrhoea, Mag. phos,. is of great help.

Time: Too early.

Character of flow: Flow dark and stringy (Crocus, Ust.).

Character of pain: Severe pain in the abdomen, especially right sided. The pain is sharp, cutting, stabbing, shooting, stitching, coming and going like a lightning, unbearable pain, driving the patient to frenzy, rapidly changing place and cramping pain.

Modalities:
 Aggravation: Pain is aggravated before the flow begins.

 Amelioration: When the flow begins (Lach,, Zincum met.) by lying on right side and by heat and bending double.



General Modalities :

Aggravation: from cold air, draught of cold air or cold wind, cold bathing or washing, motion and touch.

Amelioration: By bending double, heat, warmth and pressure.

Relations :

Antidoted by: Belladonna, Gels, Lachesis.

Compare: Colocynth, Cham.






CHAPTER :137 MEDORRHINUM

The Gonorrhoeal SWAN A. Nosode Cocei

INTRODUCTION

Medorrhinum is one of the greatest constitutional remedies contributed by Hahnemann to Materia Medica. Although Thuja claims to be the king of anti-sycotic remedies, in actual effect, Medorrhinum ranks PARI PASSU with the “KING” and merits the consideration of having an equally wide range of action as that of Thuja. Having been derived from the Gonorrhoeal cocci, it has been found most efficacious in eradicating any and_ every complaint, by whatever name they are called, brought on and consequent upon Gonorrhoea. The dormant curative power of the same contagious principle has been utilised, through potentisation, for complete annihilation of all diseases and manifestations produced by gonococcus itself. Master Hahnemann found’ in the Gonorrhoeal cocci the immense.curative value of not only all diseases of sycotic origin, but also diseases caused by psora and syphilis. MEDORRHINUM bears the same relation to deep seated sycotic chronic affections of spinal cord and the sympathetic nervous system as PSORINUM does to deep seated chronic affections of skinand mucous membrane and SYPHILINUM to all syphilitic affections.

CLINICAL

Abdominal disorders, Asthma, Cough, Diabetes, Epilepsy, Eye affection, Gonorrhoea suppressed, Headache, Liver affection, Mental disorders, Nocturnal enufesis, Paralysis, Rheumatism, Throat and Lung affections, Urinary troubles, Tumours, Warts, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Medorrhinum predominantly affects the nervous system, brain, spinal cord and its meninges, mind, lymphatics, skin and mucous membane, joints, cardio-vascular and respiratory system, gastro intestinal tract, female genital organs, urinary and sexual organs, all troubles which can be traced to a sycotic origin.

PATHOGENESIS
Medorrhinum affects:

(a) The brain and spinal cord, producing paralysis, trembling and tidgety feeling with loss of memory.

(b) Cardio-vascular and respiratory systems resulting in dyspnoea, pain and cough.

(c) Joints, manifesting as rheumatism or gout.

(d) Glands—Enlargements of glands all over the body.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Medorrhinum is ideally suited to the patients having constitutional effects of maltreated or suppressed gonorrhoea; with trembling all over; weak, fatigued and emaciated as a result of long continued chronic diseases, with a state of collapse.

Temperament: Weeping disposition, peevish and impatient.

Relation with heat and cold: Medorrhinum is a hot patient, easily affected by heat in general.

Miasm: Sycosis is in the background for most of the troubles.

Diathesis: Rheumatic and gouty diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Medorrhinum is to be thought of in all cases of constitutional effects of maltreated and/or suppressed gonorrhoea when the best selected       remedies fail to relieve or permanently improve.
 
2. Soreness all over the body especially glands with burning in hands and feet (Sulphur, Puls., Cham, and Lach.).

3. Trembling all over the body with intense nervousness and profound exhaustion (Gels., Arg. nit. and Merc. sol.).

4. A state of collapse persists in the Medorrhinum patient who wants to be fanned all the time (Carbo veg., Lachesis). Coldness all over still    does not like covering, throws them off (Camphor, Secale cor.), cold and bathed with perspiration (Ver. alb.).

. Sensation of tightness, constriction and soreness all over.

. Intense restlessness and fidgety feeling in legs and feet (Zinc).

. Inordinate craving for liquor, salt, sweet and acid.

. Backache is relieved by profuse urination (Lyco.).

. Dyspnoea relieved by lying on face and protruding tongue.

10. Menses : Profuse, very dark, clotted, stains and difficult to wash off (Mag. carb.). wonwiena a

11. Pain in the heart region from apex to base (from base to apex, Syphilinum; from base to clavicle or shoulder, Spigelia),

12. Burning of hands and feet, wants them uncovered and and fanned (Sulph. and Lach.).

13. In case of women, there may be chronic ovaritis, salpingit,, pelvic cellulitis fibroids,cysts or any other morbid growth otuterus and ovar es     both benign and malignant with or without sycotic origin.

14, There is general aggravation FROM SUNR.SE TO SUNSET, when thinking of ailments, heat, covering and sweat. Amelioration at seashore (rev. of     Natrum mur. and Syphilinum).

15. Mind : Following are the very characteristic and sinking mental symptoms of this great remedy.There is GREAT WEAKNESS OF MEMORY, The patient is much worried about his forgetfulness; cannot remember very familiar names, words or initials; forgets not only his friend’s name, also his own name. Cannot spell correctly even very common words. Always has WEEPING TENDENCY (Puls. and Lil. tig.). Cannot speak without weeping; unable to narrate the symptoms. Often the question is to be repeated asshe loses herself. But the Medorrhinum patient predicts future events very correctly. Feels matters most sensitively before they occur. Always anticipates, anticipates her own death. He/she is too much irritated at verysilly matters; also peevish and impatient. Anxious, sensitive, nervous and fastidious.Time passes very slowly (Alumina, Arg. nit and Cannabis Ind.). Wants to do everything in a hurry and then gets exhausted and fatigued. Dreams of drinking and of insatiable thirst. Many of the mental symptoms are aggravated whern thinking about them.

16. Ailments from : Cases of maltreated and/or suppressed gonorrhoea may be treated with Medorrhitium giving immense relief to the patients, when the best selected remedies give no relief or fail to permanently improve, but only palliate, such ailments are as follows :-

(a) Disease of spinal cord and its meninges, with or without organic lesions, ending in paralysis and/or trembling, neuralgia, rheumatism, gout,     etc., which can be traced to a sycotic origin.

(b) Scirrhus, carcinoma or cancer, either, acute or chronic in development, when the symptoms point to a history of sycosis.

(c) In cases of women, chronic ovarits, salpingitis, growth of uterus and ovaries, both benign and malignant, with or without sycotic origin.

PARTICULARS

Headache :

Sensation: Head feels very heavy and is drawn backward, Sensation of tightness and constriction, extending down the spine; weight and pressure on vertex.

Character of pain: There is intense burning pain in the brain which extends down the spine.

Modality: Headache aggravated from jarring of cars, exhaustion or hard work.

Castro-intestinal Symptoms :

Abdomen : Ravenous hunger immediately after eating (Cina, Lyco., Psorinum), with intense thirst; even she dreams she is drinking. There is INTENSE CRAVING FOR LIQUOR which before she hated; desire for salt, sweet, ice, acids oranges, green fruits, etc.

Stool : There is constriction and inertia of bowels with ball-like stool. Can pass stool only by leaning far backwards (Can void urine only while sitting bent backwards, Zincummet.). There is sharp

needle-like pain in rectum so as to cause crying and tears. There may also be sensation of prolapse of rectum.

Character of stool is tenacious, clay-like, sluggish with oozing of foetid moisture. Intense itching of anus.

Back : There is severe backache extending from occiput to the whole length of spine, which is very sore and sensitive to touch. Beside this, there may also be burning heat along the course of the spine, beginning in nape of neck and extending downwards with stiffness and constriction. Lumber vertebrae are very sensitive and painful to touch. There is pain in sacrum, coccyx and back of hip running around and down the limb. Severe pain in back relieved by profuse urination (Lyco). Pains are aggravated when thinking of them and by heat.

Respiratory symptoms :

Throat : In any kind of throat affection, requiring this remedy there is sensation as if cold had settled in throat with distressing pain and soreness. Throat is filled with thick, gray blood stained mucus. The patient cannot swallow either liquid or solid.

Aggravation: From heat and when thinking of his ailments.
Cough : Pneumonia :
¢ Location: Usually middle lobe of right lung is affected.
© Sensation: Constriction in throat.
© Character of cough: Cough is dry, continuous, deep, hollow, like coughing in a barrel (Lyco).

© Aggravation: When thinking of his ailments

Time: During climacteric period.

Quantity: Profuse




Duration: Long lasting.

Concomitants: Breast and nipple are very painful, sensitive and sore to touch. Breasts espciaally the Nipples are icy cold to touch during menses while rest of the body is warm.

Urinary system : In renal colic, there is intense pain in ureter with sensation of passing renal stone (Lyco., Berb. Vul. and Sars). When urinating, there is painful tenesmus in bladder.

Character of urine: Urine is high coloured with smell of ammonia.

Nocturnal enuresis in children with history of gonorrhoea in parents. Passes large quantity of urine every night. Aggravation from over work, extremes of heat and cold. When the best selected remedies fail to relieve.

Intense restlessness and fidgety feeling in legs and feet (Zincum). Pain in legs from hip to knees, only when walking; aches during night, preventing steep. During and electrical thunderstorm, there is terrible burning and aching in legs and arms,

Rheumatism :

In gout and rheumatism, caused by maltreated or suppressed gonorrhoea, this great remedy can be thought of.

Rheumatism and arthritic pain as a sequelae of suppressed gonorrhoea with sensation of constriction and tightening feeling all over the body. Sore as if bruised.

Location: Rheumatism of both the shoulders and arms (Right, Sanguinaria. Left, Ferrum met.). Pains extend; to fingers. Painful stiffness of every joint in body. Along with this, mere is deformity of finger joints, ankles are large and puffy, swelling and painful stiffness of ankles. Great tenderness of heels and balls of feet. Swelling and puffiness of all joints.

Modalities:

Aggravation: During days before a thunderstorm and when thinking of pain.

Amelioration: At sea-shore and during damp weather.

Baby :

Baby having sycotic background. Dwarfish baby with stunted growth (Psoric baby—Baryta carb.). Mentally the baby is very idiotic but physically weak. Pale rachitic with enlarged-lymphatic glands all over the body.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: Most of the ailments are worse when thinking of them, from sunrise to sunset, heat, thunderstorm, covering, stretching, least movement and sweat.

Amelioration: At seashore (rev. of Nat. mur.), lying on stomach and damp weather (Caust., Nux vom., Hepar).

Relations :

Antidoted by: Ipecac.

Compatible: Sulphur.

Sweet Clover BOWEN Leguminosae

INTRODUCTION

Melilotus was first proved by Bowen in 1851. A second proving was made by him fifteen years later. It has been re-proved by Dr. H.C.Allen.

CLINICAL

Congestion, constipation, convulsions, eclampsia, epilepsy, epistaxis, haemorrhages, headache, melancholia.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1) Congestions, relieved by haemorrhage.

2) Headache : Violent congestive or nervous headaches.

Location : Frontal Headache intense in left supra orbital region.

Sensation : Sensation of tension and wave like movement in brain with vertigo and nausea.
Character : Violent, congestive, periodical, nervous headaches, every week or every four weeks. Modality—Aggravation—By motion, by thinking. Amelioration—By lying down, by profuse urination, by epistaxis, by menstruation. Concomitant— Retching, vomiting, cold hands and feet.

3) Epistaxis preceded by intense redness, flushing of face and throbbing of carotids with general relief.

4) Very red face precedes haemorrhage from every organ.

5) Constipation : Stool is difficult, painful with feeling con-striction, fullness and throbbing in anus. No desire until there is large    accumulation.

8) General Modalities : Aggravation—rainy changeable weather, approach storm, motion, 4 p.m.






CHAPTER :139 MENYANTHES TRI FOLIATA

Buckbean HAHNEYMANN Gentianaceae



INTRODUCTION

In common language it is called as ‘Buck- bean’ or Bog—Bean ‘as it grows in boggy places. It is a water plant and abounds in few districts, where it is in great local repute, as a remedy for ague. It was introduced into homoeopathy by Hahnemann, who proved it on himself.

CLINICAL

Headache. Heart pains. Intermittent fever. Gastric affections. Nerve—disorders.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Headache: The headache found under this remedy is very characteristic.

Location : There is pressing pain in vertex from above down wards.

Sensation : Sensation as of a heavy weight pressing upon head at every step. (Cac., Glon., Lach.).

Modalities : Aggravation : Ascending (Calc.)

Amelioration—During hard pressure with hands, stooping, sitting.

Concomitant: Headache is often associated with icy coldness of hands and feet (Cal. Sep.).

2) Gastric Symptoms :

Gi) Thirst: No thirst at any time,

Gi) Has desire for meat,

(iii) Ravenous hunger passing away after eating a little,

(iv) Sensation of coldness in stomach and abdomen,

(v) Distention of abdomen increased by smoking tobacco.

3) Extremities : Iey coldness of hands and feet. As soon as patient lies down, legs jerk & twitch.

4) Anxiety : about the heart as if some evil was impending.

5) Tension : in root of nose; in arms, hands, fingers; in skin as if of several sizes, too small and was crowded into it by force,

6) Ailments from : Complaints from abuse of cinchona and quinine.

7) Intermittent Fever : Causation : Cases abused by cinchona & quinine.

Chill stage—This stage predominates in Menyanthes. Col-dness felt most acutely in abdomen & legs. It is felt most severely on the back, and it is greatly relieved by warmth of the stove or near fire. As soon as he rises from his bed in the morning he feels coldness creeping over abdomen, back and sides. Icy coldness of hands and feet as if immersed in ice water. There is shivering with yawning.

Heat stage : There are flushes of heat with hot ears and cheeks.

Sweat stage : Perspiration in evening as soon as he lies down—Continuing all night.

Menyanthes can be compared with Apis Mel, Cedron, China, Chin Ars, Eup. Perf. Ignatia, Lycopodium, Nat Mur. Ver. Alb. in intermittent fever.

Apis Mel : Chill begins at 3-00 p.m. with thirst. Pulse is full and rapid, small and trembling intermittently. No thirst in sweat stage. Worse from warm and heated room and exter-nal heat.

Cedorn : It is a valuable remedy in intermittent fever espe-cially when there is a clock wise recurrence in succesive attacks of fever & chill. Before Chill, there is a great mental excitement & exaltation of vital energy. General coldness renewed by every movement. During heat stage red face & thirst for warm drink is marked. It is soon followed by a state of profuse perspiration.

China : In China all the three stages of fever, chill, heat & sweat are very well marked. Paroxysm anticipated from two to three hours before each attack. It returns every seven or fourteen days, but never at night. There is a profuse debilitating sweat all over on being covered or during sleep.

Chin. Ars. : Intermittent fever with great prostration and periodicity. Chill stage prodominates with little thirst and continuous convulsive yawning. Eup. Perf : In Eup. Perf. the time of paroxysma is generally between 7 A.M. and 9 AM. It is postponing type. There is great thirst for several hours before the fever. He knows chill is coming because he cannot drink enough. Drinking hastens chill and causes vomiting at close of Chill. The bruised feeling, as if broken all over the body, bony pain affecting back, chest, limbs especially the wrists which feel as if dislocated. The more general and severe the pain, the better it is indi-cated and
adapted.

Ignatia : Fever paroxysm comes with marked periodicity. Fever comes at the same hour everyday. In fever the face is red during chill, pale during heat, also there is great thirst during chill stage of fever and no thirst in heat stage. There is great yawning and stretching before the attack of fever. The suffering of the patient is aggravated by covering and relieved by exiernal heat.

Lycopdium : Chill between 3 & 4 p.m. The patient feels as if lying on ice. One chill is followed by another. There is sour vomiting between chill & heat stage.

Natrum Mur : It is especially to be though of in chronic, intermittet fever and old badly treated cases especially after suppression by quinine. Fever paroxysm between 10 a.m. and 11 a.m. Fever with sever headache, left sided clavus as if a thousand little hammers were knocking in the brain with coldness of the body and chilliness well marked. Uncon-sciousness during chill and heat. There is sweat on every little exertion with relief of all the sufferings.

Veratrum Album : In this remedy we get a very congestive and pernicious type of intermittent fever with extreme cold-ness of the body, great thirst, face cold and collapsed, skin cold and clammy, great prostration, cold sweat on forehead and deathly pallor on face.

 
chapter: 140 MERCURIUS CORROSIVUS

Corrosive Sublimate BUCHNER HgCl,

INTRODUCTION

Merc. cor. is a very small drug, but its action is very remarkable in a few diseases. The key- note which runs through the whole drug is
GREAT TENESMUS, either in the rectum or urinary bladder, or in both. It was proved by our Master Hahnemann with the help of physio-chemical process, by mixing one part of mercury and two parts of chlorine.

Mercurius corrosivus very much resembles Mercurius in many of its pathogenesis, but the
depth of action, severity of the case, excoriation and burning, rapid spreading of ulcer and tenesmus are much more in Merc. cor.

CLINICAL

Apthae, Bone affection, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Eczema, Gonorrhoea, Kidney affection, Labour, Mumps, Puerperal fever, Paralysis, Syphilis, Tenesumus, Throat affections, Tongue affections, Ulcerated intestine, Urinary troubles, Uvula elongated, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on mucous membrane, intestine, urinary bladder, eye, bones etc. It also has got action over the serous membranes, especially peritoneum.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes irritation and inflammation of both mucous and serous memmbranes producing tenesmus of rectum and bladder, suppression of urine.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Great tenesmus persists before, during and even after stool. Tenesmus not relieved by stool; stool scanty mucus mixed with stool.

2. Tenesmus of the bladder and rectum at the same time; urine passes in drops with much pain. Throat intensely inflamed, swollen, burning with swollen gums, which bleed easily. Ulcers are deep and spread very rapidly.  Desire for cayenne pepper, ice, cold water. Aliments from : Syphilis, sun and summer weather.


PARTICULARS

Eyes :

Opthalmia neonatorum. Burning, excoriating discharge from the eyes, soreness of the eyes. Eyelids swollen. Deep ulcers on the cornea.

Mouth :

Teeth loose. Gums spongy and swollen. Pyorrhoea and ptyalism. Tongue swollen and inflamed. Salivation is profuse. Salty and bitter taste in 
mouth.

Throat :

UVULA SWOLLEN; SWALLOWING IS VERY PAINFUL RAPIDLY SPREADING ULCERS, BURNING PAIN WITH GREAT SWELLING. All glands about the throat are swollen.

Modality: Worse by external pressure.

Dysentery :

Merc. cor. is FAMOUS for dysentery in violent cases.

Causation: Mostly during summer weather.

Stool: COPIOUS, BLEEDING, SUMY; contains streaks of mucus membrane; very offensive;
frequent evacuation.

Before stool: Tenesmus, cutting colic and uriging to stool.

During stool: Tenesmus of the rectum and may be accompanied with tenesmus of bladder too.

After stool: No relief. Tenesmus persists for some time. Great burning in the rectum.

Modality: More at night and aggravated by motion.

Concomitants: Unquenchable thirst. Salivated, swollen tongue. Abdomen swollen, hard and sensitive to pressure, especially about the umbticus. Scanty urine, passes drop by drop; hot, bloody, tenesmus in the bladder. Faintness, weakness and shuddering. Cramps in the calf muscles.

Urine :

Tenesmus of bladder with intense burning in urethra. Urine is hot, buming, scanty or suppressed. Voided drop by drop, with great pain; bloody. Intense burning in urethra. Stabbing pain extends up urethra info bladder.

Concomitants: Perspiration after urinating. Albuminuria in early preganancy (Phosphorus, later and at full term).
Gonorrhoea :

In the second stage of gonorrhoea when the greenish discharge begins to flow and the burning and tenesmus continues, Merc. cor, is of great help.

Modality: Aggravation at night.

Concomitants; Penis and testes are enormously swollen. Chancres assume phagadenic appearance.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: Afternoon, AT NIGHT AND DURING SUMMER.

Amelioration: By rest.

chapter : 142  MERCURIUS

(HYDRARGYRUM) so Quick Silver HAHNEMANN The Element Hg

INTRODUCTION

Mercurius is the KING OF ANTI- SYPHILITIC remedies, prepared and proved by Hahnemann. It is prepared by precipitating Mercury from its solution in Nitric acid by means of Caustic ammonia. The Pathogenesis of Mercury is found in the provings of Merc, viv.,  and Merc. sol. “Iwo different preparations, but not different enough to make any distinctions in practice” remarks DR KENT. Even CLARKE supports this fact in his Dictionary by saying, “No pains have been taken to keep distinct Merc, sol and Merc, viv., and I do not find it practicable to attempt to separate them”. One more thing to clarify is that the pure element, Mercurius, manifested the same symptoms as soluble mercury—Merc. sol. Hence there is no point in separately discussing them.

CLINICAL

Abscess, Anaemia, Bone affection, Breath offensive, Bronchitis, Catarrh, Cold, Dentition, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Dyspepsia, Eye affection, Gout, Glandular swelling, Gum troubles, Heart affection, Jaundice, Leucorrhoea, Liver affection, Lung affection, Measles, Melancholia, Perspiration abnormal, Pregnancy troubles, Prostatic disorders, Rheumatism, Small-pox, Suppuration, Syphilis, Teeth affection, Throat and Lung affections, Toothache, Tremors, Ulcers, Vomiting, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Every organ and tissue of the body is more or less affected by this powerful drug—

such as bones, glands, lymphatic system, internal organs, intestine, mucous membrane, ete.

PATHOGENESIS

Lesions produced by Mercury are very similar to those of syphilis. It decomposes blood, producing profound anaemia. It has great power over suppuration with sero- Sanguinous discharge, slimy in character. It also produces ulceration of mouth and throat, much salivation, with falling of hair. It causes inflammation which leads to induration and from induration to ulceration.


CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: It is best adapted to light-haried persons with lax skin and lax muscles. In some cases, jaundice or yellow coloration of skin in marked.

Temperament: Easily frightened nature with hurried and rapid speech.

Relation with heat and cold: Mercurius is said to be the HUMAN BAROMETER, Easily affected by both extremes of heat and cold (Antim.crud.—least affected, Fi.ac.).

Miasm: Syphilis. It is the KING OF ANTI-SYPHILITIC remedies.


GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1, All complaints arc aggravated from sunset to sunrise i.e. whole night, especially the bone pains, the characteristic symptom of all syphilitic medicines.

2. Profuse offensive perspiration with nearly every complaint, which gives no relief; on the contrary it increases the suffering (Ver.alb. Hepar sulph.—profuse prespiration        
   gives     relief—Natrum mur, Psonnum). yoorinan

3. All discharges are very offensive, especially sweat and breath. The patient as a whole smells offensive. Foulness and offensiveness run through the whole remedy.

4. Tremor and trembling from least exertion, especially in nervous disorders, such a as paralysis agitans.

5. Creeping chilliness with fever is a peculiarity of this drug.

6. Discharges from mucous membrane are slimy in character.

7. Thirst : There is intense thirst for large quantity of cold water, although the tongue is moist, salivated, large, flabby, showing imprint of    teeth (Chelidonium, Podo,  
   Rhus      tox) Dry tongue no thirst—Puls., Nux mos. Dry tongue much thirst—Bryonia, Arsenic).

8. Every little injury suppurates (Hepar, Silicea, Graphites). Glandular swelling with or without suppuration, especially if the suppurative    discharges are too profuse and 
   offensive.

9. Desire: Milk, sweet, but these disagree: beer; alcohol. Aversion to meat, coffnd butter.

10. Mind : Tired of life, weak memory, loss of will power. Slow and sluggish in answering questions for fear of losing his reason. Great     apprehension. Desire to flee with    
    nightly anxiety. Bad effects of fright, mania. Throws off the clothes at night and scolds, But does not     harm any one. Disgust for life.

11. Ailments from : Abuse of crude mercurial preparations; bad effects of sugar, stings of insects, fright, suppressed foot-sweat, vapour of     arsenic or copper. Suppress 
    gonorrhoea and/or syphilis.

12. In liver and lung complaints there is utter inability to lie on right side and there i$ aggravation by lying on right side.

13. The symptoms are worse by touch and pressure.

14, In the suppurative stage of small pox it is a specific remedy.

15. Flow of pus, particularly bloody pus from any orifice calls for Mercurius.

PARTICULARS
