Daphne Mezereum E. STAPF Thymelaceae

INTRODUCTION

It was introduced in the Materia medica by Dr. Stapf, but extensively proved by Hahnemann. “The medicine still remains as one of Hahnemann’s precious medical legacies”, remarks Dr. Tyler in her drug picture. Hughes tells us that mezereum was one of the vegetable substances with which it was attempted to replace mercury in the tretment of syphilis. This fact has been supported by provings. Hence, the drug is also called VEGETABLE MERCURY.

CLINICAL

Bone affection, Ear troubles,  Exostosis, Enlargement of glands, Gonorrhoea, Herpes zoster, Impetigo, Irritation, Leucorrhoea, Neuralgia, Rheumatism, Syphilis, Teeth affection,
Tongue affection, Skin troubles, Ulcers, Vaccination-bad effects of, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on skin, bones, teeth, nerve and mind.

PATHOGENESIS

On the skin it produces variety of destructive changes, right from a simple non- eruptive itch to malignant ulcers, lesions with or without oozing and black discharges dry
up and become thick leather-like scab with a soft pus-like material intervening between it and skin surface. On bones, especially the periosteum, it causes inflammations and
bone pains. Nerves, underthe action of this drug produce neuralgia predominantly about teeth and face.


CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: It is especially suited to light haired, irresolute persons.

Temperament: Phlegmatic temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora and syphilis are in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Bad effects of vaccination (Antim. tart., Silicea, Thuja, Crotalus hor.) especially skin eruptions.


2. Its action is characterised throughout by VIOLENCE i.e., violent pains, violent itching, etc.

3. Patient is very much sensitive to cold air.

4. Pains of various kinds with chilliness.

5. Ulcers with THICK WHITISH YELLOW SCABS, under which thick yellow pus collects.

6. The head is particularly covered with THICK LEATHER LIKE CRUSTS.

7. Facial neuralgia after zona (eruptive diseases); toothache when the pains are aggravated by eating.

8. In Mezereum, affections go from above downwards, from within outward and from right to left (Clarke).

9. Aggravation at night is a generality of Mezereum.

10. Mind : Mentally the patient is hypochondriacal, sad and despondent. He is indifferent to everything and everyone. Easily becomes angry at trifles and at perfectly harmless things or words, but is soon sorry for it. Weak memory with absent-mindedness and great aversion to talking. There is fear and apprehension and faintness, as if something would happen. The faintness is caused by shock, pain and by hearing bad news.

11. Ailments from : Anger, abuse of mercury, alcohol and vaccination.

PARTICULARS

Headache :
Causation. After slight vexation and anger.

Location: Right sided, extending from root of the nose to the forehead.

Sensation: Feel as if the head would be crushed.

Character of headache. Violent type of headache. Pains are tearing and boring. Pain in head causes faintness.

Modalities:
¢ Aggravation: From slightest touch, motion and at night.

¢ Amelioration: In the open air, by heat and by covering the head.

Toothache :

In carious teeth, teeth decay suddenly, especially at the roats.

Character of toothache: Violent neuralgic pain; dull pain when biting on them and when touched by tongue. There is decaying about the root of the teeth. There is also scorbutic conditions of the gum which bleeds.

Modalities:
¢ Aggravation: At night and from touch.

¢ Amelioration: By keeping the mouth open and drawing the air in (rev. of Staph).

chapter : 144

MILLEFOLIUM Yarrow Compositae

INTRODUCTION

Another name for this plant is ‘Noseb-leed’, a very appropriate term because of its great tendency to produce haemorrhage, not only from the nose, but from every orifice and of the human system. Its medicinal proper-ties were known to the ancients. It is mentioned in Homer’s Iliad as being utilised by Achilles to heal the wounds of his soldiers and hence it is called Achillea millefolium.

CLINICAL

Cough, Convulsions, Epilepsy, Haemorrhages, Hysteria, Leucorrhoea, Vertigo.


GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Haemorrhages : from all the orifices of the body ; from wounds or of mechanical origin ; painless haemorrhage without fever ; blood is bright red and fluid.

2) Profusely bleeding wound especially after a fall.

3) Vertigo when moving slowly, but not when taking violent exercise.

4) Cough: Causation : Suppressed menses or haemorrhoids, after a fall from a height, after violent exertion.

Character of cough : Cough with raising of blood daily at 4 p.m. (Lyco.)

Concomitant : Cough with oppression and palpitation.

5) Menses :

Time : Early

Quantity : Profuse a

Duration : Protracted Character : Suppressed with colic pain in abdomen. Blood is bright red & fluid.
6) Leucorrhoea of Children from atony (Cal., Caulo.)

7) Ailments from : Falls (from height). Overexertion. Lifting. Suppressed lochia. Suppressed menses. Suppressed haemorrhoids etc. In haemorrhage, Millefolium canbe.compared with Erige-ron, Ipceac, Nitric Acid, Phosphorus & Trillium.




Erigeron Canadensis : Haemorrhages of this remedy from the orifices of the body is characterised by bright redness of the discharge. Haemorrhage from the uterus, bloody lochia even leucorrhoea are usually attended with painful micturition or urinary irritation and in some cases with irritation of the rectum. It can be used with great success in cases of haematemesis due to ulceration or rupture of blood vessels in the stomach, from bowels due to fissures, from urinary bladder due to chronic cystitis, polyp or malignancy.

Ipecac : Ipecac is a great haemorrhagic remedy. Bleeding from all orifices of the body, from uterus, bowels, kidney, nose, lungs etc. Character of blood is profuse and steady flow of bright red blood. Nausea, oppressed breathing, thirstless-ness and clean tongue are the concomitant with haemorrhage.

Nitric Acid : Nitric Acid is an excellent remedy for haemorrhage from anywhere and every where. It may be from the mouth, nose, lungs, stomach, uterus after
miscar-riage or post partum, due to overexertion, chromic diseases, or broken down cachectic condition.

The character of blood is bright red or may also be dark, but profuse and coagulable with sticking, pricking, lancinat-ing and splinter like pain, relieved only by riding
in a carriage.

Phosphorus : It is a great anti-haemorrhagic remedy. Haemorrhage is caused by degeneration of tissue and occurs from small injuries or cut. In this, character of blood is pro-fuse, watery, bright red and non-coagulable. Bleeding from various organs and parts of the body. Small wounds bleed much, pours out freely and then ceases suddenly for a time, seen as in metrorrhagia, haemoptysis, haematemesis, from nose, stomach, anus etc.

Trillium Pendulum : Trillium also has profuse, bright red and active or passive haemorrhage from nose, lungs, kidneys and uterus etc. In uterine haemorrhage flow is gushing, pro-fuse, bright red, aggravated by least movement. At climacteric the flow occurs every two weeks ; paleness, faintness, dim-sight, palpitation, obstruction and noise in ears, and painful sinking at pit of stomach are concomitant symptoms.

INTRODUCTION

INTRODUCTION

Natrum sulphuricum—Sodium sulphate was discovered by Glauber; hence it is called Glauber’s salt, it is used by the old school as a laxative or purgative. But Homoeopathy has
raised its status and established its great utility jn various diseased conditions like pneumonia, asthma, etc. Schuessler has laboriously explained the role this salt plays in the economy of life and he included it as a member of the tissue remedies. It was studied by Grauvogl, who found in it the hydrogenoid constitutions.

CLINICAL

Asthma, Abdominal disorders, Biliousness, Cough, Diarrhoea, Debility, Diabetes, Epilepsy, Flatulence, Gonorrhoea. Headache, Injury, Liver affection, Meningitis, Pneumonia, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION .

It acts mainly on gastro-intestinal tract, respiratory system and skin. Meninges and. mind are also affected with equal severity. Occasionally, head, conjunctiva and genital
organs are also affected.

PATHOGENESIS

On the alimentary system, it produces a state of inflammation causing jsentery and diarrhoea. Vomiting may also result occasionally. The drug has got its main seat of
action on the respiratory system causing sycotic pneumonia and humid asthma. Its action is undoubtedly directed upon the blood through which it produces irritating
disturbances in nearly every tissue of the body. Meningitis and brain symptoms, due to effects of long-age injury are its characteristic effects.

chapter : 153 NITRIC ACID

INTRODUCTION

Of the trio of powerful acids, viz., Sulphuric acid (H,SO,)Hydrochloric acid (HCL) and Nitric acid (HNO3), the last one leads
the list in severity and its corrosive effect. But when it is potentised, it becomes an excellent remedy. It is a constitutional
remedy, suitable for both chronic and acute diseases. All the three acids mentioned above are dangerous in their crude form, but when
potentised, they posess very useful therapeutic value. Nitric acid is a chemical product manufactured synthetically and has a wide
range of commercial use.

CLINICAL

Abdominal troubles, Anus-fissures of, Bright’s disease, Bronchitis, Bubo, Chronic catarrh, Chancres, Constipation, Cough,
Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Ear and Eye affection, Glandular swelling, Haemorrhage, Haemorrhoids, Haematuria, Headache, Herpes,
Menstrual troubles, Rickets, Syphilis, Skin troubles, Tongue affection, Ulcers, Urinary disorders, Warts, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Nitric acid acts on blood, skin, mucous membrane glands, bones and gastro-intestinal tract.

PATHOGENESIS

The special seat of ation of Nitric acid is at the junction of skin and mucous embranes of the body, such as mouth, eyes, nose, rectum, anus, vagina, urethra, etc. It
disorganises the blood causing decomposition; it produces intense irritation, resulting in nflammation, destruction, ulceration and even gangrene of the parts. Its action on
gastro-intestinal tract sets in diarrhoea, haemorrhage, etc.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: Nitric acid is especially suited to thin, weak and debilitated Prsons with rigid musculature, dark complexion, black hair and eyes. Ugly looking
appearance; with broken down cachectic constitution; anaemic and emaciated; old people WITH MORING Darrhoea (Phos.),

Temperament: Nervous and irritable temperament,

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.

INTRODUCTION
Nux vomica is the male countepart ofPulsatilla and Ignatia. It is the most “Frequently
looked for”? medecine in the box of everyHomoeopath. The remedy is indispensable becauseit is:
(a) The first remedy indicated after muchdosing with allopathic drugs.
(b) The best remedy with which tocommence treatment of cases that havebeen drugged by various schools.
c) Hahnemann’s GREATESTPOLYCHREST REMEDY.
(d) Applicable to both acute and chronic ailments.
(e) Pre-eminently the remedy for any of thexonditions incidental to and arising fromthe so called MODERN CIVILIZED LIFE.
(f) A suitable remedy for people of every age, sex and temperament.
(g) The remedy which is capable of working wonders for people of all walks of lifefrom the lowest to the highest standard, in both civilised and un-civilisedclasses.

The remedy is a unique gift from the vegetable kingdom. The tree is grown as a wild
plant found in the equatorial region. In its crude form, there may not be anything more
bitter than its seed.
It is also very poisonous. After undergoing the process of potentisation, the bitterness
and the poisonous effects of the seed are transformed into a marvellous curative power,
affecting each and every organ and system. But for the historic invention of Hahnemann
of this wild seed, millions of suffering people could not have been redeemed of their
various ailments.

Just as the Nux vomica seed is bittermost, poisonous and wild, so also are the Nux
vom. patients, like the drug itself, difficult to study.

Is followed by: Bryonia, Pulsatilla, Sulphur.

Note : Nux should be given at the time of retiring or, what is better, at the time of several hours

chapter : 157  OPIUM

Poppy HAHNEMANN Papaveraceae

INTRODUCTION

Opium is a strong poison and is obtainedfrom the unripe capsules of the poppy plant.
It contains at least twenty different alkaloidssuch as morphine, apo-mor-phine, codeine,
narcotine etc. Hahnemann says, “Opium isalmost the only medicine that in its
primary action does not produce asingle pain” Opium is a long acting,
constitu-tional, polychrest medicine havingremarkable actions in several diseases.

CLINICAL

Apoplexy, Brain affection, Colic. Constipation. Epilepsy. Fear-effects of. Marasmus.
Paralysis. Sleepiness. Sleeplessness. Sunstroke. Typhoid. Urinary complaints etc,
SPHERES OF ACTION

It is a polychrest medicine of wide range. Its chief action is on mind, senses and
nerves of the body. Also acts on skin and mucous membranes of the different tracts such
as respiratory, digestive and urinary.

PATHOGENESIS

The symptoms produced by opium poisoning vary according to the quantity of opium
taken. In mild doses it causes a sort of exhilarating effect on emotional side more than
the intellectual sphere for a short duration. In increased doses it produces the symptoms
which simulates an attack of apoplexy.

Opium lessens voluntary movements, contracts pupils, depresses higher intellectual
Powers, lessons self control and power of concentration, judgment, stimulates the
lmagina-tion. It checks all secretions except that of skin, which is excited.
CONSTITUTION

, Make up of the body: It is especially adapted to diseases of first and second childhood
Le. to children and old people. Persons with light hair, lax muscles, and want to bodily
uritability. Children with wrinkled skin, look like a little dried up old man.

Heat cold relation : Hot patient.
GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1) Want of susceptibility to well selected remedies due to lack of vital reaction.
Especially in nervous diseases (Ambra. G., Valer.)

2) Painlessness is a grand characteristic of opium. Patient complains of nothing,
wants nothing.

3) Sleep—It has many important sleep symptoms which are as follows :
(a) Sleepiness—It is one of Nash’s three remarkable remedies for sleepiness, others
being Antim Tart and Nux Moscheta.
(b) Sleep is heavy, stupid, with half-closed eyes during sleep.
(c) Stertorous rattling or breathing with great stuporous sleep.
(d) Sleeplessness with acuteness of hearing, clock striking and cocks crowing at agreat distance keeps her awake.
(e) Sleepy but cannot sleep (Bell., Chamo., Stram.)
(f) Picking of bed clothes during sleep.
(g) Loss of breath on falling asleep (Ammon C., Digi., Lac Can., Lach.)
4) Complaints from fright while fear still persists.
5) Delirium: Patient constantly talks during delirium. Eyes glossy and wide open orhalf closed. Face red & puffed. He thinks he is not at home.
6) Delirium Tremens in old emaciated persons, bloated face, stupor, eyes burning hot,dry with loud snoring.
7) Bed feels so hot she cannot lie on it and she moves often in search of a cold place.
8) Sweat: as a concomitant is a characteristic of opium. Complaints appearing with
perspiration. Hot perspiration over whole body except lower limbs.
9) Stool: Involuntary black and offensive from paralysis of sphincter especially afterfright. :
10) Urine : retained or involuntary after fright (suppression of urine, bladder empty—stram).
11) Inactivity of digestive organs resulting in reversed peris-taltic motion. Faecalvomiting.
12) Ailments from bad effects of fright, fear still remaining, from charcoal vapours.
from inhaling gas, alcohol, approach of stranger, from nursing after fright of
mother, from crying, lead poisoning, excessive use of tobacco, suppression of or
sudden retrocession of acute exanthema, from excessive joy, anger, shame,
emotion, sun etc.
13) Mentals : Opium is a great remedy for distinct and characteristic mental symptomswhich are as follows :

The patient complains of nothing, wants nothing. She tells you she is not sick,
though she has passed no stool or urine or she has a temperature of 105-106°, There
is confusion of mind, delirium with great stupor. In delerium patient is con-stantly
talking, especially when aroused. Her face looks besotted, red puffed, eyes glassy
and half closed with loud snoring. The patient thinks she is not at home. (Bry.)
which is continually in her mind. During sleep picking of bed clothes is marked.
Opium . 463
Bed feels so hot she cannot lie on it: moves often in search of a cold place. It is one of

fear remains or the cause of it comes before the eyes. There is also a sensation of bodily
well being and great happiness. Great sensibility to sound, light, and faintest odors.

PARTICULARS

Gastro-intestinal Tract:

Angina pectoris. Aphonia. Backache.

This remedy has not been proved thoroughly. For the knowledge of this remedy we are mainly indebted to Hale, who introduced it to

worries and over work. Many cases of Convulsions, epilepsy, insom-nia etc. have been reported cured with this medicine in mas-sive doses.
The dose varies from ten drops to one drum of the tincture according to the age of patient.

PETROLEUM
Coal oil or Rock oil HAHNEMANN Anthracite
INTRODUCTION

This product from the interior of the earth, when, used as a remedial agent, “can help a Homoeopathic physician to fight variety of
diseases”, so says the Master. This crude oil is purified with the help of sulphuric acid before it
undergoes the process of potentisation. Kent says that petroleum is one of the drugs abused by his
colleagues of the orthodox school of medicines and when it is used in rheumatism and bruises
as an external application on the surface, this is not its homoeopathic action.

CLINICAL

Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Abdominal disorders, Constipation, Diarrhoea, Eczema,

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts chiefly upon the skin and mucous membrane, especially of gastro-intestinal tract. Underwood claims that it has action on heart, meninges and cerebrum too.

PATHOGENESIS

The skin bears the brunt of the action of the drug. It produces a number of skin changes mainly of dry character as a result of irritation manifesting as CRACKS AND FISSURES. On brain and heart when it acts, it produces tonic and clonic convulsion with oppression, giddiness, palpitation of heart and faintness.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Adapted to persons of light hair and light skin who suffer from cutaneous eruptions and gastro-intestinal disorders.

CLINICAL

Asthma, Brain-fag, Cough, Debility, Diabetes, Diarrhoea, Enteric fever, Flatulence, Gout, Headache, Locomotor ataxia, Mental weakness, Perspiration, Disorders of pregnancy, Rheumatism, Sexual organs, Spermatorrhoea, Urinary disorders, Vertigo, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on brain, nerves, blood, kidneys, mucous membrane, sex organs and bones.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces both mental and physical debility but the mental symptoms are first to develop. The remedy runs from mental to physical, from brain to muscles (In Muriatic acid, the muscular prostration comes first and the mind seems to be clear until long after the muscles are prostrated i.e. debility runs from body to mind). It also produces haemorrhage, digestive disorders and inflammation of bones.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: It is best suited to persons of originally strong constitution, who have become debilitated BY LOSS OF VITAL FLUIDS, sexual excess, violent acute diseases, chagrin or long succession of moral emotion, grief, care or disappointed affection. INTRODUCTION

‘Phosphorus is one of our best proved and requently used drugs and besides this, it is a remedy of very definite characteristic symptoms.In Allen’s Encyclopaedia, it has no less than 3,920 recorded symptoms.

Hahnemann by using phosphorus in Homoeo Parmacy has proved the fact that potentised medicines are no longer subject to chemical laws.As we all know phosphorus in pure crude form, is highly cumbustible if exposed to air, hencedangerous, but when the same is potentised, it becomes one of the leading healers.

CLINICAL

Anaemia. Asthma, Bone diseases, Brain affection, Cancer, Catarrh, Constipation, Consumption,Cough, Diarrhoea, Dropsy, Ecchymosis, Enteric fever, Epilepsy, Exostosis, Eye affection, Epistaxis, Fatty degeneration, Flatulence, Gastritis, Haemorrhage, Headache, Heart affection, Jaundice, Liver affection, Locomotor ataxia, Marasmus, Menstrual disorders, Neuralgia, Numbness, Paralysis, Pneumona, Pregnancy—disorders of, Rheumatism, Rickets, Throat and lung affections, Ulcers, Vomiting, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

PATHOGENESIS»

It initiates inflammation and degeneration of mucous membranes irritates and inflames serous membranes, destroys spinal cord and nerves causing 
paralysis. It also destroys bones, especially of the lower jaw and tibia. Disorganises blood; causes fatty degeneration of heart and liver, with

INTRODUCTION

Platinum, the costliest and the heaviest metal in the mineral kingdom, is nick-named by some authors as the “BLACK” LETTER MEDICINE” meaning thereby that the drug has occupied its place in pur pharmacopoeia by causing (in proving) and by curing (in homoeopathic preparation) maladies especially mental or those connected with perverted mental conditions. The curious thing in Platina, is thatthis mental subconscious state extends outwards into the physical sphere.

Abdominal disorders, Constipation, Convulsion, Delusion, Genital organs, Hysteria, Headache, Labour, Melancholia, Menstrual disorders, Neuraliga, Numbness, Rheumatism, Vag-inismus, etc.

It acts especially upon the nerve centres depressing the sensorium and producing a general tendency to anaesthesia, paralysis, etc, manifested especially in women.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes the derangement of sexual health producing a hysterial condition, melancholia and menstrual disorders.

PLUMBUM

Lead HARTLAUB Pb, The Metal

INTRODUCTION

Plumbum has been proved by Hering and three other eminent doctors. The metal “LEAD” is used as one of the constituents of paints. Hence symptoms of gradual lead poisoning are commonly met with amongst the painters. Compilation of our Materia Medica is greatly helped by the careful and scientific observation of symptoms brought about by the inadvertent use of the poisonous doses, especially amongst the painters. In the old school, metallic lead was seldom used, being considered as inert, but Boehave gave it internally after reducing it to an impalpable powder for leucorrhoea, dysentery, syphilis and gout. In Homoeopathy, it is used only if the drug fulfils the law of Similia-in relation to the disease.

CLINICAL

Abdominal disorders, Anaemia, Asthma, Atrophy, Bone diseases, Brain troubles, Bright’s disease, Colic, Constipation, Epilepsy, Eye troubles, Fevers, Gout, Haemorrhoids, Headache, Hernia, Intestinal obstruction, Jaundice, Kidney affection, Liver troubles, Muscular atrophy, Paralysis, Respiratory toubles, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Plumbum acts especially upon the nervous system i.e., on spinal nerve centres. The blood and the ailmentary system are also the special seats of action of this drug.
PATHOGENESIS

It irritates the spinal nerve centre causing increased sensibility, neuralgic spasm, Paralysis cheifly of extensors, especially of forearm, or upper limbs with partial anaesthesia or excessive hyperaesthesia. Haematosis is interfered with. Rapid reduction in the number of R.B.C. and pallor, icterus, anaemia, etc. frequently occur.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Excessive and rapid emaciation, with extreme weakness and anaemia. The look of the face is greasy, shiny, pale yellow and hippocratic. Cheeks are sunken, expressive of great anxiety and suffering.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient.
Miasm: Syphilis is in the background.

muscles.

PODOPHYLLUM

Wild lemon

INTRODUCTION

Podophyllum grows throughout the United States in damp, sheddy places in wood. It has leaves having 5 to 9 lobes, large white flowers
with fruits like small lemon; hence the plant is sometimes called wild lemon. Indian tribes use the roots to expel worms and also drop the juice
of the root into the ear to cure deafness. In Homoeopathy it has been introduced by our Master, with its reputation as the VEGETABLE MERCURY.

CLINICAL

Acidity, Anus—prolapse of, Asthma, Bilious attack, Constipation, Cholera infantum, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Dyspepsia, Female genital organs, Fever, Flatulence, Gallstone, Headache, Jaundice, Liver affection, Tenesmus, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts especially upon the liver and digestive tract, has particular affinity to the mucous membrane, more especially of the duodenum, rectum and glandular structure.
PATHOGENESIS

It produces irritation and excessive secretion with a characteristic jelly-like mucus from the intestine. Acting on the liver, it causes torpidity of liver jaundice, portal engorgement with tendency to haemorrhoids and fulness of the superficial veins.

CONSTITUTION
Physical make-up: Adapted to persons who suffer from gastro-intestinal derangements, especially after abuse of mercury.
Children who suffer from diarrhoea during the time of dentition in hot weather.

Temperament: Bilious temperament.
Relation with heat and cold: Affected by extremes of heat and cold.
Miasm: Psora and syphilis are in the background.

Just keep in mind the following to remember PULSATILLA.

Passive patients, come for consultation. Unlike Ignatia, craves consolation,

Like April day, has changeable mood, Stomach cannot hold rich and fatty food, All complaints accompany thirstlessness with dry tongue,
Thick green yellowish discharge makes her funk,

Irregular and painful menses, suppressed, delayed and scanty, Leucorrhoca is also acrid, burning and creamy,

In Labour pain, wants door and windows open, And cannot lie on back for desire for urine sharpen.

Acne, Abortion, Anaemia, Amenorrhoea, Appetite, Bladder affections, Breast affections, Bronchitis, Catarrh, Chest affections, Chillblains, Cold, Colic, Cough, Diarrhoea, Distension, Dyspepsia, Ear and Eye affection, Fever, Female gential organs, Glandular Ophthalmia, Gonorrhoea, Gout, Haemorrhoid, Headache, Heart affections, Heart bum, Labour, Lactation, Leucorrhoea, Measles, Menstrual disorder, Mumps,

SPHERES OF ACTION

The main seats of action of Pulsatilla are veins, mucous membrane of tongue, stomach, bowels, female genital organs such as ovary, uterus, vagina, eyes and ears.

PATHOGENESIS

It produces irritation and catarrhal inflammation of mucous membrane, HAVING THICK BLAND, GREEN YELLOWISH DISCHARGES, venous engorgement and
congestion. It causes contractive pains in uterus. Pulsatilla also causes burning sensation on palms and soles and tongue. Furthermore, it produces arthritic or rheumatic inflammation. The veins seem to lose their vital resistance under the
influence of Pulsatilla so that varicosis occurs, especially of rectum. In eyes it acts on lids producing inflammation and catarrhal discharge. From the ear too, there is purulent discharge.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Usually ladies who are fair and beautiful-looking but inclined to be fleshy with fine hair and blue eyes, soft and lax muscels, anaemic and chlorbtic with pale face at puberty. Pulsatilla patient can be compared to the race of SHEEP, as Antim crud. to SWINE and Arsenic to RACE of HORSE

Temperament: Full of tears, slow, phelgmatic and indecisive.

Relation with heat and cold: It is controversial point whether Pulsatilla is a hot or
chilly drug. Dr. KENT says that there is a pendulum like action between heat and cold relation amongst complementary remedies.

TYLER BOERICKE AND ALLEN say that it is a chilly drug. KENT says that it is a hot blooded patient. But after using the remedy for some time, it will be noticed that the patient goes to the other extreme and becomes chilly or hot as the case may be.

Miasm: Psoric and sycotic miasms are in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Changeability of symptoms : Such as, the pain shifts from one joint to another, no two stools are alike, no two chills are similar. The whole case will appear as if mixed up having no head or tail when the patient relates her complaints. Mental condition changes rapidly. In short it has ever changing character of symptoms.

2. Weeping disposition : The patient weeps easily. It is almost impossible to detail her ailments without weeping.

3. Chilliness : The patient has constant chilliness, but aversion to cover. The patient likes open air. Feels uncomfortable and suffocated in a closed, stuffy and heated room.
4. Pain : The pain shows the following characteristics.
(a) Pain comes gradually and disappears suddenly or pain appears suddenly and goes gradually,
(b) Pains are accompanied by Chilliness. Greater the pain more severe is the chill.
(c) Pain is SHIFTING IN CHARACTER, moves from one joint to another and from one part to the other.
(d) Pain is relieved by pressure, lying on affected side and by cold application. Pain is aggravated from hot application and lying on painless side.

chapter: 171 PYROGEN

ee
A product of Sepsis DRYSDALE A Nosode

INTRODUCTION

Pyrogen is a nosode and is prepared from the pus of septic abscess. It corresponds to streptococcus and other antifebrile vaccine. Pyrogen can very conveniently be called a “G(OMOEOPATHIC DYNAMIC ANTI-SEPTIC’. The pus from the septic abscess when potentised, serves as a great anti-septic remedy. Pyrogen can be said to be the “ACONITE OF TYPHOID QUALITY OF PYREXIA’.

CLINICAL

Abscess, Bedsores, Constipation, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Eczema, Enteric fever, Heart affection, Labour, Puerperal fever,
Ptomaine poisoning, Pyaemia, Sepsis, Ulcers, Vomiting, Urinary disorders, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Pyrogen predominantly acts on blood, heart, cardio-vascular system, gastro-intestinal tract, skin, mucus membrane and uterus.
PATHOGENESIS

The action of Pyrogen results in a septic condition, setting in sapraemia or septicaemia, blood poisoning. It also causes septic fevers, typhoid condition, puerperal sepsis, diphtheria and the like.

“Sepsis” is the essence of the action of Pyrogen.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. In Sapraemia or septicaemia puerperal or surgical, from ptomaine poisoning or sewer gas infection, when the best selected remedy fails to relieve or permanently improye. Pyrogen should be thought of.
2. All discharges are horribly offensive—menstrual, lochial, diarrhoea, vomitus, sweat, breath, etc. (Merc sol., Psor., Kreosote, Baptisia).
3. Chronic complaints that date back to a previous septic condition.
4. The bed feels too hard (Am). Parts rested upon feels sore and bruised (Bapt.) with rapid decubitus (Carb. acid).
5. The patient is very much restless; must move constantly to relieve the soreness of parts (Arn., Euph. Rhus., Bapt.).
6. Tongue is very CLEAN AND SMOOTH AS IF VARNISHED AND FIERY red (Crotalus hor., Per. met. and Apis).
7. Pus-like or sweetish, terribly foetid taste in the mouth.
8. Marked tachycardia is a very striking feature. PULSE abnormally out of proportion to temperature.
9. Distinct consciousness of the heart with cardiac asthenia from septic conditions.
10. Ailments from : Septic condition, sapraemia or septicaemia, puerperal or surgical; from ptomaine poisoning or sewer gas infection, dissecting wounds, chronic malaria and after effects of miscarriage.

PARTICULARS

Septic fever :

Pyrogen is a great remedy for ALL TYPES OF SEPTIC FEVER, e.g. typhoid, puerperal fever, ptomaine poisoning or sewer gas infection, wherever the symptoms peculiar to this drug are present,
which are as follows:-

Causation: It is caused by any septic condition such as septicaemia or sapraemia, puerperal or surgical, from ptomaine poisoning or sewer gas infection.

Temperature: Sudden heat with rise of temperature upto 103-106°F. Skin is very dry and burning, may be pale or cold. Heat is followed by cold and clammy sweat. The BED FEELS VERY HARD; parts

rested upon feels sore and burised; rapid decubitus. The patient is very much restless. He must move constantly to get relief from the soreness of parts.

Chill: Chill begins in the back, between the scapulae. Chill is very severe. Feels generally cold, but particularly of extremities and bones.

Sweat: Very offensive sweat; sometimes clammy.

Pulse: Pulse abnormaly rapid, 140-170 per minute, out of all proportion to temperature. Tachycardia.

Tongue: Tongue is very characteristic. Periodically the tongue is CLEAN AND SMOOTH, AS IF VARNISHED AND FIERY RED, large and flabby, dry and cracked, articulation is difficult.

Taste: There is PUS-LIKE taste in the mouth as from an abscess. Occasionally sweetish taste and terribly foetid smell from mouth may also appear.

Discharge: All the discharges are very offensive, such as diarrhoea, vomitus, breath, urine, menstrual blood or lochia.

In septic fever, especially puerperal, Pyrogen has demonstrated its worth as a great Homoeopathic dynamic antiseptic. During the course of diphtheria or typhoid when the best selected remedy fails to relieve of permanently improve.

Vomiting :

Vomiting is persistent in Pyrogen. The character of vomitus is brownish or COFFEE-GROUND and very offensive. In the case of impacted or obstructed bowels, there may be vomiting of stool, stercoracious vomiting. This sort of vomiting may accompany septic fevers.

Diarrhoea is HORRIBLY OFFENSIVE (Psor.). Stool is brown or black; painless and involuntary. Stool
passes unconsciously along with flatus; uncertain stool.

Yellow Dock JOSLIN Polygonaceae
Curled Dock

INTRODUCTION

Rumex, the yellow dock, or curled dock, is a common British weed. This medicine was used by the Allopaths for the cure of itch, but we, Homoeopaths, use this medicine for diseases like, laryngitis, bronchitis, asthma and diarrhoea. No doubt, it is indicated in skin diseases as well when the symptoms agree. The leaves of this plant from which the drug is obtained and potentised are found to contain Bin oxalate of Potash. So, most of the symptoms manifested during proving, though partial, resemble those of potassium salts.

CLINICAL

Abdominal disorders, Aphonia, Asthma, Bronchitis, Catarrh, Cough, Coryza, Diarrhoea, Hoarseness, Phthisis, Rheumatism, Skin affection, Throat and Lung affections, Urticaria, etc.

Rumex mainly acts upon mucous membrane of larynx, trachea, bronchi and bronchioles and mucous membrane of intestine and skin.

PATHOGENESIS

Rhubarb HAHNEMANN Polygonaceac

INTRODUCTION

Rheum is our everyday Rhubarb which grows plentifully in China. Hahnemann’s proving of Rheum has confirmed many of its traditional uses. This medicine is prepared from the powdered root.

CLINICAL

Colic. Dentition-difficult. Diarrhoea.

1) Suited to children especially during dentition.

2) Sour smell of the whole body ; child smells sour, even after washing or bathing (Hep. Mag C.)

3) Profuse & constant sweat on scalp ; whether asleep or awake, quiet or in motion, the hair is always wet; may or may not be sour. (Calc.    Sanic.).

4) Child is restless, irritable, peevish with pale face and sour smell during difficult dentition.

5) Desires various kinds of food, but canj\ot eat them ; becomes repugnant.

6) Colic : Aggravated at once while uncovering an .arm or leg and standing ; Not better by stool. Colic with sour stool.

7) Children cry & toss about all night (Psor.)

8) Ailments from : Eating unripe fruits, Dentition.

9) Mind : Mentally he is impatient & vehement, Ugly & impossible to satisfy. He screams, kicks & makes himself decidedly unpleasant. He cries &      tosses about all night. Desires various kinds of food but cannot eat them ; becomes repugnant. He desires many things and cries. He dislikes    even favourite playthings.

PARTICULARS

Rheum Baby

The whole body of the Rheum baby smells sour. No amount of washing'or bathing can rid it. Sourness pervades the whole system & characterises all the discharges & exhalations of the body. Rheum is suited especially to baby during dentition.

During difficult dentition, a child is very restless, irritable, peevish and his face looks pale, body smells sour.

There is constant & profuse sweat on scalp, forehead, face, mouth and nose. The hair is always wet whether asleep or awake, quiet or in motion. Sweat may or may not be sour.

Rheum baby desires various kinds of food but cannot eat them ; becomes repugnant child, desires many things & cries but dislikes even favourite playthings.

The colic of Rheum baby is worse at once by uncovering an arm or leg and when standing and not better by stool.

The child may suffer from difficult micturition due to great weakness of the bladder. He requires great deal of pressure to expel the accumulated urine from the inert bladder.

During dentition if stupor of the child is associated with distended abdomen, due to accumulation of urine in the bladder ; Rheum is invaluable remedy.

Mentally Rheum baby is impatient & vehement, ugly & impossible to satisfy. He has sour temper, screams, kicks & makes himself unpleasant. He is cross & tosses about all the night.

Relation :

Complimentary—Mag Garb.

Antidotes—Camphor, Chamomilla.

 
chapter : 178 

Snow Rose SEIDEL Ericaceae

INTRODUCTION

Rhododendron is an evergreen shrub found growing largely on the mountain tops of Siberia and is locally named as snow rose. For the Homoeopathic purpose, the tincture is prepared from the dried leaves of this plant. This remedy deserves a place in our Materia Medica by reason of its extensive use in RHEUMATIC AND GOUTY COMPLAINTS. In support of the doctrine of signature, CLARKE SAYS, “Growing among the fogs and storms of the Siberian mountains, its provings show that it produces, sensitiveness to storm and weather changes, and this gives the grand key-note for it in our Materia Medica”.

CLINICAL

Amenorrhoea, Bone affection, Bunions, Ciliary Neuralgia, Earache, Eye affections, Flatulence, Lumbago, Neuralgia, Orchitis, Rheumatism, Toothache, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It has a limited sphere of action on fibrous tissues particularly on big joints and the vertebral column. Serous membrane, pleura and synovial membranes also come under its action.

PATHOGENESIS

It acts as an irritant and produces excessive secretion from the synovial membranes in the joint and causing all the signs and symptoms of inflammation. Fibrous tissues get inflamed producing rheumatic and gouty changes, Pleurisy results when the pleura gets affected but usually of the wet type.

CONSTITUTION

Temperament : Nervous patients who DREAD A STORM.

Relation with heat and cold: Very chilly patient.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Rheumatic and gouty diathesis,

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Dread of a storm is the key-note of this remedy.

2. Usually right sided affection e.g., right testes, extremeties.

3. All the symptoms are WORSE IN A WINDY, STORMY WEATHER, worse even before the storm, especially an electrical storm (Nat. carb., Phos.,       Psorinum, Silicea, Gels.).

4. Chilly patient; aggravation from a sudden change of weather and relief from warmth in general.

5. Induration and swelling of testicles after gonorrhoea or rheumatic exposure.

6. Cannot get sleep or remain asleep unless the legs are crossed.

PARTICULARS

Toothache :

Causation: In every spring and fall; SHARP EAST WIND.

Character: There is violent jerking pain involving dental nerves from temple to lower jaw and chin with swollen teeth.

Modalities:

¢ Aggravation : By cold and during a thunder-storm.

© Amelioration: By warmth and external heat.

Male genital organs :
Testes : Orchitis with swelling and induration of testicles.

Causation: From suppressed gonorrhoea.

Location: Right sided affection.

Sensation: Sensation in glands as if they were being, crushed.

Character of pain: Orchitis with much swelling in rheumatic patient. Drawing, tearing pain in spermatic cord. There is swelling of testes with much pain, glands feel crushed, as if drown up.

Modalities :

* Aggravation: From taking cold, from sitting on a cold stone, from suppressed gonorrhoea. before a storm especially an electric storm.

© Amelioration: From warmth and motion.

Rheumatism :
Causation: from cold, damp and WINDY WEATHER.

Location: Right side principally affected.

Sensation: Sore and bruised feeling.

Character of pain: It is a very useful remedy in gouty patient, who suffer rheumatic pains.

Acute inflammatory swelling of the joints. There is drawing, tearing pains in all the limbs. The pain Sometimes WANDERS FROM ONE JOINT TO ANOTHER. There js tearing, shooting pain, sore bruised Pain, with stiffness of joints, neck and back, Pain in dorsal region, extending to arm, pain in bone and periosteum, pain drives him out of bed. Pain in the shoulder joint is so severe that the arm cannot be moved. The patient cannot sleep unless the legs are crossed. st Gout with fibrous deposits in great toe joint.


Modalities:

* Aggravation: During rest, before and during a storm.
¢ Amelioration: By warmth, wrapping up, moving or walking about.
General Modalities :

Aggravation : STORMY, WINDY WEATHER, electric, changes in the atmosphere, on approach of a THUNDERSTORM, symptoms reappear with rough weather, right side.

Amelioration: Better from wrapping up the head, warm, dry heat, motion, external heat and eating.


Relations :

Compare: Bryonia, Conium, Lycopodium, Rhus tox.



chapter : 178

RHUS TOXICODENDRON

Poison Oak HAHNEMANN Anacardiaceae

INTRODUCTION

Rhus is a native medicine of the North America and is one of those most valuable medicines which we owe to thedomestic practice of the North American Indians. Hahnemann in his Materia Medica Pura praised thismedicine as a remarkable and valuable medicinal substancehaving a great number of characteristic peculiarities in itsaction. There are other members of the Rhus family which are also used in the Homoeopathic Therapeutic.

CLINICAL

Abortion, Beriberi, Cough, Chilblains, Cyanosis,Dengue fever, Diarrhoea, Dysentery, Eczema, Entericfever, Erysipelas, Eye and Ear affection, Gout, Headache, Herpes zoster, Lumbago, Measles,Menstrual disorders, Neuralgia, Paralysis, Ptosis, Pyaemia, Rheumatism, Restlessness, Sciatica,Sleep, Sprain, Tongue affection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Rhus tox. acts predominantly upon the organs of animal life, upon the mucous membrane, lymphatic glands, skin, muscular tissues and component parts of joints e.g. LIGAMENTS, FIBROUS TISSUES,TENDONS, etc.

PATHOGENESIS

By its actions, it produces a condition of primary irritation of serous membrane which may proceedto inflammation or if it stops, it produces serous discharge, effusion and oedema. On the skin it producestheumatoid inflammation, eruptions, burning and itching. The lymph glands throughout the body enlargeand inflame under the influence of Rhus tox. When circulatory system becomes the seat of its action, itcauses a state of blood poisoning typhoid like symptoms and febrile disturbances. Intermittent fevers, etc.are also noticed.

CONSTITUTION

Since it is more or less an acute remedy, the physical, make-up or temperament, is not of much importance. However, the patient is very chilly, easily susceptible to cold and aggravated by cold in general.

Relation with heat and cold: Very CHILLY patient. Even open air is intolerable.

Miasm: Psora is in the background of all the troubles.

Diathesis: Rheumatic and gouty diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. It is one of the NASH’S TRIO OF RESTLESS MEDICINES. CANNOT STAY INONE PLACE. MUST CHANGE POSITION FREQUENTLY TO OBTAIN RELIEFFROM PAIN (others    of the trio are Aconite and Arsenic).

2. Great rigidity, stiffness and lameness and pain are experienced on first moving the Joints after rest or on waking up in the morning; RELIEVED    BY WALKING OR CONTINUED MOTION.

3. Most complaints are relieved by movement and aggravated by rest.

4, Aggravation at night and in damp rainy weather, and relieved by heat in general e.g., covering the body, warm application, etc.Great    sensitiveness to open air. Putting the hand outside from under the bed-cover brings on cough (Hepar, Rumex, Baryta).for)

5. Triangular red-tipped tongue with imprint of teeth and bitter taste in the mouth.x1

6. Desire for cold milk which relieves gastric complaints (In Iodium cold milk relieves constipation and in Graph, warm milk relieves gastric    symptoms).

7. Great apprehension at night; cannot remain in bed in one position.

8. Desire for sweets, beer, oysters and aversion to meat and liquor.

9. Mind : Extreme restlessness, with desire for continuous change of position.Delirum with fear and suspicion of being poisoned (Kyos.). Sad,        patient begins to weep without knowing why. DREAMS of great exertion, rowing, swimming and working hard at his daily occupation (Bry.).

11. Ailments from : Spraining or straining a single part, muscle or tendon (Calec., Nux,), overlifting, particularly stretching high up to reach     things, lying on damp ground, FROM WETTING and too much summer bathing in lake or river; cold air; getting wet when heated.

Headache :

Location: Frontal headache especially.

amelioration when rising from bed.

chapter: 179 RUTA GRAVEOLENS

Rue HAHNEMANN Rutaceae

INTRODUCTION

Amongst many remedies in our Materia Medica, for injuries caused by mechanical devicesand appliances, Ruta is one possessing prime importance. This is prepared from a shrub-likeplant indigenous in Europe and is widelycultivated in the gardens. The juice of the plant iscapable of causing irritation and inflammation ofthe skin when touched. The mother tinctureisprepared from the fresh herb collected beforeblooming. The irritating and inflammatorycharacter of the plant is transformed into anexcellent therapeutic property after undergoingthe process of potentization.

CLINICAL

Amblyopia, Bone diseases, Bruises, Chest affections, Constipation, Enuresis, Eyeaffections, Facial paralyasis, Fracture, Haemorrhage, Injury, Prolapse of Uterus,Rheumatism, Sciatica, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts on bones, periosteum, joints, eyes, urinary bladder, uterus and skin.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on the bones, periosteum and joints produces symptoms of a rheumatic nature, periostitis and exostosis; in the eyes, errors of xaccommodation and vision, alsocauses prolapse of rectum, urinary troubles, metrorrhagia and miscarriage.

CONSTITUTION

There is no particular constitution of the patient as such. However, there are scrofulous exostosis and warts, especially on the palm of the hand.

Relation with heat and cold; Chilly patient.

Miasms: Psora and sycosis are in the background.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Sore, lame, bruised feeling over the entire body, as after a blow, fall or any sort of mechanical injury especially of bones and periosteum.

2. Scrofulous exostosis after injury resulting in irregular growth of periosteum and bone with sore, lame bruised sensation all over the place.

3. Sprains and dislocation as well as fractures of bones come under the domain of this remedy.

4, Lameness and soreness of wrists and ankles after sprain.

6. All parts of the body upon which the patient lies feel lame and bruised (Bapt., Pyro., Ham.).

6. The patient is physically very much restless and tosses and turns in bed to get relief (Rhus tox.).

7. Blow over the eyes resulting in ecchymosis or after using eyes for fine works and straning resulting in blurred vision and aching in the eyes.

8. Prolapse of rectum immediately on ATTEMPTING TO EVACUATE THE BOWEL.

9. Constant feeling of fulness in the urinary bladder even AFTER URINATION.

10. Flat warts on the palms of hand with sore, lame, bruised feeling.

11. Backache relieved by lying flat on the back.

12. Ruta is worse from cold and wet and relieved by motion.

13. Ailments from : Mechanical injuries, bruises, sprains, straining the eyes etc.

PARTICULARS

Eyes:
Causation: Eye troubles are caused by mechanical injuries and overstrain of ocular muscles.

Character of pain: There is severe aching in and over the eyes, with blurred vision as if they had been strained; after fine work, watch making, engraving or looking intensely. AMBLYOP1A ANDASTHENOPIA from over strain of eyes or anomalies of refraction, from overuse in bad light, fine sewing,over-reading at night in dimlight. Consequently there is misty feeling before the eyes, with dim vision,diplopia (Gels. Syphilinum), with complete obscuration of sight at a distance. Eyes burn, ache.red, fee!strained and hot like fire with spasm of lower lids.

Injury :

As a result of mechanical injuries, sprain, bruised injuries, fall or blow, etc. there may
be SCROFULOUS EXOSTOSIS, SPRAINS, PERIOSTITIS, ERYSIPELAS, FRACTURES AND DISLOCATION. There is bruised, lame and sore feeling all over the body which is worse in the limbs and joints.All parts of the body upon which the patient lies are painful as if bruised (Bapt., Phyto., Nux mos.,Ham.). Due to the intolerable pain, the patient is very much restless and, therefore, changes position quitefrequently when lying. Lameness after sprain, especially of WRISTS AND ANKLES.Phthisis after mechanical injuries of chest is also successfully treated by this remedy. Quite often following mechanical injuries, constipation from Inactivity or Impaction may also be dealt
With by this drug.

There may often be severe backache which is relieved by lying on back and in that case, Ruta is the. remedy to be thought of for a camplete cure.

The rectum may be PROLAPSED IMMEDIATELY ON ATTEMPTING A PASSAGE or from slightest stooping or after comfinement with frequent unsuccessful urging, which can be treated by this drug with sure success. Furthermore, trouble of urinary bladder may also be cured by this remedy, the symptoms being pressure on the bladder which is constantly felt. This feeling of pressure continues even after urinating. The patient can hardly retain urine for sometime on account of great urging. In spite of this great urging, if the desire is not obeyed . immediately, it would be difficult afterwards to void the bladder.Urine passes involuntarily. Urine may be scanty and greenish in colour. On the skin, especially on palm of the hands, warts may appear, which are more painful, flat or smooth (Nat. carb., Nat. mur., Anacardium), which may be treated with this remedy.
General Modalities :

Aggravation: Touch, rest, stooping, sitting, ascending, at night, cold weather, while reading and during menses.

Amelioration: Lying on back, rubbing, motion, scratching.

Relations :
Compare: Arn., Arg. nitricum, Conium mac., Euphrasia, phytolacca, Rhus tox., Symphytum. After Arnica, it hastens the curative process in the joints. After Symphytum in injuries of bones.

chapter : 181 SABINA

Savine STAPF 

INTRODUCTION

This drug was first proved by Hahnemann and is one of our important haemorrhagicmedicines. Old school uses the roots of the plantto produce miscarriage. Hahnemann provedit forthe prevention of abortion especially at the thirdmonth. Sabiha may be said to be predominantlyfemale remedy.

CLINICAL

Abortion, Condylomata, Cystitis, Gonorrhoea, Gout, Leucorrhoea, Menstural disorders,Miscarriage, Rheumatism, Skin troubles. Uterineaffection, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

It acts especially upon the uterus, serous and fibrous tissues.

PATHOGENESIS

It causes widespread irritation, congestion and inflammation of uterus and serous and fibrous tissues resulting in uterine and rheumatic symptoms.

CONSTITUTION

It is especially suited to chlorotic women, having tendency to miscarriage, particularly in the third month.

Relation with heat and cold: Hot patient.

Miasm: Sycosis is in the background.

Diathesis: Haemorrhagic and gouty diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS
1. Music is intolerable. (Aconite, Graph., Thuja, Nat. carb., Nat. sulph.) Music produces nervousness and goes through the bone and marrow.

. There is DRAWING PAIN FROM SACRUM TO PUBES in nearly all diseases.

. Ailments after abortion or premature labour.

. Violent pulsation all over the body.

. The patient is hot, disturbed by heat, worse in a warm room, wants doors and windows open and to be ifi the open air.

. Haemorrhages where blood is fluid and clots together.

. Ailments from : Abortion, premature labour, haemorrhage from uterus, retained placenta, etc.

PARTICULARS

Menses :

It is useful in menorrhagia, metrorrhagia or dysmenorrhoea.

Time: Too early.

Quantity: Too profuse.

Duration: Too long lasting.

Character of blood: Flow in paroxysms, which is too protracted. Flow is bright red, liquid and intermingled with clot ie. partly fluid and partly clotted, especially in those ladies who havemenarche very early

Character of pain: During the menses the lady suffers from bearing down, labour-like pain which is drawing in character in small ol back especially FROM SACRUM TO PUBES.

Modality: Aggravation FROM LEAST MOTION, but flow ceases when walking about (Clarke).

Concomitants: Discharges of blood between periods with sexual excitement. The lady gives the history of rheumatism especially in lower limbs. There may also be history of gonorrhoea. Such ladieshave GREAT INTOLERANCE OF MUSIC.

Abortion :

Sabina is especially indicated in those ladies who have menarche very early in their lives having the tendency to miscarriage, abortion, especially at third month (puls., Secale cor., Belladonna) with severepain in the abdomen. There is shooting-pain from back to front, bearing down labour-like pain FROMSACRUM TO PUBES.

During abortion: The striking features in this drug at the time of abortion are flow of liquid, bright ted, copious blood, which is intermingled with clot; in other words, the flow is partly fluid and partlyclotted. This type of symptoms occur over and over again.

After abortion: There is inflammtion of ovaries and uterus after premature labour or abortion. There is violent pain through ovaries and uterus. Aching pain in the back especially in sacrum and thence toPubes as if broken, as if bones were separated (opposite to sepia, where the pain is from front to back).

There is most violent, tearing, throbbing pain with copious haemorrhage accompained by uterine colic, RETAINED PLACENTA, ATONY OF UTERUS, AND VESICULAR MOLE.

At the time of climacteric: At the time of climacteric period the patient has repeated uterine haemorrhage of bright red blood, intermingled with clot and pain from sacrum to pubes. She becomes exhausted and anaemic.

N.B. : The shooting pain from back to front and from sacrum to pubes with hae norrhages are the Striking features of corroborations in abortion and haemorrhage. In abortion, it differs fromBELLADONNA which is also an important remedy for abortion especially at the third month. ButBelladonna has also got the same bearing down pain with bright red blood, followed by expulsion of clot.But the Belladonna state is not like that of Sabina. In Belladonna, there are hyperaesthesia andversensitiveness to touch, jar and motion. The patient will not allow anyone to touch even the nurse.

The bright red blood is very much hot, so hot that it is noticeable, the parts over which blood passes are so sensitive that blood feels intensely hot to her.

Rheumatism :

Sabina is a good drug for rheumatic affections.

Location: Rheumatic pain is usually felt in the anterior portion of thigh.

Character of pain: Shooting type of pain in heels with bruised sensation. Arthritic pain in joints.


Appearance: Gouty nodosities in the joints, swelling of the joints, which is red and shining.

Modalities: Worse in a heated room and better in open air.

Concomitants: Gout alternates with haemorrhage.
Skin :

Fig-warts with intolerable itching and burning with exuberant granulations.

General Modalities :

Aggravation: From LEAST MOTION, warm air and room.

Amelioration: In cool, open and fresh air.

Relations :

Antidoted by: Puls.

Complementary to: Thuja.

chapter :182 SAMBUCUS NIGRA


Elder HAHNEMANN Caprifoliaceae

INTRODUCTION

Sambucus nigra is yet another excellent remedy from the vegetable kingdom suitable for respiratory troubles. The mother tincture isprepared from the leaves and flowers. The freshly expressed juice contains viburnic acid and vibriani which produce an unpleasant odour.The trees are found in Central Europe. The inner park as well as the leaves are employed for making ointment for external application. The
flowers are used for fermentation and also for preparing medicated tea. It was proved andadded to Materia Medica Pura by our Master Hahnemann.

CLINICAL

Asthma, Chest oppression of, Goryza, Cough, Croup, Headache, Hoarseness, Perspiration, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

The main seat of action of Sambucus nigra is the mucous membrane of respiratory organs, nasal passage, larynx, chest and skin.

PATHOGENESIS

Its action on the mucous membrane results in difficult spasm of the respiratory organs, dyspnoea, coryza and suffocative cough. It also produces profuse debilitating sweat, especially during waking hours. In addition, it causes oedematous swellingon various parts of the body particularly legs.

CONSTITUTION

Make-up of the body: It is adapted to persons who were formerly robust and fleshy, but suddenly became emaciated; and to the diseases of scrofulous children with affection of the air passage especially,

Relation with heat and cold: Very chilly patient.
Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Scrofulous diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. There is profuse sweat all over the body DURING WAKING HOURS. When the patient sleeps or closes the eyes, the sweat disappears (rev. of China,    Conium, Thuja. Cactus).
2. The patient has oedematous swelling in various parts of the body, especially in leg, in step and feet.
3. Dry coryza of infants : Nose dry and completely stopped-up, preventing breathing when nursing.
4, There is severe suffocative attack of dyspnoea after mid-night. The patient wakes up suddenly, sits up in bed, and gasps for breath. The    patient becomes cyanosed and turns blue, with livid face. The CHILD CAN INSPIRE WELL BUT CANNOT EXPIRE (Med.).
5. Dry coryza precedes the fever paroxysms.
6. Fever without thirst and the patient dredads uncovering.
7. Aggravation: From sleep and from cold drinks. Amelioration: By pressure.
8. Ailments from : Violent mental emotions, anxiety, grief and excessive sexual indulgence.

PARTICULARS

Respiratory organs :

Sambucus affects especially the mucous membrane of the respiratory organs and following are its cardinal symptoms.

The remedy is indicated in catarrhal affections of the air passages with suffocative attack.

There is DRY CORYZA. The nose is completely dry and stopped up. Breathing through the nose is most difficult, if not impossible, especially while nursing.

The suffocative attack comes particularly after mid-night and the patient is compelled to wake up suddenly and sit up in bed panting for breath; but unable to breathe; turns blue and cyanosed; face becomes livid. The attack passes off after sometime, but again returns after a short while.

The patient can INSPIRE WELL, BUT CANNOT EXPIRE, regular inhalation but sighing expiration. The patient sleeps into attack.

The attack of suffocation is in the last stage of croup. Hoarseness with much tenacious mucus in larynx.

The cough is very much suffocative; hollow, deep coughing, with spasm of the chest. There is much mucus in the bronchi; expectoration is very difficult.

Cough is deep and dry, precedes the fever paroxysms. There is profuse debilitating sweat over the entire body during waking hours;; disappears as soon as the patient sleeps.

Fever :

During fever, there is dry heat while the patient sleeps or on falling asleep. The patient dreads uncovering wants to cover up completely.


Sambucus Nigra 0

There is no thirst during heat or sweat stage. Fever paroxysms are preceded by dry cough. The patient may also have oedematous swelling in parts of the body, especially the legs.

chapter : 183 SANGUINARIA CANADENSIS

anne ee
Blood Root G. BUTE Papaveraceae

INTRODUCTION

Blood root is used to be one of the oldest domestic remedies. In winter season, farmers wives would not forget to keep always blood root in their house. In the cold winter days when the coryza comes on, with a cold in the head, chest, throat, then they get hold of the blood root and
make a cup of tea with it which was a routine drug to combat all complaints from cold. Even in this crude form it is used to break up colds.

CLINICAL

Alcholism, Asthma, Breast affection, Bronchitis, Cancer, Catarrh, Chest affection, Cold, Dyspepsia, Headache, Influenza, Menstrual disorders, Pneumonia, Rheumatism, Vomiting, Whooping cough, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Sanguinaria acts chiefly upon the mucous membrane, especially of the respiratory tract. It has marked vasomotor disturbances.

PATHOGENESIS

It irritates the mucous membrane and produces catarrhal inflammation. It also causes derangement of liver and the digestive tract.

CONSTITUTION

Since it is more or less an acute drug, no importance is attached to the constitution as such. The patient is however, CHILLY, with psora in the background, having tubercular diathesis.

GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Highly chilly patient; very much susceptible to cold, even gets affected by a change of weather.

2. It is a right sided remedy. Right sided affections of the whole body e.g., head, chest, lungs, arm, shoulders, etc.

3. There is CIRCUMSCRIBED REDNESS OF THE CHEEKS, especially in the afternoon and the respiratory diseases e.g., in bronchitis, pneumonia,       pulmonary tuberculosis, etc.

4. There is burning sensation as if caused by hot water, especially in the soles and palms during climacteric period (Sulph., Medo., Puls.,       Cham.).
5. Periodic sick headache, sun headache, begins in the morning, increases during the day, lasts until evening and relieved by sleep. Headache       begins in the occiput, ascends to vertex and finally settles over the right eye (Sil., Left eye, Spig.). Headache of climacteric, returns         every seventh day.
6, Rheumatism of the right arm and shoulder (Left-Fer. met., Nux mosch.).

7. Breath and sputa are very offensive, even the patient himself feels the bad smell.

8. Dry hacking cough, waking the patient up at night and not ceasing until he sits upin bed and passes flatus, with CIRCUMSCRIBED RED CHEEKS and    night sweat. Sudden stoppage of cough brings on diarrhoea.

AF ungus: A Nosode

chapter: 188 SEPIA


Cuttle Fish HAHNEMANN Mallusca

INTRODUCTION

Popularly known as the “Washer Woman’s remedy”. Sepia is one of the greatestcontributions to Homoeopathy, by Master
Hahnemann.

The crude substance for preparation of this wonderful constitutional remedy is a liquidcontained in the ‘INK BAG?’ of the Cuttle fish.This brownish black substance is ejected out bythe fish from its gland to protect itself from anyexternal aggression. A very small insignificantquantity of this ink is capable of making thewhole water around the fish completely dark sothat the enemy would get confused arid lose sight of the fish and thus it can ascapeunhurt. The drug substance thus possesses the great potential power in its inherent,dormant and latent state which when aroused is capable of curing a variety of diseases,particularly chronic, in nature in the same way as the cuttle-fish protects itself from anydangerous enemy.

Hahnemann got the clue to initiate proving of this remedy from a patient, who was in the regular habit of wetting his brush containing Indian Ink with his own saliva. Everytime he did so, a very small portion of the ink would naturally find its way into thestomach to be absorbed by the system. By and by, he developed certain chronic ailments.Hahnemann treated him with all the then known similimums to he best of his skill andability but without any appreciable benefit. Excepting that his habit of wetting his brushwith his own saliva and consequent affection of the ink, would have been the maintainingcause, the artist was advised to discontinue with his profession. The artist obeyed him andhe was completely redeemed of all his chronic ailments. This unique pleasant experienceultimately led him to prove Sepia for the benefit of generations of mankind.

CLINICAL

Abdominal disorders, Amenorrhoea, Apoplexy, Asthma, Cough, Cancer, Dyspepsia,Eczema, Eye affection, Female genital organs, Gout, Gonorrhoea, Headache, Jaundice,Leucorrhoea, Liver affection, Preganancy, Psoriasis, Prolapse of uterus, Ptosis, Sciatica,Toothache, Urinary troubles, Uterus bearing down, Varicose veins, Whooping cough, ete.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Sepia acts of female genital organs, gastrointestinal tract, liver and portal system,skin, glands and nervous system.



PATHOGENESIS

Affecting the female genital organs, Sepia diminishes the general energy of the vegetative sphere and it produces venous congestion; gastro-ihtestinal disorders, setting in much relaxation, fatigue, exhaustion, impaired liver secretion and herpetic eruptions.

CONSTITUTION

chapter : 190 SPIGELIA

Pink Root HAHNEMANN Loganiaceae

INTRODUCTION

The Demerara pink root, a grass from which this drug has been prepared was used in the daysof Galen and Aristotle as a worm expellerantihelminth. The leaves of this shrub waspounded together with some sweetening agent andwas used in crude physiological doses to expelround worms particularly in children. HenceMaster Hahnemann unto whom we owe theintroduction of this medicine to the Homoeopathicsystem, named it Spigelia Anthelmic.

CLINICAL

Angina pectoris, Ciliary neuralgia, Cold, Constipation Depression of spirit, Eyes— pain in, Glaucoma, Headache, Heart affections, Neuralgia, Toothache, Worms, etc.

SPHERES OF ACTION

Spigelia acts especially upon the fibrous and muscular tissues of eyes and heart. The nerves especially the fifth Cranial nerve—Trigeminal nerveis affected by this medicine.The head, particularly the left side is affected.

PATHOGENESIS

When affecting the eyes—left being more common, it produces congestion, redness and intolerable pain with dilated pupils; even the headache of left side centres on the lefteye. Heart produces violent contractions resulting in roaring heart. Trigeminal neuralgiais one of the main pathogenetic effects when it affects cranial nerves. The fibrous tissuesproduce a state of inflammation, rheumatic, arthritis, etc.

CONSTITUTION

Physical make-up: Spigelia is especially adapted to anaemic, debilitated subjects who are brokendown, pale with light hair and yellow skin. In children who are afflicted withascarides and luimbrici.

Temperament; Nervous temperament.

Relation with heat and cold: Chilly patient. Even open air is unbearable.

Miasm: Psora is in the background.

Diathesis: Rheumatic diathesis,


GUIDING SYMPTOMS

1. Left sided affections e.g. left side of head, left eye, etc.

2. Body painfully sensitive to touch, parts touched feel chilly (kali carb.).

3. Visible, audible, violent and roaring heart is very well-marked.

4. Aggravation: By touch and pressure (but pressure relieves neuralgia); motion.


Amelioration: By rest. Symptoms are ameliorated by lying on right side with head high (Arsenic, Cactus, Spongia).

. Pains are sharp, stitching and sticking.

. Afraid of sharp, pointed things, like pins, needles, etc.

. Pains increase and decrease with the rising and setting of the sun.ornaw

. It is a good worm remedy and expels worms.

PARTICULARS

Eyes :

Location: Usually left eye Is AFFECTED.

Sensation: Eyes feel too large for the orbit.

Respiratory Symptoms:

Sore throat : Aggravation after eating sweets.

Cough :

Thyroid
